div0.head: Π

div1.head: παγγέλοιος
div1.sense: quite ridiculous, Plat.

div1.head: παγγενέτειρα
div1.sense: mother of all, Anth.

div1.head: παγγλωσσία
div1.sense: wordiness, garrulity, Pind.

div1.head: παγετός
div1.sense: frost, Xen.; cf. πάγος II.

div1.head: παγετώδης
div1.sense: frosty, ice-cold, Soph.

div1.head: πάγη
div1.sense: anything that fixes or fastens, a snare, noose, trap, Hdt.: a fowling-net, Xen.
metaph. a trap, snare, Aesch.

div1.head: παγιδεύω
div1.sense: to lay a snare for, entrap, NTest.

div1.head: πάγιος
div1.sense: solid, Luc.:—adv., παγίως λέγειν, to say positively, without reservations, Plat.

div1.head: παγίς
div1.sense: = πάγη, a trap, Ar.: metaph. a trap, snare, δουρατέα π. of the Trojan horse, Anth.
ἄγκυρα παγὶς νεῶν the anchor which holds ships fast, Anth.

div1.head: παγκαίνιστος
div1.sense: ever renewed, ever fresh, Aesch.

div1.head: πάγκακος
div1.sense: utterly bad, all-unlucky, Hes.: most noxious, Hes., Plat.—adv., παγκάκως ὀλέσθαι Aesch.; π. ἔχει τινί Aesch.
of persons, utterly bad, most evil or wicked, Theogn.: Sup. ὦ παγκάκιστε, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: πάγκαλος
div1.sense: all beautiful, good or noble, Ar., Plat.: adv. -λως, Plat., etc.

div1.head: πάγκαρπος
div1.sense: of all kinds of fruit, Soph.: rich in every fruit, rich in fruit, Pind.

div1.head: παγκευθής
div1.sense: all-concealing, Soph.

div1.head: πάγκλαυστος
div1.sense: all-lamented, most lamentable, Aesch., Soph.
act. all tearful, Soph.

div1.head: παγκληρία
div1.sense: a complete inheritance, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: πάγκληρος
div1.sense: held in full possession, Eur.

div1.head: πάγκοινος
div1.sense: common to all, Soph.; θεοῦ μάστιγι παγκοίνῳ, i. e. by death, Aesch.; ἓν ἀπέχθημα π. βροτοῖς one object of hate common to all mankind, Eur.; π. στάσις all the band together, Aesch.

div1.head: παγκοίτης
div1.sense: where all must sleep, θάλαμος παγκοίτας, i. e. the grave, Soph.; π. Ἅιδας Soph.

div1.head: παγκόνιτος
div1.sense: covered all over with dust, ἄεθλα παγκ. prizes gained in all the contests, Soph.

div1.head: παγκρατής
div1.sense: all-powerful, all-mighty, Trag.; π. ἕδραι the imperial throne of Zeus, Aesch.:— τοῖνδε π. φονεύς their victorious slayer, Aesch.

div1.head: παγκρατιάζω
div1.sense: to perform the exercises of the παγκράτιον, Plat.:—metaph. to sway oneʼs arms about like a gymnast, to gesticulate violently, Aeschin.

div1.head: παγκρατιαστής
div1.sense: one who practises the παγκράτιον, Plat.

div1.head: παγκρατιαστικός
div1.sense: of or for the παγκράτιον, ἡ παγκ. τέχνη the pancratiastʼs art, Plat.
skilled in the παγκράτιον, Arist.

div1.head: παγκράτιον
div1.sense: a complete contest, an exercise which combined both wrestling and boxing (πάλη and πυγμή) , Hdt., Pind., etc.

div1.head: πᾶγος
div1.sense: Lat. pagus, a canton, district, Plut.

div1.head: πάγος
div1.sense: that which is fixed or firmly set:
a mountain-peak, a rocky hill, Od., Hes., Trag.; ὁ Ἄρειος (Ionic Ἀρήιος) πάγος the Areopagus at Athens, v. Ἄρειος II.
= παγετός, Soph.

div1.head: πάγουρος
div1.sense: a kind of crab, Lat. pagurus, Ar.

div1.head: παγχάλεπος
div1.sense: most difficult to deal with, Xen., Plat. adv., παγχαλέπως ἔχειν πρός τινα to be ill affected towards him, Xen.

div1.head: παγχάλκεος
div1.sense: all-brasen, all-brass, Hom., Od., Trag.

div1.head: πάγχρηστος
div1.sense: good for all work, Ar., Xen.

div1.head: πάγχριστος
div1.sense: all-anointed: πάγχριστον (sc. φαρμακόν) seems to mean full-anointing, Soph.

div1.head: παγχρύσεος
div1.sense: all-golden, of solid gold, Il., Hes.

div1.head: πάγχυ
div1.sense: = πάνυ quite, wholly, entirely, altogether, Hom., Pind.; πάγχυ δοκέειν or ἐλπίζειν to think or hope fully, Hdt.

div1.head: πάθημα
div1.sense: anything that befals one, a suffering, calamity, misfortune, Soph., Thuc.: mostly in pl., Hdt., Attic; proverb., τὰ δέ μοι παθήματα μαθήματα γέγονε my sufferings have been my lessons, Hdt.
a passive emotion or condition, Xen., Plat.
in pl. incidents, occurrences, Plat.

div1.head: πάθη
div1.sense: a passive state, Plat.; τὰς ἐκεῖ πάθας what happened there, Soph.; πᾶσαν τὴν ἑωυτοῦ π. all that had happened to him, Hdt.
= πάθημα, Pind., Soph.; ἡ π. τῶν ὀφθαλμῶν blindness, Hdt.

div1.head: παθητικός
div1.sense: subject to feeling, capable of feeling a thing, c. gen., Arist.
impassioned, pathetic, Arist.:—adv., παθητικῶς λέγειν Arist.

div1.head: παθητός
div1.sense: one who has suffered: subject to passion, Plut.
of the Saviour, destined to suffer, NTest.

div1.head: πάθος
div1.sense: anything that befalls one, an incident, accident, Hdt., Soph.
what one has suffered, oneʼs experience, Aesch.; in pl., Plat.: —commonly in bad sense, a suffering, misfortune, calamity, Hdt., Aesch., etc.; ἀνήκεστον π. ἔρδειν to do an irreparable mischief, Hdt.
of the soul, a passion, emotion, such as love, hate, etc., Thuc., Plat., etc.
any passive state, a condition, state, Plat.: in pl. the incidents or changes to which things are liable, τὰ περὶ τὸν οὐρανὸν π. Plat., etc.
a pathetic mode of expression, pathos, Arist.

div1.head: Παιάν
div1.sense: Paean or Paeon, the physician of the gods, Il.; Παιήονος γενέθλη the sons of Paeon, i. e. physicians, Od.
after Hom., the name and office were transferred to Apollo, who was invoked by the cry ἰήιε Παιάν Aesch., Soph.; ἰὼ Παιάν Soph.
as appellat. a physician, healer, Aesch., Soph.: then, a saviour, deliverer, Eur.
παιάν, Epic παιήων, a paean, i. e. a choral song, a hymn or chant, addressed to Apollo, Il., Aesch., Soph.
a song of triumph after victory, properly to Apollo, Il., Aesch.; also a war-song, Aesch., Xen.:—the phrase was, ἐξάρχειν τὸν παιᾶνα Xen.; π. ἐξάρχεσθαι, ποιεῖσθαι Xen.
any solemn song or chant, esp. on beginning an undertaking, in omen of success, Thuc.; a song sung at a feast, Xen.
Aesch., by an oxymoron, joins π. Ἐρινύων, π. τοῦ θανόντος; so, π. στυγνός, of a dirge, Eur.
Κρητῶν παιήονες paean-singers, Hhymn.
in Prosody, a paeon, a foot consisting of three short and 1 long syll., in any order, Arist.

div1.head: παῖγμα
div1.sense: play, sport, sportive strain, Eur.

div1.head: παιγνία
div1.sense: play, sport, a game, Hdt.

div1.head: παιγνιήμων
div1.sense: fond of a joke, Hdt.

div1.head: παίγνιον
div1.sense: a plaything, toy, Plat.
in Theocr., the Egyptians are called κακὰ παίγνια roguish playmates,
a game, a sportive poem, Anth.; of the merry chirp of the cicada, Anth.

div1.head: παίγνιος
div1.sense: sportive, droll, Anth.

div1.head: παιγνιώδης
div1.sense: playful, sportive, Plut.: τὸ παιγνιῶδες playfulness, Xen.

div1.head: παιδαγωγεῖον
div1.sense: the room in which the παιδαγωγοί waited for their boys, Dem.: a school, Plut.

div1.head: παιδαγωγέω
div1.etym: fut. mid. παιδαγωγήσομαι in pass. sense
div1.sense: to attend as a παιδαγωγός, to train and teach, educate, Plat.: to watch as one does a child, Eur.
generally, to educate, Plat.

div1.head: παιδαγωγία
div1.sense: the office of a παιδαγωγός, attendance on boys, education, Plat.: generally, attendance on the sick, Eur.

div1.head: παιδαγωγικός
div1.sense: suitable to a παιδαγωγός:—ἡ -κή (sc. τέχνη) τῶν νοσημάτων = ἡ ἰατρική, the tending of diseases, Plat.

div1.head: παιδαγωγός
div1.sense: a boy-ward; at Athens, the slave who went with a boy from home to school and back again, a kind of tutor, Hdt., Eur., etc.: —hence Phoenix is called the παιδαγωγός of Achilles, Plat.; Fabius is jeeringly called the παιδαγωγός of Hannibal, because he always followed him about, Plut.

div1.head: παιδάριον
div1.sense: a young, little boy, Ar.; ἐκ παιδαρίου from a child, Plat.: in pl. young children, Ar.: a young slave, Ar., Xen.

div1.head: παιδαριώδης
div1.sense: childish, puerile, Plat.

div1.head: παιδεία
div1.sense: the rearing of a child, Aesch.
training and teaching, education, Ar., Thuc., etc.
its result, culture, learning, accomplishments, Plat.
πλεκτὰ Αἰγύπτου παιδεία the twisted handiwork of Egypt, i. e. ropes of byblus, Eur.
youth, childhood, Theogn., Eur.

div1.head: παίδειος
div1.sense: of or for a boy, Aesch.; π. τροφή the care of rearing children, a motherʼs cares, Soph.

div1.head: παιδεραστέω
div1.sense: to be a παιδεραστής, Plat.

div1.head: παιδεραστής
div1.sense: a lover of boys, Ar., Plat.

div1.head: παίδευμα
div1.sense: that which is reared up, taught, a nursling, scholar, pupil, Eur., etc.; μῆλα, φυλλάδος Παρνασίας παιδεύματʼ Eur.:—in pl. of a single object, Eur.
a thing taught, subject of instruction, lesson, Xen.

div1.head: παίδευσις
div1.sense: education, a system of education, Hdt., Ar., etc.; τὴν ὑπʼ ἀρετῆς Ἡρακλέους παίδευσιν his education by virtue, Xen.
its result, culture, learning, accomplishments, Ar., Plat.
an instructing or priming of witnesses, Dem.
a means of educating, τὴν πόλιν τῆς Ἑλλάδος παίδευσιν εἶναι that our city is the school of Greece, Thuc.

div1.head: παιδευτέος
div1.sense: to be educated, Plat.
παιδευτέον, one must educate, Plat.

div1.head: παιδευτήριον
div1.sense: a school, Strab.

div1.head: παιδευτής
div1.sense: a teacher, instructor, preceptor, Plat.
a corrector, chastiser, NTest.

div1.head: παιδευτικός
div1.sense: of or for teaching: —ἡ -κή (sc. τέχνη) , education, Plat.; so, τὸ παιδευτικόν Plut.

div1.head: παιδευτός
div1.sense: to be gained by education, Plat.

div1.head: παιδεύω
div1.sense: to bring up or rear a child, Soph.

mostly, opp. to τρέφω, to train, teach, educate, Soph., Eur., etc.; παιδεύειν τινα μουσικῆι καὶ γυμναστικῆι Plat.; ἐν μουσικῆι Plat.; π. τινὰ εἰς πρὸς ἀρετήν Plat.; c. dupl. acc., π. τινά τι to teach one a thing, Plat.; c. acc. et inf., π. τινὰ κιθαρίζειν Hdt.; and without inf., π. γυναῖκας σώφρονας εἶναι Eur.:—hence in Pass., c. acc. rei, to be taught a thing, Plat.:—absol., ὁ πεπαιδευμένος a man of education, opp. to ἀπαίδευτος or ἰδιώτης, Xen., Plat.:—Mid. to have any one taught, cause him to be educated, Plat.
to correct, discipline, Soph., Xen.: to chastise, punish, NTest.

div1.head: παιδιά
div1.sense: childish play, sport, game, pastime, Xen., Plat.; π. παίζειν πρός τινα to play a game with him, Ar.; μετὰ παιδιᾶς in sport, Thuc.; ὥστε σοι τὸν νῦν χόλον παιδιὰν εἶναι δοκεῖν will seem mere childʼs play, Aesch.

div1.head: παιδικός
div1.sense: of, for or like a child, boyish, Lat. puerilis, Plat., etc.
playful, sportive, Plat., Xen.; so, adv. -κῶς, Plat.
of or for a beloved youth, π. λόγος a love- tale, Xen.
as Subst., παιδικά, ῶν, τά, a darling, favourite, Lat. deliciae, Thuc., Plat., etc.

div1.head: παιδιόθεν
div1.sense: from a child, NTest.

div1.head: παιδίον
div1.sense: a little or young child, Hdt., Ar., Plat.
a slave-lad, Ar.

div1.head: παιδίσκη
div1.sense: a young girl, maiden, Xen.
a young slave, courtesan, Hdt., Plut.

div1.head: παιδίσκος
div1.sense: a young boy or son, Xen.

div1.head: παιδιώδης
div1.sense: playful, Lat. ludibundus, Arist.

div1.head: παιδνός
div1.sense: childish, Aesch., Anth.
παιδνός, οῦ, as Subst. a boy, lad, Od.

div1.head: παιδοβόρος
div1.sense: child-eating, μόχθοι π., said of Thyestes, Aesch.

div1.head: παιδογονία
div1.sense: a begetting of children, Plat.

div1.head: παιδογόνος
div1.sense: begetting children, Ζεῦ παιδογόνε πόριος Ἰνάχου father of a child by the daughter of Inachus, Eur.
making fruitful, Theocr.

div1.head: παιδοκομέω
div1.sense: to take care of a child, Anth.

div1.head: παιδοκτονέω
div1.sense: to murder children, Eur.

div1.head: παιδοκτόνος
div1.sense: child-murdering, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: παιδολετήρ
div1.sense: murderer of children: fem. παιδ-ολέτειρα, murderess of children, Eur.

div1.head: παιδολυμάς
div1.sense: destroying children, Aesch.

div1.head: παιδονομία
div1.sense: the education of children, Arist.
the office of παιδονόμος, Arist.

div1.head: παιδονόμος
div1.sense: one of a board of magistrates in Dorian States, who superintended the education of youths, Xen., Arist.

div1.head: παιδοποιέω
div1.sense: to beget children, Eur.; πεπαιδοποίηται has been begotten, Dem.
to bear children, of the woman, Soph.
more commonly as Dep., fut. -ήσομαι: aor1 ἐπαιδοποιησάμην: perf. πεπαιδοποίημαι, in same sense as Act., Eur., Xen., etc.

div1.head: παιδοποιία
div1.sense: procreation of children, Plat.

div1.head: παιδοποιός
div1.sense: begetting or bearing children, Eur.
generative, Hdt.

div1.head: παιδοπόρος
div1.sense: through which a child passes, Anth.

div1.head: παιδοσπορέω
div1.sense: to beget children, Plat.

div1.head: παιδοσπόρος
div1.sense: begetting children, Ar.

div1.head: παιδοτριβέω
div1.sense: to train as a gymnastic master: generally, to train, π. τινὰ πονηρὸν εἶναι Dem.

div1.head: παιδοτρίβης
div1.sense: one who teaches boys wrestling and other exercises, a gymnastic master, Ar., Plat., etc.; ἐν παιδοτρίβου at his school, Ar.

div1.head: παιδοτριβικός
div1.sense: of or for a παιδοτρίβης: ἡ -κή (sc. τέχνη) his art, the art of wrestling, Arist.: adv., παιδοτριβικῶς like a gymnastic master, Ar.

div1.head: παιδοτροφία
div1.sense: the rearing of children, Plat.

div1.head: παιδοτρόφος
div1.sense: rearing boys, Simon.: παιδοτρόφος ἐλάα Soph.
as fem. Subst. a mother, Eur.

div1.head: παιδότρωτος
div1.sense: wounded by children, πάθεα π. wounds and death at childrenʼs hands, Aesch.

div1.head: παιδουργία
div1.sense: = παιδοποιία, Plat.
in Soph. = γυνὴ παιδοποιός, a mother.

div1.head: παιδοφιλέω
div1.sense: to love boys, Theogn., Solon.

div1.head: παιδοφόνος
div1.sense: killing children, Il., Eur.; π. συμφορή the accident or calamity of having killed a son, Hdt.; π. αἷμα the blood of slain children, Eur.

div1.head: παιδοφορέω
div1.sense: to waft away a boy, Anth.

div1.head: παίζω
div1.sense: properly, to play like a child, to sport, play, Od., Hdt., etc.
to dance, Od., Pind.:—so in Mid., Hes.
to play [a game], σφαίρηι π. to play at ball, Od.; also, π. σφαῖραν Plut.
to play (on an instrument), Hhymn.

to sport, play, jest, joke, Hdt., Xen., etc.; π. πρός τινα to make sport of one, mock him, Eur.; π. εἴς τι to jest upon a thing, Plat.: the part. παίζων is used absol. in jest, jestingly, Plat.:—Pass., ὁ λόγος πέπαισται is jocularly told, Hdt.; ταῦτα πεπαίσθω ὑμῖν enough of jest, Plat.
c. acc. to play with, Anth., Luc.

div1.head: Παιηόνιος
div1.sense: healing, like Παιώνιος, Anth.

div1.head: Παίονες
div1.sense: the Paeonians, a people of Macedonia, Il.; Παίων στρατός Eur.:— Παιονία, ἡ, their land, Il.:—adj. Παιονικός, ή, όν Paeonian, Thuc.; pecul. fem. Παιονίς, ίδος, Hdt.

div1.head: παιπάλημα
div1.sense: like παιπάλη, a piece of subtlety, of a man, Ar., Aeschin.

div1.head: παιπάλη
div1.sense: pollen the finest flour or meal, Lat. flos farinae, Ar.: metaph. of a subtle rogue, Ar.

div1.head: παιπαλόεις
div1.sense: craggy, rugged, old Epic word of uncertain origin, epith. of hills, mountain-paths, and rocky islands, Hom.

div1.head: παῖς
div1.sense: in relation to Descent, a child, whether son or daughter, Il.:— παῖς παιδός a childʼs child, grandchild, Il.; Ἀγήνορος παῖδες ἐκ παίδων Eur.;—of animals, Aesch.
metaph., ἀμπέλου παῖς, i. e. wine, Pind.
periphr., δυστήνων παῖδες (v. sub δύστηνος) ; οἱ Λυδῶν παῖδες, sons of the Lydians, i. e. the Lydians, Hdt.; π. Ἑλλήνων Aesch.; οἱ Ἀσκληπιοῦ π. i. e. physicians, Plat., etc.

in relation to Age, a child, either a boy, youth, lad, or a girl, maiden, Hom., etc.; with another Subst., παῖς συφορβός a boy- swineherd, Il.: —ἐκ παιδός from a child, Plat.; ἐκ παίδων or παίδων εὐθύς Plat.; εὐθὺς ἐκ παίδων ἐξελθών Dem.
in relation to Condition, a slave, servant, man or maid, Aesch., Ar., etc.

div1.head: παιφάσσω
div1.sense: to dart or rush wildly about, Il.

div1.head: παίω
div1.sense: to strike, smite, Hdt., Trag.; π. τινὰ ἐς τὴν γῆν Hdt.; π. τινὰ ἐς τὴν γαστέρα Ar.; εἰς τὰ στέρνα or κατὰ τὸ στέρνον Xen.; c. dupl. acc., π. τινὰ τὸ νῶτον Ar.:—also c. acc. cogn., ὀλίγας π. (sc. πληγάς) Xen.;— π. ἅλμην, of rowers, , Aesch.:—Mid., ἐπαίσατο τὸν μηρόν he smote his thigh, Xen.

c. acc. instrumenti, to strike, dash one thing against another, ναῦς ἐν νηὶ στόλον ἔπαισε one ship struck its beak against another, Aesch.; metaph., ἐν δʼ ἐμῶι κάραι θεὸς μέγα βάρος ἔπαισεν the god dashed a great weight upon my head, i. e. smote me heavily, Soph.; ἔπαισας ἐπὶ νόσωι νόσον Soph.
to drive away, τοὺς σφῆκας ἀπὸ τῆς οἰκίας Ar.
to hit hard in speaking, Ar.
intr. to strike or dash against, Lat. illido, πρός τινι or τι Aesch., Xen.; c. acc., παίειν ἄφαντον ἕρμα strikes on a hidden reef, Aesch.; so, στήλην παίσας, of a charioteer, Soph.
to eat, Ar.

div1.head: Παιωνιάς
div1.sense: Παιωνιὰς σοφία the healing art, medicine, Anth.

div1.head: Παιώνια
div1.sense: a festival of Paeon, Ar.
like a paean or song of victory, Aesch.

div1.head: παιωνίζω
div1.sense: to chant the paean or song of triumph, Hdt., Ar., etc.; c. acc. cogn. to sing in triumph, Aesch.; of an after-dinner song, Xen.: Pass., 3rd sg. imperf. used impersonally, ἐπεπαιώνιστο αὐτοῖς the paean had been sung by them, Thuc.

div1.head: παιώνιος
div1.sense: belonging to Paeon, medicinal, healing, Aesch., Soph., Ar.
a healer, reliever, c. gen., Soph.

div1.head: παιωνισμός
div1.sense: a chanting of the paean, Thuc.

div1.head: πακτόω
div1.sense: to fasten, make fast, δῶμα πάκτου make fast the house, Soph.
to stop up, stop, caulk, Ar.
to bind fast, Anth.

div1.head: παλάθη
div1.sense: a cake of preserved fruit, Hdt., Luc.

div1.head: παλαιγενής
div1.sense: born long ago, full of years, ancient, Hom.; ἄνθρωποι Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: παλαιμονέω
div1.sense: to wrestle or fight, Pind.; cf. Παλαίμων.

div1.head: Παλαίμων
div1.sense: Palaemon, i. e. wrestler, masc. prop. n., a name of Melicertes, son of Ino, who was adored as a sea-god friendly to the shipwrecked, Eur.

div1.head: παλαιομάτωρ
div1.sense: ancient mother, Eur.

div1.head: παλαιόπλουτος
div1.sense: rich from early times, Thuc.

div1.head: παλαιός
div1.sense: old in years,
of persons, old, aged, ἢ νέος ἠὲ παλαιός Hom.; π. γέρων, π. γρηῦς Od.; χρόνῳ π. Soph.
of things, οἶνος Od.; νῆες Od.
of old date, ancient,
of persons, Hom.; Μίνως παλαίτατος ὧν ἀκοῇ ἴσμεν Thuc.; οἱ π. the ancients, Lat. veteres, Thuc.
of things, Od., Hdt., etc.: —τὸ παλαιόν, as adv. like τὸ πάλαι, anciently, formerly, Hdt., etc.; ἐκ παλαιοῦ from of old, Hdt.; ἐκ παλαιτέρου from older time, Hdt.; ἐκ παλαιτάτου Thuc.
of things, also, antiquated, obsolete, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: παλαιότης
div1.sense: antiquity, obsoleteness, Eur., Plat.

div1.head: παλαιόφρων
div1.sense: old in mind, with the wisdom of age, Aesch.

div1.head: παλαιόω
div1.sense: to make old, mostly in Pass. (pres.) to be old or antiquated, βραχίονος π. is of long standing, Hipp.
in Pass. also, to become old, Plat.
like Lat. antiquare, to abrogate a law, NTest.

div1.head: πάλαι
div1.sense: long ago, in olden time, in days of yore, in time gone by Il., Soph., etc.; πάλαι ποτέ once upon a time, Ar.:—often used with a pres. in the sense of a perf., ὁρῶ πάλαι, Lat. dudum video, I have long seen, Soph.; πάλαι ποτʼ ὄντες ye who have long ago been, Ar.;—also with the Art., τὸ πάλαι Hdt., Thuc., etc.
πάλαι is often used like an adj. with the Art. and a Noun, οἱ πάλαι φῶτες men of old, Pind.; Κάδμου τοῦ πάλαι Soph.; τὰ π. Dem.
of time just past, ἠμὲν πάλαι ἠδʼ ἔτι καὶ νῦν Il.: hence πάλαι comes to mean not long ago, but now, just now, much like ἄρτι, Aesch., Plat.

div1.head: πάλαισμα
div1.sense: a bout or fall in wrestling, Hdt.; ἓν μὲν τόδʼ ἤδη τῶν τριῶν παλαισμάτων Aesch.
any struggle, Trag.
any trick or artifice, subterfuge, Ar.; π. δικαστηρίου a trick of the courts, Aeschin.

div1.head: παλαισμοσύνη
div1.sense: wrestling, the wrestlerʼs art, Hom.

div1.head: παλαιστή
div1.etym: later form of παλαστή, q. v.

div1.head: παλαιστής
div1.sense: a wrestler, Hdt., Plat., etc.
generally, a rival, adversary, Aesch., Soph.: a candidate, suitor, Aesch.

div1.head: παλαιστικός
div1.sense: expert in wrestling, Arist., Luc.

div1.head: παλαίστρα
div1.sense: a palaestra, wrestling-school, wherein wrestlers (παλαισταί) were trained, Hdt., Eur.

div1.head: παλαιστρίτης
div1.sense: like a παλαιστής, π. θεός god of the palaestra, Babr.

div1.head: παλαίφατος
div1.sense: spoken long ago, Od., Pind., Aesch.
having a legend attached to it, legendary, δρῦς π. an oak of ancient story, Od.
generally, primeval, ancient, olden, Pind., Soph.

div1.head: παλαίχθων
div1.sense: that has been long in a country, an ancient inhabitant, indigenous, Aesch., Anth.

div1.head: παλαίω
div1.sense: to wrestle, Il., Plat.: π. τινί to wrestle with one, Od., Pind.:—Pass., παλαισθείς beaten, Eur.

div1.head: παλαίωσις
div1.sense: a growing old, Strab.

div1.head: παλαμάομαι
div1.sense: Dep.
to manage, execute, Xen.
like μηχανάομαι, to manage adroitly, contrive cunningly, Ar.

div1.head: Παλαμήδης
div1.sense: name of a hero, the Inventor, Ar., etc.

div1.head: παλάμη
div1.sense: the palm of the hand, the hand, Hom., Pind.; πάσχειν τι ὑπʼ Ἄρηος παλαμάων by the hands of Ares, Il.:—hence a deed of force, Soph.
the hand as used in works of art, Hes.

metaph. cunning, art, a device, plan, method, Hdt., etc.; π. βιότου a device for oneʼs livelihood, Theogn.: of the gods, θεοῦ σὺν παλάμᾳ, θεῶν παλάμαι, παλάμαις Διός by their arts, Pind.; παλάμας πλέκειν Ar.; π. πυριγενής a fire-born instrument, i. e. a sword, Eur.

div1.head: παλαμναῖος
div1.sense: one guilty of violence, a blood-guilty man, murderer, Aesch., Soph.: —ὦ παλαμναίη oh miscreant! of the fox, Babr.
= ἀλάστωρ, the avenger of blood, Eur., Xen.

div1.head: παλάσσω
div1.sense: to besprinkle, sully, defile, Od.; mostly in Pass., Hom.:—Mid., παλάσσετο χεῖρας he defiled his hands, Il.
Pass. also of things, to be scattered abroad, Il.
perf. pass. of lots shaken in an urn, κλήρῳ πεπαλάχθαι to determine oneʼs fate by lot, Hom.; cf. πάλος.

div1.head: παλαστή
div1.sense: the palm of the hand: as a measure of length, a palm, four fingersʼ breadth, a little more than three inches.

div1.head: παλαστιαῖος
div1.sense: a palm long or broad, Hdt.

div1.head: παλεύω
div1.sense: to catch by decoy-birds, Ar.

div1.head: παλέω
div1.sense: to be disabled, Hdt.

div1.head: πάλη
div1.sense: wrestling, Lat. lucta, Hom., Pind., etc.
generally, battle, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: παλιγγενεσία
div1.sense: a being born again, new birth; used by Cic. of his restoration after exile:— hence, in NTest.,
regeneration by baptism.

div1.head: παλίγγλωσσος
div1.sense: contradictory, false, Pind.
of strange or foreign tongue, Pind.

div1.head: παλιγκαπηλεύω
div1.sense: to sell over again, sell wares by retail, Dem.

div1.head: παλιγκάπηλος
div1.sense: one who buys and sells again, a petty retailer, huckster, Ar., Dem.

div1.head: παλίγκοτος
div1.sense: of wounds, breaking out afresh: metaph. in adv., αὐτῷ παλιγκότως συνεφέρετο according to his old ill-luck fared it with him, Hdt.
of fresh outbreaks of passion, κληδόνες π. injurious, untoward reports, Aesch.; π. τύχη adverse fortune, Aesch.
of persons, hostile, malignant, Ar., Theocr.; παλίγκοτοι adversaries, Pind.
div1.etym: -κοτος seems to be a termin., as in ἀλλόκοτος.

div1.head: παλίγκραιπνος
div1.sense: very swift, Anth.

div1.head: παλιλλογέω
div1.sense: to say again, repeat, recapitulate, 3rd sg. plup. pass. ἐπαλιλλόγητο Hdt.

div1.head: παλιλλογία
div1.sense: recapitulation, Arist.
retractation, recantation, Theophr.

div1.head: παλίλλογος
div1.sense: to gather collected again, Il.
repeated.

div1.head: παλίμβαμος
div1.sense: walking back, ἱστῶν παλίμβαμοι ὁδοί, of women working at the loom, Pind.

div1.head: παλιμβλαστής
div1.sense: growing again, Eur.

div1.head: παλίμβολος
div1.sense: thrown back, reversed: hence, untrustworthy, uncertain, unstable, Plat.: τὸ παλίμβολον instability, Aeschin.

div1.head: παλιμμήκης
div1.sense: doubly long, Aesch.

div1.head: παλιμπετής
div1.sense: falling back:—in neut. as adv., back, back again, Hom.

div1.head: παλίμπηξις
div1.sense: a patching up or cobbling of shoes, Theophr.

div1.head: παλίμπλαγκτος
div1.sense: back-wandering, Aesch.

div1.head: παλιμπλάζομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to wander back, only in aor. 1 part. παλιμπλαγχθείς wandering homewards, Hom.

div1.head: παλιμπλανής
div1.sense: wandering to and fro, Anth.

div1.head: παλίμπλυτος
div1.sense: washed up again, vamped up; metaph. of a plagiarist, Anth.

div1.head: παλίμποινος
div1.sense: retributive: παλίμποινα, ων, τά, retribution, repayment, Aesch.

div1.head: παλιμπρυμνηδόν
div1.sense: stern-foremost, Eur.

div1.head: παλίμφημος
div1.sense: back-speaking, recanting, π. ἀοιδά παλινῳδία, Eur.

div1.head: παλίμψηστος
div1.sense: scraped again, βιβλίον παλ. a palimpsest, i. e. a parchment from which one writing has been erased to make room for another, Plut.

div1.head: παλινάγρετος
div1.sense: to be taken back or recalled, ἔπος οὐ παλινάγρετον an irrevocable word, Il.

div1.head: παλιναυξής
div1.sense: growing again, Anth.

div1.head: παλιναυτόμολος
div1.sense: a double deserter, Xen.

div1.head: παλινδικία
div1.sense: a second action, a new trial, Plut.

div1.head: παλινδίνητος
div1.sense: whirling round and round, Anth.

div1.head: παλινδρομέω
div1.sense: to run back again, of a ship, Plut.

div1.head: παλινδρομία
div1.sense: a running back or backwards, Anth.

div1.head: παλινδρομικός
div1.sense: recurring, of the tide, Strab.

div1.head: παλίνδρομος
div1.sense: running back again, Luc.

div1.head: παλινηνεμία
div1.sense: a returning calm, Anth.

div1.head: παλινόρμενος
div1.sense: rushing back, Il.

div1.head: παλίνορσος
div1.sense: starting back, Il.:—neut. as adv. back again, Anth.; Attic παλίνορρον, with a backward wrench, Ar.

div1.head: παλίνορτος
div1.sense: recurring, inveterate, much like παλίγ-κοτος, Aesch.

div1.head: πάλιν
div1.sense: of Place, back, backwards, Hom., Hes., etc.; π. χωρέειν Hdt.; π. ἔρχεσθαι Aesch., etc.; also, πάλιν δοῦναι to give back, restore, Il.:—c. gen., πάλιν τράπεθʼ υἷος ἑοῖο she turned back from her son, Il.; πάλιν κίε θυγατέρος ἧς Il.;—also πάλιν αὖτις back again, αὖτε πάλιν, ἂψ π., π. ὀπίσσω, etc.

with a notion of contradiction, πάλιν ἐρεῖν to gain say (i. e. say against), Il.; but, μῦθον πάλιν λάζεσθαι to take back oneʼs word, unsay it, Il.; opp. to ἀληθέα εἰπεῖν, Od.: in Prose, contrariwise, Plat.: —c. gen., τὸ πάλιν νεότητος youthʼs opposite, Pind.; χρόνου τὸ πάλιν the change of time, Eur.
of Time, again, once more, anew, Soph., etc.; so, αὖθις πάλιν, πάλιν αὖθις, αὖ πάλιν, πάλιν αὖ, αὖ πάλιν αὖθις, αὖθις αὖ πάλιν, Attic
again, in turn, Soph.

div1.head: παλίνσκιος
div1.sense: shaded over again, thick-shaded, Hhymn., etc.

div1.head: παλινσκοπιά
div1.sense: a looking back again; acc. as adv. in the opposite direction, Eur.

div1.head: παλίνσοος
div1.sense: safe again, recovered, Anth.

div1.head: παλινστομέω
div1.sense: to speak words of ill omen, Aesch.

div1.head: παλίντιτος
div1.sense: like ἄντιτος, requited, avenged, Od.

div1.head: παλίντονος
div1.sense: back-stretched, back-bending, epith. of the bow, Hom. It denotes the form of the Homeric bow, which when unstrung bent in a direction contrary to that which it took when strung.
ἡνίαι π. back-stretched reins, Ar.

div1.head: παλιντριβής
div1.sense: rubbed again and again: hence hardened, knavish, Soph.

div1.head: παλίντροπος
div1.sense: turned back, averted, Lat. retortus, π. ὄμματα Aesch.
turning back, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: παλιντυχής
div1.sense: with a reverse of fortune, Aesch.

div1.head: παλινῳδέω
div1.sense: to recant an ode and so, generally, to revoke, recant, Plat.

div1.head: παλινῳδία
div1.sense: a palinode or recantation, a name first given to an ode by Stesichorus, in which he recants his attack upon Helen, Plat.

div1.head: παλίουρος
div1.sense: a thorny shrub, Rhamnus paliurus, Eur., Theocr.

div1.head: παλιουροφόρος
div1.sense: made of the wood of the παλίουρος, Anth.

div1.head: παλιρροέω
div1.sense: to ebb and flow, Lat. reciprocare, Strab., Theophr.

div1.head: παλιρρόθιος
div1.sense: back-rushing, refluent, Od.

div1.head: παλίρροια
div1.sense: the reflux of water, back-water, Hdt.:— metaph. of fortune, Polyb.

div1.head: παλίρροπος
div1.sense: inclining backwards, π. γόνυ backward-sinking knee, Eur.

div1.head: παλίρροος
div1.sense: back-flowing, refluent, Eur.
metaph. recurring, returning upon oneʼs head, Eur.

div1.head: παλίρροχθος
div1.sense: roaring with ebb and flow, Aesch.

div1.head: παλιρρύμη
div1.sense: a rush backwards, back-flow, Plut.

div1.head: παλίρρυτος
div1.sense: in retribution, Soph.

div1.head: παλίσσυτος
div1.sense: rushing hurriedly back, δρόμημα π. hurried flight, Soph.; παλ. στείχειν Eur.

div1.head: παλίωξις
div1.sense: pursuit back again or in turn, as when fugitives rally and turn on their pursuers, Il., Hes.

div1.head: Παλλάδιον
div1.sense: a statue of Pallas, Hdt., Ar.

div1.head: παλλακεύομαι
div1.sense: as Dep., π. τινα to keep as a concubine, Hdt.
as Pass. to be a concubine, Plut.

div1.head: παλλακίς
div1.sense: a concubine, mistress, Lat. pellex, opp. to a lawful wife (κουριδίη ἄλοχος) , Hom.
div1.etym: Prob. from same Root as παλλάς νεᾶνις.

div1.head: Παλλάς
div1.sense: Pallas, in Hom. always Παλλὰς Ἀθήνη or Παλλὰς Ἀθηναίη.
div1.etym: Commonly deriv. from πάλλω, either as brandisher of the spear:—but prob. it is an old word παλλάς νεᾶνις.

div1.head: πάλλευκος
div1.sense: all-white, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: Παλληνεύς
div1.sense: an inhabitant of Παλλήνη; fem. Παλληνίς, ίδος, Hdt.

div1.head: Παλλήνη
div1.sense: a peninsula and town of Chalcidice, Hdt., etc.
an Attic deme.

div1.head: πάλλω
div1.sense: to poise or sway a missile before it is thrown, Eur., Ar.
to sway other arms, not missiles, σάκος Hes.; πέλτας Eur.:—then, to toss a child, Il.; Νὺξ ὄχημʼ ἔπαλλεν she drave it furiously, Eur.

κλήρους ἐν κυνέηι πάλλον they shook the lots together in a helmet, till one leapt forth, Hom.: absol. to cast lots, Il.; ὅθʼ αὐτοὺς οἱ βραβεῖς κλήροις ἔπηλαν where the stewards ranged them by casting lots, Soph.:—Mid. to draw lots, ἔλαχον ἅλα παλλομένων I obtained the sea when we cast lots, Il.; so in Hdt., Soph.

Pass. to swing or dash oneself, ἐν ἄντυγι πάλτο he dashed himself upon the shield-rim, Il.: to quiver, leap, esp. in fear, πάλλεται ἦτορ Il.; also of the person, παλλομένη κραδίην Il.; of dying fish, to quiver, leap, Hdt.
intr., like the Pass., to leap, bound, Eur.: to quiver, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: πάλος
div1.sense: the lot cast from a shaken helmet, ἂμ πάλον θέμεν to cast the lot again, Pind.; πάλωι λαχεῖν to obtain by lot, Hdt., Aesch.; ἀρχὰς πάλωι ἄρχειν to hold public offices by lot, Hdt.; οὓς ἐκλήρωσεν πάλος Eur.

div1.head: παλτός
div1.sense: brandished, hurled, Soph.
as Subst., παλτόν, οῦ, a light spear used by the Persian cavalry, like the Moorish jereed, Xen.

div1.head: παλύνω
div1.sense: to strew or sprinkle, ἄλφιτα παλύνειν Hom.
to bestrew, besprinkle, with dat. of the thing sprinkled, παλύνας ἀλφίτου ἀκτῇ Od.
of liquids, ἁ σῦριγξ εὐρῶτι παλύνεται Theocr.
to sprinkle, cover lightly, χιὼν ἐπάλυνεν ἀρούρας Il.

div1.head: πᾶμα
div1.sense: property, Anth.

div1.head: παμβασιλεία
div1.sense: absolute monarchy, Arist.

div1.head: παμβασίλεια
div1.sense: queen of all, Ar.

div1.head: παμβασιλεύς
div1.sense: an absolute monarch, Arist.

div1.head: παμβίας
div1.sense: all-subduing, Pind.

div1.head: παμμάταιος
div1.sense: all-vain, all-useless, Aesch.

div1.head: πάμμαχος
div1.sense: fighting with all, Aesch.: esp. = παγκρατιαστής, ready for every kind of contest, Plat., Theocr.

div1.head: πάμμεγας
div1.sense: very great, immense, Plat.

div1.head: παμμεγέθης
div1.sense: neut. as adv., παμμέγεθες ἀναβοᾶν Aeschin.

div1.head: παμμέλας
div1.sense: all-black, Od.

div1.head: παμμήκης
div1.sense: very long, prolonged, Soph., Plat.

div1.head: πάμμηνος
div1.sense: through all months, the live-long year, Soph.

div1.head: παμμήτωρ
div1.sense: mother of all, Aesch.
a very mother, mother indeed, τοῦδε π. νεκροῦ Soph.

div1.head: παμμίαρος
div1.sense: all-abominable, Ar.

div1.head: παμμιγής
div1.sense: all-mingled, promiscuous, Aesch.

div1.head: πάμμορος
div1.sense: all-hapless, Soph.

div1.head: παμπάλαιος
div1.sense: very old, Plat., etc.

div1.head: πάμπαν
div1.sense: like πάνυ, quite, wholly, altogether, Hom., Hes., Eur.; οὐδέ τι πάμπαν not at all, by no means, Il.: with the Art., τὸ π. Eur.

div1.head: παμπειθής
div1.sense: all-persuasive, Pind.

div1.head: παμπήδην
div1.sense: like πάμπαν, entirely, Theogn., Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: παμπησία
div1.sense: entire possession, the full property, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: παμπληθεί
div1.sense: with the whole multitude, NTest.

div1.head: παμπληθής
div1.sense: of or with the whole multitude, Xen.
= πάμπολυς, very numerous. multitudinous, Plat., Dem.
neut. as adv. entirely, Dem.

div1.head: πάμπληκτος
div1.sense: in which all sorts of blows are given and received, ἄεθλα Soph.

div1.head: παμποίκιλος
div1.sense: all-variegated, of rich and varied work, Hom.: all-spotted, of fawn-skins, Eur.

div1.head: πάμπολις
div1.sense: prevailing in all cities, universal, Soph.

div1.head: πάμπολυς
div1.sense: very much, great, large or numerous, Ar., Xen.:—in pl. very many, Ar.

div1.head: παμπόνηρος
div1.sense: all-depraved, thoroughly knavish, Ar., Plat.: adv., παμπονήρως ἔχειν to be very ill, Luc.

div1.head: παμπόρφυρος
div1.sense: all-purple, Pind.

div1.head: παμπότνια
div1.sense: all-venerable, Anth.

div1.head: πάμπρεπτος
div1.sense: all-conspicuous, Aesch.

div1.head: παμπρόσθη
div1.sense: corrupt in Aesch. Ag.

div1.head: πάμπρωτος
div1.sense: first of all, the very first, Il.: in neut. πάμπρωτον and -τα as adv., Hom.

div1.head: παμφάγος
div1.sense: all-devouring, voracious, Eur.

div1.head: παμφαής
div1.sense: all-shining, all-brilliant, radiant, Soph., Eur., etc.; of honey, bright, pure, Aesch.

div1.head: παμφαίνω
div1.sense: to shine or beam brightly, of burnished metal, Il.; of a star, Il.; στήθεσι παμφαίνοντες with their breasts white-gleaming, i. e. naked, Il.

div1.head: παμφανόων
div1.etym: Epic part. as if from παμφᾰνάω
div1.sense: bright-shining, beaming, of burnished metal, Il.; of the Sun, Od.

div1.head: παμφάρμακος
div1.sense: skilled in all charms or drugs, Pind.

div1.head: πάμφθαρτος
div1.sense: all-destroying, Aesch.

div1.head: πάμφλεκτος
div1.sense: all-blazing, Soph.

div1.head: πάμφορβος
div1.sense: all-feeding, Anth.

div1.head: πάμφορος
div1.sense: all-bearing, all-productive, Lat. omnium ferax, χώρη παμφορωτέρη Hdt.; a friend is called παμφορώτατον κτῆμα by Xen.
bearing all things with it, π. χέραδος a mixed mass of rubbish, Pind.

div1.head: πάμφυλος
div1.sense: of mingled tribes, of all sorts, Ar.

div1.head: πάμφωνος
div1.sense: with all tones, full-toned or many-tone, Pind.: generally, expressive, Anth.

div1.head: παμψηφεί
div1.sense: by all the votes, Anth.

div1.head: πάμψυχος
div1.sense: with all his soul, or = πασῶν τῶν ψυχῶν, Soph.

div1.head: πάναβρος
div1.sense: quite or very soft, Luc.

div1.head: παναγής
div1.sense: all-hallowed, Lat. sacrosanctus, Plut.

div1.head: παναγρεύς
div1.sense: one who catches everything, Anth.

div1.head: πάναγρος
div1.sense: catching all, Il.

div1.head: πανάγρυπνος
div1.sense: all-wakeful, Anth.

div1.head: Παναθήναια
div1.sense: Παν-αθήναια (sc. ἱερά), τά, the Panathenaea, two festivals of the Athenians, τὰ μεγάλα and τὰ μικρά, in honour of Athena, Ar., etc. The greater was celebrated in the third year of each Olympiad, the latter annually.

div1.head: Παναθηναϊκός
div1.sense: of or at the Panathenaea, Thuc.

div1.head: πανάθλιος
div1.sense: all-wretched, Trag.

div1.head: παναιγλήεις
div1.sense: all-shining, Anth.

div1.head: πάναιθος
div1.sense: all-blazing, Il.

div1.head: παναίολος
div1.sense: epith. of armour, either all-variegated, sparkling, or, quite light, easily-moved, Il.
metaph. manifold, Aesch.

div1.head: παναίσχης
div1.sense: utterly ugly, ugliest, Arist.[accent corr. to agree with LSJ]

div1.head: παναίτιος
div1.sense: the cause of all, Aesch.
to whom all the guilt belongs, Aesch.

div1.head: παναλάστωρ
div1.sense: all-avenging, Anth.

div1.head: παναληθής
div1.sense: all true, all too true, of a person, Aesch.
of things, absolutely true or real, Plat.

div1.head: παναλκής
div1.sense: all-powerful, Aesch.

div1.head: πανάλωτος
div1.sense: all-embracing, Aesch.

div1.head: πανάμμορος
div1.sense: without any share in a thing, c. gen., Anth.

div1.head: πανάμωμος
div1.sense: all-blameless, Simon.

div1.head: παναοίδιμος
div1.sense: sung by all, Anth.

div1.head: πανάπαλος
div1.sense: all-tender, all-delicate, Od.

div1.head: παναπήμων
div1.sense: all-harmless, Hes., Anth.

div1.head: πανάποτμος
div1.sense: all-hapless, Il.

div1.head: πανάργυρος
div1.sense: all-silver, Od.

div1.head: πανάρετος
div1.sense: all virtuous, Luc.

div1.head: πανάριστος
div1.sense: best of all, Hes., Anth.

div1.head: παναρκής
div1.sense: all-sufficing:—the gen. fem. παναρκέτας in Aesch. is prob. corrupt.

div1.head: παναρμόνιος
div1.sense: in Music, suited to all modes; τὸ π. (sc. ὄργανον) an instrument on which all modes can be played, Plat.
metaph. all harmonious, Plat.

div1.head: πάναρχος
div1.sense: all-powerful, ruling all, Soph.

div1.head: πανατρεκής
div1.sense: all-exact, infallible, Anth.

div1.head: παναφῆλιξ
div1.sense: all-away from the friends of oneʼs youth, Il.

div1.head: πανάφθιτος
div1.sense: all-imperishable, Anth.

div1.head: πανάφυκτος
div1.sense: all-inevitable, Anth.

div1.head: πανάφυλλος
div1.sense: all-leafless, Hhymn.

div1.head: Παναχαιοί
div1.sense: all the Achaians, Hom.

div1.head: παναώριος
div1.sense: all-untimely, doomed to an untimely end, Il., Anth.

div1.head: πανδαισία
div1.sense: a complete banquet, a banquet at which nothing is wanting, Hdt., Ar.

div1.head: πανδάκρυτος
div1.sense: all-tearful, Soph.
allbewept, most miserable, Trag.

div1.head: πανδαμάτωρ
div1.sense: the all-subduer, all-tamer, Hom., Soph.

div1.head: πάνδεινος
div1.sense: all-dreadful, terrible, Plat.: —πάνδεινόν ἐστι it is outrageous, Dem.
clever at all things, Plat., Dem.

div1.head: πανδελέτειος
div1.sense: knavish like Pandeletus (a sycophant), Ar.

div1.head: πανδερκής
div1.sense: all-seeing, Anth.

div1.head: πανδημεί
div1.sense: with the whole people, in a mass or body, Hdt., Aesch.; π. βοηθεῖν, στρατεύειν, of a whole people going out to war, a levee en masse, Thuc.

div1.head: πανδημία
div1.sense: the whole people, Plat.

div1.head: πανδήμιος
div1.sense: πτωχὸς πανδήμιος one who begs of all people, a public beggar, Od.; π. πόλις the city with all its people, Soph.

div1.head: πάνδημος
div1.sense: of or belonging to all the people, public, common, Soph., Eur.; π. πόλις, στρατός the whole body of the city, of the army, Soph.
π. Ἔρως, common, vulgar love, as opp. to the spiritual sort (οὐράνιος) , Plat., Xen.

div1.head: Πάνδια
div1.sense: Πάν-δια (sc. ἱερά) a feast of Zeus, Dem.

div1.head: πάνδικος
div1.sense: all righteous, Soph. adv. -κως, most justly, Aesch.; but simply = πάντως, Soph.

div1.head: Πανδιονίς
div1.sense: daughter of Pandion, i. e. the swallow, Hes.
one of the Attic tribes, Aeschin.

div1.head: πανδοκεῖον
div1.sense: a house for the reception of strangers, an inn, hotel, Ar., Dem., etc.

div1.head: πανδοκεύς
div1.sense: one who receives all comers, an innkeeper, host, Plat., etc.: metaph., πάσης κακίας π. Plat.

div1.head: πανδοκεύτρια
div1.sense: a hostess, Ar.; metaph., φάλαινα π. a sea-monster ready to take all in, Ar.

div1.head: πανδοκεύω
div1.sense: to receive and entertain as a host, Hdt., Plat.: absol. to keep an inn, Theophr.

div1.head: πανδοκέω
div1.sense: metaph. to take upon oneself, assume, Aesch.

div1.head: πάνδοκος
div1.sense: all-receiving, common to all, Pind., Aesch.: c. gen., δόμοι π. ξένων Aesch.

div1.head: πανδοξία
div1.sense: absolute fame, perfect glory, Pind.

div1.head: πάνδυρτος
div1.sense: all-lamentable, all-plaintive, Trag.

div1.head: πανδυσία
div1.sense: the total setting of a star, Anth.

div1.head: πανδώρα
div1.sense: giver of all, Ar.
pass. as fem. prop. n., Pandora, i. e. the all-endowed, a beautiful female, made by Hephaestus, who received presents from all the gods, in order to win the heart of Epimetheus, Hes.

div1.head: πάνδωρος
div1.sense: giver of all, Epic Hom.

div1.head: πανεθνεί
div1.sense: with the whole nation, Strab.

div1.head: πανείκελος
div1.sense: like in all points, Anth.

div1.head: Πανεῖον
div1.sense: a temple of Pan, Strab.

div1.head: πανελεύθερος
div1.sense: entirely free, Anth.

div1.head: Πανέλληνες
div1.sense: all the Hellenes, Il., Hes., Eur.

div1.head: Πάνεμος
div1.sense: Boeotian name of the month Μεταγειτνιών, Philipp. ap. Dem.

div1.head: πανεπήρατος
div1.sense: all-lovely, Anth.

div1.head: πανεπίσκοπος
div1.sense: all-surveying, Anth.

div1.head: πανεργέτης
div1.sense: all-effecting, Doric gen. -εργέτα Aesch.

div1.head: πανέρημος
div1.sense: all-desolate, Luc.

div1.head: πανέσπερος
div1.sense: lasting the whole evening, Anth.

div1.head: πανέστιος
div1.sense: with all the household, Plut.

div1.head: πάνετες
div1.sense: all the year long, Pind.

div1.head: πανευδαίμων
div1.sense: quite happy, Luc.

div1.head: πανεύτονος
div1.sense: much strained, very active, Anth.

div1.head: πάνεφθος
div1.sense: of metals, quite purified, Hes.

div1.head: πανηγυρίζω
div1.sense: to celebrate or attend a festival, πανηγύρις π. to keep holy-days, Hdt.

div1.head: πανηγυρικός
div1.sense: fit for a public festival, ὁ λόγος ὁ π., or ὁ π. alone, a panegyric, eulogy, Isocr., Arist.
ostentatious, pompous, Plut.

div1.head: πανήγυρις
div1.sense: a general or national assembly, esp. a festal assembly in honour of a national god, Pind., Aesch., etc.; πανηγύρις πανηγυρίζειν, ἀνάγειν, ποιεῖσθαι to hold such festivals, keep holy-days, Hdt.
any assembly, θεῶν Aesch.; φίλων Eur.:— the assembly, people assembled, Thuc.

div1.head: πανηγυριστής
div1.sense: one who attends a πανήγυρις, Luc.

div1.head: πανῆμαρ
div1.sense: all day, the livelong day, Od.

div1.head: πανημερεύω
div1.sense: to spend the whole day in a thing, c. acc., Eur.

div1.head: πανημέριος
div1.sense: all day long, πανημέριοι θεὸν ἱλάσκοντο continued to appease the god all day long, Il.; ὅσσον τε πανημερίη νηῦς ἤνυσεν as much as a ship sails in a whole day, Od.:—neut. πανημέριον, as adv. = πανῆμαρ, Il.
of the whole day, Eur.

div1.head: πανήμερος
div1.sense: = πᾰν-ημέριος, Aesch.:—neut. πανημερόν (oxyt.) as adv., Hdt.
Doric πανάμερος πάντως τῇδε τῇ ἡμέρᾳ, Soph.

div1.head: πανθηλής
div1.sense: with all manner of trees, Anth.

div1.head: πάνθηρ
div1.sense: the panther or leopard, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: πανθυμαδόν
div1.sense: in high wrath, Od.

div1.head: πάνθυτος
div1.sense: celebrated with all kinds of sacrifices, Soph.

div1.head: Πανικός
div1.sense: of or for Pan, Luc.
of fears, panic, such fears being attributed to Pan, Plut.

div1.head: πανίμερος
div1.sense: all-lovely, Anth.
burning with desire, Soph.

div1.head: Πανιώνιον
div1.sense: their place of meeting at Mycale, and the common temple there built, Hdt.
Πανιώνια (sc. ἱερά), τά, the festival of the united Ionians, Hdt.

div1.head: πανλώβητος
div1.sense: grievously disfigured, hideous, Luc.

div1.head: παννυχίζω
div1.sense: to celebrate a night festival, keep vigil, τῇ θεᾷ Ar.
generally, to do anything the livelong night, φλὸξ συνεχὲς π. it lasts all night long, Pind.; c. acc., π. τὴν νύκτα to spend the livelong night, Ar.

div1.head: παννυχικός
div1.sense: fit for a night-reveller, Anth.

div1.head: παννύχιος
div1.sense: all night long, εὗδον παννύχιοι Il.; π. χοροί Soph.; τὸ ἐλλύχνιον καίεται παννύχιον Hdt.:—neut. as adv., Il. παν-νῡχίς, ίδος, ἡ, (νύξ) a night-festival, vigil, Hdt., Eur., etc.
a night-watch, vigil, Soph.

div1.head: πάννυχος
div1.sense: = παννύχιος, Od., Hdt., Attic
lasting all the night, τί πάννυχον ὕπνον ἀωτεῖς; Il.; π. σελάνα Eur.:—neut. pl. as adv., πάννυχα the livelong night, Soph.

div1.head: πανόδυρτος
div1.sense: most lamentable, Anth.

div1.head: πάνοιζυς
div1.sense: gen. υος, all-unhappy, Aesch.

div1.head: πανοικίᾳ
div1.sense: with all the house, household and all, Hdt.

div1.head: πανοίκιος
div1.sense: with all oneʼs house, Strab.

div1.head: πανοίμοι
div1.sense: Exclam. oh utter woe! Aesch.

div1.head: πανόλβιος
div1.sense: truly happy, Hhymn., Theogn.

div1.head: πανομιλεί
div1.sense: in whole troops, Aesch.

div1.head: πανόμματος
div1.sense: all-eyed, Anth.

div1.head: πανόμοιος
div1.sense: just like, Anth.

div1.head: πανομφαῖος
div1.sense: sender of all ominous voices, author of all divination, Il., Anth.

div1.head: πανοπλία
div1.sense: the full armour of an ὁπλίτης, i. e. shield, helmet, breastplate, greaves, sword, and lance, a full suit of armour, panoply, Thuc., etc.; πανοπλίᾳ, Ionic -ίῃ, in full armour, cap-à-pie, Hdt.; so, πανοπλίαν ἔχων στῆναι Ar.; τὴν π. λαβεῖν Ar.:— metaph., ἡ π. τοῦ θεοῦ NTest.

div1.head: πανοπλίτης
div1.sense: a man in full armour, Tyrtae.

div1.head: πάνοπλος
div1.sense: in full armour, full-armed, Aesch., Eur.; πάνοπλα ἀμφιβλήματα suits of full armour, Eur.

div1.head: πανόπτης
div1.sense: the all-seeing, of the sun, Aesch.; of the herdsman Argus, Eur.

div1.head: πάνορμος
div1.sense: always fit for landing in, Od.

div1.head: Πάνορμος
div1.sense: the ancient name of Palermo, Thuc.; Πανορμῖτις, ιδος, ἡ, its territory, Polyb.

div1.head: πανός
div1.sense: a torch, = φανός, Aesch.

div1.head: πανουργέω
div1.sense: to play the knave or villain, Eur., Ar.; ἃ πανουργεῖς the rogueries you are playing, Ar.; ὅσια πανουργήσασα, an oxymoron, having dared a righteous crime, Soph.

div1.head: πανούργημα
div1.sense: a knavish trick, villany, Soph.

div1.head: πανουργία
div1.sense: knavery, roguery, villany, Lat. malitia, Aesch., Soph.: in pl. knaveries, villanies, Soph., etc.

div1.head: πανουργιππαρχίδης
div1.sense: knave-Hipparchides, Ar.

div1.head: πανοῦργος
div1.sense: ready to do anything wicked, knavish, villanous, Aesch., etc.:—as Subst. a knave, rogue, villain, Eur., Ar.; τὰ π. the knavish sort, Soph.; but also = πανουργία, Soph.:—comp. -ότερος, Sup. -ότατος, Ar.
adv. -γως, Sup. -ότατα, Ar.
in a less positively bad sense, cunning, crafty, clever, smart, Plat., etc.

div1.head: πανόψιος
div1.sense: all-seen, in the sight of all, Il.

div1.head: Πάν
div1.sense: Pan, god of Arcadia, son of Hermes, Hhymn.; represented with goatʼs feet, horns, and shaggy hair. At Athens his worship began after the battle of Marathon, Hdt.:—pl. Πᾶνες in Ar., Theocr.

div1.head: πανσαγία
div1.sense: in full armour, Soph.

div1.head: πανσέληνος
div1.sense: of the moon, at the full, ἡ σελήνη ἐτύγχανε οὖσα π. Thuc.; π. κύκλος the moonʼs full orb, Eur.
ἡ πανσέληνος (sc. ὥρα) the time of full moon, Hdt., Ar.; τὰν αὔριον π. at the next full moon, Soph.; without the Art., Aesch.

div1.head: πάνσεμνος
div1.sense: all-majestic, Luc.

div1.head: πάνσκοπος
div1.sense: all-seeing, Anth.

div1.head: πάνσοφος
div1.sense: all-wise, Eur., Plat.

div1.head: πανσπερμία
div1.sense: a mixture of all seeds, Luc.

div1.head: πάνσπερμος
div1.sense: composed of all sorts of seeds, Anth.

div1.head: πανστρατιά
div1.sense: a levy of the whole army, πανστρατιᾶς γενομένης Thuc.: elsewhere only in dat. πανστρατιᾷ as adv., with the whole army, Hdt., Thuc.; cf. πανσυδίῃ.

div1.head: πανσυδίῃ
div1.sense: with all speed, = πάσῃ τῇ σπουδῇ, Il.; Attic πανσυδίᾳ or πασσυδίᾳ, Eur.—No nom. πανσυδία occurs, cf. πανστρατιά.

div1.head: πανσυδί
div1.sense: with all oneʼs force; π. διεφθάρθαι utterly, Thuc.

div1.head: πάνσυρτος
div1.sense: swept all together, αἰὼν πάνσυρτος ἀχέων a life of accumulated woes, Soph.

div1.head: παντάλας
div1.sense: all-wretched, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: παντάπασι
div1.sense: all in all, altogether, wholly, absolutely, Hdt., Attic; οὐ π. οὕτως ἀλόγως not so absolutely without reason, Thuc.:—with the Art., τὸ π. Thuc.
in replying, it affirms strongly, by all means, quite so, undoubtedly, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: πανταρκής
div1.sense: all-powerful, Aesch.

div1.head: παντάρχης
div1.sense: lord of all, Ar.

div1.head: πάνταρχος
div1.sense: all-ruling, Soph.

div1.head: πανταχῇ
div1.sense: adv. of Place, everywhere, Lat. ubique, ubivis, Thuc., Plat., etc.:—c. gen. loci, in every part of, π. τοῦ Ἑλλησπόντου Hdt.; π. ἄστεως Eur.
on every side, in every direction, every way, Hdt., Attic
by all means, absolutely, Hdt.; οὐ κατʼ ἓν μόνον, ἀλλὰ π. in all respects, Hdt.; π. δρῶντες, i. e. whatever we do, Soph.

div1.head: πανταχόθεν
div1.sense: adv. from all places, from all quarters, on every side, Lat. undique, Hdt., Attic
from every side, i. e. in every way, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: πανταχοῖ
div1.sense: in every direction, any whither, every way, Lat. quovis, quoquoversus, Ar., Dem.

div1.head: πανταχοῦ
div1.sense: everywhere, Lat. ubique, ubivis, Hdt., Attic:—c. gen., π. τῆς γῆς Plat.
altogether, always, absolutely, Plat.

div1.head: πανταχῶς
div1.sense: in all ways, altogether, Lat. omnino, Plat.

div1.head: παντέλεια
div1.sense: consummation, Polyb.

div1.head: παντελής
div1.sense: all-complete, absolute, complete, entire, Aesch., etc.; π. δάμαρ uxor legitima, the mistress of the house, Soph.; π. ἐσχάραι the whole number of sacrificial hearths, their complete tale, Soph.
act. all-accomplishing, all-achieving, Aesch.
adv. παντελῶς, Ionic -έως, altogether, utterly, absolutely, entirely, completely, Hdt., Attic; παντελέως εἶχε it was quite finished, Hdt.; π. θανεῖν to die outright, Soph.
in answers, most certainly, παντελῶς γε, π. μὲν οὖν Soph., Plat.
later, εἰς τὸ παντελές παντελῶς, NTest.

div1.head: παντευχία
div1.sense: = πανοπλία, Eur.ὅπλων πολέμιος παντευχία enemies in full array, Id.; ξὺν παντευχίᾳ in full armour, Aesch.

div1.head: πάντεχνος
div1.sense: assistant of all arts, Aesch.

div1.head: πάντῃ
div1.sense: every way, on every side, Hom., Hdt., Ar.
in every way, by all means, altogether, entirely, Plat., etc.

div1.head: πάντιμος
div1.sense: all-honourable, Soph.

div1.head: παντοβίης
div1.sense: all-overpowering, Anth.

div1.head: παντογήρως
div1.sense: making all old, i. e. subduing all, Soph.

div1.head: παντοδαπός
div1.sense: of every kind, of all sorts, manifold, Hhymn., Aesch., etc.:—in pl., πολλοὶ καὶ π. Hdt.:—adv. -πῶς, in all kinds of ways, Poeta ap. Arist.
παντοδαπὸς γίγνεται, = παντοῖος γίγνεται, assumes every shape, Ar.

div1.head: πάντοθεν
div1.sense: from all quarters, from every side, Lat. undique, Il., Hdt., Trag.

div1.head: πάντοθι
div1.sense: everywhere, Anth.

div1.head: παντοῖος
div1.sense: of all sorts or kinds, manifold, Hom., Hdt., Soph.
παντοῖος γίγνεται he takes all shapes, i. e. tries every shift, turns every stone, Hdt.
adv. -ως, in all kinds of ways, Hdt., Plat.

div1.head: παντοκράτωρ
div1.sense: almighty, NTest., Anth.

div1.head: παντολιγοχρόνιος
div1.sense: utterly short-lived, Anth.

div1.head: πάντολμος
div1.sense: all-daring, shameless, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: παντόμιμος
div1.sense: a pantomimic actor, Luc.

div1.head: παντομισής
div1.sense: all-hateful, Aesch.

div1.head: παντοποιός
div1.sense: ready for all, reckless, Theophr.

div1.head: παντοπόρος
div1.sense: all-inventive, opp. to ἄπορος, Soph.

div1.head: παντοπώλιον
div1.sense: a place where all things are for sale, a general market, bazaar, Plat.

div1.head: πάντοσε
div1.sense: every way, in all directions, Il., Xen.

div1.head: πάντοτε
div1.sense: adv. at all times, always, NTest.

div1.head: παντοφάγος
div1.sense: all-devouring, Anth.

div1.head: παντόφυρτος
div1.sense: mixed all together, Aesch.

div1.head: πάντρομος
div1.sense: all-trembling, Aesch.

div1.head: πάντροπος
div1.sense: all-routed, tumultuous, Aesch.

div1.head: πάντροφος
div1.sense: all-nourishing, Anth.; π. πελειάς a dove that rears all her nestlings, Aesch.

div1.head: πάντως
div1.sense: altogether; in Hom., always πάντως οὐ, in nowise, by no means, not at all, Lat. omnino non: ἔδεε πάντως it was altogether necessary, Hdt.; εἰ π. ἐλεύσεσθε if ye positively will go, Hdt.
in affirmations, at all events, at any rate, Hdt., Attic; ἄλλως τε πάντως καί above all . . , Aesch.
with the imperat., in command or entreaty, π. παρατίθετε only put on table, Plat.
in answers, yes by all means, Plat.; so, πάντως γάρ . . Ar.; π. δήπου Plat.

div1.head: πανυπείροχος
div1.sense: eminent above all, Anth.

div1.head: πανυπέρτατος
div1.sense: highest of all, Od.

div1.head: πάνυ
div1.sense: altogether, entirely, Aesch., etc.; π. μανθάνω perfectly, Ar.:—with Adjs. very, exceedingly, π. πολλοί, ὀλίγοι, π. μικρός, μέγας Aesch., etc.:— with Advs., π. σφόδρα Ar.; μόλις or μόγις π. Plat.; with Nouns in adv. sense, π. σπουδῇ in very great haste, Dem.; π. ἐξ εἰκότος λόγου Plat.:—with a Part., π. ἀδικῶν if ever so criminal, Thuc.
strengthd., καὶ πάνυ Thuc., Xen.
οὐ πάνυ, like οὐ πάντως, Lat. omnino non, not at all, Soph., etc.
in answers, yes by all means, no doubt, certainly, Ar.; πάνυ γε, πάνυ μὲν οὖν Ar., Plat.: —πάνυ καλῶς, Lat. benigne, no I thank you, Ar.
ὁ πάνυ (where κλεινός may be supplied), the excellent, the famous, οἱ πάνυ τῶν στρατιωτῶν Thuc.; ὁ πάνυ Περικλῆς Xen.

div1.head: πανύστατον
div1.sense: for the very last time, Soph., Eur.; so πανύστατα Eur.

div1.head: πανύστατος
div1.sense: last of all, Hom., Soph., Eur., Anth.

div1.head: πανωλεθρία
div1.sense: utter destruction, utter ruin: in dat., πανωλεθρίῃ ὄλλυσθαι Hdt.; πανωλεθρία ἀπώλετο Thuc.

div1.head: πανώλεθρος
div1.sense: utterly ruined, utterly destroyed, Hdt.; πανωλέθρους ὀλέσθαι Soph.; π. πίπτειν Aesch., etc.
in moral sense, utterly abandoned, Lat. perditissimus, Soph., Eur.
act. all destructive, all-ruinous, Hdt., Aesch.

div1.head: πανώλης
div1.sense: = πανώλεθρος, Aesch.
in moral sense, like πανώλεθρος I. 2, Soph., Eur.
act. all-destructive, Soph.

div1.head: πανωπήεις
div1.sense: visible to all, Anth.

div1.head: πάομαι
div1.etym: The forms ἐπᾱσάμην, πέπᾱμαι must not be confounded with ἐπασάμην, πέπασμαι from πατέομαι, to eat.
div1.sense: to get, acquire, Lat. potior, πᾱσάμενος ἐπίτασσε when youʼve got slaves order them, Theocr.: chiefly in perf. πέπᾱμαι, κέκτημαι, to possess, Pind., Eur., Ar., 3rd pl. πέπανται Xen.; inf. πεπᾶσθαι Solon, Eur.; part. πεπᾱμένος Aesch., Xen.; plup. ἐπεπάμην Xen.

div1.head: παπαιάξ
div1.sense: Comic exaggeration of παπαῖ, ἀππαπαῖ παπαιάξ Ar.
as exclam. of surprise, Eur.

div1.head: παπαῖ
div1.sense: Exclam. of suffering, Lat. vae, oh! Trag.; φεῦ παπαῖ, παπαῖ μάλʼ αὖθις Soph.; also, παππαπαππαπαῖ Soph.; παπαῖ, ἀπαππαπαῖ, παπαπαππαπαππαπαππαπαῖ Soph.
of surprise, like Lat. papae, vah, atat, Hdt.

div1.head: παππάζω
div1.sense: to call any one papa, Il.

div1.head: πάππης
div1.sense: papa, a childʼs word for πατήρ, father, (as μάμμα for μήτηρ) in voc., πάππα φίλε Od.; in acc., πάππαν καλεῖν, like παππάζειν, Ar.

div1.head: παππίζω
div1.sense: to wheedle oneʼs father, Ar.

div1.head: παππίας
div1.sense: dear little papa, Ar.

div1.head: πάππος
div1.sense: a grandfather, Hdt., Ar.: —in pl. oneʼs grand-parents, ancestors, Arist.
a little bird, Ar.

div1.head: παππῷος
div1.sense: of or from oneʼs grand-fathers, Ar.

div1.head: πάπραξ
div1.sense: a Thracian lake-fish, Hdt.

div1.head: παπταίνω
div1.sense: to look earnestly, gaze, Hom.; mostly with notion of alarm or caution, to look or peer around, Hom.
c. acc. to look round for, look after, Il., Pind.; παπτάναις (Doric aor1 part.) having set eyes on a thing, Pind.: to glare at, τινά Soph.

div1.head: πάπυρος
div1.sense: the papyrus, an Egyptian rush with triangular stalks: paper was made by peeling off its outer coat (βύβλος) , and gluing the slips together.
anything made of it, linen, cord, etc., Anth.

div1.head: παραβάκτρος
div1.sense: like a staff, π. θεραπεύμασι with service as of a staff, Eur.

div1.head: παράβακχος
div1.sense: like a Bacchanal, theatrical, Plut.

div1.head: παραβάλλω
div1.sense: to throw beside or by, throw to one, as fodder to horses, Hom.: to hold out as a bait, Xen.
to cast in oneʼs teeth, Lat. objicere, τί τινι Aeschin.

to expose, παρέβαλεν ἐμέ exposed me to them, Ar.:—Mid. to expose oneself or what is oneʼs own to danger, αἰὲν ἐμὴν ψυχὴν παραβαλλόμενος πολεμίζειν risking it in war, Il.; so, παραβάλλεσθαι τὰ τέκνα Hdt.:—Pass., κύβοισι παραβεβλημένος given up to dice, Ar.

Mid. also to set what one values upon a chance, to hazard it as at play, πλείω παραβαλλόμενοι having greater interests at stake, Thuc.; so in perf. pass., Λακεδαιμονίοις πλεῖστον δὴ παραβεβλημένοι having risked far the most upon them, Thuc.;—also, τὸν κίνδυνον τῶν σωμάτων παραβαλλομένους Thuc.

to lay beside, to compare one with another, τί τινι Hdt.; τι πρός τι Xen.; τι παρά τι Plat.:—so in Mid., absol., παραβαλλόμεναι vying with one another, Eur.; —and in Pass., ἀπάτα δʼ ἀπάταις παραβαλλομένα one piece of treachery set against others, Soph.
Mid. to bring alongside, τὴν ἄκατον παραβάλλου bring your boat alongside, Ar.; and absol., παραβαλοῦ Ar.

to throw, turn, bend sideways, παραβάλλειν τὸν ὀφθαλμόν or τὼ ὀφθαλμώ to cast the eyes askance, like a timid animal, Ar., Plat.; so, π. τὸ ἕτερον οὖς πλάγιον to turn oneʼs ears to listen, Xen.; π. τοὺς γομφίους to lay to oneʼs grinders, Ar.
to deposit with one, entrust to him, Lat. committere, τί τινι Hdt.
in Mid. to deceive, betray, Hdt., Eur., etc.
intr. to come near, approach, Plat., Arist.; π. ἀλλήλοις to meet one another, Plat.
to go by sea, to cross over, Lat. trajicere, παρέβαλε νηυσί Hdt.; so of the ships, ναῦς Πελοποννησίων παρέβαλον εἰς Ἰωνίαν Thuc.
to turn aside, pass over, Arist.

div1.head: παραβάπτω
div1.sense: to dye at the same time, Plut.

div1.head: παράβασις
div1.sense: a going aside, deviation, Arist.
an overstepping, τῶν δικαίων Plut.:—absol. a transgression, Plut.
the parabasis, a part of the old Comedy, in which the chorus came forward and addressed the audience in the Poetʼs name.

div1.head: παραβάτης
div1.note: παραβάτης, poet. παραιβάτης, and παρβάτης, ου, ὁ,
div1.sense: one who stands beside: properly the warrior who stood beside the charioteer, Il., Eur., Xen.
in pl. light troops (velites) who ran beside the horsemen, Plut.
(παραβαίνω II. 1) a transgressor, Aesch.

div1.head: παραβάτις
div1.sense: a woman who follows the reapers, Theocr.

div1.head: παραβατός
div1.sense: to be overcome or overreached, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: παραβιάζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to use violence to one, to constrain, compel him, NTest.

div1.head: παραβλαστάνω
div1.sense: to grow up beside or by, Plat.

div1.head: παραβλέπω
div1.sense: to look aside, take a side look, Ar.; π. θατέρῳ (sc. ὀφθαλμῷ) to look suspiciously with one eye, Ar.
to see wrong, Luc.

div1.head: παραβλήδην
div1.sense: thrown in by the way, παραβλήδην ἀγορεύων speaking with a side-meaning, i. e. maliciously, deceitfully, Il.; cf. παράβολος I.

div1.head: παράβλημα
div1.sense: that which is thrown beside or before, a curtain or screen used to cover the sides of ships, Xen.

div1.head: παραβλητέος
div1.sense: to be compared, τινί to one, Plut.

div1.head: παραβλητός
div1.sense: comparable, Plut.

div1.head: παραβλώσκω
div1.sense: to go beside, for the purpose of protecting, c. dat., Il.

div1.head: παραβλώψ
div1.sense: looking askance, squinting, Il.

div1.head: παραβοήθεια
div1.sense: help, aid, succour, Plat.

div1.head: παραβοηθέω
div1.sense: to come up to help, τινί Thuc.: —absol. to come to the rescue, Ar., Thuc.

div1.head: παραβολεύομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to run hazard, NTest.

div1.head: παραβολή
div1.sense: juxta-position, comparison, Plat.
a comparison, illustration, analogy, Arist.
a parable, i. e. a fictitious narrative by which some religious or moral lesson is conveyed, NTest.
a by-word, proverb, NTest.

div1.head: παράβολος
div1.sense: thrown in by the way, deceitful, παραίβολα παραβλήδην, Hhymn.
exposing oneself: hence,
of persons, venturesome, reckless, Ar.
of things and actions, hazardous, perilous, Hdt.

div1.head: παράβυστος
div1.sense: stuffed in: pushed aside or into a corner, ἐν παραβύστῳ in a corner, Dem.

div1.head: παραβύω
div1.sense: to stuff in, insert, Luc.

div1.head: παραγγελία
div1.sense: a command or order issued to soldiers, a charge, Xen., NTest.
the summoning oneʼs partisans to support one in a law-suit, exertion of influence, Dem.
canvassing for public office, Lat. ambitus, Plut.
a set of rules, Arist.

div1.head: παραγγέλλω
div1.sense: to transmit as a message, as by telegraph, παραγγείλασα σέλας Aesch.; μνήμην παραγγέλλοντες ὧν ἐκύρσατε Eur.; π. τὸ σύνθημα to pass on the watchword, Xen.
generally, to give the word, give orders, of the general, Hdt., Aesch., etc.; π. τινὶ ποιεῖν τι Hdt., Xen., etc.:—Pass., τὰ παραγγελλόμενα military orders, Thuc.; so, τὰ παρηγγελμένα Xen.

to order, recommend, exhort, π. τινὶ ποιεῖν τι Soph., etc.; τί τινι Eur.; ὅπως ἂν . . , to give orders to the end that . . , Plat.:—c. acc. rei only, to order, π. παρασκευὴν σίτου to order corn to be prepared, Lat. imperare frumentum, Hdt.; π. σιτία Thuc.; στρατείαν Aeschin.
to encourage, cheer on, ἵππους Theogn.; π. εἰς ὅπλα to call to arms, Xen.
to summon to oneʼs help, summon oneʼs partisans, form a cabal, Dem.
π. τὴν ἀρχήν to canvass for office, Lat. magistratum ambire, Plut.; π. εἰς ὑπατείαν to be candidate for the consulship, Plut.

div1.head: παράγγελμα
div1.sense: a message transmitted by beacons, Aesch.
an order, command, ἀπὸ παραγγέλματος by word of command, Thuc.
an instruction, precept, Xen.

div1.head: παράγγελσις
div1.sense: in war, a giving the word of command, Thuc.; ἀπὸ παραγγέλσεως πορεύεσθαι Xen.

div1.head: παραγεύω
div1.sense: to give just a taste of, τινός Plut.

div1.head: παραγηράω
div1.sense: to be superannuated, Aeschin.

div1.head: παραγίγνομαι
div1.sense: to be beside, to be by or near, attend upon one, c. dat., Od., Plat.: c. dat. rei, π. τῇ μάχῃ to be present at . . , Plat.
π. τινι to come to oneʼs side, come to aid, stand by, second, support, Hes., Hdt., Attic
of things, to be at hand, to be gained, to accrue to one, π. τινι, Lat. contingere alicui, Thuc., Xen.:—impers., σῷ τρόπῳ παραγίγνεται εἰδέναι Plat.
to come to, τινι Theogn., Hdt.; π. ἐς τὠυτό to come to the same point, Hdt.:—absol. to arrive, come up, Hdt.
to come to maturity, of corn, Hdt.; of the horns of oxen, to be fully grown, Hdt.

div1.head: παραγιγνώσκω
div1.sense: to decide wrongly, err in their judgment, Xen.

div1.head: παραγκάλισμα
div1.sense: that which is taken into the arms, a beloved one, Soph.

div1.head: παραγκωνίζω
div1.sense: to set the arms a-kimbo:—Mid. to push aside with the elbows, elbow, Luc.

div1.head: παραγναθίς
div1.sense: the cheekpiece of a helmet or tiara, Strab.

div1.head: παράγραμμα
div1.sense: that which one writes beside, an additional clause, Dem.

div1.head: παραγραφή
div1.sense: anything written beside: an exception taken by the defendant to the admissibility of a suit (γραφή) , a demurrer, Dem.

div1.head: παραγράφω
div1.sense: to write by the side, Ar.:—generally, to add a clause to a law or contract, Plat., Dem.: esp. by fraud, ἄλλου πατρὸς ἑαυτὸν παραγράφειν to enroll oneself with a wrong fatherʼs name, Dem.
Mid., with perf. pass.,
παραγράφεσθαι τὸν νόμον to have the law written in parallel columns with a decree charged with illegality, Dem.: Pass., οἱ παραγεγραμμένοι νόμοι Dem., Aeschin.
παραγραφὴν παραγράφεσθαι to demur to the admissibility of a suit (v. παραγραφή) Dem.

div1.head: παραγυμνόω
div1.sense: to lay bare at the side: metaph. to lay bare, disclose, τὸν πάντα λόγον Hdt.

div1.head: παράγω
div1.sense: to lead by or past a place, c. acc. loci, Hdt.
as military term, to march the men up from the side, to bring them from column into line, Xen.
to lead aside from the way, mislead, Lat. seducere, Pind., Attic: —Pass., φόβῳ παρηγόμην Soph.; ἀπάτῃ Thuc.
generally, to lead to or into a thing, ἔς τι Eur.; mostly of something bad, Theogn., etc.:—Pass. to be induced, c. inf., παρηγμένος εἰργάσθαι τι Soph.
of things, to lead aside, alter the course of a thing, Hdt., Plat.
to bring and set beside others, to bring forward, introduce, ἐς μέσον Hdt.; π. εἰς τὸ δικαστήριον to bring a matter before the court, Dem.:—also to bring forward as a witness, Dem.
to bring in, with a notion of secresy, Hdt.:—Pass. to come in stealthily, slip in, Soph.
intr. to pass by, pass on oneʼs way, Xen.
to pass away, NTest.; so in Pass., NTest., Plut.

div1.head: παραγωγή
div1.sense: a leading by or past, carrying across, Xen.
as military term, a wheeling from column into line, Xen.
π. τῶν κωπῶν a sliding motion of the oars, so that they made no dash (πίτυλος) in coming out of the water, Xen.
a misleading, seduction, Hdt.:— a false argument, fallacy, quibble, Dem.:—also delay, Plut.
a variation, as of language, Hdt.
a persuading, Plat.

div1.head: παραδακρύω
div1.sense: to weep beside or with, τινί Luc.

div1.head: παραδαρθάνω
div1.sense: to sleep beside another, c. dat., Hom.

div1.head: παράδειγμα
div1.sense: a pattern or model of the thing to be executed, Lat. exemplar, an architectʼs plan, Hdt.; a sculptorʼs or painterʼs model, Plat.
a precedent, example, Thuc., Plat.; ἐπὶ παραδείγματος by way of example, Aeschin.
an example, i. e. a lesson or warning, π. ἔχειν τινός to take a lesson from another, Thuc.; τὸ σὸν π. ἔχων Soph.; ζῶντά τινα τοῖς λοιποῖς π. ποιεῖν Dem.
an argument, proof from example, Thuc.
the model or copy of an existing thing, Hdt.

div1.head: παραδειγματίζω
div1.sense: to make an example of one, c. acc., Polyb., NTest.

div1.head: παραδειγματώδης
div1.sense: characterised by examples, Arist.

div1.head: παραδείκνυμι
div1.sense: to exhibit side by side: generally, to exhibit, bring forward, in Mid., Dem.
to represent as so and so, π. τινὰ οὐκ ὄντα Polyb.: also in bad sense, like παραδειγματίζω, Plut.
to exhibit and hand over, τί τινι Xen.

div1.head: παραδειπνέομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to go without oneʼs dinner, Theophr.

div1.head: παράδεισος
div1.sense: a park, a Persian word brought in by Xen.; used for the garden of Eden, Paradise, NTest.

div1.head: παραδεκτέος
div1.sense: one must admit, Plat.

div1.head: παραδεκτέος2
div1.sense: to be admitted, Plat.

div1.head: παραδέχομαι
div1.sense: Dep.
to receive from another, Il., Xen., etc.:—of children, to receive as inheritance, succeed to, τὴν ἀρχήν Hdt.; so, τὴν μάχην π. to take up and continue the battle, Hdt.
c. inf., π. τινι πράττειν τι to take upon oneself, engage to do a thing, Lat. recipere se facturum, Dem.
to admit, Plat.

div1.head: παραδηλόω
div1.sense: to make known by a side-wind, to intimate or insinuate, Dem., Plut.
to accuse underhand, Plut.

div1.head: παραδιακονέω
div1.sense: to live with and serve another, c. dat., Ar.

div1.head: παραδίδωμι
div1.sense: to give or hand over to another, transmit, τί τινι, Lat. tradere, Hdt.; of transmission to oneʼs successor, Hdt.; π. τὴν ἀρετήν to transmit, impart as a teacher, Plat.:—c. inf., π. τινὶ τοὺς νέους διδάσκειν Plat.

to give a city or person into anotherʼs hands, Hdt.; esp. as an hostage, to deliver up, surrender, Lat. dedere, Hdt., Thuc., etc.; also, with notion of treachery, to betray, Xen.: τύχῃ αὑτὸν π. to commit oneself to fortune, Thuc.
to give up to justice, ἑωυτὸν Κροίσῳ Hdt.; τινὰ εἰς τὸν δῆμον Xen.
to hand down legends, opinions, and the like, Lat. memoriae prodere, Dem.

to grant, bestow, κῦδός τινι Pind.:—in pres. and imperf. to offer, allow, αἵρεσιν Pind.: c. inf. to allow one to do, Hdt.; so, c. acc. rei, ὁ θεὸς τοῦτό γε οὐ παρεδίδου Hdt.:—absol., τοῦ θεοῦ παραδιδόντος if he permits, Hdt.

div1.head: παραδιηγέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to relate by the way, Arist.

div1.head: παραδοξία
div1.sense: marvellousness, Strab.

div1.head: παραδοξολογέω
div1.sense: to tell marvels, Strab.:—Pass., πολλὰ παραδοξολογεῖται many marvels are told, Strab.

div1.head: παραδοξολογία
div1.sense: a tale of wonder, marvel, Aeschin.

div1.head: παράδοξος
div1.sense: contrary to opinion, incredible, paradoxical, Plat., Xen., etc.; ἐκ τοῦ παραδόξου contrary to expectation, Dem.:—adv. -ξως, Aeschin.

div1.head: παραδόσιμος
div1.sense: handed down, hereditary, Polyb.

div1.head: παράδοσις
div1.sense: a handing down, transmission, Thuc.
the transmission of legends and doctrines, tradition, Plat., etc.:—also that which is so handed down, a tradition, NTest.
a giving up, surrender, Thuc.

div1.head: παραδοτέος
div1.sense: to be handed down, Plat.: παραδοτέον one must hand over, τί τινι Plat.
to be given up, Plat.
παραδοτέα one must give up, Thuc.

div1.head: παραδοτός
div1.sense: capable of being taught, Plat.

div1.head: παραδοχή
div1.sense: a receiving from another: also that which has been received, a hereditary custom, Eur.
acceptance, approval, Polyb.

div1.head: παραδράω
div1.sense: to be at hand, to serve another, c. dat., Od.

div1.head: παραδρομή
div1.sense: a running beside or over, traversing, Plut.; ἐν παραδρομῇ cursorily, Arist.

div1.head: παράδρομος
div1.sense: that may be run through, παράδρομα gaps, Xen.

div1.head: παραδυναστεύω
div1.sense: to reign with another, Thuc.

div1.head: παραδύομαι
div1.sense: to creep past, slink or steal past, Il.
to creep or steal in, Plat., Dem.

div1.head: παράδυσις
div1.sense: a creeping in beside, encroachment, Dem.

div1.head: παραδωσείω
div1.sense: to be disposed to deliver up, Thuc.

div1.head: παραείδω
div1.sense: to sing beside or to one, c. dat., Od.

div1.head: παραείρω
div1.sense: to lift up beside:—Pass., aor1 παρ-ηέρθην, to hang on one side, Il.

div1.head: παραζεύγνυμι
div1.sense: to yoke beside, set beside, Eur.:—Pass. to be joined, coupled with another, c. dat., Dem.

div1.head: παράζυξ
div1.sense: yoked beside: pl. παράζυγες supernumeraries, Arist.

div1.head: παραζώννυμι
div1.sense: to gird to the side, Plat.:—Mid. to wear at the girdle, Plut.

div1.head: παραθαλάσσιος
div1.sense: beside the sea, lying on the sea-side, maritime, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: παραθάλπω
div1.sense: to comfort, cheer;— Pass., Eur.

div1.head: παραθαρσύνω
div1.sense: to embolden, cheer on, encourage, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: παραθεάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to compare, Theophr.

div1.head: παραθέλγω
div1.sense: to assuage, Aesch.

div1.head: παραθερμαίνω
div1.sense: to heat to excess:—Pass., aor1 part. παραθερμανθείς, of a man become quarrelsome in his cups, Aeschin.

div1.head: παράθερμος
div1.sense: over-hot, Plut.

div1.head: παράθεσις
div1.sense: juxta-position, neighbourhood, Polyb.; ἐκ παραθέσεως on comparison, Polyb.

div1.head: παραθέω
div1.sense: to run beside or alongside, Plat., Xen.
to run beyond, outrun, τινά Xen.: to run past, Xen.
to touch on cursorily, Luc.

div1.head: παραθεωρέω
div1.sense: to examine a thing beside another, compare, τινὰ πρός τινα Xen.
to look slightly at, overlook, neglect, Dem.:—Pass., NTest.

div1.head: παραθήκη
div1.sense: anything entrusted to one, a deposit, Hdt.: of persons, a hostage, Hdt.

div1.head: παραιθύσσω
div1.sense: to move or stir in passing, Anth.:—metaph., θόρυβον π. to raise a shout in applause, Pind.
intr., of words, to fall by chance from a person, Pind.

div1.head: παραίνεσις
div1.sense: an exhortation, address, Hdt., Attic; c. gen. pers. advice or counsel given by a person, Hdt.; c. gen. rei, advice given for or towards a thing, Thuc.; ἐπὶ γνώμης παραινέσει to recommend an opinion, Thuc.

div1.head: παραινέω
div1.sense: to exhort, recommend, advise, π. τινὶ ποιεῖν τι Hdt., Ar., etc.; π. τί τινι Aesch.; π. τινί to advise a person, Aesch.
to advise or recommend publicly, παρῄνει τοιάδε Thuc.; οὐ π. to advise not to do, Thuc.

div1.head: παραίρεσις
div1.sense: a taking away from beside, curtailing, τῶν προσόδων Thuc.

div1.head: παραιρέω
div1.sense: to take away from beside, withdraw, remove, Eur.:— c. gen. partit. to take away part of a thing, Eur., Thuc.:—Pass., παρῃρημένοι τὰ ὅπλα having their arms taken from them, Thuc.
π. ἀρὰν εἰς παῖδα to draw aside the curse on thy sonʼs head, Eur.
Mid. to draw over to oneʼs own side, seduce, detach, Xen., Dem.
to take away, Xen.: Mid., παραιρεῖσθαι τὴν θρασύτητα to lessen, damp it, Dem.
generally, to take away from, steal away from, τί τινος Hdt., Eur.

div1.head: παραίρημα
div1.sense: the edge or selvage of cloth (cut off by the tailor): generally, a band, strip, Thuc.

div1.head: παραισθάνομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:— to remark or hear of by the way, τινος Xen.; absol., οὐχὶ παρῄσθευ (Doric for παρῄσθου) , Theocr.

div1.head: παραίσιος
div1.sense: of ill omen, ominous, Il.

div1.head: παραΐσσω
div1.sense: to dart past, Il.; c. acc., ἵπποι γάρ με παρήιξαν Il.

div1.head: παραιτέομαι
div1.sense: Dep.
to beg from another, ask as a favour of him, Lat. exorare, τί τινα Eur., Plat., etc.: to obtain by entreaty, τι Hdt.
π. τινα to move by entreaty, obtain leave from, Hdt.: to intercede with a person, prevail upon him by supplications, Hdt., Eur.
c. acc. et inf. to entreat one to do or be so and so, Hdt., Xen., etc.:—also c. gen. pers. et inf. to beg of a person to do a thing, Eur.:—c. inf. only, to obtain leave to do, Hdt.
c. acc. rei, Lat. deprecari, to avert by entreaty, deprecate, τὴν ὀργήν, τὰς ζημίας Aeschin.
to decline, deprecate, χάριν Pind.
c. acc. pers. to ask him to excuse one, decline his invitation, Polyb.; absol., NTest.:—Pass., ἔχε με παρῃτημένον have me excused, NTest.
π. γυναῖκα to divorce her, Luc.
c. acc. pers. to intercede for, beg off, esp. from punishment, Hdt.; π. περί τινος Xen.

div1.head: παραίτησις
div1.sense: earnest prayer, Plat.
a deprecating, Thuc.
an interceding for, begging off, Dem.

div1.head: παραιτητής
div1.sense: an intercessor, Plut.

div1.head: παραίτιος
div1.sense: being in part the cause of a thing, c. gen., ap. Dem.

div1.head: παραιφάμενος
div1.sense: exhorting, encouraging, Hhymn., Hes.
rebuking, Il.

div1.head: παραίφασις
div1.sense: persuasion, Il.

div1.head: παραιωρέω
div1.sense: to hang up beside:—Pass. to be hung or hang beside, Hdt.:—absol., of a suppliant, to hang upon another, Plut.

div1.head: παρακάθημαι
div1.sense: Dep. to be seated beside or near another, c. dat., Ar., Thuc., etc.

div1.head: παρακαθιδρύω
div1.sense: to place by or near, Plut.

div1.head: παρακαθίζω
div1.sense: to set beside or near, Plat.
aor1 mid., παρεκαθισάμην π. τινά to make him assessor or coarbiter, Dem.
Pass. and Mid.: fut. -καθιζήσομαι: imperf. -καθιζόμην: aor1 παρεκαθισάμην:— to seat oneself or sit down beside another, c. dat., Ar., Xen.

div1.head: παρακαθίημι
div1.sense: to let down beside: inMid., πηδάλια ζεύγλαισι παρακαθίετο caused the rudder to be let down beside the rudder-bars, Eur.

div1.head: παρακαθίστημι
div1.sense: to station or establish beside, Dem.

div1.head: παρακαίω
div1.sense: to light or keep lighted beside, Hdt.

div1.head: παράκαιρος
div1.sense: unseasonable, ill-timed, Luc.

div1.head: παρακαλέω
div1.sense: to call to one, Xen.

to call to aid, call in, send for Lat. arcessere, Hdt., Ar., etc.; π. τινα σύμβουλον Xen.:— to call on, invoke the Gods, Xen., etc.:—Pass., παρακαλούμενος καὶ ἄκλητος, "vocatus atque non vocatus, " Thuc.
to summon oneʼs friends to attend one in a trial (cf. παράκλησις 1. 1):—Pass., παρακεκλημένοι summoned to attend at a trial, Aeschin.
to invite, ἐπὶ δαῖτα Eur.; ἐπὶ θήραν Xen.; π. τινὰ ἐπὶ τὸ βῆμα to invite him to mount the tribune, Aeschin.
to call to, exhort, cheer, encourage, τινά Aesch., Xen.
to comfort, console: in Pass., NTest.
to excite, τινὰ ἐς φόβον, ἐς δάκρυα Eur.: —of things, to foment, φλόγα Xen.
π. τινά, c. inf., to exhort one to do, Eur., Xen.
to demand, require, ὁ θάλαμος σκεύη π. Xen.

div1.head: παρακάλυμμα
div1.sense: anything hung up beside or before, a covering, curtain, Plut.:—metaph. an excuse, τινος for a thing, Plut.

div1.head: παρακαλύπτω
div1.sense: to cover by hanging something beside, to cloak, disguise, Plut.:—Mid. to cover oneʼs face, Plat.

div1.head: παρακαταβαίνω
div1.sense: to dismount beside, of horsemen who dismount to fight on foot, Polyb.

div1.head: παρακαταβάλλω
div1.sense: to throw down beside, Il.; ζῶμα δέ οἱ παρακάββαλεν put a waistband on him, Il.
as Attic law-term, to make a special claim to property, when the claimant deposited a sum of money called παρακαταβολή, Dem.

div1.head: παρακαταβολή
div1.sense: money deposited in court by claimants, and forfeited in case of failure (v. παρακαταβάλλω II), Dem.

div1.head: παρακαταθήκη
div1.sense: a deposit entrusted to oneʼs care, Lat. fidei commissum, Hdt., Thuc., etc.
of persons entrusted to guardians, Ἀπόλλωνα παρακαταθήκην δεξαμένη Hdt.; of children, Dem.

div1.head: παρακαταθνῄσκω
div1.sense: to die beside, poet. aor2 παρακάτθανε Anth.

div1.head: παρακατάκειμαι
div1.sense: Pass. to lie beside another at meals, Lat. accumbere, c. dat., Xen.

div1.head: παρακατακλίνω
div1.sense: to lay down beside, to put to bed with, τινά τινι Aeschin., Luc.

div1.head: παρακαταλέχομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to sleep beside another, c. dat., Il.

div1.head: παρακαταλείπω
div1.sense: to leave with one, τινά τινι Thuc.

div1.head: παρακαταπήγνυμι
div1.sense: to drive in alongside, Thuc.

div1.head: παρακατατίθημι
div1.sense: Mid. to deposit oneʼs own property with another, entrust it to his keeping, give it him in trust, Hdt., Xen., etc.

div1.head: παρακατέχω
div1.sense: to keep back, restrain, detain, Thuc.

div1.head: παρακατοικίζω
div1.sense: to make to dwell or settle beside, π. φόβον τινι to make fear his companion, Plut.

div1.head: παρακαττύω
div1.sense: to sew on beside, patch up:—in Mid., generally, to put all in order, set straight, Ar.

div1.head: παράκειμαι
div1.sense: to lie beside or before, Hom.:—metaph., ὑμῖν παράκειται ἐναντίον ἠὲ μάχεσθαι ἢ φεύγειν the choice lies before you, to fight or to flee, Od.:—in part. close at hand, present, Pind.

div1.head: παρακέλευμα
div1.sense: an exhortation, cheering address, Eur.
a precept, maxim, Plat.

div1.head: παρακελεύομαι
div1.sense: Dep.
to order one to do a thing, advise, prescribe, τί τινι Hdt., Thuc., etc.; π. ταῦτα to give this advice, Plat.;—also, π. τινι, c. inf., Plat., Xen.
to exhort, τοιαῦτα παρακελευσάμενος having delivered this address, Thuc.:—absol. to encourage one another by shouting, Hdt.
παρακεκέλευστο in pass. sense, orders had been given, Hdt.

div1.head: παρακέλευσις
div1.sense: a calling out to, cheering on, exhorting, addressing, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: παρακελευστικός
div1.sense: calling out to, cheering on, Plat.

div1.head: παρακελευστός
div1.sense: summoned, of a packed audience, Thuc.

div1.head: παρακελητίζω
div1.sense: to ride by or past, τινά Ar.

div1.head: παρακινδύνευσις
div1.sense: a desperate venture, Thuc.

div1.head: παρακινδυνευτικός
div1.sense: venturesome, audacious, Plat., Dem.: adv., παρακινδυνευτικῶς λέγειν Plat.

div1.head: παρακινδυνεύω
div1.sense: to make a rash venture, to venture, run the risk, Ar., Thuc., etc.; π. εἰς Ἰωνίαν to venture to Ionia, Thuc.
c. acc. rei, to venture, risk a thing, Ar., Plat.; τοιουτονί τι παρακεκινδυνευμένον a bold, venturous phrase, Ar.
c. inf. to have the hardihood to do a thing, Ar., Xen.

div1.head: παρακινέω
div1.sense: to move aside, disturb, Plat.: absol. to raise troubles, enter into plots, Dem.:— Pass. to be violently incited, Luc.
intr. to be disturbed, to shift oneʼs ground, Plat.
to be highly excited, ἐπί τινι Xen.; παρακινῶν out of his senses, Plat.

div1.head: παρακινητικός
div1.sense: inclined to insanity: adv., παρακινητικῶς ἔχειν to shew symptoms of insanity, Plut.

div1.head: παρακίω
div1.sense: to pass by, τινά Il.

div1.head: παρακλείω
div1.sense: to shut out, exclude, Hdt.

div1.head: παρακλέπτω
div1.sense: to steal from the side, filch underhand, Ar.

div1.head: παράκλησις
div1.sense: a calling to oneʼs aid, summons, οἱ ἐκ παρακλήσεως συγκαθήμενοι a packed party in the jury, Dem.
a calling upon, appealing, τινος to one, Thuc.: intreaty, deprecation, Strab.
an exhortation, address, Thuc., Aeschin.: encouragement, NTest.

div1.head: παρακλητέος
div1.sense: one must call on, summon, Arist.

div1.head: παρακλητικός
div1.sense: hortatory, Plat.

div1.head: παράκλητος
div1.sense: called to oneʼs aid, Lat. advocatus: as Subst. a legal assistant, advocate, Dem.
in NTest., ὁ Παράκλητος, the Intercessor or the Comforter.

div1.head: παρακλιδόν
div1.sense: bending sideways, turning aside, swerving, οὐκ ἂν ἔγωγε ἄλλα παρὲξ εἴποιμι παρακλιδόν I would not tell you another tale beside the mark, swerving from the truth, Od.

div1.head: παρακλίνω
div1.sense: to bend or turn aside, παρακλίνας κεφαλήν Od.; π. τὴν θύραν, τὴν πύλην to set it ajar, Hdt.
metaph., ἄλλῃ παρκλίνουσι δίκας they turn justice from her path, Hes.
