to lay beside another:—Pass. to lie down beside, at meals, Lat. accumbere, τινι Theocr.
intr. to turn aside, Il.; παρακλίνασα having swerved from the course, Aesch.

div1.head: παρακλίτης
div1.sense: one who lies beside at meals, Xen.

div1.head: παρακμάζω
div1.sense: to be past the prime, Xen.

div1.head: παρακμή
div1.sense: the point at which the prime is past, abatement, Plut.

div1.head: παρακοή
div1.sense: unwillingness to hear, disobedience, NTest.

div1.head: παρακοινάομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to communicate, τί τινι Pind.

div1.head: παρακοιτέω
div1.sense: to keep watch beside, Polyb.

div1.head: παρακοίτης
div1.sense: one who sleeps beside, a bedfellow, husband, spouse, Il., Hes.

div1.head: παράκοιτις
div1.sense: a wife, spouse, Il.; Epic dat. παρακοίτῑ Od.

div1.head: παρακολουθέω
div1.sense: to follow beside, follow closely, c. dat., Dem.: of a physician, π. νοσήματι Plat.; so, π. τοῖς πράγμασιν ἐξ ἀρχῆς Dem.: of an audience, to follow with the mind, Aeschin.

div1.head: παρακομιδή
div1.sense: a carrying across, transporting, Thuc.
(from Pass.) a going or sailing across, passage, transit, Thuc.

div1.head: παρακομίζω
div1.sense: to carry along with one, escort, convoy, Eur.
to carry or convey over, to transport, Xen.: generally, to convey, carry, Hdt.: —Mid. to have a thing brought one, Xen.
Pass. to go or sail beside, coast along, τὴν Ἰταλίαν Thuc.
to go or sail across, pass over, Polyb.

div1.head: παρακονάω
div1.sense: to sharpen besides, sharpen also, Xen.:—Pass. to be so sharpened, 3rd pl. perf. pass. παρηκόνηνται Ar.

div1.head: παρακοντίζω
div1.sense: to throw the dart with others, Luc.

div1.head: παρακοπή
div1.sense: metaph. infatuation, insanity, frenzy, Aesch.

div1.head: παράκοπος
div1.sense: frenzied, frantic, Aesch.; also, παράκοπος φρενῶν Eur.

div1.head: παρακόπτω
div1.sense: to strike falsely: Pass., perf. part. παρακεκομμένος, of coin, counterfeit; metaph. of men, ἀνδράρια μοχθηρά, παρακεκομμένα knavish mannikins, base coin, Ar.
Mid. to cheat or swindle out of a thing, π. τινὰ ἀγαθῶν Ar.; simply, to cheat, τινά Ar.:—Pass. to be cheated, τινι in a thing, Ar.
metaph. to strike the mind awry, drive mad, Eur.

div1.head: παράκουσμα
div1.sense: a false story, Strab.

div1.head: παρακουστέος
div1.sense: one must disobey, τινός Muson. ap. Stob.

div1.head: παρακούω
div1.sense: to hear beside, esp. to hear accidentally, to hear talk of, c. acc., Hdt.
to hear underhand, overhear from, τί τινος Ar.; τι παρά τινος Plat.
to hear imperfectly or wrongly, misunderstand, Plat.
to hear carelessly, take no heed to, c. gen., NTest.

div1.head: παρακρεμάννυμι
div1.sense: to hang beside, χεῖρα παρακρεμάσας letting the hand hang down, Il.

div1.head: παράκρημνος
div1.sense: on the edge of a precipice, Strab.

div1.head: παρακρίνω
div1.sense: to draw up in line opposite: Pass., πεζὸς παρακεκριμένος παρὰ τὸν αἰγιαλόν the land force drawn up along the shore, Hdt.; παρεκρίθησαν διαταχθέντες Hdt.

div1.head: παρακροτέω
div1.sense: to pat or clap one, Luc.

div1.head: παράκρουσις
div1.sense: a striking falsely: metaph. a cheating, deception, Dem.:— a fallacy, Arist.

div1.head: παρακρούω
div1.sense: to strike aside: to disappoint, mislead, Plat.:—Pass. to be led astray, go wrong, Plat., Dem.:—so also in Mid., Isocr.
in Mid. also, to strike away from oneself, parry, Plut.

div1.head: παρακτάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to get over and above: in perf. -κέκτημαι, to have over and above, Hdt.

div1.head: παράκτιος
div1.sense: on the sea-side, by the shore, Trag.

div1.head: παρακύπτω
div1.sense: to stoop sideways, of the attitude of a bad harp-player, Ar.
to stoop for the purpose of looking at, and so,
to look sideways at, cast a careless glance on a thing, Dem.
to peep out of a door or window, Ar.:— or, of persons outside, to peep in, look in, κατʼ ἄντρον παρκύπτοισα Theocr.; παρέκυψεν εἰς τὸ μνημεῖον NTest.

div1.head: παραλαμβάνω
div1.sense: to receive from another, of persons succeeding to an office, π. τὴν βασιληίην Hdt.; τὴν ἀρχήν Plat., etc.:—also of persons succeeding by inheritance, Eur., Dem.; π. ἀράς to inherit curses, Eur.
to take upon oneself, undertake, πρᾶγμά τι Ar.: Pass., τὰ παραλαμβανόμενα undertakings, Hdt.
to take in pledge, Hdt.: also, to take by force or treachery, get possession of, Hdt., Thuc.
to receive by hearsay or report, to ascertain, π. τὴν ἀλήθειαν Hdt., etc.
to take up, catch up, τὸ οὔνομα τοῦτο Hdt.
c. acc. pers. to take to oneself, associate with oneself, as a wife or mistress, an adopted son, a partner or ally, Hdt., Thuc., etc.; as a pupil, Plat.
to invite, Hdt.
to wait for, intercept, Lat. excipere, Hdt., Xen.: to take prisoner, Polyb.

div1.head: παραλανθάνω
div1.sense: to escape the notice of, τινά Plat.

div1.head: παραλέγω
div1.sense: to lay beside: Mid. to lie beside or with another, c. dat., ὁ δέ οἱ παρελέξατο λάθρη Il.;Epic aor2 παρέλεκτο Hhymn.
παραλέγεσθαι τὴν γῆν to sail or coast along, Lat. legere oram, NTest.

div1.head: παραλειπτέος
div1.sense: one must pass over, τι Xen.

div1.head: παραλείπω
div1.sense: to leave on one side, leave remaining, Thuc., Xen.: —τοῖς ἐχθροῖς παραλείπεται is reserved for enemies, Dem.
to leave to another, λόγον τινὶ π. to leave him time for speaking, Aeschin.
to leave on one side, pass by, neglect, Eur., Ar., etc.: Pass., εἴ τις παραλείπεται πρόσοδος if the revenue is insufficient, Arist.
to pass over, leave untold, omit, Eur., Thuc., etc.: Pass., τὰ παραλειπόμενα omissions, Plat.

div1.head: παραλείφω
div1.sense: to bedaub as with ointment, Arist.

div1.head: παραληπτέος
div1.sense: one must produce, μάρτυρας Dem.

div1.head: παραληπτός
div1.sense: to be accepted, Plat.

div1.head: παραληρέω
div1.sense: to talk like a dotard, talk nonsense, Lat. delirare, Ar., etc.

div1.head: παράληψις
div1.sense: a receiving from another, succession to, τῆς ἀρχῆς Polyb.
the taking of a town, Polyb.

div1.head: Παράλιον
div1.sense: a chapel of the hero Paralus, Dem.

div1.head: παράλιος
div1.sense: by the sea, Trag.
ἡ (sc. γῆ or χώρα) the seacoast, sea-board, Hdt., Arist.
the eastern coast of Attica, between Hymettus and the sea, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: παραλλαγή
div1.sense: a passing from hand to hand, transmission, Aesch.
variation, change, NTest.

div1.head: παράλλαγμα
div1.sense: an interchange, variation, Strab.

div1.head: παράλλαξις
div1.sense: alternation, alternating motion, τῶν σκελῶν Plut.
a change for the worse, alteration, Plat.

div1.head: παραλλάσσω
div1.sense: to make things alternate, to transpose, Plat.
to change or alter a little, Hdt., Soph.
of Place, to pass by, go past, elude, Xen.:— to get rid of, Plut.
to go beyond, exceed in point of time, Plut.
intr. to pass by one another, to overlap, Hdt.
to differ, vary, Hdt.:—impers., οὐ σμικρὸν παραλλάττει it makes no small difference, Plat.
π. τοῦ σκοποῦ to go aside from the mark, Plat.
to deviate from the course, to be liable to deviation, Plat.; λόγοι παραλλάσσοντες delirious, Eur.
to slip aside or away, Aesch.

div1.head: παραλλάξ
div1.sense: alternately, in turn, Lat. vicissim, Soph.
in alternating rows, Lat. ad quincuncem dispositi, Thuc.

div1.head: παράλληλος
div1.sense: beside one another, side by side, αἱ παράλληλοι (sc. γραμμαί) parallel lines, Arist.; π. (sub. κύκλος) a parallel of latitude, Strab.; οἱ βίοι οἱ π. the parallel lives of Plutarch, Plut.; ἐκ παραλλήλου parallelwise, Plut.
c. dat. parallel to, Polyb.

div1.head: παραλογίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:
in keeping accounts, to misreckon, miscalculate, Dem.
to cheat out of a thing, to defraud of, c. dupl. acc., Arist.
to mislead by fallacious reasoning, Aeschin.:—Pass. to be so misled, Arist.

div1.head: παραλογισμός
div1.sense: false reasoning, deception, Polyb.

div1.head: παραλογιστικός
div1.sense: fallacious, Arist.

div1.head: παράλογος
div1.sense: beyond calculation, unexpected, casual, uncertain, Arist., etc.: —παράλογον, -ου, an unexpected event; but, τὰ παράλογα the portions of food given to unexpected guests, Xen.:—adv. παραλόγως Dem.

παράλογος, ὁ, as Subst., an unexpected issue, Thuc.; πολύς, μέγας ὁ π. the event is greatly contrary to calculation, Thuc.; so, τὸν π. τοσοῦτον ποιῆσαι τοῖς Ἕλλησι caused so great a miscalculation to the Greeks, Thuc.; ἐν τοῖς ἀνθρωπείοις παραλόγοις by miscalculations such as men make, Thuc.

div1.head: πάραλος
div1.sense: by or near the sea, Soph., Eur.: near the salt, (with a pun on ἡ Πάραλος) , Ar.
generally, concerned with the sea, naval, Hdt.
ἡ πάραλος γῆ the coast-land of Attica (cf. παράλιος II), Thuc.;—hence οἱ Πάραλοι the people of the coast-land, Hdt., Eur.
ἡ Πάραλος ναῦς, or ἡ Π. alone, the Paralus, one of the Athenian sacred galleys, reserved for state-service, Thuc., Dem.; also Πάραλος (without Art.), Ar.
οἱ Πάραλοι, the crew of the Paralus, Ar., Thuc.

div1.head: παράλπιος
div1.sense: dwelling near the Alps, Plut.

div1.head: παραλυπέω
div1.sense: to grieve or trouble besides, ἄλλο παρελύπει οὐδέν no disease attacked them besides the plague, Thuc.; ὅταν μηδὲν αὐτὴν παραλυπῇ Plat.; οἱ παραλυποῦντες the troublesome, the refractory, Xen.

div1.head: παράλυπρος
div1.sense: of soil, rather poor, Strab.

div1.head: παράλυσις
div1.sense: a loosening by the side: paralysis, palsy, Theophr.

div1.head: παραλυτικός
div1.sense: paralytic, NTest.

div1.head: παραλύω
div1.sense: c. acc. rei, to loose from the side, take off, detach, Hdt., etc.
to undo, put an end to, Eur.

c. acc. pers. et gen. rei, to unyoke or part from, πολλοὺς παρέλυσεν θάνατος δάμαρτος Eur.; π. τινὰ τῆς στρατηίης to set free from military service, Hdt.; π. τινὰ τῆς στρατηγίης to dismiss from the command, Hdt.: —τοὺς Ἀθηναίους π. τῆς ὀργῆς to set them free from . . , Thuc.: c. acc. only, to set free, Eur.:—Pass. to be parted from, τινος Hdt.: to be exempt from service, Hdt.
to loose beside, i. e. one beside another, Xen.
in Pass. to be disabled at the side, to be paralysed, Arist.: generally, to be exhausted, to flag, of camels, Hdt.

div1.head: παραμείβω
div1.sense: to leave on one side, pass by, c. acc. loci, Plut.
to outrun, exceed, excel, σοφίᾳ σοφίαν Soph.
to pass, βίον Anth.
mostly in Mid. to go past, pass by, leave on one side, Od., Hdt., etc.; τὸν παραμειψάμενος Od.; παραμείβεσθαι ἔθνεα πολλά Hdt.;—but, πύλας παραμείψεται shall pass through the gates, Theogn.
to pass over, make no mention of, Lat. praetermitto, Hdt.
to outrun, outstrip, Pind., Eur.
of Time, to pass, go by, Hes.
in a causal sense, to turn aside, divert, Pind.

div1.head: παραμελέω
div1.sense: to pass by and disregard, to be disregardful of, τινός Thuc., Xen., etc.: absol., παρημελήκεε he recked little, Hdt.; παραμελοῦντες being negligent, Plat.:—Pass. to be abandoned, Aesch.

div1.head: παραμένω
div1.sense: to stay beside or near, stand by another, c. dat., Il., Ar.; παρά τινι Aeschin.:—of slaves, to remain faithful, Plat.; hence Παρμένων, trusty, as a slaveʼs name, Menand.
absol. to stand oneʼs ground, stand fast, Il., Hdt., Attic; to remain with the army, Thuc.
to stay at a place, stay behind or at home, Hdt.
to survive, remain alive, Hdt.
of things, to endure, last, Eur., Xen.

div1.head: παραμετρέω
div1.sense: to measure one thing by another, to compare, Plat.

div1.head: παραμεύομαι
div1.sense: παραμεύεσθαί τινος μορφάν to surpass, Pind.

div1.head: παραμήκης
div1.sense: oblong or oval, Polyb.
extending parallel to the mainland, Strab.

div1.head: παραμηρίδιος
div1.sense: along the thighs; τὰ παραμ. armour for the thighs, cuisses, Xen.

div1.head: παραμίγνυμι
div1.sense: to intermix with, τί τινι Ar.:—Pass., ἡδονὴν παραμεμῖχθαι τῇ εὐδαιμονίᾳ Arist.
to add by mixing, Lat. admiscere, ὕδωρ παραμίσγειν Hdt.:—Pass., ὅ τι αὐτοῖς παραμέμικται Plat.

div1.head: παραμιμνήσκομαι
div1.sense: Dep., to mention besides, to make mention of a thing along with another, c. gen. rei, Hdt., Soph.

div1.head: παραμίμνω
div1.sense: to abide, tarry, Od.

div1.head: παραμόνιμος
div1.sense: staying beside, i. e. steadfast, permanent, Theogn., Pind.
of slaves, trusty, Xen.

div1.head: παράμουσος
div1.sense: out of tune with, discordant with, c. dat., Eur.: absol. harsh, horrid, Aesch.

div1.head: παραμπέχω
div1.sense: to wrap a thing round as a cloak: metaph., π. λόγους to use a cloak of words, Eur.

div1.head: παραμυθέομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:

to encourage or exhort one to do a thing, c. dat. pers. et inf., τοῖς ἄλλοισιν ἔφη παραμυθήσασθαι οἴκαδʼ ἀποπλείειν Il.; c. acc. pers., παραμυθοῦ με (sc. ποιεῖν ὅ τι καὶ πείσεις Aesch.:—c. acc. pers. only, to encourage, exhort, advise, Plat., Xen.
to console, comfort, τινα Hdt., Attic
to pacify, παρεμυθεῖτο attempted to pacify them, Thuc.
to assuage, abate, Plut.: to soften down, explain away, Strab.

div1.head: παραμυθητικός
div1.sense: consolatory, Arist.

div1.head: παραμυθία
div1.sense: encouragement, exhortation, persuasion, Plat.
consolation, diversion, Plat.
relief from, abatement of, φθόνου Plut.

div1.head: παραμύθιον
div1.sense: an address, exhortation, Plat.
an assuagement, abatement, καμάτων Soph.; πυρσῶν of the fires of love, Theocr.; ἐλπὶς κινδύνῳ π. οὖσα Thuc.

div1.head: παραμυκάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to bellow beside or in answer, of thunder following on earthquake, Aesch.

div1.head: παραναγιγνώσκω
div1.sense: to read beside, so as to compare one document with another, π. τῷ ψηφίσματι τοὺς νόμους Aeschin.; π. παρὰ μαρτυρίας τὰς ῥήσεις Dem.
to read publicly, Polyb.

div1.head: παραναδύομαι
div1.sense: Mid., with aor2 and perf. act., to come forth and appear beside or near, Plut.

div1.head: παραναιετάω
div1.sense: to dwell near, c. acc. loci, Soph.

div1.head: παραναλίσκω
div1.sense: to spend amiss, to waste, squander, Dem.:—Pass., of persons, to be sacrificed uselessly, 3rd pl. aor1 παραναλώθησαν Plut.

div1.head: παρανάλωμα
div1.sense: useless expense, Plut.

div1.head: παρανηνέω
div1.sense: to heap or pile up beside, only in imperf., σῖτον παρενήνεον ἐν κανέοισιν Od.

div1.head: παρανήχομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to swim along the shore, Od.: to swim beside, τῇ τριήρει Plut.

div1.head: παρανικάω
div1.sense: to subdue to evil, pervert, Aesch.

div1.head: παρανίσσομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to go past, c. acc., Hhymn.

div1.head: παρανίστημι
div1.sense: to set up beside: Mid. with aor2 act. to stand up beside, Plut.

div1.head: παρανίσχω
div1.sense: trans. to raise in answer, Thuc.
intr. to stand forth beside, Plut.

div1.head: παρανοέω
div1.sense: to think amiss, to be deranged, lose oneʼs wits, Eur., Ar.

div1.head: παράνοια
div1.sense: derangement, madness, Aesch., Eur., Ar.

div1.head: παρανοίγνυμι
div1.sense: to open at the side or a little, set ajar, θύραν Dem.

div1.head: παρανομέω
div1.sense: to transgress the law, act unlawfully, Thuc., Plat.:—Pass., κάθοδος παρανομήθη a return illegally procured, Thuc.
to commit an outrage, ἐς τὸν νεκρὸν ταῦτα παρενόμησε Hdt.; περί τινα Thuc.:—Pass. to be outraged, ill used, Dem.

div1.head: παρανόμημα
div1.sense: an illegal act, transgression, Thuc.

div1.head: παρανομία
div1.sense: transgression of law, decency or order, Thuc., Plat.; ἡ κατὰ τὸ σῶμα π. εἰς τὴν δίαιταν loose and disorderly habits of life, Thuc.

div1.head: παράνομος
div1.sense: acting contrary to law, lawless, Eur., Plat.
of things, contrary to law, unlawful, Ar., Thuc., etc.:—adv., παρανόμως, illegally, Thuc.

in Attic law, παράνομα γράφειν, εἰπεῖν to propose an illegal measure, Dem.; παρανόμων γράφεσθαί τινα to indict one for proposing such a measure, Dem.: the indictment itself was παρανόμων γραφή Aeschin.:—in superl., παρανομώτατα γεγραφότα Aeschin.

div1.head: παράνοος
div1.sense: distraught, Aesch.

div1.head: πάραντα
div1.sense: sideways, sidewards, Il.

div1.head: παρανυκτερεύω
div1.sense: to pass the night beside, Plut.

div1.head: παράνυμφος
div1.sense: the bridegroomʼs friend or best man, who went beside him in his chariot to fetch his bride:—as fem. the brideʼs-maid, Ar.

div1.head: παράξενος
div1.sense: half-foreign, counterfeit, Ar.

div1.head: παραξέω
div1.sense: to graze or rub in passing, Anth.

div1.head: παραξιφίς
div1.sense: a knife worn beside the sword, a dirk, Strab.

div1.head: παραξόνιος
div1.sense: beside the axle: τὸ π. a linchpin: —παραξόνια, in Ar. Ran., perh., rapid whirlings.

div1.head: παραπαιδαγωγέω
div1.sense: to help to train: to reform gradually, Luc.

div1.head: παραπαίω
div1.sense: to strike on one side: to strike a false note, and metaph. to be infatuated, lose oneʼs wits, Aesch.: —p. ti to commit a folly, Luc.
to fall away from, Lat. aberrare, τῆς ἀληθείας Polyb.

div1.head: παραπάλλομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to bound beside, τινι Eur.

div1.head: παράπαν
div1.sense: altogether, absolutely, generally with Art., τὸ π. Hdt., Thuc., etc.:—with a negat., τὸ π. οὐδέν not at all, Hdt.; οὔκ εἰμι τὸ π. ἄθεος Plat.
in reckoning, ἐπὶ διηκόσια τὸ παράπαν up to two hundred altogether, Hdt.

div1.head: παραπατάω
div1.sense: to deceive, cajole, Aesch.

div1.head: παραπαφίσκω
div1.sense: to mislead, beguile, Od.:—c. inf. to induce one to do a thing by craft or fraud, Il.

div1.head: παραπείθω
div1.sense: to persuade gradually, win over, beguile, Hom., in Epic aor2, 3rd sg. παραιπεπίθῃσιν, part. παρ-πεπιθών.

div1.head: παραπέμπω
div1.sense: to send past, convey past or through, c. acc. loci, Od.
to send by or along the coast, Thuc.
to escort, convoy, of ships of war convoying merchant vessels, Dem.; so in Mid., Dem.
to convoy supplies to an army, Xen.
to send troops to the flank, in support, Xen.
to pass on to, of an echo, π. στόνον τινί Soph.; θόρυβον π. to waft him applause, Ar.
to send away, dismiss, Philipp. ap. Dem.

div1.head: παρά

trans.i: from the side of, c. gen., beside, alongside of, c. dat., to the side of, motion alongside of, c. acc.

div1.sense: prep. with gen., dat., and acc.: Radical sense beside:
WITH GENIT. from the side of, from beside: from, φάσγανον ὀξὺ ἐρυσσάμενος παρὰ μηροῦ Il.
commonly of Persons, ἦλθε πὰρ Διός Il.; ἀγγελίη ἥκει παρὰ βασιλῆος Hdt.; ὁ παρά τινος ἥκων his messenger, Xen.

issuing from a person, γίγνεσθαι παρά τινος to be born from him, Plat.; when it follows a Noun, a particip. may be supplied, ἡ παρὰ τῶν ἀνθρώπων δόξα glory from (given by) men, Plat.; τὸ παρʼ ἐμοῦ ἀδίκημα done by me, Xen.; παρʼ ἑαυτοῦ διδόναι to give from oneself, i. e. from oneʼs own means, Hdt.
with Verbs of receiving and obtaining, τυχεῖν τινος παρά τινος Od.; εὑρέσθαι τι παρά τινος Isocr.; δέχεσθαι, λαμβάνειν τι παρά τινος Thuc.; μανθάνειν, ἀκούειν παρά τινος Hdt.

with Pass. Verbs, on the part of (not, like ὑπό, of the direct agent), παρὰ θεῶν δίδοταί or σημαίνεταί τι Plat.; τὰ παρά τινος λεγόμενα or συμβουλευόμενα Xen.; φάρμακον πιεῖν παρὰ τοῦ ἰατροῦ by his prescription, Plat.
in poetic passages, for παρά c. dat., near, πὰρ Σαλαμῖνος Pind.; πὰρ Κυανεᾶν σπιλάδων Soph.; παρʼ Ἰσμηνοῦ ῥείθρων Soph.
WITH DAT. beside, alongside of, by, with Verbs implying rest, used to answer the question where?
of Places, ἧσθαι πὰρ πυρί Od.; ἑστάναι παρʼ ὄχεσφιν Il.; πὰρ ποσσί at oneʼs feet, Il.; παρὰ ῥηγμῖνι θαλάσσης Il.
of persons, κεῖτο παρὰ μνηστῇ ἀλόχῳ Il.; στῆναι παρά τινι to stand by him, Il.

like Lat. apud, French chez, at oneʼs house, μένειν παρά τινι Il.; οἱ παρʼ ἡμῖν ἄνθρωποι the people here, Plat.; ἡ παρʼ ἡμῖν πολιτεία Dem.:—like Lat. apud for penes, in oneʼs own hands, ἔχειν παρʼ ἑωϋτῷ Hdt.
Lat. coram, before, in the presence of, ἤειδε παρὰ μνηστῆρσιν Od.: before a judge, Hdt., Attic; παρʼ ἐμοί, Lat. me judice, Hdt.; εὐδοκιμεῖν, μέγα δύνασθαι, τιμᾶσθαι παρά τινι with one, Plat.
WITH ACCUS. to the side of an object, or motion alongside of it:
of Place,
with Verbs of coming and going, βῆ παρὰ θῖνα Il.; παρʼ Ἥφαιστον to his chamber, Il.; εἰσιέναι παρά τινα to go into his house, Thuc., Plat.
with Verbs of rest, beside, near, by, κεῖται ποταμοῖο παρʼ ὄχθας lies stretched beside the river banks, Il.; παρʼ ἔμʼ ἵστασο come and stand by me, Il.
with Verbs of striking, wounding, βάλε στῆθος παρὰ μαζόν Il.; αἰχμὴ δʼ ἐξεσύθη παρὰ ἀνθερεῶνα Il.
with Verbs of passing by, leaving on one side, Hom.; παρὰ τὴν Βαβυλῶνα παριέναι Xen.
by or beside the mark, πὰρ δύναμιν beyond oneʼs strength, Il.
contrary to, against, παρὰ μοῖραν contrary to destiny, Hom.; παρʼ αἶσαν, παρὰ τὰς σπονδάς Thuc.; παρὰ δόξαν contrary to opinion, Thuc.; παρʼ ἐλπίδας Soph.

beside, except, οὐκ ἔστι παρὰ ταῦτʼ ἄλλα beside this there is nothing else, Ar.; παρὰ ἓν πάλαισμα ἔδραμε νικᾶν Ὀλυμπιάδα he won the Olympic prize save in one conflict, he was within one of winning it, Hdt.; so, παρὰ ὀλίγον only just, Eur.; παρʼ ἐλάχιστον ἦλθε ἀφελέσθαι was within an ace of taking away, Thuc.; παρὰ τοσοῦτον ἦλθε κινδύνου came within such a degree of peril, i. e. was in such imminent peril, Thuc.: —opp. to these phrases is παρὰ πολύ by far, δεινότατον παρὰ πολύ Ar.; παρὰ πολὺ νικᾶν Thuc.:—but
παρὰ ὀλίγον ποιεῖσθαι, ἡγεῖσθαι to hold of small account, Xen.; παρʼ οὐδέν ἐστι are as nothing, Soph.
with a sense of alternation, παρʼ ἡμέραν or παρʼ ἦμαρ, Doric παρʼ ἆμαρ, day by day, Pind., Soph.; πληγὴ παρὰ πληγήν blow for blow, Ar.
with a sense of Comparison, παρὰ τὰ ἄλλα ζῷα ὥσπερ θεοὶ οἱ ἄνθρωποι βιοτεύουσι men beyond all other animals live like gods, Xen.; χειμὼν μείζω παρὰ τὴν καθεστηκυῖαν ὥραν Thuc.
metaph. to denote dependence, on account of, because of, by means of, παρὰ τὴν ἑαυτοῦ ἀμέλειαν Thuc.; παρὰ τοῦτο γέγονε Dem.
of Time, along the whole course of, during, παρὰ τὴν ζόην Hdt.; παρὰ πάντα τὸν χρόνον Dem.; παρὰ ποτόν while they were at wine, Aeschin.
at the moment of, παρʼ αὐτὰ τἀδικήματα, flagrante delicto, Dem.
POSITION: —παρά may follow its Subst. in all cases, but then becomes by anastrophe πάρα.
πάρα (with anastrophe) also stands for πάρεστι and πάρεισι.
παρά absol., as adv., near, together, at once, in Hom.
IN COMPOS.,
alongside of, beside, παράλληλοι, παραπλέω.
to the side of, to, παραδίδωμι, παρέχω.
to one side of, by, past, παρέρχομαι, παρατρέχω.
metaph.:
aside, i. e. amiss, wrong, παραβαίνω, παρακούω.
of comparison, παραβάλλω, παρατίθημι.
of change, παραλλάσσω, παράφημι.

div1.head: παραβαίνω
div1.sense: to go by the side of, c. dat., Ἕκτορι παρβεβαώς standing beside Hector in the chariot, Il.; παρβεβαῶτε ἀλλήλοιιν Il.; so imperf. παρέβασκε is used as = ἦν παραβάτης, Il.

to pass beside or beyond, to overstep, transgress, τὰ νόμιμα Hdt.; δίκην Aesch.; τὰς σπονδάς Ar., Thuc.:—absol., παραβάντες the transgressors, Aesch.:—Pass. to be transgressed, σπονδὰς ἅς γε ὁ θεὸς νομίζει παραβεβάσθαι Thuc.; νόμῳ παραβαθέντι Thuc.; παραβαινομένων, absol., though offences are committed, Thuc.
to pass over, omit, Soph., Dem.: οὔ με παρέβα φάσμα it escaped me not, Eur.
to come forward, π. πρὸς τὸ θέατρον to step forward to address the spectators, Ar.; cf. παράβασις III.

div1.head: παραπέτασμα
div1.sense: that which is spread before a thing, a hanging curtain, Hdt., Ar.:—metaph. a screen, cover, Plat., Dem.

div1.head: παραπέτομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:— to fly alongside, Arist.
to fly past, to escape, Anth.

div1.head: παραπήγνυμι
div1.sense: to fix or plant beside, Hdt.:—Pass., with perf. 2 πέπηγα, to be fixed in the ground beside, Il.: to be closely annexed to a thing, c. dat., Isocr.

div1.head: παραπηδάω
div1.sense: to spring beyond, transgress, τοὺς νόμους Aeschin.

div1.head: παραπικραίνω
div1.sense: to embitter, provoke, NTest.

div1.head: παραπικρασμός
div1.sense: provocation, NTest.

div1.head: παραπίμπραμαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be inflamed, Xen.

div1.head: παραπίπτω
div1.sense: to fall beside, Plut.
to fall in oneʼs way, Hdt., Xen.: —καιρὸς παραπίπτει an opportunity offers, Thuc.: —ὁ παραπεσών, like ὁ παρατυχών, the first that comes, Plat.
c. dat. to befall, Plat.
to fall aside or away from, c. gen., Polyb.:—absol. to fall away, NTest.

div1.head: παραπλάζω
div1.sense: to make to wander from the right way, to drive seamen from their course, Od.:—metaph. to lead astray, perplex, Od.:—Pass., παρεπλάγχθη ἰός the arrow went aside, Il.; παραπλαγχθῆναι γνώμης to wander from reason, Eur.

div1.head: παράπλειος
div1.sense: almost full, Plat.

div1.head: παραπλέκω
div1.sense: to braid or weave in, Strab.

div1.head: παραπλευρίδια
div1.sense: covers for the sides of horses, Xen.

div1.head: παραπλευστέος
div1.sense: that must be sailed past, Strab.

div1.head: παραπλέω
div1.etym: Epic aor2 παρέπλων as if from a Verb in μι
div1.sense: to sail by or past, absol., οἴη δὴ κείνῃ γε παρέπλω Ἀργώ was the only ship that sailed past or through that way, Od.; ἐν χρῷ παραπλέοντες sailing past so as to shave closely, Thuc.
to sail along the coast, c. acc. loci, of persons making a coasting voyage, Hdt.

div1.head: παράπληκτος
div1.sense: frenzy-stricken, Soph.

div1.head: παραπλήξ
div1.sense: stricken sideways, ἠιόνες π. spits on which the waves break obliquely, Od.
metaph. = παράπληκτος, mad, Hdt., Ar.

div1.head: παραπλησιάζω
div1.sense: to be a neighbour, Aesop.

div1.head: παραπλήσιος
div1.sense: coming near, nearly resembling, such-like, τοιαῦτα καὶ παραπλήσια such and such-like, Thuc.; ναυσὶ παραπλησίαις τὸν ἀριθμόν with ships nearly equal in number, Thuc.:—with dat., παραπλήσιοι ἀλλήλοις about equal, Hdt.; ὅμοια ἢ π. τούτοις Dem.

foll. by a relat., παρ. ὡς . . , Dem.; π. ὥσπερ ἂν εἰ . . , Isocr.:—Neut. παραπλήσια as adv., π. ὡς εἰ . . , perinde ac si . . , Hdt.; so adv. -ίως, Plat.; παραπλησίως ἀγωνίζεσθαι, Lat. aequo Marte contendere, Hdt.

div1.head: παραπλήσσω
div1.sense: to strike at the side: — Pass. to be stricken on one side: to be deranged, frantic, γέλως παραπεπληγμένος Eur.

div1.head: παράπλοος
div1.sense: a sailing beside, a coasting voyage, τῆς Ἰταλίας towards Italy, Thuc.
a point sailed by or doubled, Strab.

div1.head: παραπνέω
div1.sense: to blow by the side, to escape by a sideway, of the winds confined by Aeolus, Od.

div1.head: παραποδίζω
div1.sense: to entangle the feet; generally, to impede, Polyb.:—Pass. to be ensnared, Plat.

div1.head: παραπόδιος
div1.sense: at the feet, i. e. present, Pind.

div1.head: παραποιέω
div1.sense: to make falsely: Mid., παραποιησάμενος σφραγῖδα having got a false seal made, Thuc.
to alter slightly, Arist.

div1.head: παραπολαύω
div1.sense: to have the benefit of besides, τινός Luc.

div1.head: παραπόλλυμι
div1.sense: to destroy besides:—Mid., with perf. 2 παραπόλωλα, to perish besides, παραπολεῖ (2nd sg. fut.) Ar.
to be ruined undeservedly, Dem.

div1.head: παραπομπή
div1.sense: a convoying, σίτου Decret. ap. Dem.
a procuring, providing, Arist.
that which is procured, supplies, Lat. commeatus, Xen.

div1.head: παραπομπός
div1.sense: escorting, Polyb.

div1.head: παραπόντιος
div1.sense: beside or near the sea, Anth.

div1.head: παραπορεύομαι
div1.sense: Dep., with fut. mid. and aor1 pass.,
to go beside or alongside, Polyb.
to go past, c. acc. loci, Polyb.: to pass, διὰ τῶν σπορίμων NTest.

div1.head: παραποτάμιος
div1.sense: beside a river, lying on a river, Hdt., Eur.: οἱ π. people who live on a river, Hdt.

div1.head: παραπράσσω
div1.sense: to do a thing beside or beyond the main purpose, Hdt.
to help in doing, Soph.

div1.head: παραπρεσβεία
div1.sense: a dishonest embassage, Dem.

div1.head: παραπρεσβεύω
div1.sense: to execute an embassy dishonestly, Dem., Aeschin.:—so Dep. παραπρεσβεύομαι, Dem.

div1.head: παράπρισμα
div1.sense: saw-dust, metaph., of poetic phrases, Ar.

div1.head: παράπτομαι
div1.sense: Pass., χερσὶ παραπτομένα πλάτα fitted to the hands, plied by the hands, Soph.; others take it as contr. for παραπετομένα, flying.

div1.head: παράπτωμα
div1.sense: a false step, a transgression, trespass, NTest.

div1.head: παράπτωσις
div1.sense: a falling beside; κατὰ τὴν π. τινος in the course of an action, Polyb.

div1.head: παραπύθια
div1.sense: Comic word, a sickness which prevented one from being victor at the Πύθια, Anth.

div1.head: παραρπάζω
div1.sense: to filch away, Anth.

div1.head: παραρράπτομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be sewn as a fringe along, Hdt.

div1.head: παραρρέω
div1.sense: to flow beside or past, τόπον or παρὰ τόπον Hdt.: to drift away, NTest.
to slip out or off, Soph., Xen.
to slip in unawares, Dem.

div1.head: παραρρήγνυμι
div1.sense: to break at the side, esp. to break a line of battle, Thuc.; and in Pass. to be broken, Thuc.
Pass., aor2 παρερράγην [ᾰ], with perf. 2 act. παρέρρωγα, to break or burst at the side, Soph., Plut.
φωνὴ παρερρωγυῖα a voice broken (by passion), Theophr.

div1.head: παραρρητός
div1.sense: of persons, that may be moved by words, Il.
of words, persuasive, Il.

div1.head: παραρρίπτω
div1.sense: to throw beside: metaph. to run the risk of doing a thing, c. part., π. λαμβάνων Soph.: to throw aside, reject, Anth.

div1.head: παράρρυμα
div1.sense: anything drawn along the side: a leathern or hair curtain, stretched along the sides of ships to protect the men, Xen.

div1.head: παραρτάω
div1.sense: hang alongside; in Pass., to be hung by oneʼs side, Plut.

div1.head: παραρτέομαι
div1.sense: Mid.:
trans. to fit out for oneself, παραρτέετο στρατιήν was engaged in preparing his army, Hdt.
in pass. sense, to hold oneself in readiness, Hdt.

div1.head: παραρτύω
div1.sense: of food, to season by additions.

div1.head: παρασάγγης
div1.sense: a parasang (the Persian farsang), containing thirty stades, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: παρασάττω
div1.sense: to stuff in beside, τι παρά τι Hdt.

div1.head: παράσειον
div1.sense: a topsail, Luc.

div1.head: παράσειρος
div1.sense: fastened alongside, π. ἵππος a horse harnessed alongside of the regular pair, an outrigger:—metaph. a yoke-fellow, true associate, Eur.

div1.head: παρασείω
div1.sense: to shake at the side, π. τὰς χεῖρας to swing oneʼs arms in running; then (without χεῖρας) φεύγειν παρασείσας, like demissis manibus fugere, i. e. celerrime, Arist.

div1.head: παρασημαίνομαι
div1.sense: Mid.:
to set oneʼs seal beside, to counterseal, seal up, Dem.:—perf. part. παρασεσημασμένος in pass. sense, Dem.
to note in passing, to notice besides, Arist.

div1.head: παράσημον
div1.sense: a side-mark: a mark of distinction, the ensign of a ship, Lat. insigne, NTest.: the badge of a soldier, Plut.

div1.head: παράσημος
div1.sense: marked amiss, falsely struck, counterfeit, of coin, Dem.; metaph. of men, Ar.; so, π. δόξα Eur.; παράσημος αἴνῳ falsely stamped with praise, i. e. praised by a wrong standard, Aesch.
of words, false, incorrect, Anth.
noted, Plut.

div1.head: παρασιγάω
div1.sense: to pass by in silence, Strab.

div1.head: παρασιτέω
div1.sense: to play the parasite or toad-eater, Luc.
to be honoured with a seat at the public table, Plut.

div1.head: παρασιτικός
div1.sense: of a παράσιτος: ἡ -κή (sc. τέχνη) , the trade of a παράσιτος, toad-eating, Luc.

div1.head: παράσιτος
div1.sense: one who eats at anotherʼs table, one who lives at anotherʼs expense, a parasite, toad-eater, Com., Luc.

div1.head: παρασιωπάω
div1.sense: to pass over in silence, Polyb.

div1.head: παρασκευάζω
div1.sense: to get ready, prepare, Hdt., Attic
to provide, procure, to get up, Dem.

to make or render so and so, with a Part. or adj., π. τινὰ εὖ ἔχοντα, π. τινὰ ὅτι βέλτιστον Xen.; c. inf., π. τινὰ ὡς μὴ ποιεῖν to accustom him not to do, Xen.;—so, π. ὅπως ὡς βέλτισται ἔσονται αἱ ψυχαί Plat.
absol. to make oneʼs friend, Dem.
Mid. and Pass.:
in proper sense of Mid., to get ready or prepare for oneself, Hdt., Attic
in Oratt. to procure witnesses and partisans, so as to obtain a false verdict (cf. παρασκευή 1. 3):—absol. to form a party, intrigue, Dem.:—so in Act., Xen.
in Mid., absol. to prepare oneself, make preparations, Hdt., Attic
perf. παρεσκεύασμαι is mostly pass. to be ready, be prepared, Hdt., Attic; παρεσκευάσθαι τί to be provided with a thing, Plat.:—impers., ὡς παρεσκεύαστο when preparations had been made, Thuc.

div1.head: παρασκεύασμα
div1.sense: anything prepared, apparatus, Xen.

div1.head: παρασκευαστέος
div1.sense: one must prepare or provide, Plat., Xen.
(from Pass.) one must prepare oneself, be ready, Plat.

div1.head: παρασκευαστής
div1.sense: a provider, τινος Plat.

div1.head: παρασκευαστικός
div1.sense: skilled in providing, τινος Xen.

div1.head: παρασκευαστός
div1.sense: that can be provided, Plat.

div1.head: παρασκευή
div1.sense: preparation, Hdt., Attic; ἐν τούτῳ παρασκευῆς in this state of preparation, Thuc.:— preparation of a speech, Xen.:—with Preps., ἐκ παρασκευῆς of set purpose, μάχη ἐγένετο ἐκ π. a pitched battle, Thuc.; so, ἀπὸ παρασκευῆς Thuc.; διʼ ὀλίγης παρασκευῆς at short notice, offhand, Thuc.; ἐν παρασκευῇ in course of preparation, Thuc.
a providing, procuring, π. φίλων καὶ οὐσίας Plat.
an intrigue or cabal, for the purpose of gaining a verdict or carrying a measure, Dem., etc.
that which is prepared, equipage, Lat. apparatus, Plat., Xen.: an armament, Thuc., Dem.
generally, power, means, Thuc.
among the Jews, the day of preparation, the day before the sabbath of the Passover, NTest.

div1.head: παρασκηνάω
div1.sense: to pitch oneʼs tent beside or near, Xen.

div1.head: παρασκήνιον
div1.sense: the side-scenes, Dem.

div1.head: παρασκηνόω
div1.sense: to throw over one like a tent or curtain, Aesch.

div1.head: παρασκήπτω
div1.sense: to fall beside, εἴς τι Luc.

div1.head: παρασκιρτάω
div1.sense: to leap upon, Plut.

div1.head: παρασκοπέω
div1.sense: to give a sidelong glance at, τινά Plat.
c. gen. to miss seeing the force of a thing, Aesch.

div1.head: παρασκώπτω
div1.sense: to jeer indirectly, Hhymn.

div1.head: παρασοβέω
div1.sense: to scare away birds: intr. to stalk haughtily past, Plut.

div1.head: παρασοφίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to out-do in skill, τινα Arist.

div1.head: παρασπάω
div1.sense: to draw forcibly aside, wrest aside, Soph.: metaph., παρασπᾶν τινα γνώμης Soph.; ἀδίκους φρένας παρασπᾷς, i. e. ὥστε εἶναι ἀδίκους, Soph.: —Mid., παρασπᾶσθαί τινά τινος to detach him from anotherʼs side, Xen.

div1.head: παρασπίζω
div1.sense: to bear a shield beside, i. e. to fight beside, stand by, Eur.:—metaph., τόξα παρασπίζοντʼ ἐμοῖς βραχίοσι Eur.

div1.head: παρασπιστής
div1.sense: a companion in arms, Eur.

div1.head: παρασπονδέω
div1.sense: to act contrary to an alliance or compact, break a treaty, Dem.
trans. to break faith with one, Polyb.:—Pass. to suffer by a breach of faith, Polyb.

div1.head: παρασπόνδημα
div1.sense: a breach of faith, Polyb.

div1.head: παρασπόνδησις
div1.sense: a breaking of faith, Polyb.

div1.head: παράσπονδος
div1.sense: contrary to a treaty, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: παρασταδόν
div1.sense: at oneʼs side, Hom., Theogn.

div1.head: παράστασις
div1.sense: a putting aside or away, banishing, relegatio, Plat., etc.
a setting out things for sale, retail-trade, Arist.
(παρίσταμαι) intr. a being beside:
a position or post near a king, Xen.
presence of mind, courage, Polyb.: also, desperation, Polyb.
as law-term, a small money deposit on entering law-suits, Oratt.

div1.head: παραστατέω
div1.sense: to stand by or near, Trag.
to stand by, to support, succour, τινί Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: παραστάς
div1.sense: anything that stands beside: pl. παραστάδες, doorposts, pilasters, Lat. antae:—also, the space enclosed between the antae, the vestibule, Eur.:—sometimes in sg., Eur.

div1.head: παραστάτης
div1.sense: one who stands by, a defender, Eur.
oneʼs comrade on the flank (as προστάτης is oneʼs front-rank-man, ἐπιστάτης oneʼs rear-rank-man), Hdt., Xen.: generally, a comrade, supporter, Hdt., etc.
oneʼs right or left-handman in a chorus, Arist.

div1.head: παραστατικός
div1.sense: fit for standing by:
able to exhort or rouse, c. gen., Polyb., Plut.
having presence of mind, courageous, desperate, Polyb.

div1.head: παραστάτις
div1.sense: a helper, assistant, Soph., Xen.

div1.head: παραστείχω
div1.sense: to go past, pass by, c. acc. loci, Hhymn., Aesch.: absol., Soph.
to pass into, enter, δόμους Soph.

div1.head: παραστορέννυμι
div1.sense: to lay flat, lay low, ἐγώ σε παραστορῶ (Attic fut.) Ar.

div1.head: παραστρατηγέω
div1.sense: to be at the generalʼs side, interfere with him, Plut.

div1.head: παραστρατοπεδεύω
div1.sense: to encamp opposite to, τινί Polyb.

div1.head: παραστρέφω
div1.sense: to turn aside: metaph., perf. pass. part. παρεστραμμένος, perverted, Arist.
π. τὸν τρίβωνα, to wear it crooked, Theophr.

div1.head: παρασυγγραφέω
div1.sense: to break contract with, τινα Dem.

div1.head: παρασυλλέγομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to assemble with others, Andoc.

div1.head: παρασύρω
div1.sense: to sweep away, carry away, of a rapid stream, Ar.
π. ἔπος to drag a word in, use it out of time and place, Aesch.

div1.head: παρασφάλλω
div1.sense: to make an arrow glance aside, Il.; π. τινά τινος to foil one of [obtaining] a thing, Pind.

div1.head: παρασχίζω
div1.sense: to rip up lengthwise, slit up, Hdt.

div1.head: παράταξις
div1.sense: a placing in line of battle, ἐκ παρατάξεως in regular battle, Thuc., etc.
of marshalling a political party, arrangement, Aeschin., Dem.

div1.head: παρατάσσω
div1.sense: to place side by side, draw up in battle-order, Hdt., Thuc., etc.:—Mid. to draw up oneʼs men in battle-order, Xen.; so of ships, Thuc.:—Mid. and Pass. to be drawn up along, παρατετάχατο παρὰ τὴν ἀκτήν Hdt.; ἑκατέρωθεν παρατεταγμένοι Thuc.; so, παρετάξαντο ἀλλήλοις Xen.: absol., παρατεταγμένοι or παραταξάμενοι in order of battle, Thuc., Dem.
in Mid. and Pass., also, to stand prepared, παρατετάχθαι πρὸς τὸ ἀποκρίνεσθαι Plat.

div1.head: παρατείνω
div1.sense: to stretch out along or beside, to extend the line of battle, Lat. ordines explicare, Xen.; π. τάφρον to draw a long trench, Xen.:—Pass. to be stretched along (v. infr. II. 1): to be stretched at length, laid low, Ar.
to stretch on the rack, torture, Xen.: —Pass. to be half-dead, worn out, Plat.
Pass., παρατείνεσθαι εἰς τοὔσχατον to strain themselves to the uttermost, hold out to the last, Thuc.
to prolong, protract, Arist., Luc.
to apply a figure to a right line, Plat.
of pronunciation, to lengthen in pronunciation, Lat. producere, Luc.
intr. to stretch along, of a wall, a tract of country, Hdt.:— so also in Pass., παρατέταται τὸ ὄρος Hdt., etc.
of Time, to continue oneʼs life, Luc.

div1.head: παρατείχισμα
div1.sense: a wall built beside or across, Thuc.

div1.head: παρατεκταίνομαι
div1.sense: Mid.:—of timber, to work into another form; then, generally, to transform, alter, οὐδέ κεν ἄλλως Ζεὺς παρατεκτήναιτο not even Zeus could make it any way else, Il.; αἶψά κε ἔπος παρατεκτήναιο soon couldst thou dress up some other tale, Od.
Act. to build besides, Plut.

div1.head: παρατεταγμένως
div1.etym: adverb from part. perf. pass. of παρατάσσω
div1.sense: as in battle-array, steadily, Plat.

div1.head: παρατηρέω
div1.sense: to watch closely, observe narrowly, to watch oneʼs opportunity, Xen.:—so in Mid., NTest.
to take care, ὅπως μὴ . . Dem.

div1.head: παρατήρησις
div1.sense: observation, μετὰ παρατηρήσεως so that it can be observed, NTest.

div1.head: παρατίθημι
div1.sense: in Attic παράκειμαι generally serves as the Pass.:— to place beside, Od., Attic:—of meals, to set before, serve up, τί τινι Hom.; οἱ παρατιθέντες the serving-men, Xen.:—Pass., τὰ παρατιθέμενα meats set before one, Xen.
generally, to offer, provide, Od., Plat.
to place upon, στεφάνους παρέθηκε καρήατι Hes.
to lay before one, explain, τί τινι Xen., NTest.
to compare, τί τινι Plut.
Mid. to set before oneself, have set before one, Od., Thuc., etc.
to deposit what belongs to one in anotherʼs hands, give in charge, commit, Hdt., Xen.; τι εἴς τινα or τινά τινι NTest.
to venture, stake, hazard, παρθέμενοι κεφαλάς, ψυχάς Od.
to employ something of oneʼs own, τι ἔν τινι Plat.

div1.head: παρατίλλω
div1.sense: to pluck the hair off, Ar.:— Mid. to pluck out oneʼs hairs, Ar.: perf. pass. part. παρατετιλμένος, η, clean-plucked, Ar.

div1.head: παράτολμος
div1.sense: foolhardy, Plut.

div1.head: παράτονος
div1.sense: stretched beside, hanging down by the side, Eur.

div1.head: παρατρέπω
div1.sense: to turn aside, Il.; ποταμὸν π. to turn a river from its channel, Lat. derivare, Hdt.; π. ἄλλῃ τὸ ὕδωρ Thuc.:—Pass., παρατρεπόμενος εἰς Τένεδον turning aside to . . , Xen.
to turn one from his opinion, change his mind, Hes.: so in Mid., Theocr.
of things, π. λόγον to pervert or falsify a story, Hdt.
to alter or revoke a decree, Hdt.

div1.head: παρατρέφω
div1.sense: to feed beside another:—Pass., of men not worth their keep, to feed at anotherʼs expense, Dem.

div1.head: παρατρέχω
div1.sense: to run by or past, Il., Ar.
to outrun, overtake, Il.: π. τὰ τότε κακά to go beyond, exceed them, Eur.
to run through or over, run across (a space of ground expressed or implied), Xen.
to run over, i. e. treat in a cursory way, Isocr.:— to slight, neglect, Theocr.
to escape unnoticed, τινά Polyb.

div1.head: παρατρέω
div1.sense: to start aside from fear, Il.

div1.head: παρατρίβω
div1.sense: to rub beside or alongside, π. χρυσὸν ἀκήρατον ἄλλῳ χρυσῷ (sc. εἰς βάσανον) to rub pure gold by the side of other gold on the lapis Lydius and see the difference of the marks they leave, Hdt.
παρατρίψασθαι τὸ μέτωπον, Lat. frontem perfricare, to harden the forehead by rubbing, i. e. to be hardened, dead to shame, Strab.

div1.head: παρατροπέω
div1.sense: τί με ταῦτα παρατροπέων ἀγορεύεις; why tell me this, leading me astray? Od.

div1.head: παρατροπή
div1.sense: a turning away, means of averting, θανάτου Eur.
intr. a digression, Luc.

div1.head: παράτροπος
div1.sense: turned aside, lawless, strange, unusual, Plut.
act. averting a thing, c. gen., Eur.

div1.head: παρατροχάζω
div1.sense: to run past, τινά Anth.: to pass by or over, to leave unnoticed, Anth.

div1.head: παρατρώγω
div1.sense: to gnaw at the side, nibble at, take a bite of, c. gen., Ar.

div1.head: παρατρωπάω
div1.sense: θεοὺς θυέεσσι παρατρωπῶσʼ ἄνθρωποι turn away the anger of the gods by sacrifices, Il.

div1.head: παρατυγχάνω
div1.sense: to happen to be near, be among others, c. dat., Il.; π. τῷ λόγῳ τῷ πάθεϊ to be present at . . , Lat. interesse, Hdt.
absol. to happen to be present, Hdt.: of a thing, to offer itself, παρατυχούσης τινὸς σωτηρίας Thuc.

often in partic. παρατυχών, whoever chanced to be by, i. e. the first comer, any chance person, Thuc.;— so, τὸ παρατυγχάνον or παρατυχόν whatever turns up or chances, πρὸς τὸ παρατυγχάνον as circumstances required, Thuc.: nom. absol., ἐν τῷ παρατυχόντι Thuc.: —παρατυχόν, it being in oneʼs power, since it was in oneʼs power to do, c. inf., Thuc.

div1.head: παραυγάζω
div1.sense: to illumine slightly:—Pass. to be illumined, Strab.; and of the sun, to shine, Strab.

div1.head: παραυδάω
div1.sense: to address so as to console or encourage, Od.; μὴ ταῦτα παραύδα do not talk me into this, Od.
c. acc. rei, to speak lightly of, μὴ δή μοι θάνατόν γε παραύδα Od.

div1.head: παραυλίζω
div1.sense: to lie near a place, c. dat., Eur.

div1.head: πάραυλος
div1.sense: dwelling beside, πάραυλον οἰκίζειν τινά to place one on the borders (of a land), Soph.; βοὴ πάραυλος a cry close at hand, Soph.

div1.head: πάραυτα
div1.sense: in like manner, Lat. perinde or (as others) = παραυτίκα, at first, Aesch., Dem.

div1.head: παραυτίκα
div1.sense: immediately, forthwith, straightway, Lat. illico, Hdt.; also, τὸ π. Hdt.; ἐν τῷ π. Thuc.
with Substantives, to express brief duration, Ἅιδην τὸν π. present death, Eur.; ἡ π. λαμπρότης momentary splendour, Thuc.; ἡ π. ἐλπίς Thuc.

div1.head: παραυχένιος
div1.sense: hanging from the neck, Anth.

div1.head: παραφαίνω
div1.sense: to shew beside or by uncovering, Hes.
to walk beside and light, light one to a place, Ar.
Pass. to appear by the side, disclose itself, Plat.

div1.head: παράφασις
div1.etym: only in poet. forms such as παραίφασις, πάρφασις
div1.sense: an address, encouragement, consolation, Il.
allurement, persuasion, said of the cestus of Aphrodite, Il.: deceit, Pind.

div1.head: παραφέρω
div1.sense: to bring to oneʼs side, to hand to, set before one, Hdt., Xen.; π. τὰς κεφαλάς to exhibit them, Hdt.:—Pass. to be set on table, Hdt.
to bring forward, by way of argument, π. ἐς μέσον Hdt.: to bring forward, allege, cite, Hdt., Eur., etc.
to hand over, transmit, Eur.
to carry beside, τί τινι Eur.
to carry past or beyond, Plat.; π. τὴν χεῖρα to wave the hand, Dem.:—Pass. to be carried past or beyond, Thuc.; τοῦ χειμῶνος παραφερομένου while the winter was passing, Plut.
to turn aside or away, τὴν ὄψιν π. τινός Xen.: to put away, remove, NTest.
to turn in a wrong direction, Dem.:—Pass. to move in a wrong direction, of paralysed limbs, Arist.
to lead aside, mislead:—Pass. to be misled, err, go wrong, Plat.
to sweep away, of a river, Plut.: —Pass. to be carried away, Anth.
to let pass, Lat. praetermittere, τὰς ὥρας παρηνέγκατε τῆς θυσίας Orac. ap. Dem.:—Pass. to slip away, escape, Xen.
intr. to be beyond or over, ἡμερῶν ὀλίγων παρενεγκουσῶν, ἡμέρας οὐ πολλὰς παρενεγκούσας a few days over, more or less, Thuc.

div1.head: παραφεύγω
div1.sense: to flee close past or beyond, παρφυγέειν (Epic aor2 inf.) Od.

div1.head: παράφημι
div1.sense: to speak gently to, to advise, c. dat., Il.:—Mid. to persuade, appease, c. acc., Hom.
to speak deceitfully or insincerely, Pind.; and, in Mid., Pind.

div1.head: παραφθάνω
div1.sense: to overtake, outstrip, Il.; εἰ δʼ ἄμμε παραφθαίησι πόδεσσι (Epic 3rd sg. opt.) Il.

div1.head: παραφθέγγομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:
to add a qualification, Plat.
to interrupt, Plut.

div1.head: παραφορά
div1.sense: a going aside: of the mind, derangement, Aesch.

div1.head: παραφορέω
div1.sense: to set before, τί τινι Ar.:—Pass., Hdt.

div1.head: παράφορος
div1.sense: borne aside, carried away, Plut.
wandering, reeling, staggering, Eur., Luc.
mad, frenzied, Plut., Luc.

div1.head: παράφραγμα
div1.sense: a breastwork on the top of a mound, only in pl., Thuc.; in a ship, the bulwarks, Thuc.: a low screen, Plat.

div1.head: παραφράσσω
div1.sense: to enclose with a breastwork, Polyb.

div1.head: παραφρονέω
div1.sense: to be beside oneself, be deranged or mad, Hdt., Aesch., etc.; poet. παραιφρ-, Theocr.

div1.head: παραφροσύνη
div1.sense: derangement, Plat.

div1.head: παραφρουρέω
div1.sense: to keep guard beside, c. acc., Strab.

div1.head: παράφρων
div1.sense: wandering from reason, out of oneʼs wits, deranged, Soph., Eur., etc.

div1.head: παραφυάς
div1.sense: an offshoot, Arist.

div1.head: παραφυής
div1.sense: growing beside: παραφυές, παραφυάς, Arist.

div1.head: παραφυλακή
div1.sense: a guard, watch, garrison, Polyb.

div1.head: παραφυλάσσω
div1.sense: to watch beside, to guard closely, watch narrowly, Xen., etc.
Mid. to be on oneʼs guard, Plat.

div1.head: παραφύω
div1.sense: mid.-pass. to grow beside or at the side, Hdt.

div1.head: παραχαλάω
div1.sense: to slacken at the side: of a ship, to let in water, leak, Ar.

div1.head: παραχαράσσω
div1.sense: to mark with a false stamp, falsify, Luc.

div1.head: παραχειμάζω
div1.sense: to winter in or at a place, Dem., etc.

div1.head: παραχειμασία
div1.sense: a wintering in a place, Polyb.

div1.head: παραχελῳίτης
div1.sense: a dweller by the Achelous, Strab.: —fem. παραχελωῖτις, ιδος, (sc. χώρα) the country along the Achelous, Strab.

div1.head: παραχέω
div1.sense: to pour in beside, pour in, Hdt.
of solids, to heap up on the side, Hdt.
Pass. to lie spread out near, of a country, Plut.

div1.head: παραχράομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:
to use improperly, misuse, abuse, c. dat., Polyb.
π. ἔς τινα to deal wrongly or unworthily with him, Hdt.
= ἐκ παρέργου χράομαι, to treat with contempt, disregard, c. acc., Hdt.: Ionic part. παραχρεώμενοι, of furious combatants, setting nothing by their life, Hdt.

div1.head: παραχρῆμα
div1.sense: on the spot, forthwith, straightway, Hdt., Thuc., etc.:—with the Art., τὸ π. Hdt., Attic; ἐκ or ἀπὸ τοῦ παραχρῆμα off-hand, immediate, Xen.; ἐν τῷ π. Plat., etc.; —ἐς τὸ π. ἀκούειν Thuc.

div1.head: παραχρηστηριάζω
div1.sense: to give a false oracle, Strab.

div1.head: παράχροος
div1.sense: of false or altered colour, colourless, faded, Luc.

div1.head: παραχρώννυμι
div1.sense: to corrupt music by the ἁρμονία χρωματική, Arist.

div1.head: παράχωμα
div1.sense: a side embankment, a dyke, Strab.

div1.head: παραχώννυμι
div1.sense: to throw up beside, Hdt.

div1.head: παραχωρέω
div1.sense: to go aside, make room, give place, retire, Ar., etc.: π. τινί to give way, yield, submit, Plat., etc.:— π. τινός to retire from, Dem.
to step aside out of the way for another, as a mark of respect, ὁδοῦ π. πρεσβυτέρῳ Xen.; π. τινί τοῦ βήματος Aeschin.; τῇ πόλει παραχωρῶ τῆς τιμωρίας I leave the task of punishment to the state, Dem.
to concede a thing, c. acc., Plat.

div1.head: παραχώρησις
div1.sense: a giving way: c. gen. a retiring from, τῆς ἀρχῆς Plut.

div1.head: παραχωρητέος
div1.sense: one must give way, Xen.

div1.head: παραψάλλω
div1.sense: to touch lightly, Plut.

div1.head: παραψελλίζω
div1.sense: to stammer out somewhat of the truth, Strab.

div1.head: παραψυχή
div1.sense: cooling, refreshment, consolation, Eur.; ἀλγέων π. Eur.; π. τῷ πένθει Dem.

div1.head: παραψύχω
div1.sense: to cool gently: metaph. to console, soothe, Theocr.

div1.head: παρδακός
div1.sense: wet, damp, Ar.

div1.head: παρδαλέη
div1.sense: (sc. δορά) a leopard-skin, Il., Hdt.; Doric παρδαλέα, Pind.

div1.head: παρδαλιοκτόνος
div1.sense: leopard-killing, Anth.

div1.head: πάρδαλις
div1.sense: gen. εως Ionic ιος; dat. ει, the pard, whether leopard, panther, or ounce, Hom., Attic

div1.head: παρδαλωτός
div1.sense: spotted like the pard, Luc.

div1.head: παρέγγραπτος
div1.sense: illegally registered, π. πολίτης an intrusive citizen, Aeschin.

div1.head: παρεγγράφω
div1.sense: to interpolate, Aeschin.; παρεγγραφεὶς πολίτης παρέγγραπτος, Aeschin.

div1.head: παρεγγυάω
div1.sense: to hand over to another, to entrust or commend to his care, Hdt.
as a military term, to pass on the word of command along the line, Lat. imperium tradere per manus, Eur., Xen.
of a general, to give the word to do a thing, command suddenly, π. τινι ποιεῖν τι Xen.
of a general also, to deliver an address before battle, Xen.
to pledge oneʼs word, promise, c. acc. et inf. fut., Soph.

div1.head: παρεγγύη
div1.sense: a word of command passed on, Xen.

div1.head: παρεγγύησις
div1.sense: a passing on the word of command, Xen.

div1.head: παρεγείρω
div1.sense: to raise partly, Plut.

div1.head: παρεγκλίνω
div1.sense: to make to incline sideways:—Pass. to incline sideways, Plut.

div1.head: παρεδρεύω
div1.sense: to sit constantly beside, attend constantly, be always near, Lat. assidere, c. dat., Eur.
of judges, to be an assessor, Dem.

div1.head: πάρεδρος
div1.sense: sitting beside, as at table, Hdt.: generally, sitting beside, near, τινι Eur.
as Subst. an assessor, coadjutor, associate, foll. by dat. or gen., Pind., Eur.
in Prose, the assessor or coadjutor of a king or magistrate, Hdt.

div1.head: παρέζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to sit beside, Theogn.; cf. παρίζω.

div1.head: παρειά
div1.sense: the cheek, mostly in pl., (παρήιον being used by Hom. for sg.), Hom., Trag.
div1.etym: Prob. from παρά, being literally the side of the face.

div1.head: παρείας
div1.sense: a reddish-brown snake, sacred to Aesculapius, Ar., Dem.

div1.head: παρεῖδον
div1.etym: aor2, παροράω being used as the pres.
div1.sense: to observe by the way, notice, τί τινι something in one, Hdt.
to look past, overlook, disregard, Dem.

div1.head: παρεικάζω
div1.sense: to compare, τινί τι Plat.

div1.head: παρείκω
div1.sense: to give way, τινί to one, Soph.: absol. to permit, allow, Plat.; κατὰ τὸ παρεῖκον by such ways as were practicable, Thuc.
impers., παρείκει μοι it is competent, allowable for me, εἴ μοι παρείκοι Soph.; ὅπῃ παρείκοι wherever it was practicable, Thuc.

div1.head: πάρειμι
div1.sense: to be by or present, Hom.
to be by or near one, c. dat., Od., Soph., etc.: to be present in or at a thing, Hom., Attic
to be present so as to help, stand by, Lat. adesse, τινι Il.
παρεῖναι εἰς . . , to arrive at, to have come to, a place, Hdt.; π. ἐπὶ δεῖπνον Hdt., Attic
of things, to be by, to be ready or at hand, Lat. praesto esse, Od., etc.; εἴ μοι δύναμίς γε παρείη if power were at my command, Od.:—so of feelings, φόβος βαρβάροις παρῆν Aesch.; θαῦμα παρῆν Soph.

of Time, ὁ παρὼν νῦν χρόνος Soph.; τὰ παρόντα (Ionic παρεόντα) the present state of affairs, present circumstances, Hdt.; ἐκ τῶν παρόντων according to present circumstances, Thuc.; ἐν τῷ παρόντι, opp. to ἐν τῷ ἔπειτα, Thuc.; πρὸς τὸ π. αὐτίκα Thuc.
impers., πάρεστί μοι it is in my power to do, c. inf., Hdt., Aesch., etc.; and without dat., παρῆν κλύειν one might hear, Aesch.
part. παρόν, Ionic παρεόν, it being possible since it is allowed, Lat. quum liceret, παρεὸν αὐτῷ βασιλέα γενέσθαι Hdt.

div1.head: πάρειμι
div1.etym: used as fut. of παρέρχομαι and παρῄειν as imperf.
div1.sense: to go by, beside or past, to pass by, pass, Od., Plat., etc.:— to go alongside, Thuc.: to march along the coast, of an army, as παραπλέω of a fleet, Thuc., Xen.
c. acc. loci, to pass by, Hdt.; absol., Hdt.
of Time, to pass on, pass, Hdt.
to pass by, overtake, surpass, Xen.
to pass into, enter, Hdt., Eur.
in discourse, to pass on from one part of a subject to another, Ar.
in Attic Prose, to come forward, Xen.; πάριτʼ ἐς τὸ πρόσθεν Ar.
to come forward to speak, Plat., Dem.; οἱ παριόντες orators, Dem.
to pass from man to man, Xen.

div1.head: παρεῖπον
div1.etym: aor2, with no pres. in use, παρά-φημι or παρ-αγορεύω being used instead
div1.sense: to persuade by indirect means, to talk over, win over, Il., Aesch.; παρειπών by thy persuasions, Il.:—c. acc. cogn. to give such and such advice, αἴσιμα παρειπών Il.
div1.etym: In Il. the first syll. is long, πᾱρειπών, πᾱρειποῦσα, the orig. form having been παρϝειπών.

div1.head: παρείρω
div1.sense: to fasten in beside, insert, Xen.; νόμους παρείρων if he adds observance of laws, Soph.

div1.head: παρεισάγω
div1.sense: to lead in by oneʼs side, bring forward, introduce, Isocr., NTest.

div1.head: παρείσακτος
div1.sense: introduced privily, NTest.

div1.head: παρεισέρχομαι
div1.sense: Dep. with aor. and perf. act. to come or go in beside or secretly, Polyb., NTest.

div1.head: παρεισπίπτω
div1.sense: to get in by the side, steal in, Polyb.

div1.head: παρεισρέω
div1.sense: to flow on beside, Plut.

div1.head: παρεισφέρω
div1.sense: to bring in beside, π. νόμον to propose a new law to amend another, Lat. subrogare, Dem.
to apply besides, NTest.

div1.head: παρέκβασις
div1.sense: a deviation from, c. gen., Arist.; of constitutional forms, τυραννίς is a παρέκβασις from monarchy, oligarchy from aristocracy, Arist.

div1.head: παρεκκλίνω
div1.sense: to deviate, Aeschin.

div1.head: παρεκλέγω
div1.sense: to collect covertly, π. τὰ κοινά to embezzle the public moneys, Dem.

div1.head: παρεκπροφεύγω
div1.sense: to flee forth from, elude, ἵνα μή σε παρεκπροφύγῃσιν ἄεθλα (Epic 3rd sg. aor2 subj.), Il.

div1.head: παρεκτείνω
div1.sense: to stretch out in line, Polyb.

div1.head: παρεκτελέω
div1.sense: to accomplish otherwise, Mosch.

div1.head: παρεκτέος
div1.sense: one must cause, Xen.

div1.head: παρεκτός
div1.sense: besides or except for, c. gen., NTest.: —absol., τὰ παρεκτός things external, NTest.

div1.head: παρεκτρέπω
div1.sense: to turn aside, divert, Eur.

div1.head: παρεκτρέχω
div1.sense: to run out past, Plut.

div1.head: παρεκχέω
div1.sense: to pour out by degrees:—Pass., of rivers and lakes, to overflow, Strab.

div1.head: παρέκχυσις
div1.sense: an overflowing, of rivers, Strab.

div1.head: παρελαύνω
div1.sense: to drive by or past, ἐναντίω δυʼ ἅρματε π. to drive them past one another, Ar.; τὰς αἶγας παρελᾶντα (Doric pres. part. acc.) Theocr.
intr.,
to drive by, Il.:—then c. acc. pers. to drive past, overtake, Il., Xen.
to row or sail past, Od.; c. acc. pers., Σειρῆνας παρήλασε Od.
to ride by, run by, c. acc., Xen.
more rarely to ride up to, rush towards, Xen.: to ride on oneʼs way, Xen.

div1.head: παρέλκω
div1.sense: to draw aside, pervert, Pind.: —Mid. to draw aside to oneself, draw away from, τί τινος Od.
to lead alongside, as one does a led horse, Hdt.; παρέλκειν ἐκ γῆς to tow [boats] from the bank, Hdt.
κενὰς παρέλκειν (sc. τὰς κώπας) to pull them through the air without dipping them, i. e. to make a mere show of working, Ar.
to drag to one side, put off, μὴ μύνῃσι παρέλκετε put not things off by excuses, Od.
intr. to be prolonged, to continue, Luc.

div1.head: παρεμβάλλω
div1.sense: to put in beside, insert, interpolate, interpose, τι Ar., Dem.; π. ὑποψίας to insinuate suspicions, Aeschin.
to put the auxiliaries in line with the legionaries, Polyb.
intr. to fall into line, to encamp, Polyb.

div1.head: παρεμβλέπω
div1.sense: to look askance, Eur.

div1.head: παρεμβολή
div1.sense: insertion, interpolation, Aeschin.
an encampment, fortress, NTest.

div1.head: παρεμβύω
div1.sense: to stuff in, Luc.

div1.head: παρεμπίπλημι
div1.sense: to fill secretly with, c. gen., Plut.

div1.head: παρεμπίπραμαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be inflamed by rubbing, Strab.

div1.head: παρεμπίπτω
div1.sense: to fall in by the way, creep or steal in, Plat., Aeschin.

div1.head: παρεμπολάω
div1.sense: to traffic underhand in a thing, to smuggle a thing in, Eur.

div1.head: παρεμπόρευμα
div1.sense: of small wares: metaph. an appendix, Luc.

div1.head: παρεμπορεύομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to traffic in besides:—metaph., τὸ τερπνὸν π. to yield delight besides instruction, Luc.

div1.head: παρενθήκη
div1.sense: something put in beside, an addition, appendix, Hdt.; παρενθήκην ἔχρησε ἐς Μιλησίους delivered an oracle by way of parenthesis, Hdt.

div1.head: παρενοχλέω
div1.sense: to trouble greatly, NTest.:—Pass., καὶ ὑμεῖς παρηνώχλησθε (2nd pl. perf. pass.) Dem.

div1.head: παρενσαλεύω
div1.sense: to swing to and fro, Ar.

div1.head: παρεντείνω
div1.sense: to rouse to exertion, Plut.

div1.head: παρεξαίρω
div1.sense: to lift up beside, Strab.

div1.head: παρεξαυλέω
div1.sense: of musical instruments, worn out by being played upon, and so, generally, worn out, Ar.

div1.head: παρέξειμι
div1.sense: to go out beside, pass by or alongside of, c. acc. loci, Hdt.: absol., Hdt., Eur., etc.
to turn aside out of the path, Plat.
to overstep, transgress, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: παρεξειρεσία
div1.sense: the part of the ship beyond the rowers, at either end, Thuc.

div1.head: παρεξελαύνω
div1.sense: to drive out past, to pass in a race, Il.: to row past, c. acc., Od.: to march by, Hdt.
to march out to meet, ἀλλήλοις Plut.

div1.head: παρεξέρχομαι
div1.sense: to go out beside, slip past, Od.; π. τινα, Hdt.
παρεξελθεῖν πεδίοιο τυτθόν to pass over a little of it, Il.
to overstep, transgress, Διὸς νόον Od.; δίκην Soph.

div1.head: παρεξετάζω
div1.sense: to examine by comparing, Dem.

div1.head: παρεξευρίσκω
div1.sense: to find out besides, π. ἄλλον νόμον to find out another different law, Hdt.

div1.head: παρεξίημι
div1.sense: to let out beside: of Time, to let pass, Hdt.

div1.head: παρέξ
div1.sense: as prep.,
c. gen. loci, outside, before, παρὲκ λιμένος Od.; παρὲξ ὁδοῦ out of the road, Il.
like χωρίς, besides, except, exclusive of, παρὲξ τοῦ ἀργύρου Hdt.

c. acc. out by the side of, along side of, παρὲξ ἅλα Il.; παρὲξ τὴν νῆσον away from the island, Od.; παρὲξ δοῦρα out of the way of spears, Od.; παρὲκ νόον out of sense and reason, foolishly, Il.; παρὲξ Ἀχιλῆα without the knowledge of Achilles, Il.
as adv.,
of Place, out beside, στῆ δὲ παρέξ hard by, Il.; νῆχε παρέξ was swimming out along shore, Od.
metaph. beside the mark, παρὲξ ἀγορεύειν Il.
ἄλλα παρὲξ μεμνώμεθα let us talk of something else, Od.; παρὲξ ἢ ὅσον except so long as, Hdt.

div1.head: παρεκβαίνω
div1.sense: c.gen. to step out aside from, deviate from, Hes., Arist.
c. acc. to overstep, transgress, Aesch., Arist.
absol. to deviate, Arist.: to make a digression, Arist.

div1.head: παρέπαινος
div1.sense: subordinate or incidental praise, Plat.

div1.head: παρεπιγράφω
div1.sense: to correct an inscription, Strab.

div1.head: παρεπιδείκνυμι
div1.sense: Mid. to exhibit out of season, make a display, Luc.

div1.head: παρεπιστροφή
div1.sense: a turning round in passing, Plut.

div1.head: παρέπομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to follow along side, follow close, c. dat., Xen.; absol., Plat.

div1.head: παρεργάτης
div1.sense: a pottering workman, Eur.

div1.head: πάρεργον
div1.sense: a bye-work, subordinate or secondary business, appendage, appendix, Eur.; πάρεργʼ ὁδοῦ a secondary purpose of my journey, Eur.; π. τύχης an unhappy addition to my fortune, Eur.; πάρεργα κακῶν things useless to remedy my ills, Eur.:— ἐν παρέργῳ as a bye-work, as subordinate or secondary, Lat. obiter, ἐν π. θέσθαι to treat as a bye-work, Soph.; ὡς ἐν π. Eur.; ἐκ παρέργου Thuc.

div1.head: παρέρπω
div1.sense: to creep secretly up to, Theocr.
to pass by, Anth.

div1.head: παρερύω
div1.sense: to draw along the side, φραγμόν Hdt.

div1.head: παρέρχομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:— to go by, beside or past, to pass by, pass, Od.; παρῆλθεν ὁ κίνδυνος ὥσπερ νέφος passed away, Dem.
of Time, to pass, Hdt.; ὁ παρελθὼν ἄροτος the past season, Soph.; π. ὁδοί wanderings now gone by, Soph.; ἐν τῷ παρελθόντι in time past, of old, Xen.; τὰ παρεληλυθότα past events, Dem.
to pass by, outstrip, Hom., Theogn., Attic; τοὺς λόγους τὰ ἔργα παρέρχεται Dem.
to outwit, escape, elude, Il., Hdt., Eur.
to arrive at, π. εἰς . . Hes.
to pass in, ἐς τὴν αὐλήν Hdt.; π. ἔσω or εἴσω to go into a house, etc., Trag.; c. acc., π. δόμους Eur.
to pass without heeding, τεὸν βωμόν Il.: to pass by, pass over, disregard, slight, θεούς Eur.
to overstep, transgress, τοὺς νόμους Dem.
to pass unnoticed, escape the notice of, τουτὶ παρῆλθέ με εἰπεῖν Dem.
in Attic to come forward to speak, π. εἰς τὸν δῆμον Thuc.; absol., παρελθὼν ἔλεξε τοιάδε Thuc.

div1.head: παρεσθίω
div1.sense: to gnaw or nibble at a thing, c. gen., Ar.

div1.head: πάρεσις
div1.sense: a letting go, remission, NTest.

div1.head: παρέστιος
div1.sense: by or at the hearth, Soph.:— generally, = ἐφέστιος, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: παρευδοκιμέω
div1.sense: to surpass in reputation, τινα Plut.

div1.head: παρευθύνω
div1.sense: to direct, constrain, Soph.

div1.head: παρευκηλέω
div1.sense: to calm, soothe, Eur.

div1.head: παρευνάζομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to lie beside another, c. dat., Od.

div1.head: πάρευνος
div1.sense: lying beside or with:—metaph., πῆμα πατρὶ πάρευνον Aesch.

div1.head: παρεύρεσις
div1.sense: the invention of a false pretext, a pretence, Decret. ap. Dem.

div1.head: παρευρίσκω
div1.sense: to discover besides, invent, Hdt.
Pass. to be discovered besides, aor1 παρευρέθην Hdt.

div1.head: παρευτακτέω
div1.sense: to perform oneʼs duty regularly, Polyb.

div1.head: παρευτρεπίζω
div1.sense: to put in order, arrange, make ready, Eur.
to arrange badly, neglect, Eur.

div1.head: παρεφεδρεύω
div1.sense: to lie near to guard, to keep guard, Polyb.

div1.head: παρέχω
div1.sense: Act. to hold beside, hold in readiness, to furnish, provide, supply, Hom., etc.:—absol., πᾶσι παρέξω I will provide for all, Od.
to afford, cause, grant, give, φιλότητα, εὐφροσύνην Hom.; ὄχλον Hdt.; χάριν, εὔνοιαν Soph., etc.

to present or offer for a purpose, c. inf., ὄϊες παρέχουσι γάλα θῆσθαι Od.; π. τὸ σῶμα τύπτειν Ar.; π. ἑαυτόν τινι ἐρωτᾶν Plat.:—hence, absol., to submit oneself, ἰατροῖς παρέχουσι ἀποτέμνειν Xen.; πάρεχε ἐκποδών make yourself scarce, Ar.
with reflex. Pron. and a predicative, to shew or exhibit oneself so and so, π. ἑαυτὸν σοφιστήν Plat.; εὐπειθῆ Xen.; π. γῆν ἄσυλον to offer the country as an asylum, Eur.
to allow, grant, σιγὴν παρασχών Soph.;—c. inf. to allow one to do a thing, Soph.

impers., παρέχει τινί c. inf. (where ὁ καιρός may be supplied), it is allowed, easy, in oneʼs power to do so and so, Hdt., Eur., etc.:—so neut. part. used absol., παρέχον it being in oneʼs power, since one can, Hdt., Thuc.
in Attic to produce a person on demand, Xen., etc.
Mid. παρέχομαι, fut. -έξομαι and -σχήσομαι· perf. pass. (in mid. sense) -έσχημαι:— to supply of oneself or from oneʼs own means, Hdt., etc.
to furnish, produce, κροκοδείλους Hdt.
to display on oneʼs own part, exhibit, προθυμίαν Hdt., etc.
in Attic law, παρέχεσθαί τινα μάρτυρα to bring forward as a witness, Plat.
to produce as oneʼs own, ἄρχοντα παρέχεσθαί τινα to acknowledge as oneʼs general, Hdt.; π. πόλιν, of an ambassador, to represent a city in oneʼs own person, Thuc.
to offer, promise, Hdt., etc.
to make so and so for or towards oneself, παρασχέσθαι θεὸν εὐμενῆ Eur.
in Arithmetic, to make up, amount to, παρέχονται ἡμέρας διηκοσίας Hdt.

div1.head: παρηβάω
div1.sense: to be past oneʼs prime, to be growing old, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: πάρηβος
div1.sense: past oneʼs prime, Anth.

div1.head: παρηγορέω
div1.sense: to address, exhort, Hdt., Aesch., etc.; c. inf. to advise, Eur.; so in Mid., Hdt.
to console, appease, Aesch.

div1.head: παρηγορία
div1.sense: exhortation, persuasion, Aesch.
consolation, Plut.

div1.head: παρήγορος
div1.sense: consoling, and as Subst. a comforter, Soph.

div1.head: παρήϊον
div1.etym: Ionic for παρεῖον which is not in use
div1.sense: the cheek, jaw, Hom.
παρήιον the cheek-ornament of a bridle, Il. Cf. παρειά.

div1.head: παρηΐς
div1.etym: later form of παρήιον, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: παρήκω
div1.sense: to have come alongside, i. e. to lie beside, stretch along, Hdt., Thuc.
to pass forth, Soph.

div1.head: παρῆλιξ
div1.sense: past oneʼs prime, Plut., Anth.

div1.head: πάρημαι
div1.sense: to be seated beside or by, c. dat., Il., Eur.; ἀλλοτρίοισι παρήμενος seated at other menʼs tables, Od.: generally, to dwell with, σύεσσι π. Od.:—absol. to sit beside or near, Hom.

div1.head: παρήμερος
div1.sense: day by day, daily, Pind.

div1.head: πάρηξις
div1.sense: a coming to shore: a landing place, Aesch.

div1.head: παρηονῖτις
div1.sense: fem. adj. on the shore, Anth.

div1.head: παρηορία
div1.sense: in pl. side-traces, i. e. the traces by which the outside horse (παρήορος) was harnessed beside the regular pair, Il.; ἐν δὲ παρηορίῃσι Πήδασον ἵει he harnessed Pedasus with side-traces, Il.

div1.head: παρήορος
div1.sense: hanging or hung beside: παρήορος (sc. ἵππος) a horse which draws by the side of the regular pair (ξυνωρίς) , an outrigger, elsewhere παράσειρος, σειραφόρος, Il.
lying along, outstretched, sprawling, Il., Aesch.
metaph. (from the fact that the ἵππος π. was given to prancing), reckless, distraught, senseless, Il.

div1.head: παρθενεία
div1.sense: maidenhood, virginity, Eur.

div1.head: παρθένειος
div1.sense: of or belonging to a maiden, Pind., Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: παρθένευμα
div1.sense: in pl. the pursuits or amusements of maidens, Eur.; so in sg., a maidenʼs work, Eur.
νόθον π. the child of an unmarried woman, Eur.

div1.head: παρθενεύω
div1.sense: to bring up as a maid, Eur.:—Pass. to lead a maiden life, remain a maid, Hdt., Aesch.; πολιὰ (neut. pl.) παρθενεύεται grows gray in maidenhood, Eur.

div1.head: παρθένια
div1.sense: παρθένια (sc. μέλη) , τά songs sung by maidens to the flute (αὐλὸς παρθένιος) Pind.; so παρθένεια, ων, τά, Ar.

div1.head: παρθενίας
div1.sense: the son of a concubine: Παρθένιαι the youths born at Sparta during the Messenian War, Arist.

div1.head: παρθενικός
div1.sense: of or for a maiden, Plut.

div1.head: παρθένιος
div1.sense: like παρθένειος, of a maiden or virgin, maiden, maidenly, Od., Hes., Aesch., etc.
παρθένιος, the son of an unmarried girl, Il.:—but, π. ἀνήρ the husband of maidenhood, first husband, Plut.
metaph. pure, undefiled, Hhymn.; π. μύρτα, of white myrtleberries, Ar.

div1.head: Παρθενοπαῖος
div1.sense: the maiden-hero or son of the maiden (Atalanta), one of the Seven against Thebes: [to be pronounced Παρθεννοπαῖος in Aesch.].

div1.head: παρθενοπίπης
div1.sense: one who looks after maidens, a seducer, Il.

div1.head: παρθένος
div1.sense: a maid, maiden, virgin, girl, Hom., etc.
Παρθένος, as a name of Athena at Athens, of Artemis, etc.
as adj. maiden, virgin, chaste, πάρθενον ψυχὴν ἔχων Eur.: metaph., π. πηγή Aesch.; παρθένοι τριήρεις maiden, i. e. new, ships, Ar.
as masc., παρθένος, an unmarried man, NTest.

div1.head: παρθενόσφαγος
div1.sense: of a slaughtered maidenʼs blood, Aesch.

div1.head: παρθενών
div1.sense: the maidensʼ apartments, young womenʼs chambers in a house, mostly in pl., Aesch., Eur., etc.
in sg. the Parthenon or temple of Athena Parthenos in the citadel at Athens, rebuilt under Pericles, Dem.

div1.head: παρθενωπός
div1.sense: of maiden aspect, Eur.

div1.head: παρθεσίη
div1.sense: a deposit, pledge, Anth.

div1.head: Παρθικός
div1.sense: Parthian, Strab.; Παρθικά, τά, a history of Parthia, Strab.; so Παρθίς, ίδος, ἡ, Luc.

div1.head: παριαύω
div1.sense: to sleep beside, c. dat., Hom.

div1.head: παριδρύω
div1.sense: to set up beside:—in Mid., Anth.

div1.head: παρίζω
div1.sense: to sit beside another, c. dat., Od., Hdt.
Causal, to seat or make to sit beside, τινά τινι Hdt.: —Mid. παρίζομαι to seat oneself or sit beside, Hdt., Bion.; aor2 παρ-εζόμην, Epic imperat. -εζεο, Hom.

div1.head: παρίημι
div1.sense: to let drop beside or at the side, let fall, Soph., Eur.:—Pass., παρείθη ποτὶ γαῖαν it hung down to earth, Il.
to pass by, pass over, leave out, Lat. omitto, Hdt., Soph.
to pass unnoticed, disregard, let alone, Lat. praetermittere, Hdt., Aesch.; τὰ παθήματα παρεῖσʼ ἐάσω Soph.; so in Pass., πόθος παρεῖτο Soph.; παρεθῆναι Dem.
c.inf. to omit to do, Plat., etc.; and with a negat. repeated, μὴ παρῇς τὸ μὴ οὐ φράσαι Soph.
of Time, to let pass, τὸν χειμῶνα Hdt.; τὸν καιρόν Thuc.
to relax, slacken, remit, γόον, χόλον Eur.:—Pass. to be relaxed, weakened, exhausted, Eur.
τοῦ ποδὸς παριέναι to slack away the sheet, v. πούς II. 2; so metaph., τοῦ μετρίου παρείς letting go oneʼs hold of moderation, i. e. giving it up, Soph.
to remit punishment, to forgive, pardon, Ar.

to yield, give up, Lat. concedere, νίκην τινί Hdt., Attic: — to leave a thing to another, σοὶ παρεὶς τάδε Soph.; παρῆκεν, ὥστε βραχέα μοι δεῖσθαι φράσαι left it so that there is need for me to say but little, Soph.
to permit, allow, c. dat. pers. et inf., ἄλλῳ παρήσομεν ναυμαχήσειν Hdt.; absol., the inf. being understood, Soph.
to allow to pass, let pass, let in, admit, Hdt., Eur., etc.; so perf. pass. in mid. sense, βαρβάρους εἰς τὰς ἀκροπόλεις παρεῖνται have admitted them into their citadels, Dem.
Mid. παρίεσθαί τινα to obtain leave from him, obtain his consent, Soph., Plat.
to beg to be let off something, οὐδέν σου παρίεμαι I ask no quarter, Plat.: to beg a favour, Plat.; παριέμεσθα we ask pardon, Eur.

div1.head: παρίκω
div1.sense: of Time, to be gone by, Pind.

div1.head: παριππεύω
div1.sense: to ride along or over, πόντον Eur.: to ride alongside, Thuc.

div1.head: παρισόω
div1.sense: Mid. Pass. to make oneself equal to, measure oneself with, c. dat., Hdt., Theocr.
to be made equal or like to, τινι Plat.

div1.head: Παρθιστί
div1.sense: in the Parthian tongue, Plut.

div1.head: Πάρθοι
div1.sense: the Parthians, Hdt.

div1.head: Παρθυαία
div1.sense: Parthia, Strab.

div1.head: πάρισος
div1.sense: almost equal, evenly balanced, Polyb.: of the clauses of a sentence, Arist.

div1.head: παρίστημι
div1.sense: Causal in pres., imperf., fut. and aor1 to make to stand or to place beside, Polyb.; παραστήσας τὰ ὅπλα having brought his arms into view, Dem.
to set before the mind, present, offer, bring home to the mind, c. inf., Dem.; π. τινὶ θαρρεῖν to give one confidence, Aeschin.
to make good, prove, shew, Lys., NTest.
to set side by side, compare, Isocr.
Pass., with aor2, perf. and plup. act., intr., to stand by, beside or near, Hom.; so aor1 pass. part. παρασταθείς, Eur.
to stand by, i. e. to help or defend, τινι Il., Hdt., Trag.
in past tenses, to have come, be at hand, be present, Il.
of events, to be near, be at hand, Hom.; perf. part., Lat. praesens, τὸ χρῶμα τὸ παρεστηκός Ar.; Attic also παρεστώς, ῶσα, ός, Trag.; τὰ παρεστῶτα present circumstances, Aesch.; πρὸς τὸ παρεστός Ar.
to come to the side of another, come over to his opinion, Hdt.: absol. to come to terms, surrender, submit, Hdt., Dem.
to happen to one, Hdt.: to come into oneʼs head, occur to one, δόξα μοι παρεστάθη Soph.:—impers., παρίσταταί μοι it occurs to me, Hdt., Thuc.
absol., παρεστηκός, παρόν, since it was in their power, since the opportunity offered, Thuc.
Some tenses of Mid., esp. fut. and aor1, are used in causal sense:
to bring forward, produce, Xen.; esp. in a court of justice, Dem.
to bring to oneʼs side, and so,
to bring over by force, bring to terms, Hdt., Soph., etc.
to gain by kindness, win over, Thuc., Dem.
generally, to dispose for oneʼs own views or purposes, Hdt.

div1.head: παριστίδιος
div1.sense: at the loom, Anth.

div1.head: παρίσχω
div1.sense: to hold in readiness, Il.: to present, offer, Il.

div1.head: παρίσωσις
div1.sense: an even balancing of the clauses in a sentence, Isocr.

div1.head: παριτητέα
div1.sense: one must come forward, Thuc.

div1.head: Παρνάσιος
div1.sense: Parnassian, Pind.; fem. Παρνᾱσιάς, άδος, Ionic Παρνησιάς, Eur.; also Παρνησίς, ίδος, Aesch.

div1.head: Παρνασός
div1.sense: Parnassus, a mountain of Phocis, Od.

div1.head: Πάρνης
div1.sense: Parnes, a mountain of Attica, Ar.:—adj. Παρνήθιος, η, ον, Ar.

div1.head: πάρνοψ
div1.sense: a locust, Ar.

div1.head: παροδεύω
div1.sense: to pass by, Theocr.
c. acc. to go past, Luc.

div1.head: παροδίτης
div1.sense: a passer-by, wayfarer, Anth.:— fem. παροδῖτις, ιδος, Anth.

div1.head: πάροδος
div1.sense: a by-way, passage, Thuc.
a going by, passing, Thuc.; ἐν τῇ παρόδῳ as they passed by, Thuc.
a side-entrance, a narrow entrance or approach, Xen.; λαβεῖν τὰς παρόδους (of Thermopylae), Dem.
a coming forward, esp. before the assembly to speak, Dem.
the first entrance of the chorus, their first song, Arist.

div1.head: παροίγνυμι
div1.sense: to open at the side or a little, half-open, Hhymn., Eur.; παροίξας τῆς θύρας having opened a bit of the door, put it ajar, Ar.

div1.head: πάροιθε
div1.sense: prep. c. gen.
before, in the presence of, Hom.
of Time, π. ἐμοῦ before me, Aesch.
adv.,
of Place, before, in front, Il.
of Time, before this, formerly, Hom., Trag.; οἱ π. men bygone, Pind.; τῆς π. ἡμέρας Eur.
πάροιθεν πρὶν . . , Lat. priusquam, Soph.

div1.head: παροικέω
div1.sense: to dwell beside, c. acc., π. τὴν Ἀσίαν dwell along the coast of Asia, Isocr.: c. dat. to live near, Thuc.: to dwell among, τισίν Thuc.; of places, to lie near, Xen.
(πάροικος II) to live in a place, sojourn, NTest.

div1.head: παροίκησις
div1.sense: a neighbourhood, Thuc.

div1.head: παροικία
div1.sense: a sojourning in a foreign land, NTest.

div1.head: παροικίζω
div1.sense: to place near:—Pass. to settle near, dwell among, τισίν Hdt.

div1.head: παροικοδομέω
div1.sense: to build beside or across, Thuc.

div1.head: πάροικος
div1.sense: dwelling beside or near, c. gen., Aesch., Soph.; c. dat., Thuc.:—absol. a neighbour, Arist.
πάροικος πόλεμος a war with neighbours, Hdt.
as Subst. a sojourner, alien, NTest.

div1.head: παροιμιάζω
div1.sense: to make proverbial:—Pass. to pass into a proverb, become proverbial, Plat.
Mid. to speak in proverbs, Plat.

div1.head: παροιμιακός
div1.sense: proverbial: adv. -κῶς, Anth.
παροιμιακόν (sub. μέτρον) , a paroemiac, i. e. an Anapaestic dimeter catalectic, used at the end of an Anapaestic system.

div1.head: παροιμία
div1.sense: a by-word, common saying, proverb, maxim, saw, Aesch., Soph., etc.; κατὰ τὴν π. as the saying goes, Plat.
a parable, NTest.

div1.head: παροινέω
div1.sense: to behave ill at wine, play drunken tricks, Oratt.
to act like a drunken man, Plut.; παροινήσας in a drunken fit, Plat.
trans. to treat with drunken violence:— Pass. to be so treated, Dem.

div1.head: παροινία
div1.sense: drunken behaviour, drunken violence, a drunken frolic, Xen., etc.

div1.head: παροινικός
div1.sense: addicted to wine, Ar.

div1.head: παροίνιος
div1.sense: = παροινικός, Ar.
befitting a drinking party, Luc.; παροίνια drinking songs, Plut.

div1.head: παροίτερος
div1.sense: the one before or in front, Il.

div1.head: παροίχομαι
div1.sense: to have passed by, παρῴχετο γηθόσυνος κῆρ he passed on, went on his way, Il.
of Time, to be gone by, Il.; ἡ παροιχομένη νύξ the bygone night, Hdt.; ἄνδρες παροιχόμενοι men of by-gone times, Pind.; τὰ παροιχόμενα the past, Hdt.
c. gen., ὅσον μοίρας παροίχῃ how art thou fallen from thine high estate, Eur.

div1.head: παροκωχή
div1.sense: redupl. form of παροχή, a supplying, furnishing, Thuc.

div1.head: παρολιγωρέω
div1.sense: to neglect a little, Xen.

div1.head: παρομαρτέω
div1.sense: to accompany, Plut., Luc.

div1.head: παρομοιάζω
div1.sense: to be much like, τινί NTest.

div1.head: παρόμοιος
div1.sense: much like, nearly like, closely resembling, τινι Hdt., Thuc.:—absol., Hdt.
of numbers, nearly equal, Xen.

div1.head: παρονομάζω
div1.sense: to alter slightly, Strab.

div1.head: παροξυντικός
div1.sense: fit for inciting or urging on, Xen., Dem.
exasperating, provoking, Isocr.

div1.head: παροξύνω
div1.sense: to urge, prick or spur on, stimulate, Xen., Dem.
to anger, provoke, irritate, exasperate, πατρὸς μὴ π. φρένα Eur., Thuc.:—Pass. to be provoked, Thuc., etc.

div1.head: παροξυσμός
div1.sense: irritation, exasperation, Dem., NTest.: a provoking, NTest.

div1.head: παροπλίζω
div1.sense: to disarm, Polyb.:—Pass., Plut.

div1.head: παροπτέος
div1.sense: to be overlooked, Luc.
παροπτέον, one must overlook, Dem.

div1.head: παρόρασις
div1.sense: overlooking, negligence, Plut., Luc.

div1.head: παροράω
div1.sense: to look at by the way, notice, remark, Xen.; τί τινι something in one, Hdt., Ar.
to overlook, disregard, neglect, Xen., etc.
to see amiss, see wrong, Plat.
to look sideways, Xen.

div1.head: παροργίζω
div1.sense: to provoke to anger, NTest.:—Pass., Dem.

div1.head: παροργισμός
div1.sense: provocation; anger, NTest.

div1.head: παρόρειος
div1.sense: along a mountain, Strab.

div1.head: παρορίζω
div1.sense: to outstep oneʼs boundaries, encroach on a neighbourʼs property, Anth.

div1.head: παροριστής
div1.sense: an encroacher, Anth.

div1.head: παρορμάω
div1.sense: to urge on, stimulate, Xen.

div1.head: παρορμέω
div1.sense: to lie at anchor beside or near, Plut.

div1.head: παρόρμησις
div1.sense: incitement, Xen.

div1.head: παρορμητικός
div1.sense: stimulative, Plut.

div1.head: παρορμίζω
div1.sense: to anchor side by side, Lys.

div1.head: πάρορνις
div1.sense: ill-omened, Aesch.

div1.head: παρορύσσω
div1.sense: to dig alongside or parallel, Thuc.
to dig one against another, as was done by men in training for a preparatory exercise as the Olympic games.

div1.head: παρορχέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to represent by vulgar dancing, Luc.

div1.head: πάρος
div1.sense: adv.,
of Time, beforetime, formerly, erst, Hom., Trag.; θεοὶ οἱ πάρος Aesch.; τά τε πάρος τά τʼ εἰσέπειτα Soph., etc.
like πρίν, before, Lat. priusquam, c. inf., πάρος τάδε ἔργα γενέσθαι Il.
anteced. to πρίν γε, πάρος δʼ οὐκ ἔσσεται ἄλλως, πρίν γε . . not until, Il.
before the time, too soon, Il.
rather, sooner, Il.
rarely of Place, first, σοι βαδιστέον π. Soph.
prep., poet. = πρό,
of Place, before, Il., Soph., Eur.
of Time, θανεῖν πάρος τέκνων Eur.
Causal, before, above, in preference to, Eur.
for, instead of, ἀδελφῶν πάρος θανεῖν Eur.

div1.head: Πάρος
div1.sense: Paros, one of the Cyclades, famous for its white marble, Hhymn.:—adj. Πάριος, η, ον, Πάριος λίθος Parian marble, Pind., Hdt.

div1.head: παροτρύνω
div1.sense: to urge one on to do a thing, Pind.

div1.head: παρουσία
div1.sense: a being present, presence, Aesch., Eur., etc.; so, πόλις μείζων τῆς ἡμετέρας παρουσίας ἡμῶν τῶν παρόντων, Thuc.:—of things, κακῶν π. Eur. : —παρουσίαν ἔχειν for παρεῖναι, Soph.
arrival, Soph., Eur.:— the Advent, NTest.

div1.head: παροχέομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to sit beside in a chariot, τινι Xen.

div1.head: παροχετεύω
div1.sense: to turn from its course, divert, Plut.:—metaph., τοῦτʼ αὖ παρωχέτευσας εὖ Eur.

div1.head: παροχή
div1.sense: a supplying, furnishing, νεῶν παροχῇ with liability to furnish ships, Thuc.

div1.head: παροχλίζω
div1.sense: to move as with a lever, Anth.

div1.head: πάροχος
div1.sense: one who goes beside another in a chariot, one who attends the bridegroom (v. παράνυμφος), Ar.

div1.head: παροψάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to eat dainties, Luc.

div1.head: παροψίς
div1.sense: a dainty side-dish, Xen.

div1.head: παροψώνημα
div1.sense: an addition to the regular fare, a dainty, metaph., π. χλιδῆς a new relish to luxury, Aesch.

div1.head: παρρησιάζομαι
div1.sense: in act. and pass. sense, Dep.: to speak freely, openly, boldly, Plat., etc.

div1.head: παρρησία
div1.sense: freespokenness, openness, frankness, Eur.; μετὰ παρρησίας Dem.
in bad sense, licence of tongue, Isocr.
