div1.etym: From πρό, ἀγείρω, because birds collect their food there before it passes into the second stomach.

div1.head: πρήθω
div1.sense: to blow up, swell out by blowing, ἔπρησεν δʼ ἄνεμος μέσον ἱστίον Od.
to blow out, drive out by blowing, τὸ δʼ αἷμα ἀνὰ στόμα πρῆσε he blew a shower of blood through his mouth, Il.

div1.head: πρημαίνω
div1.sense: to blow hard, Ar.

div1.head: πρηνής
div1.sense: with the face downwards, head-foremost, Lat. pronus, opp. to ὕπτιος (Lat. supinus), Il., Hes.
of the sides of hills, πρὸς κατὰ πρανοῦς down hill, Xen.; κατὰ τὰ πρανῆ Xen.

div1.head: πρηνίζω
div1.sense: to throw headlong:—Pass. to fall headlong, πρηνιχθείς Anth.

div1.head: πρηστήρ
div1.sense: a hurricane, Hes., Hdt.

div1.head: πρίασθαι
div1.sense: to have a thing sold to one, to buy, purchase, Hom., Attic; c. dat. pretii, πρ. κτεάτεσσιν ἑοῖσιν to buy with oneʼs money, Od.; c. gen., πρ. θανάτοιο to purchase by his death, Pind.; πρ. τι ταλάντου Xen.; π. πολλοῦ Xen.; metaph., οὐδενὸς λόγου πρίασθαι to buy at no price, Soph.; πρ. τι παρά τινος Hdt.:—πρ. τίμιον τοὔλαιον to buy it dear, Ar.
to farm a tax, Xen.

div1.head: Πριαμίδης
div1.sense: Patronymic, son of Priam Il.

div1.head: Πριαμικός
div1.sense: of or like Priam, Arist., Eur.

div1.head: Πρίαμος
div1.sense: Priam, Il., etc.; prob. a chief, king,

div1.head: Πρίαπος
div1.sense: Priapus, the god of gardens and vineyards, and generally of country life, Luc.:— adj. Πρῑάπειος, η, ον, Anth.

div1.head: πρίνινος
div1.sense: made from the πρῖνος, Lat. iligneus, Hes., Ar.:—metaph. oaken, i. e. tough, sturdy, Ar.

div1.head: πρῖνος
div1.sense: the evergreen oak, ilex, or the scarlet oak, quercus coccifera, Hes., Ar., etc.

div1.head: πρίν
div1.sense: formed with a comparative force from πρό:
adv. of Time, before,
of future time, before that time, sooner, with fut. Ind. or Subj. = fut., Hom.: with Opt. and κεν, Od.

of past time, aforetime, formerly, once, erst, Hom.; so with the Art., τὸ πρίν γε . . , νῦν δὲ . . ; νῦν δὲ . . τὸ πρίν γε Il.:—with the Art. the Part. ὤν is omitted, τὰ πρὶν πελώρια (sc. ὄντα) the giants of old, Aesch.; ἐν τῷ πρὶν χρόνῳ Soph.; ἐν τοῖς πρὶν λόγοις Thuc.

πρὶν ἤ, as Conjunction, before that, before, ere, priusquam, Hom.; but ἤ is often omitted, so that πρίν becomes a Conjunction: the antecedent clause also has πρίν (or πρότερον, πρόσθεν, πάρος) , so that πρίν the Conjunction is relat. to πρίν the adv., especially after a negat.:—it is constructed with Inf., ναῖε δὲ Πήδαιον, πρὶν ἐλθεῖν υἷας Ἀχαιῶν Il.; οὐδὲ παύσεται χόλου, πρὶν κατασκῆψαί τινα Eur.
with a finite Verb:
with Ind., in which case Hom. uses πρίν γʼ ὅτε, πρίν γʼ ὅτε δή, until, μάχη τέτατο, πρίν γʼ ὅτε δὴ Ζεὺς κῦδος Ἕκτορι δῶκε Il.; so, οὐκ ἦν ἀλέξημʼ οὐδέν, πρίν γʼ ἐγὼ σφίσιν ἔδειξα Aesch.

with Subj. only after negatives or equiv. of neg., οὐ καταδυσόμεθʼ, πρὶν μόρσιμον ἦμαρ ἐπέλθῃ we will not go down, till the day of death come on, Od.;—in Attic πρὶν ἄν is regular, οὐδέν ἐστι τέρμα μοι μόχθων, πρὶν ἂν Ζεὺς ἐκπέσῃ τυραννίδος Aesch.; but ἄν is sometimes omitted, μὴ στέναζε, πρὶν μάθῃς Soph.; as always with πρὶν ἤ, πρὶν ἢ ἀνορθώσωσι Hdt.
with Opt., after historical tenses, οὐκ ἔθελεν φεύγειν πρὶν πειρήσαιτʼ Ἀχιλῆος Il.; ἔδοξέ μοι μὴ ποιεῖσθαι, πρὶν φράσαιμί σοι Soph.

div1.head: πρινώδης
div1.sense: tough as oak, Ar.

div1.head: πριονώδης
div1.sense: like a saw, Anth.

div1.head: πριστήρ
div1.sense: a saw: πριστῆρες ὀδόντες the incisors, Anth.

div1.head: πριστός
div1.sense: sawn, Od.

div1.head: πρίων
div1.sense: a sawyer, Ar.
a saw, Soph.; πρίων ὀδόντων a saw of teeth, i. e. a jagged row, Anth.; v. πρίων2.
div1.etym: ῑ, Attic; but ι in later Poets.

div1.head: πρίων2
div1.sense: a comic Noun, formed from πρίω, imperat. of ἐπριάμην, with a pun upon πρίων, a saw, ὁ πρ. ἀπῆν that rasping word "buy" was unknown, Ar.

div1.head: πρίω
div1.sense: to saw, πρ. δίχα to saw asunder, Thuc.: Pass. to be cut in pieces, Eur.
πρίειν τοὺς ὀδόντας to grind or gnash the teeth, Ar.:—metaph. in Pass. to be irritated, Anth.
to seize as with the teeth, bind fast, ζωστῆρι πρισθεὶς ἱππικῶν ἐξ ἀντύγων Soph.

div1.head: προάγγελσις
div1.sense: a forewarning, early intimation, Thuc.

div1.head: προάγνυμι
div1.sense: to break before, Od.

div1.head: προαγόρευσις
div1.sense: a stating beforehand, Arist., Plut.

div1.head: προαγορεύω
div1.sense: to tell beforehand, Thuc.: c. inf. to tell or declare beforehand that . . , Hdt., etc.; so, πρ. ὅτι . . , Xen.
to foretell, prophesy, τὸ μέλλον Xen.
to speak before all, to state, declare or proclaim publicly, Hdt., Thuc.; to have a thing proclaimed by herald, Hdt.
c. inf. to order publicly, πρ. ὑμῖν παρεῖναι Hdt.; πρ. τοῖς πολίταις μὴ κινεῖν to forbid them to move, Plat.:—Pass., γυμνάζεσθαι προαγορεύεται ἅπασι Xen.; τὰ προηγορευμένα Xen.
to give notice, notify, Plat.

div1.head: προάγω
div1.sense: to lead forward, on, onward, Hdt., etc.: to escort on their way, Hdt., Xen.
to bring forward in public, Plat.

to lead on, induce, Hdt., Thuc.; c. inf., πρ. τινὰ κινδυνεύειν Thuc.; with Preps., πρ. θυμὸν ἐς ἀμπλακίην Theogn.; τινὰ εἰς φιλοποσίαν, εἰς μῖσος Xen.; ἐπʼ ἀρετήν Xen.:—so in Mid., ἐς γέλωτα προαγαγέσθαι τινά to move one to laughter, Hdt.; εἰς ἀνάγκην Dem.
to carry on or forward, πρ. τὴν πόλιν to lead it on to power, Thuc.; μέχρι πόρρω προήγαγον τὴν ἔχθραν carried it so far, Dem.:—Pass. to increase, wax, Dem.
of persons, to promote or prefer to honour, Plut.
perf. pass. with mid. sense, προῆκται παῖδας οὕτω ὥστε . . , has had them brought up in such a way that . . , Dem.; but also in pass. sense, τοῖς ἔθεσι προηγμένοι Arist.
intr. to lead the way, go before, advance, Plat., Xen., etc.:—an acc. added, to go before one, NTest.

div1.head: προαγωγεία
div1.sense: the trade of a προαγωγός, pandering, Xen., Aeschin.

div1.head: προαγωγεύω
div1.sense: to prostitute, Lex ap. Aeschin.
metaph., πρ. ἑαυτὸν ὀφθαλμοῖς Ar.

div1.head: προαγωγή
div1.sense: a leading on, promotion, rank, eminence, Polyb.

div1.head: προαγωγός
div1.sense: one who leads on: a pander, pimp, procurer, Ar., Aeschin.
a negotiator, Xen.

div1.head: προαγωνιστής
div1.sense: one who fights for another, a champion, Plut.

div1.head: προαδικέω
div1.sense: to be the first in wronging:— Pass. to be wronged before or first, Dem., Aeschin.

div1.head: προᾴδω
div1.sense: to sing before, prelude, Aeschin.

div1.head: προαιδέομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:— to owe one special respect, be under obligations to one, c. dat., Hdt.

div1.head: προαγών
div1.sense: a preliminary contest, prelude, Ar., Plat.:— the preparation for a festival, Aeschin.

div1.head: προαγωνίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:— to fight before, ἐξ ὧν προηγώνισθε ἐξ ἀγωνῶν οὓς προηγώνισθε, from the contests which you have before had, Thuc.:—perf. also in pass. sense, οἱ προηγωνισμένοι ἀγῶνες Plut.
to fight for or in defence of another, Plut.

div1.head: προαίρεσις
div1.sense: a choosing one thing before another, an act of deliberate choice, a purpose, resolution, Plat., etc.:— κατὰ προαίρεσιν on purpose, as one will, Arist.
a purpose, plan, or scope of action, a course of life, principle of action, Dem.
in political language, a deliberate course of action, a policy, Dem.:—also, a mode of government, such as an oligarchy, Dem.; in pl., τὰς κοινὰς πρ. your public principles, your general policy, Dem.
a department of government, Dem.
a political party, Dem.

div1.head: προαιρετέος
div1.sense: one must choose, prefer, Plat.

div1.head: προαιρετικός
div1.sense: inclined to prefer, deliberately choosing a thing, c. gen., Arist.
absol. purposing, intentional, Arist.

div1.head: προαιρετός
div1.sense: deliberately chosen, purposed, Arist.

div1.head: προαιρέω
div1.sense: to bring forth, produce from oneʼs stores, Thuc., Theophr.
to take away first, Babr.
mostly in Mid., fut. -αιρήσομαι: aor2 -ειλόμην: perf. pass. (in mid. sense) -ῄρημαι:— to take away first for oneself, remove out of oneʼs way, Plat.
to choose before or sooner than something else, prefer, τί τινος or τι πρό τινος Plat.; τι ἀντί τινος Xen.
c. inf. to prefer to do, Arist.: to purpose or propose to do, Dem.

div1.head: προαισθάνομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to perceive or observe beforehand, Thuc., Xen.; πρ. τινος to become aware of a thing beforehand, Thuc.

div1.head: προαιτιάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to accuse beforehand, τινα εἶναι NTest.

div1.head: προακοντίζομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be thrown like a javelin before, Luc.

div1.head: προακούω
div1.sense: to hear beforehand, Hdt., Attic

div1.head: προαλής
div1.sense: springing forward, i. e. overhanging, abrupt, Il.
metaph. = προπετής:— comp. adv., προαλέστερον more eagerly, Strab.

div1.head: προαλίσκομαι
div1.sense: Pass: to be convicted beforehand, Dem.

div1.head: προαμαρτάνω
div1.sense: to fail or sin before, NTest.

div1.head: προαμύνομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to defend oneself or take measures for defence beforehand, Thuc.: —c. acc. to take such measures against others, Thuc.

div1.head: προαναβαίνω
div1.sense: to ascend before, so as to preoccupy, τὸν λόφον Thuc.

div1.head: προαναβάλλομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to say or sing by way of prelude, Ar.

div1.head: προανάγω
div1.sense: to lead up before:—Pass. to put to sea before, Thuc.

div1.head: προαναιρέω
div1.sense: to take away before, Dem.: to refute by anticipation, Arist.

div1.head: προαναισιμόω
div1.sense: to use up, spend before: Pass., perf. -ανῃσίμωμαι, Ionic -αναισίμωμαι, ἐν τῷ προαναισιμωμένῳ χρόνῳ πρότερον ἢ ἐμὲ γενέσθαι in times past before I was born, Hdt.

div1.head: προανακινέω
div1.sense: to stir up before, Plut.
absol. to make previous movements, Arist.

div1.head: προανακρίνω
div1.sense: to examine before, of the measures to be submitted to the vote of the people, Arist.

div1.head: προαναλίσκω
div1.sense: to use up or spend before, Thuc., Dem.:—Pass. to throw away oneʼs life before, Thuc.

div1.head: προαναρπάζω
div1.sense: to carry off or arrest beforehand, Dem.; πρ. τῆς παρασκευῆς ἀναρπάζειν πρὸ τῆς παρασκευῆς, Plut.

div1.head: προαναστέλλω
div1.sense: to check beforehand, Plut.

div1.head: προαναφωνέω
div1.sense: to say by way of preface, Plut.

div1.head: προαναχώρησις
div1.sense: a former departure, Thuc.

div1.head: προανύτω
div1.sense: to accomplish before, Xen.

div1.head: προαπαγορεύω
div1.sense: to give in before, Isocr.

div1.head: προαπαντάω
div1.sense: to go forth to meet, Thuc.
to meet beforehand, Thuc.

div1.head: προάπειμι
div1.sense: to go away first, Luc.

div1.head: προαπεῖπον
div1.sense: to give in or fail before, Isocr.; perf. προαπείρηκα Isocr.

div1.head: προαπέρχομαι
div1.sense: Dep.: to go away before, Thuc., Dem.

div1.head: προαπεχθάνομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to begin hostilities before, Dem.

div1.head: προαποδείκνυμι
div1.sense: to prove before, Isocr.

div1.head: προαποθνῄσκω
div1.sense: to die before or first, Hdt., Plat.; of a coward, πρ. ἀπὸ τοῦ φόβου, i. e. before his real death, Xen.

div1.head: προαποθρηνέω
div1.sense: to bewail beforehand, Plut.

div1.head: προαποκάμνω
div1.sense: to grow tired before the end, give up the task of doing, c. inf., Plat.; c. gen., Plut.

div1.head: προαποκληρόομαι
div1.sense: to be allotted beforehand, Luc.

div1.head: προαποκτείνω
div1.sense: to kill beforehand, Luc.

div1.head: προαπολαύω
div1.sense: to enjoy beforehand, Plut.

div1.head: προαπολείπω
div1.sense: intr. to fail before, i. e. in comparison of, c. gen., Antipho.

div1.head: προαπόλλυμι
div1.sense: Intr. -όλλυμαι:— to be first destroyed, to perish before or first, Thuc.; μὴ ἡ ψυχὴ προαπολλύηται (as if from -απολλύω ) Plat.

div1.head: προαποπέμπω
div1.sense: to send away before, Thuc.:— Mid., Xen.

div1.head: προαποστέλλω
div1.sense: to send away, dispatch beforehand, or in advance, Thuc.:—Pass. to be sent in advance, Thuc.; but, προαποσταλῆναί τινος ἀποσταλῆναι πρό τινος, Thuc.

div1.head: προαποσφάζω
div1.sense: to slay before, Luc.

div1.head: προαποτρέπομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to turn aside before, leave off, c. part., προαποτρέπομαι διώκων Xen.

div1.head: προαποφαίνω
div1.sense: to declare before:—Mid., πρ. τὴν γνώμην to declare oneʼs opinion before, Plat.

div1.head: προαποχωρέω
div1.sense: to go away before, Thuc.

div1.head: προαρπάζω
div1.sense: to snatch away before, Luc.; metaph., πρ. τὸ λεγόμενον to snap at a conclusion, anticipate hastily, Plat.

div1.head: προασκέω
div1.sense: to train or exercise before, Isocr.

div1.head: προάστειον
div1.sense: the space immediately in front of or round a town, a suburb, Hdt., Thuc., etc.

div1.head: προαυδάω
div1.sense: to declare before or first, Ar., in the contr. inf. πρωυδᾶν.

div1.head: προαυλέω
div1.sense: to play a prelude on the flute, Arist.

div1.head: προαύλιον
div1.sense: a prelude on the flute, Arist.

div1.head: προαφηγέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to relate before, Hdt.

div1.head: προαφικνέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to arrive first, Thuc.

div1.head: προαφίσταμαι
div1.sense: Pass., with perf. and aor2 act.:— to fall off or revolt before, Thuc.
to leave off or desist before, Plat.

div1.head: προβάδην
div1.sense: as one walks, Hes.; πρ. ἔξαγε lead them out onward, Ar.

div1.head: προβαίνω
div1.sense: to step on, step forward, advance, Hom., etc.:—as a mark of Time, ἄστρα προβέβηκε they are far gone in heaven, i. e. it is past midnight, Il.; ἡ νὺξ προβαίνει the night is wearing fast, Xen.; then of Time itself, τοῦ χρόνου προβαίνοντος as time went on, Hdt.; so, προβαίνοντος τοῦ ἔργου, τοῦ πολέμου Hdt.; and of persons, τοὺς προβεβηκότας τῇ ἡλικίᾳ advanced in age, Lys., etc.

metaph. of narrative, argument, events, προβήσομαι ἐς τὸ πρόσω τοῦ λόγου Hdt.; πρ. ἐπʼ ἔσχατον θράσους Soph.; τὸ τῆς τύχης ἀφανὲς οἷ προβήσεται Eur.; πρ. πόρρω μοχθηρίας to be far gone in knavery, Xen.; πρ. εἰς τοῦτο ἔχθρας Dem.
to advance, proceed, προέβαινε τὸ ἔθνος ἄρχον the nation kept making advances in dominion, kept extending its sway, Hdt.; μὴ προβαίη μεῖζον ἢ τὸ νῦν κακόν lest it creep on, increase, Eur.
to go before, i. e. to be before or superior to another, c. gen., προβέβηκας ἁπάντων Il.; Τρηχῖνος προβέβηκε he was set over, i. e. ruled, Trachis, Hes.
c. acc. rei, to overstep, τέρμα προβάς (for ὑπερβάς) Pind.
in Poets, πόδα πρ. to advance the foot, Theogn.; τὸν πόδα Ar.; προβὰς κῶλον, ἀρβύλαν προβάς Eur.; v. βαίνω A. II. 3.
Causal, in fut. act., to put forward, advance, τίς τρόπος ἄνδρα προβάσει [ᾱ]; Pind.

div1.head: προβακχήϊος
div1.sense: of Bacchus, leader of the Bacchanals, Eur.

div1.head: προβάλλω
div1.sense: to throw before, throw or toss to, Lat. projicere, Νότος Βορέῃ προβάλεσκε σχεδίην Od.; τοὺς μαζοὺς κυσὶ προέβαλε Hdt.
to put forward, i. e. to begin, ἔριδα προβαλόντες Il.
to put forward as a defence or plea, Soph., Eur.:—Pass., Thuc.
to propose for an office, Andoc.
to propose a problem, riddle (cf. πρόβλημα IV), Ar., etc.
to put forth beyond, τί τινος Soph.
πρ. ἑαυτόν to give oneself up for lost, Lat. spem abjicere, Hdt.; so, πρ. ἐμαυτὸν εἰς δεινὰς ἀράς Soph.
Mid. with perf. pass. (which is used also in pass. sense):— to throw or toss before one, οὐλοχύτας προβάλοντο Hom.: to throw away, expose, Soph.
to lay before or first, θεμείλιά τε προβάλοντο Il.
to set before oneself, propose to oneself, ἔργον Hes.
to propose for election, Lat. designare, Hdt., Attic:— Pass. to be so proposed, Hdt.
to throw beyond, beat in throwing; and so, to surpass, excel, c. gen. pers. et dat. rei, ἐγὼ δέ κε σεῖο νοήματί γε προβαλοίμην Il.

to hold before oneself, τὼ χεῖρε Ar.; πρ. τὰ ὅπλα, i. e. to present arms, whether for offensive or defensive purposes, Xen.;—so, in perf. pass., κοντὸν προβεβλημένος having a pole advanced, with levelled pole, Luc.; also, προβεβλημένοι τοὺς θωρακοφόρους having them to cover one in front, Xen.:—absol. to stand in front, stand on the defensive, Xen.; προαίρεσις προβεβλημένη a defensive system, Dem.:— c. gen., προβεβλῆσθαί τινος to stand before, shield him, Dem.
metaph. to put forward, Dem.:— to bring forward or cite in defence, Plat.: to cite as an example, Hdt.:— to use as an excuse or pretext, Thuc.:— προβέβληνται (in mid. sense), Thuc.
as Attic law-term, to present or accuse a person before the Ecclesia by the process called προβολή (v. προβολή IV); ὁ προβαλλόμενος the prosecutor in a προβολή, Dem.:—Pass. to be accused, Xen.

div1.head: προβασανίζω
div1.sense: to torture before, Luc.

div1.head: πρόβασις
div1.sense: property in cattle (πρόβατα) , cattle, Od.

div1.head: προβατεία
div1.sense: a keeping of sheep, a shepherdʼs life, Plut.
property in cattle, a flock of sheep, like the Homeric πρόβασις, Strab.

div1.head: προβατευτικός
div1.sense: of or for cattle:— ἡ -κή (sc. τέχνη) the art of breeding or keeping sheep, Lat. pecuaria, Xen.

div1.head: προβατεύω
div1.sense: to watch sheep, be a shepherd, Anth.

div1.head: προβατικός
div1.sense: of sheep or goats:— ἡ προβατικὴ (sc. πύλη) the sheep-gate, NTest.

div1.head: προβάτιον
div1.sense: a little sheep, Lat. ovicula, Ar., Plat.; cf. πρόβατον.

div1.head: προβατογνώμων
div1.sense: a good judge of sheep: metaph. a good judge of character, Aesch.

div1.head: προβατοκάπηλος
div1.sense: a retailer of sheep, Plut.

div1.head: πρόβατον
div1.sense: mostly in pl. πρόβατα, properly, anything that walks forward; in Hom. generally of cattle, flocks and herds; in Hdt. and Pind. also of horses; τὰ λεπτὰ τῶν προβάτων small cattle, i. e. sheep and goats, Hdt.; but in Attic always of sheep, Ar., Thuc.
proverb. of stupid, lazy people, πρόβατʼ ἄλλως a set of sheep, Ar.; so, προβατίου βίος, i. e. a lazy do-nothing life, Ar.

div1.head: προβατοπώλης
div1.sense: a sheep-dealer, Ar.

div1.head: προβέβουλα
div1.etym: an isolated poet. perf. 2 (προβούλομαι does not occur)
div1.sense: to prefer one to another, τινά τινος Il.

div1.head: πρόβημα
div1.sense: a step forward, Ar.

div1.head: προβιάζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to force a measure through, Aeschin.

div1.head: προβιβάζω
div1.sense: to make step forward, lead forward, lead on, τινά Soph., Ar., etc.:— to lead on, induce, λόγῳ τινὰ πρ. Xen.
to push forward, advance, to exalt, τὴν πατρίδα Polyb.
to teach beforehand, τινά τι LXX.:— Pass., prob. in NTest.

div1.head: προβλέπω
div1.sense: to foresee: so in Mid., NTest.

div1.head: πρόβλημα
div1.sense: anything projecting, a headland, promontory, Soph.
anything put before one, a fence, barrier, screen, Hdt., Attic; πρ. σώματος, of a shield, Aesch.; προβλήματα ἵππων χαλκᾶ the brasen armour of horses, Xen.
c. gen. a defence against a thing, πέτρων Aesch.; χείματος Eur.; κακῶν Ar.
πρ. φόβου ἢ αἰδοῦς ἔχειν to have fear or shame as a defence, Soph.
anything put forward as an excuse or screen, Dem.; so, πρ. λαβεῖν τινά (as we say) to make a stalking horse of him, Soph.
that which is proposed, a task, business, Eur.
a problem in Geometry, Plat.

div1.head: προβληματώδης
div1.sense: problematical, Plut.

div1.head: προβλής
div1.sense: forestretching, jutting, Hom.: προβλῆτες, without Subst., forelands, headlands, Soph.

div1.head: πρόβλητος
div1.sense: thrown forth, tossed away, Lat. projectus, Soph.

div1.head: προβλώσκω
div1.sense: to go or come forth, to go out of the house, Hom.

div1.head: προβοάω
div1.sense: to shout before, cry aloud, Il., Soph.

div1.head: προβοηθέω
div1.sense: to hasten to aid before, προβωθῆσαι ἐς τὴν Βοιωτίην Hdt.

div1.head: προβόλαιος
div1.sense: held out before one, levelled, couched, of a spear, Theocr.: ὁ πρ., alone, a spear, ap. Hdt.

div1.head: προβολή
div1.sense: a putting forward, esp. of a weapon for defence, τὰ δόρατα εἰς προβολὴν καθιέναι to bring the spears to the rest, Xen.; ἐν προβολῇ θέσθαι ξίφος to bring it to the guard, Anth.; ἐν προβολῇ ἑστάναι to stand with spear in rest, Plut.:—of a pugilist, a lunging out with the fist, Theocr.
a projection, a jutting rock, foreland or tongue of land, Soph.; Νειλόρυτος πρ. i. e. the Delta of the Nile, Anth.
a thing held before one as a defence, a fence, screen, bulwark, Xen.: c. gen. a defence against, δείματος καὶ βελέων Soph.; θανάτου Eur.
a legal process in which the plaintiff appealed to the Ecclesia to support his suit before bringing it into court, pl. προβολαί, Xen., Dem., etc.

div1.head: προβόλιον
div1.sense: a boar-spear, Xen.

div1.head: πρόβολος
div1.sense: anything that projects:
a jutting rock, foreland, Od.:—metaph. a rock in the path, an obstacle, Dem.; λιμένας προβόλων ἐμπλῆσαι Dem.; πρόβολοι ξύλων projecting barriers of wood, Plut.
a defence, bulwark, Xen.: of a person, a shield, guardian, Ar.
a hunting-spear, Hdt.; cf. προβόλαιος.

div1.head: προβοσκίς
div1.sense: a means of providing food: an elephantʼs proboscis, Arist.

div1.head: προβοσκός
div1.sense: an assistant herdsman, Hdt.

div1.head: προβούλευμα
div1.sense: at Athens, a preliminary order of the senate, Dem., Aeschin.

div1.head: προβουλεύω
div1.sense: to contrive or concert measures before, Thuc.:—Mid. to debate or consider first, Hdt., etc.

of the Senate at Athens, to frame or pass a προβούλευμα, Xen., Dem.; of magistrates, to propose decrees, Thuc.:—impers. in Pass., τῇ βουλῇ προβεβούλευται, c. acc. et inf., it has been decreed that, Xen.
to award by a decree of this kind, Dem.
to have the chief voice in the senate and in passing decrees, Xen.
πρ. τινός to deliberate for one, provide for his interest, Ar., Xen.

div1.head: προβουλή
div1.sense: forethought, ἐκ προβουλῆς of malice aforethought, Antipho.

div1.head: προβουλόπαις
div1.sense: in Aesch., πρ. Ἄτης, πρόβουλος παῖς Ἄτης, the fore-counselling child of Ate.

div1.head: πρόβουλος
div1.sense: debating beforehand:—pl. πρόβουλοι,
commissioners to examine measures before they were proposed to the people, Ar., etc.
deputies of the Ionian states at the Panionium, Hdt.: also the deputies appointed by the Western Greeks to consult on the mode of meeting Xerxes, Hdt.
at Athens, a committee of Ten, appointed before the constitution of the 400, Ar.

div1.head: προβύω
div1.sense: πρ. λύχνον to push up the wick of a lamp, to trim it, Ar.

div1.head: προβώμιος
div1.sense: before the altar, σφαγαί Eur.: προβώμια, ων, τά, a space in front of an altar, Eur.

div1.head: προγαργαλίζω
div1.sense: (sub. ἑαυτόν) to prepare oneself for tickling, Arist.

div1.head: προγαστρίδιον
div1.sense: a false paunch worn by actors, Luc.

div1.head: προγάστωρ
div1.sense: fat-paunch, Anth.

div1.head: προγένειος
div1.sense: with prominent chin, long-chinned, Theocr.

div1.head: προγενής
div1.sense: born before, primaeval, Soph.: —comp. προγενέστερος earlier in birth, i. e. older, Hom.; οἱ πρ. our predecessors, Arist.:—Sup. προγενέστατος, eldest-born, Hhymn.

div1.head: προγεννήτωρ
div1.sense: in pl. forefathers, Eur.

div1.head: προγίγνομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to come forwards, τάχα προγένοντο quickly they came in sight, Il.
to be born before, exist before, Hdt.; οἱ προγεγονότες θεοί Hdt.; οἱ πρ. ἄνθρωποι former men, and οἱ προγεγενημένοι Xen.
of events and the like, ταῦτά μοι προὐγεγόνει Plat.; τὰ προγεγενημένα things of old time, Thuc.; προγεγενημένοι πόλεμοι, καιροί Thuc.

div1.head: προγιγνώσκω
div1.sense: to know, perceive, learn, or understand beforehand, Hhymn., Plat., etc.; absol., Eur.
to foreknow, NTest.
to judge beforehand, Thuc.; to provide, Xen.

div1.head: πρόγνωσις
div1.sense: a perceiving beforehand, Luc.: in medicine, prognosis of diseases, Anth.

div1.head: πρόγονος
div1.sense: a forefather, ancestor, Hdt., Attic; οἱ ἄνωθεν πρ. Plat.; ἐκ προγόνων, Lat. antiquitus, Plat.:— also of gods who are the authors or founders of a race; Ζεῦ πρόγονε Eur.; θεοὶ πρόγονοι Plat.:—metaph., πόνοι πρόγονοι πόνων troubles parents of troubles, Soph.
a child by a former marriage, i. e. oneʼs step-son, Lat. privignus, Eur.: fem. a stepdaughter, Plut.

div1.head: πρόγραμμα
div1.sense: a public proclamation or notice, programm, Dem.

div1.head: προγραφή
div1.sense: a public notice, Xen.:—esp. a sale of confiscated property, Lat. proscriptio, Strab.

div1.head: προγράφω
div1.sense: to write before or first, Thuc.
to give public notice of anything, Ar., Dem.:—also to summon by public notice, ἐκκλησίαν Aeschin.:—Pass. to be set forth publicly, NTest.
= Lat. proscribere, Plut.
to write at the head of a list, Plut.

div1.head: προγυμνάζω
div1.sense: to exercise or train beforehand, Luc.

div1.head: προδαῆναι
div1.etym: aor2 pass. inf. with act. sense from *προδάω
div1.sense: to know beforehand, part. προδαείς Od.

div1.head: προδανείζω
div1.sense: to lend before or first, Plut.

div1.head: προδαπανάω
div1.sense: to spend beforehand, Luc.

div1.head: προδείδω
div1.sense: to fear prematurely, Soph.

div1.head: προδείελος
div1.sense: before evening, Theocr.

div1.head: προδείκνυμι
div1.sense: to shew by way of example, Hdt.; τὸν ζωστῆρα προδέξας having pointed out [the use of] the girdle, Hdt.
absol. to tell first, Aesch.
to foreshew what is about to happen, Hdt., etc.:—c. acc. et inf. to make known beforehand that . . , Thuc.
to point before one, σκήπτρῳ πρ. (sc. τὴν ὁδόν) to feel oneʼs way with a stick, of a blind man, Soph.
pugilistic term, χερσὶ πρ. to make feints with the hands, make as if one was going to strike, Lat. praeludere, Theocr.:—in war, to make a demonstration, Xen.

div1.head: προδειμαίνω
div1.sense: to fear beforehand, Hdt.

div1.head: προδέκτωρ
div1.sense: a foreshewer, Hdt.

div1.head: προδέρκομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to see beforehand, Aesch.

div1.head: πρόδηλος
div1.sense: clear or manifest beforehand, Eur., etc.:— πρόδηλον ἤδη ἦν, ὅτι . . , Xen.; so, πρόδηλα γάρ ἐστι, ὅτι μέλλουσι Hdt.:— ἐκ προδήλου from a place in sight, Soph.: adv. -λως, Soph.

div1.head: προδηλόω
div1.sense: to make clear beforehand, shew plainly, Thuc.

div1.head: προδήλωσις
div1.sense: demonstration of the event, Plut.

div1.head: προδιαβαίνω
div1.sense: to go across before others, τάφρον Xen.

div1.head: προδιαβάλλω
div1.sense: to raise prejudices against one beforehand, τινά Thuc.:—Pass. to have prejudices raised against one, Arist.

div1.head: προδιαγιγνώσκω
div1.sense: to perceive or understand beforehand, Thuc.
to make a previous decree, Thuc.

div1.head: προδιαίτησις
div1.sense: preparation by diet, Luc.

div1.head: προδιαλέγομαι
div1.sense: Mid., with aor1 pass., to speak or converse beforehand, Isocr.

div1.head: προδιασύρω
div1.sense: to pull in pieces or ridicule beforehand, Arist.

div1.head: προδιαφθείρω
div1.sense: to ruin beforehand, Isocr.: to bribe beforehand, Dem.:—Pass., Thuc.

div1.head: προδιαχωρέω
div1.sense: to have a previous difference with another, Arist.

div1.head: προδιδάσκω
div1.sense: to teach one a thing beforehand, τινά τι Soph., Ar.; πρ. τινά Plat.:—c. acc. et inf., πρ. τινὰ σοφὸν εἶναι Soph.:—Mid. to have one taught beforehand, Soph.:—Pass. to learn beforehand, Thuc.

div1.head: προδίδωμι
div1.sense: to give beforehand, pay in advance, Xen.
to give up to the enemy, deliver up, betray, Lat. prodere, Hdt.:—c. inf., ὃν σὺ προὔδωκας θανεῖν Eur.:—Pass., Hdt., Soph.
to forsake in distress, abandon, Hdt., Attic:—Pass., Hdt.
absol. to play false, desert, Hdt., etc.; προδοῦσʼ ἁλίσκεται is convicted of treachery, Soph.; πρ. πρὸς τοὺς κατιόντας to treat treasonably with them, Hdt.
with a thing as subject, to betray or fail one, Xen.:—intr. to fail, Lat. deficere, of a river that has run dry, Hdt.; of a tottering wall, Hdt.
with a thing as object, to betray, give up, Eur.; χάριν πρ. to be thankless, Eur.:—hence, to give up as lost, bid adieu to, ἡδονάς Soph.; τὰς ἐλπίδας Ar.

div1.head: προδιεξέρχομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to go out through before, Xen.: —metaph. to go through before, τι Aeschin.

div1.head: προδιεργάζομαι
div1.sense: Dep.: to work or mould beforehand, Arist.

div1.head: προδιερευνάω
div1.sense: to discover by searching, Xen.

div1.head: προδιερευνητής
div1.sense: one sent before to search, Xen.

div1.head: προδιέρχομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to go through before, Xen.

div1.head: προδιηγέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to relate beforehand, premise, Hdt.

div1.head: προδιήγησις
div1.sense: a detailing beforehand, Aeschin.

div1.head: πρόδικος
div1.sense: an advocate, defender, avenger, Aesch.
at Sparta, a young kingʼs guardian, Xen.: regent, Plut.

div1.head: προδιοικέω
div1.sense: to regulate, order, govern, manage beforehand, Dem.: Mid. in act. sense, Aeschin.

div1.head: προδιομολογέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to grant beforehand:—Pass. to be granted on both sides beforehand, Arist.

div1.head: προδιώκω
div1.sense: to pursue further or to a distance, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: προδοκέω
div1.note: only in perf. and plup. pass.
div1.sense: ὥσπερ προεδέδοκτο αὐτοῖς as had been before determined, Thuc.; τὰ προδεδογμένα Thuc.; προὐδέδοκτο ταῦτά μοι this was my former opinion, Plat.

div1.head: προδοκή
div1.sense: a place where one lies in wait, lurking-place, Il.

div1.head: πρόδομος
div1.sense: the chamber entered immediately from the αὐλή, serving as the guestsʼ sleeping-room, Hom.

div1.head: πρόδομος2
div1.sense: before the house, Anth.

div1.head: προδοξάζω
div1.sense: to judge beforehand, Plat., Arist.

div1.head: προδοσία
div1.sense: a giving up, betrayal, treason, Hdt., Eur., Dem.

div1.head: πρόδοσις
div1.sense: payment beforehand, money advanced, earnest-money, Dem.

div1.head: προδότης
div1.sense: a betrayer, traitor, Hdt., Attic
one who abandons in danger, Aesch.

div1.head: προδοτικός
div1.sense: traitorous, Luc.

div1.head: προδότις
div1.sense: a traitress, Eur.

div1.head: πρόδοτος
div1.sense: betrayed, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: πρόδουλος
div1.sense: serving as a slave, of a shoe, Aesch.

div1.head: προδρομή
div1.etym: from προδρᾰμεῖν aor2 inf. of προτρέχω
div1.sense: a running forward, a sally, sudden attack, Xen.

div1.head: πρόδρομος
div1.etym: from προδρᾰμεῖν aor2 inf. of προτρέχω
div1.sense: running forward, with headlong speed, Trag.
going in advance, Hdt., Eur.:— οἱ πρ. the advanced guard, "the guides, " a corps in the Maced. army, Arr.
metaph. a precursor, Plat.

div1.head: προεγείρω
div1.sense: to wake up before, Arist.

div1.head: προεγκάθημαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be implanted before, Polyb.

div1.head: προεδρεύω
div1.sense: to act as president, Aeschin.; πρ. τῆς βουλῆς Dem.

div1.head: προεδρία
div1.sense: the privilege of the front seats at public games, in theatres, in the public assemblies, given as an honour to ambassadors, etc., Hdt., Ar.
in concrete sense, the front seat, ἐν προεδρίῃ κατήμενος on a chair of state, Hdt.
the office of πρόεδρος (II.), Arist.

div1.head: πρόεδρος
div1.sense: one who sits in the first place, a president, Thuc., etc.
in the Athenian ἐκκλησία, the πρυτάνεις in office were called πρόεδροι (v. πρύτανις), ap. Dem.

div1.head: προεέργω
div1.sense: to stop by standing before, c. acc. et inf., προέεργε πάντας ὁδεύειν Il.

div1.head: προεθίζω
div1.sense: to train beforehand:—Pass. to be so trained, Xen., etc.

div1.head: προεῖδον
div1.etym: aor2 with no pres. in use, προοράω being used instead
div1.sense: to see beforehand, catch sight of, Hom., etc.; so in Mid., προϊδέσθαι Od.:—absol. to look forward, Od.
of Time, to foresee, portend, Orac. ap. Hdt., Pind.:—so in Mid., Xen., etc.
to have a care for, provide against, c. gen., ἡμέων οἰκοφθορημένων Hdt.; αὐτῶν (sc. τῶν ἀποβαινόντων) Thuc.:—so in Mid., προϊδομένους αὐτῶν Thuc.:— to make provision, προϊδέσθαι ὑπέρ τινος Dem.

div1.head: προεικάζω
div1.sense: to conjecture beforehand, Arist.

div1.head: πρόειμι
div1.sense: to go forward, go on, advance, Thuc., etc.
of Time, προϊόντος τοῦ χρόνου as time went on, Hdt.; so, προϊόντος Xen.; προϊούσης τῆς νυκτός Xen., etc.
of persons reading, προϊὼν καὶ ἀναγιγνώσκων going on reading, Plat.
to go first, go in advance, Xen.:—c. gen. to go before or in advance of, τῆς στρατιῆς Hdt.
to go forth, Xen.
πρ. εἴς τι to pass on to, begin another thing, Xen., Arist.
of an action, to go on well, succeed, Xen.

div1.head: πρόειμι
div1.sense: to be before, Il.

div1.head: προεῖπον
div1.etym: aor2 with no pres. in use, πρόφημι, προαγορεύω being used instead
div1.sense: to tell or state before, Plat.: to premise, Aeschin.
to proclaim or declare publicly, Lat. indicere, πόλεμόν τινι Hdt., etc.:— πρ. τινι φόνου to make proclamation of murder against him, Dem.
c. inf. to order or command before, Od., etc.; the inf. is sometimes omitted, πρ. Λυδοῖσι (sc. ποιέειν) τὰ ὁ Κροῖσος ὑπετίθετο Hdt.; πρ. ξεινίην τοῖσι Ἀκανθίοισι, like Lat. imperare frumentum, Hdt.

div1.head: προεισάγω
div1.sense: to bring in or introduce before, Dem.:—Mid. to bring in beforehand for oneself, to bring in from the country into the town, Hdt.
intr., πρ. ἑαυτοῦ to go on the stage before oneself, Arist.

div1.head: προεισέρχομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to come or go in before, Dem.

div1.head: προεισπέμπω
div1.sense: to send in before, Xen.

div1.head: προεισφέρω
div1.sense: to advance money to pay the εἰσφορά for others, Dem.

div1.head: προεισφορά
div1.sense: money advanced to pay the εἰσφορά for others, Dem.

div1.head: προεκδέχομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to intercept before, Strab.

div1.head: προέκθεσις
div1.sense: an introduction, preface, Polyb.

div1.head: προεκθέω
div1.sense: to run out before, sally from the ranks, rush on, Thuc.

div1.head: προεκκομίζω
div1.sense: to carry out beforehand, Hdt.

div1.head: προεκλέγω
div1.sense: to collect moneys not yet due, Dem.

div1.head: προεκπέμπω
div1.sense: to send out before, Plut.

div1.head: προεκπλέω
div1.sense: to sail out before, Plut.

div1.head: προεκπλήσσω
div1.sense: to astound before, Plut., Luc.

div1.head: προέκπτωσις
div1.sense: a going beyond limits, Strab.

div1.head: προεκτίθημι
div1.sense: Mid. to set forth before or by way of preface, Polyb.

div1.head: προεκτρέχω
div1.sense: to run out before, Plut.

div1.head: προεκφοβέω
div1.sense: to scare away before, Plut., Luc.

div1.head: προεκφόβησις
div1.sense: a previous panic, Thuc.

div1.head: προέλασις
div1.sense: a riding forward, Xen.

div1.head: προελαύνω
div1.sense: seemingly intr. (sub. ἵππον) to ride on or forward, Xen.: c. gen. to ride before one, Xen.:—Pass., of Time, ὡς πρόσω τῆς νυκτὸς προελήλατο (3rd sg. plup. impers.) as the night was now far advanced, Hdt.

div1.head: προελπίζω
div1.sense: to hope for before, NTest.

div1.head: προεμβαίνω
div1.sense: to embark first or before, Plut.

div1.head: προεμβάλλω
div1.sense: to put in or insert before, Arist.
absol., προεμβαλλόντων ἐς τὴν γῆν τῶν κερέων the horns first striking against the ground, of the βόες ὀπισθονόμοι, which by reason of their projecting horns were obliged to graze backwards, Hdt.
of ships, to make the charge (ἐμβολή) first, Thuc.

div1.head: προεμβιβάζω
div1.sense: to put in before, πρ. τινὰ εἰς ἀπέχθειαν to make one hated before, Polyb.

div1.head: προενάρχομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to begin before, NTest.

div1.head: προενδείκνυμαι
div1.sense: Dep. to exhibit oneself or make a demonstration before another, c. dat., Aeschin.

div1.head: προὐννέπω
div1.sense: to proclaim, announce, Aesch., Eur.; πρ. τινὶ ὅτι . . Aesch.: c. inf., πρ. τινὰ χαίρειν I publicly bid him hail, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: προενοίκησις
div1.sense: a dwelling in a place before, Thuc.

div1.head: προενσείω
div1.sense: to set at before, τινά τινι Plut.

div1.head: προεντυγχάνω
div1.sense: to converse with before, Plut., etc.; ὄψις πρ. τῆς φωνῆς his face begins to converse before he speaks, Plut.

div1.head: προεξαγγέλλω
div1.sense: to announce beforehand, Dem.

div1.head: προεξαγκωνίζω
div1.sense: of pugilists, to move the arms before beginning to fight: also of a speaker, Arist.

div1.head: προεξάγω
div1.sense: to lead or carry out first, Hdt., Thuc.
intr. to advance first, τῷ κέρᾳ with the wing, Thuc.:—so in Pass., Thuc.

div1.head: προεξαιρέω
div1.sense: to take out before:—Pass. to be deprived of before, τι Luc.

div1.head: προεξαΐσσω
div1.sense: to dart out before, as out of the ranks in battle, Hdt.; aor1 part. προεξᾴξαντες Thuc.

div1.head: προεξαμαρτάνω
div1.sense: to do wrong before, Isocr.

div1.head: προεξανίσταμαι
div1.sense: Pass., with aor2, perf., and plup. act. to rise and go out before or first, Hdt., Dem.
in a race, to start before the signal is given, Hdt.

div1.head: προεξαπατάω
div1.sense: to deceive before, Arist.

div1.head: προεξαποστέλλω
div1.sense: to send out before, Polyb.

div1.head: προεξέδρα
div1.sense: a chair of state, Hdt.

div1.head: προέξειμι
div1.sense: to sally forth from, Thuc.

div1.head: προεξελαύνω
div1.sense: to ride out before, Plut.
π. πλοίῳ to run out in a ship before, Plut.

div1.head: προεξεπίσταμαι
div1.sense: Dep. to know well before, Aesch.

div1.head: προεξερευνάω
div1.sense: to investigate before, Eur.

div1.head: προεξερευνητής
div1.sense: an explorer sent before, Eur.

div1.head: προεξέρχομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to go out before, τῷ πεζῷ with the infantry, Thuc.

div1.head: προεξετάζω
div1.sense: to examine before, Luc.

div1.head: προεξεφίεμαι
div1.sense: Mid. to enjoin beforehand, Soph.

div1.head: προεξορμάω
div1.sense: to set out or start beforehand, Xen.

div1.head: προεπαγγέλλω
div1.sense: announce before, Mid. to promise before, NTest.

div1.head: προεπαινέω
div1.sense: to praise beforehand, Thuc.

div1.head: προεπανασείω
div1.sense: to raise the hand against before: metaph. in Pass., ἡ παρασκευὴ προεπανεσείσθη it was in agitation before, Thuc.

div1.head: προεπαφίημι
div1.sense: to send forward against the enemy, Luc.,

div1.head: προεπιβουλεύω
div1.sense: to plot against one beforehand, τινί Thuc.:—Pass. to be the object of such plots, Thuc.

div1.head: προεπιξενόομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be received as a guest before, Luc.

div1.head: προεπιπλήσσω
div1.sense: to be the first to blame, τινί Arist.

div1.head: προεπισκοπέω
div1.sense: to inspect or consider before, Strab., Luc.

div1.head: προεπίσταμαι
div1.sense: Dep. to know or understand beforehand, Plat., Xen.

div1.head: προεπιχειρέω
div1.sense: to be the first to attack, Thuc., Plut., etc.
c. inf. to attempt beforehand, Plut.

div1.head: προεποικέω
div1.sense: to colonise before, Strab.

div1.head: προεργάζομαι
div1.sense: to do or work at beforehand, Hdt., Xen.:—perf. also in pass. sense, τὰ προειργασμένα former deeds, Thuc.; ἡ προειργασμένη δόξα glory won before, Xen.

div1.head: προερέσσω
div1.sense: to row forwards, Hom.

div1.head: προερευνάω
div1.sense: Mid. to search out first or before, οἱ προερευνώμενοι ἱππεῖς the videttes, Xen.

div1.head: προερέω
div1.sense: to say beforehand, Plat.:—Pass., ἐκ τῶν προειρημένων Plat.; τὰ προρρηθέντα Plat.; ταῦτά μοι προειρήσθω be said by way of preface, Isocr.

to order one to do a thing beforehand or publicly, τινί c. inf., Hdt.; also, πρ. τινί ὡς . . Hdt.:—Pass. impers., προείρητο αὐτοῖς μὴ ἐπιχειρεῖν orders had been given them not to attack, Thuc.; τὸ προειρημένον the prescribed implement, Hdt.; δεῖπνον πρ. ordered beforehand, Hdt.; πόλεμος προερρήθη, Lat. indictus est, Xen.

div1.head: προερύω
div1.sense: to draw on or forward, νῆα ἅλαδε προέρυσσεν drew the ship forward, by hauling her from the beach to the sea, Il.
of ships at sea, = προερέσσω, Hom.

div1.head: προέρχομαι
div1.etym: like πρόειμι (which serves as the fut.)
div1.sense: Dep.
to go forward, go on, advance, Hdt., Thuc., etc.: —absol., προελθὼν ὁ κῆρυξ ἐκήρυττε Aeschin.
of Time, προελθόντος πολλοῦ χρόνου Thuc.; of persons, προεληλυθὼς τῇ ἡλικίᾳ far advanced in age, Xen.
to go on, in a story or argument, Plat.
metaph., τὰ Περσέων πρήγματα ἐς τοῦτο προελθόντα the power of the Persians having advanced to this height, Hdt.; εἰς πᾶν μοχθηρίας πρ. Dem.; εἰς τοῦτο προβέβηκεν ἔχθρας, ὥστε . . Dem.
to go before or first, Xen.; πρ. τινος to go before him, Xen.; later, πρ. τινα NTest.
with instr. of motion, πρ. πόδα to advance the foot, Luc.

div1.head: πρόεσις
div1.sense: a throwing away, Arist.

div1.head: προετικός
div1.sense: apt to throw away, giving lavishly, profuse, lavish, Xen., etc.; πρ. τινι giving lavishly to . . , Arist.:—adv. -κῶς, Arist.

div1.head: προετοιμάζω
div1.sense: to get ready before:—Mid. to prepare for oneʼs own use or purpose, Hdt.

div1.head: προευαγγελίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to preach the gospel beforehand, NTest.

div1.head: προευλαβέομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:— to take heed, be cautious beforehand, Dem.

div1.head: προεφοδεύομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be traversed before, Strab.

div1.head: προέχω
div1.sense: to hold before, so as to protect another, Ar. Xen.:—Mid. to hold before oneself, hold out before one, Hom., Ar.
metaph. in Mid. to put forward, use as a pretext, Soph.; ὅπερ μάλιστα προὔχονται, μὴ ἂν γίγνεσθαι τὸν πόλεμον which is the chief reason they allege, to shew that the war would not arise, Thuc.
to hold forth, offer, Thuc.
to be possessed or informed of a thing beforehand, Hdt.
to have before others, τιμὴν προέξουσʼ τῶν ἐνδίκων shall have honour before the righteous, Soph.: absol., ὁ προέχων the first possessor, Arist.
intr. to jut out, project of headlands, towers, hills, Hom., Hdt., etc.

in running, to be the first, have the start, Il.; c. gen., προέχων τῶν ἄλλων getting before the rest, Hdt.; πρ. ἡμέρης ὁδῷ to keep ahead by a dayʼs march, Hdt.; πρ. τῇ κεφαλῇ to beat by a head, in racing, Xen.;—of Time, προεῖχε ἡ τριήρης ἡμέρᾳ καὶ νυκτί started first by a day and night, Thuc.

of rank, c. gen., δήμου προὔχουσιν they are the first or chief of the people, Hhymn.:— absol. to be superior, to be eminent, Thuc.; τὸ προὔχον all that is eminent, Thuc.; οἱ προὔχοντες the chief men, Thuc.
to surpass, excel, c. gen., Hdt., Attic; πρ. τινὸς τιμήν to be preferred to him in honour, Soph.
rarely c. acc. pers., Xen.:—Pass. to be excelled, NTest.
impers., οὔ τι προέχει it naught avails, c. inf., Hdt.

div1.head: προηγεμών
div1.sense: one who leads as a guide, Dem.

div1.head: προηγέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to go first and lead the way, to be the leader, Hdt., etc.; τινι for a person, i. e. to guide him, Ar., Xen.; πρ. τὴν ὁδόν Xen.
c. gen. to take the lead of, Xen.;—later, c. acc., NTest.
of things, to go before, precede, Xen.
part. προηγούμενος, η, ον, going first, τὸ πρ. στράτευμα the van, Xen.

div1.head: προηγητής
div1.sense: one who goes before to shew the way, a guide, Soph.; so προηγητήρ, Eur.

div1.head: προηγορέω
div1.sense: to speak on the part of others, Xen.; πρ. τινί to speak for another, Plut.

div1.head: προηγορία
div1.sense: a speaking in behalf of others, Luc.

div1.head: προήγορος
div1.sense: one who speaks in behalf of others, an advocate.

div1.head: προηγουμένως
div1.sense: beforehand, antecedently, Plut.

div1.head: προήδομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be pleased before or first, Arist.

div1.head: προήκης
div1.sense: pointed in front, Od.

div1.head: προήκω
div1.sense: to have gone before, be the first, Thuc., Xen.
to have advanced, πρ. ἐς βαθὺ τῆς ἡλικίας Ar.; εἰς τοῦτο προήκειν to have come to this pass, Dem.; of Time, τῆς ἡμέρας προηκούσας Plut.
to reach beyond, τῆς ἄρκυος Xen.

div1.head: προησσάω
div1.sense: to overpower beforehand, Polyb.:—perf. and plup. pass. to be beaten or worsted before, Polyb.

div1.head: προθαλής
div1.sense: early growing, Hhymn.

div1.head: προθέλυμνος
div1.sense: from the foundations or roots, προθελύμνους ἕλκετο χαίτας he tore his hair out by the roots, Il.; προθέλυμνα χαμαὶ βάλε δένδρεα he threw to earth trees uprooted, Il.; ἐφόρει τὰς δρῦς προθελύμνους Ar.
σάκος σάκεϊ προθελύμνῳ φράξαντες fixing shield on shield close-pressed, — where θέλυμνα are the several shields, each overlapping its neighbour, Hom.

div1.head: προθεραπεύω
div1.sense: to prepare beforehand, Plat.
to court beforehand, Plut.

div1.head: πρόθεσις
div1.sense: a placing in public;— of a corpse, the laying it out (cf. προτίθημι II), Plat., Dem.
a public notice, Arist.
the statement of the case, Arist.
οἱ ἄρτοι τῆς προθέσεως the loaves laid before, the shewbread, NTest.
a purpose, end proposed, Philipp. ap. Dem.
a supposition, calculation, Polyb.

div1.head: προθέσμιος
div1.sense: fore-appointed, Luc.
προθεσμία (sc. ἡμέρα) , in Attic law, a day appointed beforehand, within which money was to be paid, actions brought, claims made, elections held, Dem., Aeschin.: —generally, an appointed time, Plat.

div1.head: προθεσπίζω
div1.sense: to foretell, Aesch.

div1.head: προθέω
div1.sense: to run before, Il.; πολὺ προθέεσκε (Ionic imperf.) he was far ahead, Hom.
to run forward or forth, Xen.
c. acc. to outrun, outstrip, Xen.; c. gen., Plut.

div1.head: προθέω
div1.sense: τοὔνεκά οἱ προθέουσιν ὀνείδεα μυθήσασθαι do they therefore let him speak reproachful words? Il.

div1.head: προθνῄσκω
div1.sense: to die before, Thuc.
to die for another, c. gen., Eur.

div1.head: πρόθρονος
div1.sense: a president, Anth.

div1.head: προθρυλέω
div1.sense: to noise abroad beforehand, Luc.

div1.head: προθρῴσκω
div1.sense: to spring before, forth, forward, only in aor2 part. προθορών, Il.

div1.head: πρόθυμα
div1.sense: a preparatory sacrifice, Ar.:— metaph., ἐμὸν θάνατον προθύματʼ ἔλαβεν Ἄρτεμις Eur.

div1.head: προθυμέομαι
div1.sense: to be ready, willing, eager, zealous to do a thing, c. inf., Hdt., Attic; also πρ. ὅπως Hdt., Attic
absol. to shew zeal, exert oneself, Hdt.:— to be of good cheer, Xen.
c. acc. rei, to be eager or zealous for, promote eagerly, desire ardently, Thuc., etc.

div1.head: προθυμητέος
div1.sense: one must be eager, Plat.;and

div1.head: προθυμία
div1.sense: readiness, willingness, eagerness, zeal, ᾗσι προθυμίῃσι πεποιθὼς, i. e. πρόθυμος ὤν, Il.; πάσῃ προθυμίᾳ with all zeal, Plat.; ὑπὸ προθυμίας zealously, Plat.
c. gen. pers., ἐκ τῆς Κλεομένεος προθυμίης at his desire, Hdt.; κατὰ τὴν τούτου προθυμίην as far as his desire goes, Hdt.; τοῦ θεοῦ προθυμίᾳ by the will of the god, Eur.
c. gen. rei, προθυμίη σωτηρίης zeal to save him, Hdt.; πρ. ἔργου readiness for action, the will or purpose to act, Soph.
πρ. ἔχειν, προθυμεῖσθαι, Hdt.; c. inf., Hdt., Attic
good-will, ready kindness, Hdt.

div1.head: πρόθυμος
div1.sense: ready, willing, eager, zealous, π. εἰμι, c. inf., = προθυμέομαι, Hdt., Attic
c. gen. rei, eager for, Soph., Thuc.
with Preps., πρ. εἴς τι Ar., Thuc., etc.; ἐπί τι, πρός τι Xen.
absol., Hdt., etc.:— τὸ πρόθυμον προθυμία, Eur.
bearing good-will, wishing well, Soph., Eur., etc.
adv. -μως, readily, zealously, actively, Hdt., etc.; πρ. μᾶλλον ἢ φίλως with more zeal than kindness, Aesch.:—comp. -ότερον, Thuc., etc.:—Sup. -ότατα, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: προθύραιος
div1.sense: before the door; προθύραια, ων, τά, the space before a door, Hhymn.

div1.head: πρόθυρον
div1.sense: the front-door, the door leading from the αὐλή, Hom.; also in pl., Hom.
the space before a door, a kind of porch or verandah, Lat. vestibulum, Od., Hdt., Attic
metaph., Κόρινθος πρόθυρον Ποτειδᾶνος Pind.; πρόθυρα ἀρετῆς Plat.

div1.head: προθύω
div1.sense: to sacrifice or offer before, Plat.:—Mid. to have a person sacrificed or slaughtered before, Luc.
to sacrifice for or in behalf of another, c. gen., Eur.; ὑπέρ τινος Eur.

div1.head: προϊάλλω
div1.sense: to send forth, dismiss, Hom.

div1.head: προϊάπτω
div1.sense: to send forward, to send untimely to the nether world, Il., Aesch.

div1.head: προΐζομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to sit before, take the first seat, Hdt.

div1.head: προΐημι
div1.note: 3 pres. προΐει as if from προΐω
div1.sense: to send before, send on or forward, Hom.: also, to send something to another, ἀγγελίας, φήμην Od.:—Hom. often with an inf. added; αἰετὼ προέηκα πέτεσθαι, οὖρον προέηκεν ἀῆναι Od.
to send away, dismiss, let go, Il.; τήνδε θεῷ πρόες let her go to the god, i. e. in reverence to him, Il.
to let loose, let fall, esp. thoughtlessly, ἔπος προέηκε let drop a word, Od.; πηδάλιον ἐκ χειρῶν προέηκε he let the helm slip from his hands, Od.; δάκρυα προῆκεν Eur.
of missiles, to send forth, shoot or dart forth, Hom.
of a river, ὕδωρ προΐει ἐς Πηνειόν it pours its water into the Peneius, Il.
πρ. τινί ποιεῖν τι to allow one to do, Pind.
to give up, deliver over, betray one to his enemy, Hdt., Thuc.: —Pass. to be given or thrown away, εἰ προεῖτο ταῦτα Dem.
ἐπὶ τὸ αὐτίκα ἡδὺ πρ. αὑτόν to give up or devote oneself to present delights, Xen.
Mid. to send forward from oneself, drive forward, Xen.:—of sounds, to utter, Aeschin., etc.
to give up, let go: to give up to the enemy, Thuc., etc.; πρ. σφᾶς αὑτούς gave themselves up as lost, Thuc.
to desert, abandon, Thuc.; οὐδαμῆ προΐεντο ἑαυτούς did not lose themselves (i. e. take bribes), Dem.
to give away, give freely, Thuc., etc.; προέσθαι ἀπὸ τῶν ἰδίων Dem.
to throw off oneʼs clothes, Dem.: and, in bad sense, to throw away, τὸν καιρόν Dem.; τὰ πατρῷα Aeschin.: absol. to be lavish, Arist.
a second predicate is sometimes added, ἡμᾶς προέσθαι ἀδικουμένους to suffer us to be wronged, Thuc.; προέμενοι αὐτοὺς ἀπολέσθαι Xen.; πρ. τινὶ ὑμᾶς ἐξαπατῆσαι Dem.
to suffer to escape, Polyb.
rarely in good sense, to give over to one, confide to oneʼs care, Xen.
to neglect, disregard, Arist.:— absol. to neglect all advice, to be reckless, Dem.

div1.head: προίκιος
div1.sense: gratuitous, Anth.

div1.head: προΐκτης
div1.sense: one who asks a gift, a beggar, Od.; ἀνὴρ π. a beggar- man, Od.

div1.head: προίξ
div1.sense: a gift, present, προικὸς γεύσασθαι to taste of a present, Od.; προικὸς χαρίσασθαι to give away gratis (προικός being gen. pretii), Od.
a marriage-portion, dowry, Plat., Dem.
the Attic used acc. προῖκα as adv., like δωρεάν, as a free gift, freely, at oneʼs own cost, Lat. gratis, Ar., Plat.; πρ. κρίνειν without a gift, unbribed, Dem.

div1.head: προϊππεύω
div1.sense: to ride before others, c. gen., Plut.

div1.head: προΐστημι
div1.sense: Causal in these tenses, as also in pres. and aor1 mid., to set before or in front, προστήσας σε Τρωσὶ μάχεσθαι Il.
to set over others, c. gen., Plat.
Mid., mostly in aor1, to put another before oneself, choose as oneʼs leader, Hdt.: c. gen., προΐστασθαι τουτονὶ ἑαυτοῦ to take as oneʼs leader, Plat.
to put before one, put in front, Hdt., etc.
metaph. to put forward as a pretence, use as a screen, τὰ τῶν Ἀμφικτυόνων δόγματα προστήσασθαι Dem.; c. gen. to use one thing as a pretext for another, Dem.
to prefer, value one above another, τινά τινος Plat.
Pass., with aor2 act. προὔστην: perf. προέστηκα, Ionic 2nd pl. προέστατε, inf. προεστάναι, part. προεστώς: aor1 pass. προεστάθην:—3 to put oneself forward, come forward, Dem.
c. acc. to approach, Soph.
c. dat. to stand before or face another, Soph.

c. gen. to be set over, be the chief power, τῆς Ἑλλάδος, τῶν Ἀρκάδων Hdt.:— to be at the head of a party, act as chief or leader, τῶν παράλων, τῶν ἐκ τοῦ πεδίου Hdt.; τοῦ δήμου Thuc.: hence absol., οἱ προεστῶτες, Ionic -εῶτες, the leading men, chiefs, leaders, Hdt., Thuc., etc.
in various relations, to govern, direct, manage, οὐκ ὀρθῶς σεωυτοῦ προέστηκας you do not manage yourself well, Hdt.; πρ. τοῦ ἑαυτοῦ βίου Xen.

to stand before so as to guard him, Hdt.; πρόστητε τύχης be our defence against fortune, Soph.; ὁ προστὰς τῆς εἰρήνης the champion of peace, Aeschin.;—also, προὐστήτην φόνου were the authors of death, Soph.:—absol., βέλεα ἀρωγὰ προσταθέντα Soph.

div1.head: προΐσχω
div1.sense: to hold before, hold out, of boys playing at ποσίνδα, Xen.:—mostly in Mid. to hold out before oneself, stretch forth, χεῖρας Thuc.: c. gen. to hold before, τῶν ὄψεων τὰς χεῖρας Plut.
metaph. in Mid. to put forward, use as a pretext, allege, plead, Hdt., Thuc.
to propose, offer, Thuc.

div1.head: Προιτίδες
div1.sense: Προιτίδες (πύλαι) , αἱ, one of the gates of Thebes, called from Proetus, Aesch.

div1.head: προΐωξις
div1.sense: pursuit of the foremost, Hes.

div1.head: πρόκακος
div1.sense: exceeding bad, κακὰ πρόκακα evils beyond evils, Aesch.

div1.head: προκαλέω
div1.sense: to call forth: mostly in Mid., 3 sg. Epic aor1 προκαλέσσατο, imperat. προκάλεσσαι:— to call out to fight, challenge, defy, Lat. provoco, Hom.; so, πρ. εἰς ἀγῶνα Xen.
to invite or summon beforehand, τινὰ ἐς λόγους Hdt., Thuc.; ἐς σπονδάς Thuc.; ἐπὶ ξυμμαχίαν Thuc.
c. acc. et inf. to invite one to do, Thuc., etc.
absol., αὐτῶν προκαλεσαμένων at or after their invitation, Thuc.
c. acc. rei, to offer or propose, δίκην Thuc.; τὰς σπονδάς Ar.; c. acc. pers. added, προκαλεῖσθαί τινα τὴν εἰρήνην to offer one peace, Ar.

as Attic law-term, to make an offer or challenge to the opponent, such as to submit the case to arbitration, let slaves be put to the torture, Dem.; cf. πρόκλησις:— Pass., πρ. ἐς κρίσιν περί τινος Thuc.
to call up or forth, εὐγένειαν Eur.

div1.head: προκαλίζομαι
div1.etym: only in pres. imperat. προκαλίζεο, Epic 3rd sg. imperf. προκαλίζετο
div1.sense: Dep. to call forth or out, challenge, defy, Hom.

div1.head: προκαλινδέομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to fall prostrate before another, Isocr., Dem.

div1.head: προκάλυμμα
div1.sense: anything put before, a curtain, such as was hung in doorways instead of doors, Aesch.
a covering, as a protection, Thuc.
metaph. a screen or cloak, Thuc., Luc.

div1.head: προκαλύπτω
div1.sense: to hang before as a covering:— Mid. to put over oneself as a screen or cloak, Eur.; οὐ παρακαλυπτομένα παρηίδος putting no veil over oneʼs face, Eur.
to cover over, ἥλιον νεφέλη πρ. Xen.: —Mid., προὐκαλύψατο ὄμματα veiled her eyes, Eur.

div1.head: προκάμνω
div1.sense: to work or toil before, Theogn.
to toil for or in defence of, τινός Soph.
to grow weary, give up, μὴ πρόκαμνε Aesch.; μὴ προκάμητε πόδα Eur.
to have a previous illness, Thuc.;— to be distressed beforehand, Thuc.

div1.head: πρόκα
div1.sense: forthwith, straightway, suddenly, in Hdt., πρόκα τε or πρόκατε.

div1.head: προκαθεύδω
div1.sense: to sleep before or first, Ar.

div1.head: προκαθηγέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to go before and guide, Polyb.; πρ. τῆς κρίσεως to influence it beforehand, Polyb.

div1.head: προκάθημαι
div1.sense: to be seated before, πρὸ τῆς ἄλλης Ἑλλάδος πρ. to lie in front of the rest of Greece, of the Thessalians, Hdt.
c. gen. to be seated or lie before a place, and so, to protect, defend, Hdt., Thuc.; στρατιᾶς πρ. Eur.
to preside over, τῆς πόλεως Plat.

div1.head: προκαθίζω
div1.sense: to sit down or alight before, Il.
to sit in public, sit in state, ἐς θρόνον Hdt.: —so in Mid., Hdt.
to settle before, Hdt.
trans. to set over, Polyb.

div1.head: προκαθίημι
div1.sense: to let down beforehand: metaph., πόλιν πρ. εἰς ταραχήν to plunge the city into confusion, Dem.; πρ. τινὰ ἐξαπατᾶν to put a person forward in order to deceive, Dem.

div1.head: προκαθίστημι
div1.sense: to set before; so in Mid., Xen.
Pass., with aor2 and perf. act., φυλακῆς μὴ προκαθεστηκυίας no guard having been set beforehand, Thuc.

div1.head: προκαθοράω
div1.sense: to examine beforehand, to reconnoitre, Hdt.

div1.head: προκαίω
div1.sense: to burn before: Pass. to be lighted before, of fires, Xen.

div1.head: προκάρηνος
div1.sense: head-foremost, Anth.

div1.head: προκαταγγέλλω
div1.sense: to announce or declare beforehand, NTest.

div1.head: προκαταγιγνώσκω
div1.sense: to vote against beforehand, condemn by a prejudgment, c. gen. pers., Dem., etc.; absol., Ar.; μὴ προκατεγνωκέναι μηδέν not to prejudge in any point, Dem.
c. inf., πρ. ἡμῶν ἥσσους εἶναι to prejudge us and say we are inferior, Thuc.
πρ. τί τινος, as, φόνον τινός, to give a verdict of murder against one beforehand, Oratt.

div1.head: προκατάγομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to get into harbour before, τινος Luc.

div1.head: προκαταγωγή
div1.sense: a coming into port before, Arr.

div1.head: προκαταθέω
div1.sense: to run down before, Xen.

div1.head: προκατακαίω
div1.sense: to burn all before one, Xen.

div1.head: προκατάκειμαι
div1.sense: Pass. to lie down before, Luc.

div1.head: προκατακλίνω
div1.sense: to make to lie down before others, Joseph.:—Pass., = προκατάκειμαι, Luc.

div1.head: προκαταλαμβάνω
div1.sense: to seize beforehand, preoccupy, Thuc., etc.:—Pass. to be preoccupied, Thuc.
metaph. to anticipate, frustrate, Thuc., Aeschin.:—of persons, to anticipate or surprise them, Thuc.
to overpower before, Thuc.

div1.head: προκαταλέγομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be described beforehand, Hdt.

div1.head: προκαταλήγω
div1.sense: to terminate beforehand, Polyb.

div1.head: προκαταλύω
div1.sense: to break up or annul beforehand, Thuc.; τὸν βίον πρ. τοῦ ἔργου to end his life before finishing his work, Plut.:—Mid., πρ. τὴν ἔχθρην to end their mutual enmity before, Hdt.

div1.head: προκαταπίπτω
div1.sense: to fall down before: λόγοι προκατέπιπτον εἰς τὴν Ῥώμην rumours reached Rome beforehand, Plut.

div1.head: προκαταπλέω
div1.sense: to sail down before, Polyb.

div1.head: προκαταρτίζω
div1.sense: to complete beforehand, NTest.

div1.head: προκατάρχω
div1.sense: to begin a thing before others, to begin hostilities, Polyb.
προκατάρχεσθαί τινι τῶν ἱερῶν to serve one with the first portion of the victim (one of the privileges of the citizens of the mother-city in their colonies), Thuc.

div1.head: προκατασκευάζω
div1.sense: to prepare beforehand, Xen.

div1.head: προκατασκευή
div1.sense: previous preparation, a preface, introduction, Polyb.

div1.head: προκαταφεύγω
div1.sense: to escape to a place of safety before, Thuc.

div1.head: προκαταχράομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to use up beforehand, Dem.

div1.head: προκατελπίζω
div1.sense: to hope beforehand, Polyb.

div1.head: προκατεσθίω
div1.sense: to eat up beforehand, Luc.

div1.head: προκατέχω
div1.sense: to hold or gain possession of beforehand, preoccupy, Thuc., Xen.:—Mid. to hold down before oneself, Hhymn.

div1.head: προκατηγορέω
div1.sense: to bring accusations beforehand, Dem.

div1.head: προκατηγορία
div1.sense: a previous accusation, Thuc.

div1.head: πρόκειμαι
div1.sense: to be set before one, of meats, Hom., Hdt.
to lie exposed, of a child, Hdt.:— to lie dead, Aesch., Soph.; ὁ προκείμενος the corpse laid out for burial, Soph., etc.

to be set before all, as the prize of a contest, Hes.:—metaph. to be set before all, be set forth, proposed, Lat. in medio poni, γνῶμαι τρεῖς προεκέατο three opinions were set forth, proposed, Hdt., etc.:—of contests, struggles, πόνος τε καὶ ἀγὼν πρόκειται Plat.:—in partic., ἄεθλος προκείμενος a task proposed, Hdt., etc.; τὰ προκείμενα, opp. to μέλλοντα, Soph.; τὸ προκείμενον πρῆγμα the matter in hand, Hdt.

to be set forth beforehand, to be prescribed, αἱ προκείμεναι ἡμέραι the prescribed days, Hdt.; so, ἐνιαυτοὶ πρόκεινται ἐς ὀγδώκοντα are set, fixed at, Hdt.; of laws, νόμοι οἱ προκείμενοι Soph.; of penalties, Thuc.
to lie before, lie in front of, c. gen., Αἴγυπτος προκειμένη τῆς ἐχομένης γῆς Hdt.; τὰ προκείμενα τῆς χώρας ὄρη Xen.
to precede, γράμμα πρ. an initial letter, Anth.

div1.head: προκέλευθος
div1.sense: conducting, τινος Mosch.

div1.head: προκενόω
div1.sense: to empty beforehand, Luc.

div1.head: προκήδομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to take care of, take thought for, τινος Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: προκηραίνω
div1.sense: to be anxious for, τινός Soph.: also, τί ποτʼ, ὦ τέκνον, τάδε κηραίνεις; why art thou thus anxious? Eur.

div1.head: προκηρυκεύομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to negotiate by herald, Aeschin.

div1.head: προκηρύσσω
div1.sense: to proclaim by herald, proclaim publicly, Soph.: c. acc. rei, Soph.

div1.head: προκινδυνεύω
div1.sense: to run risk before others, brave the first danger, bear the brunt of battle, Thuc., Dem.; τῷ βαρβάρῳ against the barbarians, Thuc.

div1.head: προκινέω
div1.sense: to move forward, τὸν στρατόν Xen.: to urge on, ἵππον Xen.:—Pass. with fut. mid. to advance, Xen.

div1.head: προκλαίω
div1.sense: to weep beforehand or openly, Soph., Eur.
trans. to lament beforehand, Hdt., Eur.

div1.head: πρόκλησις
div1.sense: a calling forth, challenging, challenge, ἐκ προκλήσιος upon or by challenge, Hdt.
an invitation, offer, proposal, Thuc., etc.

as law-term, a challenge offered to the opponent, for the purpose of bringing disputed points to issue, somewhat like the Roman sponsio, Dem., etc.; πρ. προκαλεῖσθαι to make such a challenge, δέχεσθαι to accept it, Dem.

div1.head: προκλητικός
div1.sense: calling forth, challenging: προκλητικόν, τό, a challenge, Plut.

div1.head: προκλίνω
div1.sense: to lean forward, Soph.

div1.head: πρόκλυτος
div1.sense: heard formerly, of olden time, Il.

div1.head: προκλύω
div1.sense: to hear beforehand, Aesch.

div1.head: προκνημίς
div1.sense: a covering for the leg, Polyb.

div1.head: προκοιτία
div1.sense: a watch kept before a place; in pl., like Lat. excubiae, Polyb.

div1.head: πρόκοιτος
div1.sense: one who keeps watch before a place, Polyb.

div1.head: προκολάζω
div1.sense: to chastise beforehand, Arist.

div1.head: προκολακεύω
div1.sense: to flatter beforehand, Plat.

div1.head: προκόλπιον
div1.sense: a robe falling over the breast, Theophr.

div1.head: προκομίζω
div1.sense: to bring forward, produce, Luc.
Pass. to be carried before to a place of safety, Hdt.

div1.head: προκόμιον
div1.sense: the forelock of a horse, Xen.

div1.head: προκοπή
div1.sense: progress on a journey, generally, progress, advance, Polyb.; in pl., Plut., Luc.

div1.head: προκόπτω
div1.sense: to cut away in front: hence to forward a work (the metaph. being prob. taken from pioneers), Pass. to be forwarded, to advance, prosper, Hdt.
with neut. Adjs., τὰ πολλὰ προκόψασʼ having made most things ready, Eur.; τί ἂν προκόπτοις; what good would you get? Eur.; οὐδὲν προὔκοπτον they were making no progress, Xen.

c. gen. rei, τοῦ ναυτικοῦ μέγα μέρος προκόψαντες having made improvements in their navy to a great extent, Thuc.; ἡμῶν προκοπτόντων τῆς ἀρχῆς ἐκείνοις since we promote the increase of their empire, Thuc.; ἐπὶ πλεῖον πρ. ἀσεβείας having advanced further in impiety, NTest.
absol., ἡ νὺξ προέκοψεν the night is far spent, NTest.; πρ. σοφίᾳ to advance in wisdom, NTest.

div1.head: πρόκριμα
div1.sense: prejudgment, prejudice, NTest.

div1.head: προκρίνω
div1.sense: to choose before others, choose by preference, prefer, select, Hdt., Attic:—Pass. to be preferred before others, τὰ προκεκριμένα the most eminent, Hdt.: c. inf., τοῦτο προκέκριται εἶναι κάλλιστον Xen.; inf., τὸ ἐμὲ προκριθῆναι ἄρχοντα Xen.
c. gen. to prefer before others, Plat.:—Pass., τῶν ἄλλων προκεκρίσθαι Hdt.
c. acc. et inf. to judge or decide beforehand that . . , Xen.

div1.head: πρόκριτος
div1.sense: chosen before others, select, Plat.

div1.head: πρόκροσσοι
div1.sense: ranged at regular intervals, like steps or battlements (v. κρόσσαι); of ships drawn up on the beach, ranged in a row, Il.; πρόκροσσαι ἐς πόντον ἐπὶ ὀκτώ ranged in rows turned seawards eight deep, Hdt.; of a cup, πέριξ αὐτοῦ γρυπῶν κεφαλαὶ οἱ πρόκροσσοι ἦσαν the heads of griffins were set at intervals round it, Hdt.

div1.head: προκυλινδέομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to roll at the feet of another, Lat. provolvi ad genua alicujus, τινι Ar.; τινος Dem.

div1.head: προκυλίνδομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to roll forward, of a wave, Il.

div1.head: προκύπτω
div1.sense: to stoop and bend forward, to peep out, Ar.

div1.head: προκυρόομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be confirmed before, NTest.

div1.head: Προκύων
div1.sense: Procyon, a star which rises (about the middle of July) before the dog-star, Hor.
πικροὶ Καλλιμάχου πρόκυνες, a nickname of the Grammarians, snappers and snarlers, Anth.

div1.head: προκώμιον
div1.sense: the prelude sung by a κῶμος, Pind.

div1.head: πρόκωπος
div1.sense: of a sword, grasped by the hilt, drawn, Aesch., Eur.:—metaph. ready, Aesch.

div1.head: προλάζυμαι
div1.sense: Dep. to receive beforehand or by anticipation, τινος some of a thing, Eur.

div1.head: προλαλέω
div1.sense: to prate before, Anth.

div1.head: προλαμβάνω
div1.sense: to take or receive before, Eur., Dem., etc.
to take or seize beforehand, Dem.; πρ. ὅπως . . to provide that . . , Dem.; προλαβὼν προεγνωκότας ὑμᾶς first procured your vote of condemnation, Dem.
to take before, take in preference, τι πρό τινος Soph.
to take away or off before, προὔλαβον μόγις πόδα Eur.
to be beforehand with, anticipate,
c. acc. pers. to get the start of, Xen., Dem.:—also c. gen. pers., Dem.
c. acc. rei, Eur.
c. gen. spatii, πρ. τῆς ὁδοῦ to get a start on the way, Hdt.; πρ. τῆς φυγῆς Thuc.
absol., πολλῷ προὔλαβε was far ahead, Thuc.:— to anticipate the event, prejudge, Dem.; προλαβόντες by anticipation, Xen.
to repeat from the origin, Isocr.

div1.head: προλέγω
div1.sense: to choose before others, prefer: Pass., Ἀθηναίων προλελεγμένοι Il.; πασᾶν ἐκ πολίων πρ. Theocr.
to foretell, announce beforehand, of an oracle, Hdt., Attic
to state publicly, proclaim, c. acc. et inf., Aesch., etc.
πρ. τινὶ ποιεῖν τι to order him to do, Xen.— to caution, warn, Thuc.
to denounce punishment, πρ. δεσμόν τινι Dem.

div1.head: προλείπω
div1.sense: to go forth and leave, to leave behind, forsake, abandon, Hom., etc.; μῆτίς σε προλέλοιπε prudence hath forsaken thee, Od.; χώραν πρ. to abandon oneʼs post, Thuc.
c. inf. to omit to do a thing, Theogn., Soph.
of things, to desert, fail one, Plat.
intr. to cease or fail beforehand, Ἀτρείδαις οὐ προλείπει φόνος Eur.; εἴ τῳ προλείποι ἡ ῥώμη Thuc.; of persons, to faint, fall into a swoon, Eur.

div1.head: προλεσχηνεύομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to hold conversations with one before, c. dat. pers., Hdt.

div1.head: προλεύσσω
div1.sense: to see before oneself or in front, Soph.

div1.head: πρόλογος
div1.sense: in Trag. and old Com. Poets, the prologue, that portion of the play that comes before the first chorus, Arist.; but from the time of Eur., a narrative of facts introductory to the plot, Ar.

div1.head: προλοχίζω
div1.sense: to lay an ambuscade beforehand: — Pass., αἱ προλελοχισμέναι ἐνέδραι the ambush that had before been laid, Thuc.
to beset with an ambuscade, Thuc.

div1.head: προλυμαίνομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to destroy beforehand, Polyb.

div1.head: προλυπέομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to feel pain before, Plat.

div1.head: προλύπησις
div1.sense: previous distress, Plat.

div1.head: προμαλάσσω
div1.sense: to soften beforehand: so in Mid., Plut.

div1.head: πρόμαλος
div1.sense: a tree, prob. a kind of willow, Anth.

div1.head: προμανθάνω
div1.sense: to learn beforehand, and (in aor2 προὔμαθον) to know beforehand, Pind., Thuc., etc.:—c. acc. to learn by rote, Ar.: c. inf., προὔμαθον στέργειν τάδε Soph.

div1.head: προμαντεία
div1.sense: the right of consulting the Delphic Oracle first, Hdt., Dem.

div1.head: προμαντεύομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to prophesy, Hdt.:c. acc. to foretell, predict, Luc.

div1.head: πρόμαντις
div1.sense: a prophet or prophetess, Eur.
the title of the Pythia or Delphic priestess, who gave out the answers of the oracle, Hdt., Thuc.; so of the priestess at Dodona, Hdt.
as adj. prophetic, δίκη πρ. justice giving presage of the issue, Soph.; θυμὸς πρ. "my prophetic soul, " Eur.; c.gen., τούτων πρ. οὖσα prophetic, foreboding of a thing, Aesch.

div1.head: προμαρτύρομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to witness beforehand, NTest.

div1.head: προμαχέω
div1.sense: to fight in front, Xen.

div1.head: προμαχεών
div1.sense: a bulwark, rampart, Lat. propugnaculum, Hdt., Xen.; πρ. τοῦ τείχεος Hdt.

div1.head: προμαχίζω
div1.sense: to fight before, Τρωσί in front of the Trojans, as their champion, Il.; also, to fight as champion with another, Ἀχιλῆι Il.

div1.head: προμάχομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to fight before, ἁπάντων before all, Il.
to fight for or in defence of, τινος Ar.

div1.head: πρόμαχος
div1.sense: fighting before or in front: πρόμαχοι, οἱ, the foremost fighters, champions, Hom.; ἐν προμάχοισιν among the foremost, Il.:—as adj., πρ. δόρυ the champion spear, Soph.
fighting for, πόλεως, δόμων Aesch.

div1.head: προμελετάω
div1.sense: to practise beforehand: c. inf., Xen.

div1.head: Προμένεια
div1.sense: name of a prophetess of Dodona, presage, Hdt.

div1.head: προμεριμνάω
div1.sense: to take thought before, NTest.

div1.head: προμετωπίδιος
div1.sense: before or on the forehead:— προμετωπίδιον, ου, the skin or hair of the forehead, Hdt.
a frontlet for horses, Xen.

div1.head: Προμήθεια
div1.sense: the festival of Prometheus, Xen.

div1.head: προμηθέομαι
div1.sense: Dep to take care beforehand, to provide for, c. gen., Hdt.; ὑπέρ τινος, περί τι Plat.; absol., Aesch.: —generally, to take heed, Lat. cavere, πρ. μὴ . . Hdt.: —c. acc. to shew regard or respect for, Hdt., Plat.

div1.head: προμήθεια
div1.sense: foresight, forethought, Hdt., Eur., etc.; ἐν προμηθίῃ ἔχειν τινά to hold in consideration, Hdt.; προμηθίαν ἔχειν τινός Eur., Plat.

div1.head: Προμήθειος
div1.sense: Promethean, Anth.

div1.head: Προμηθεύς
div1.sense: Prometheus, son of the Titan Iapetus and Themis, inventor of many arts: he is said to have made man from clay, and to have furnished him with the ἔντεχνον πῦρ stolen from Olympus: hence also his name (from προμηθής), opp. to his careless brother Ἐπιμηθεύς, — forethought and afterthought, Hes., Aesch., etc.
as appellat. forethought, Aesch.

div1.head: προμηθής
div1.sense: forethinking, provident, cautious, Thuc.; τὸ προμηθές, προμήθεια, Thuc.: c. gen. troubling oneself about a thing, Soph.

div1.head: προμηθικῶς
div1.sense: shrewdly, warily, with allusion to the name Prometheus, Ar.

div1.head: προμήκης
div1.sense: prolonged, elongated, Plut.

div1.head: προμηνύω
div1.sense: to denounce beforehand, τινί τι Soph.: to indicate before, τι Plut.

div1.head: προμήτωρ
div1.sense: first mother of a race, formed like προπάτωρ, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: προμηχανάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to contrive beforehand, Luc.

div1.head: προμίγνυμι
div1.sense: to mingle beforehand:—Pass., παλλακίδι προμιγῆναι (aor2 inf.) to have intercourse with her before, Il.

div1.head: προμισθόομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be hired beforehand, Plut.

div1.head: προμνάομαι
div1.sense: Dep.
to woo or court for another, ἡ προμνησαμένη = προμνήστρια, Xen.
generally, to solicit, Xen., Plut.
προμνᾶταί τί μοι γνώμα my mind forebodeth somewhat, Soph.

div1.head: προμνηστῖνοι
div1.sense: one by one, one after the other, Od.
div1.etym: Perh. from μένω, for προμενετῖνοι — each waiting for the one before.

div1.head: προμνήστρια
div1.sense: a woman who woos or courts for another, a match-maker, Ar., Plat.; metaph., κακῶν πρ. of one who brings about evil, Eur.

div1.head: πρόμοιρος
div1.sense: before the destined term, i. e. untimely, of death, Anth.

div1.head: προμολή
div1.sense: an approach, of the foot of a mountain, Anth.; the mouth of a river, Anth.

div1.head: πρόμος
div1.sense: the foremost man, = πρόμαχος, Hom.; πρ. τινί opposed to another in the front rank, Il.:— generally, a chief, Lat. primus, princeps, Trag.; πάντων θεῶν θεὸς πρόμος, of the Sun, Soph.

div1.head: προμοχθέω
div1.sense: to work beforehand, Eur.

div1.head: πρόναος
div1.sense: before a temple, esp. of gods whose shrines or statues stood before the temple, as of Athena at Delphi, Hdt.; Παλλὰς προναία Aesch.
as Subst., πρόναος, πρόδομος, the hall of a temple, through which one went to the ναός or cella, Hdt.

div1.head: προναυμαχέω
div1.sense: to fight at sea for or in defence of, c. gen., Hdt.

div1.head: προνέμω
div1.sense: to assign beforehand, τί τινι Pind.; καθαρὰς χεῖρας πρ. to present unspotted hands, Aesch.
Mid. to go forward in grazing: hence to gain ground, creep onward, of war, etc.

div1.head: προνεύω
div1.sense: to stoop or bend forward, Plat.; of a rider, Xen.; of rowers, Xen.

div1.head: προνηστεύω
div1.sense: to fast before, Hdt.

div1.head: προνικάω
div1.sense: to gain a victory beforehand, Thuc.

div1.head: προνοέω
div1.sense: to perceive before, foresee, Il., Thuc., Arist.; προνοῶν ὅτι . . foreseeing that . . , Xen.
to think of or plan beforehand, provide, Od.:—absol. to be provident, take measures of precaution, Eur., Thuc.: —πρ. ὅτι . . , to provide, take care that . . , Thuc.; ὅπως . . , Xen., etc.
c. gen. to provide for, take thought for, Xen.
in same sense, Dep. προνοοῦμαι
Act. to provide, Thuc., etc.:—c. inf. to take care to do, Eur.
c. gen. to provide for, Thuc., etc.

div1.head: προνοητέος
div1.sense: one must provide, Xen.

div1.head: προνοητικός
div1.sense: provident, cautious, wary, Xen.
of things, shewing forethought or design, Xen.: adv. -κῶς, Xen.

div1.head: πρόνοια
div1.sense: foresight, foreknowledge, Aesch., Soph.

foresight, forethought, forecast, Soph.; ἐκ προνοίας with forethought, purposely, Lat. consulto, Hdt.; ἀπὸ προνοίας τίνων by their precautions, Thuc.:—esp. of crimes committed with design or malice prepense, ἐκ προνοίας τραύματα Aeschin.; τὰ ἐκ πρ., opp. to ἀκούσια, Arist.:— πρόνοιαν ἔχειν (or ἴσχειν) τινός to take thought for . . , shew care for . . , Eur., etc.; περί τινος Soph.; c. inf., πολλὴν πρ. εἶχεν εὐσχήμως πεσεῖν Eur.
divine providence, Hdt., Attic

div1.head: προνομαία
div1.etym: = προνομή II, Plut.; of a fly, Luc.

div1.head: προνομεύω
div1.sense: to go out for foraging, Polyb.

div1.head: προνομή
div1.sense: a foraging, a foraging expedition, foray, Xen.: in pl., foraging parties, Xen.
an elephantʼs trunk, Polyb.
= προ-νομία, Luc.

div1.head: προνομία
div1.sense: a privilege, Strab., Luc.

div1.head: προνόμιον
div1.sense: earnest-money, Luc.

div1.head: πρόνοος
div1.sense: careful, Hdt.:—comp. προνούστερος, Soph.

div1.head: προνωπής
div1.sense: stooping forwards, with head inclined, Lat. pronus, στείχει πρ., of one in deep grief, Eur.; πρ. ἐστι, of one dying, Eur.; so, πρ. λαβεῖν to take her as she fell fainting forward, Aesch.
metaph. inclined, ready, πρ. ἐς τὸ λοιδορεῖν Eur.

div1.head: προνώπια
div1.sense: the front of a house (cf. ἐνώπια) , Eur.: metaph. in sg., χώρας Πελοπίας πρ., of Troezen, the outer portal of Peloponnesus, Eur.
as adj. in front, before the door, Eur.

div1.head: προξενία
div1.sense: proxeny, i. e. a compact between a State and a foreigner, Lat. hospitium, Thuc., etc.; προξενίᾳ πέποιθα I trust my public friendship, Pind.; τινὰ πρ. ἐξευρήσεις; what protector wilt thou find? Eur.

div1.head: πρόξενος
div1.sense: a public ξένος, public guest or friend, made so by an act of the State, such as was the King of Macedon to the Athenians, Hdt.; —the word expressed the same relation between a State and an individual of another State, that ξένος expressed between individuals of different States.—The πρόξενος enjoyed his privileges on the condition of entertaining and assisting the ambassadors and citizens of the State which he represented, so that the πρόξενοι answered to our Consuls, Agents, Residents, though the πρόξενος was always a member of the foreign State.
generally, a patron, protector, Aesch.: as fem. a patroness, Soph.

div1.head: προοδεύω
div1.sense: to travel before, Luc.

div1.head: προοδοιπορέω
div1.sense: to travel before, Luc.

div1.head: προοδοποιέω
div1.sense: to prepare the way before, prepare or pave the way, τινί for another, Arist.
c. acc. to prepare beforehand, Plut.:—Pass. to be prepared before, Arist.: part. προωδοποιημένος, η, ον, prepared, ready, Arist.

div1.head: πρόξ
div1.sense: the roe-deer, Od.: cf. προκάς.

div1.head: προξενέω
div1.sense: to be any oneʼs πρόξενος, διὰ τὸ προξενεῖν ὑμῶν because he is your πρόξενος, Xen.; πρ. τῶν πρέσβεων to act as πρ. to the envoys of a friendly State, Dem.:—generally, to be oneʼs protector, patron, Eur.
from the duties of a πρόξενος (signf. II),

to manage or effect anything for another, Eur.; πρ. θράσος to lend daring, Soph.; πρ. τιμήν τινι to procure it for him, Plut.:—also in bad sense, πρ. κίνδυνόν τινι to put danger upon one, Xen.:—also, c. dat. et inf., πρ. τινὶ ὁρᾶν to be the means of his seeing, Soph.; πρ. τινὶ καταλῦσαι βίον to grant one to die, Xen.:—also, πρ. τινί to be oneʼs guide, Soph.
to introduce or recommend to another, Plat., Dem.

div1.head: πρόοδος
div1.sense: going before: οἱ πρ. a party of soldiers in advance, Xen.

div1.head: πρόοδος2
div1.sense: a going on, advance, progress, Xen.

div1.head: πρόοιδα
div1.sense: to know beforehand, Hdt., Attic

div1.head: προοικοδομέω
div1.sense: to build before:—Pass., Luc.

div1.head: προοιμιάζομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:— to make a prelude, preamble or preface, Aesch., Xen.

c. acc. to say by way of preface, premise, φροιμιάζομαι θεούς begin by invoking them, Aesch.; τί φροιμιάζει; Eur.:—perf. in pass. sense, πεφροιμιάσθω τοσαῦτα let so much be said by way of preface, Arist.

div1.head: προοίμιον
div1.sense: an opening or introduction to a thing; in Music, a prelude, overture, Pind.; in poems and speeches, a proem, preface, preamble, introduction, Lat. exordium, Pind., Xen.
metaph. of any prelude or beginning, φροίμιον χορεύσομαι Aesch.; μηδέπω ʼν προοιμίοις only just beginning, Aesch.; εἴ τι τοῦδε φρ. ματᾷ if any part of this presage be vain, Aesch.
generally, a hymn, Thuc., Plat.

div1.head: προοίχομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to have gone on before, Xen.

div1.head: προόμνυμι
div1.sense: to swear before or beforehand, Dem.
to testify on oath before that . . , c. acc. et inf., Aesch., Dem.

div1.head: προομολογέω
div1.sense: to grant or concede beforehand, Plat.:—Pass., προωμολόγηταί τι εἶναι Plat.

div1.head: προοπτέος
div1.sense: one must look to, be careful of, c. gen., Hdt.

div1.head: πρόοπτος
div1.sense: foreseen, manifest, Hdt., Attic

div1.head: προορατός
div1.sense: to be foreseen, Xen.

div1.head: προοράω
div1.sense: to see before one, see what is just before the eyes, Thuc.: to look forward to, Xen.:—absol. to look before one or forward, Xen.
to see before, foresee, τὸ μέλλον Hdt., Attic:—absol., τὸ προορᾶν σευ your foresight, Hdt.
c. gen. to provide or make provision for, Hdt.
in Attic also in Mid., with perf. and plup. pass., to look before one, Xen.
to foresee, Thuc., Dem.
to provide for, Thuc., Dem.

div1.head: προορίζω
div1.sense: to determine beforehand, to predetermine, pre-ordain, NTest.

div1.head: προορμάω
div1.sense: to drive forward:—Pass. to move forward, push on, Xen.;—so intr. in Act., Xen.

div1.head: προορχηστήρ
div1.sense: one who leads the dance, Luc.

div1.head: προοφείλω
div1.sense: to owe beforehand: πρ. κακόν τινι to owe one an ill turn, i. e. to deserve evil at his hands, Eur.; πρ. κακὸν ταῖς πλευραῖς to owe oneʼs ribs a mischief, i. e. deserve a beating, Ar.:—Pass. to be due beforehand, of debts, ὁ προοφειλόμενος φόρος the arrears of tribute, Hdt.; ἔχθρη προοφειλομένη εἴς τινα the hatred one has long had reason to feel, Hdt.; εὐεργεσία προὐφειλομένη a kindness that has long remained as a debt, Thuc.
= ὀφείλω I, to be due beforehand, Eur.

div1.head: πρόοψις
div1.sense: a foreseeing, Thuc.; οὐκ οὔσης τῆς προόψεως since there was no seeing, Thuc.

div1.head: προπαγής
div1.sense: prominent, Luc.

div1.head: προπαιδεία
div1.sense: preparatory teaching, Plat.

div1.head: προπαιδεύω
div1.sense: to teach beforehand:—Pass., Plat.

div1.head: πρόπαλαι
div1.sense: very long ago, Ar.

div1.head: πρόπαππος
div1.sense: a great-grandfather, Oratt.

div1.head: προπάροιθε
div1.sense: prep. with gen., before, in front of, Hom.; πρ. ποδῶν at oneʼs feet, i. e. close at hand, Hom.; ἠιόνος πρ. before, i. e. along the shore, Il.; πρ. νεός before, i. e. beyond the ship, Od.
before the time of, Aesch.
as adv.,
of Place, in front, in advance, forward, before, Hom., Hes.
of Time, before, formerly, Hom., Aesch.

div1.head: πρόπαρ
div1.sense: prep. with gen. before, in front of, Hes., Eur.
adv., before, sooner, Aesch.

div1.head: προπαραβάλλω
div1.sense: to put beside beforehand:—Mid. to do so for oneself, Thuc.

div1.head: προπαρασκευάζω
div1.sense: to prepare beforehand, Thuc., etc.:—Mid. to prepare for oneself, Thuc.:—Pass., ἐκ πολλοῦ προπαρεσκευασμένοι Thuc.

div1.head: προπαρέχω
div1.sense: to offer before, Xen.
to supply before, Xen.

div1.head: πρόπας
div1.sense: πρόπαν ἦμαρ all day long, Hom.; νῆας προπάσας all the ships together, Il.; πρόπασα χώρα, γαῖα Aesch.; πρόπαντος χρόνου Aesch.; πρ. στόλος Soph.; πρόπαντα κακὰ κακῶν Soph.: neut. πρόπαν, as adv., Eur.

div1.head: προπάσχω
div1.sense: to suffer first or beforehand, Hdt., Thuc., etc.: to be ill-treated before, ὑπό τινος Thuc.:—also, ἀγαθὸν πρ. Xen.

div1.head: προπάτωρ
div1.sense: the first founder of a family, forefather, Hdt., Eur.:—in pl. ancestors, forefathers, Hdt., etc.; ὦ Ζεῦ, προγόνων προπάτωρ Soph.

div1.head: προπείθω
div1.sense: to persuade beforehand, Luc.

div1.head: πρό
div1.sense: before, Lat. prae:
PREP. WITH GENIT.:
of Place, before, in front of, πρὸ ἄστεος, πρὸ πυλάων Hom.; οὐρανόθι πρό Il.; χωρεῖν πρὸ δόμων to come out in front of, Soph.
before, in front of, for the purpose of shielding or guarding, στῆναι πρὸ Τρώων Il.:— in defence of, for, μάχεσθαι πρὸ γυναικῶν Il.; ὀλέσθαι πρὸ πόληος, Lat. pro patria mori, Il.
πρὸ ὁδοῦ further on the road, i. e. forwards, onward, Il.: (hence φροῦδος) .

of Time, before, πρὸ γάμοιο Od.; πρὸ ὁ τοῦ (= ὁ πρὸ τοῦ) ἐνόησεν one before the other, Il.; πρὸ τοῦ θανάτου Plat., etc.; πρὸ πολλοῦ long before, Hdt.; τὸ πρὸ τούτου before this, before, Thuc.; πρὸ τοῦ (often written προτοῦ) before, Hdt., Attic
in other relations:
