of Preference, before, sooner or rather than, κέρδος πρὸ δίκας αἰνῆσαι to praise sleight before right, Pind.; πᾶν πρὸ τῆς παρεούσης λύπης anything before, rather than their actual grievance, Hdt.; πρὸ πολλοῦ ποιεῖσθαι to esteem above much, i. e. very highly, Isocr.; so, πρὸ πολλῶν χρημάτων τιμᾶσθαι Thuc.: redundant, after a comp., ἡ τυραννὶς πρὸ ἐλευθερίης ἀσπαστότερον Hdt.
of Cause or Motive, Lat. prae, for, out of, from, πρὸ φόβοιο for fear, Il.; πρὸ τῶνδε there fore, Soph.
POSITION: never after its case, except after the Epic gen. Ἰλιόθι πρό, οὐρανόθι πρό, ἠῶθι πρό.
πρό, absol. as adv.:
of Place, before, in front, forth, forward, Il.
of Time, before, beforehand, Od.: before, earlier, Hes.: prematurely, Aesch.
with other Preps. ἀποπρό, διαπρό, ἐπιπρό, περιπρό, προπρό, it strengthens the first prep.
πρό IN COMPOS.
with Substs., to denote
position before or in front, πρόθυρον, προπύλαια.
priority of rank, πρόεδρος; or of order, προοίμιον.
standing in anotherʼs place, πρόμαντις, πρόξενος.
with Adjs., to denote
proximity, readiness, πρόχειρος, πρόθυμος.
forth from, προθέλυμνος, πρόρριζος.
prematureness, πρόμοιρος, πρόωρος.
with Verbs,
of Place, before, forwards, προβαίνω, προβάλλω· also before, in defence, προκινδυνεύω.
forth, προέλκω, προφέρω:—also publicly, προειπεῖν.
giving away, προδίδωμι.
before, in preference, προαιροῦμαι, προτιμάω.
before, beforehand, προαισθάνομαι, προνοέω, προοράω.

div1.head: προαγγέλλω
div1.sense: to announce beforehand, Xen.

div1.head: πρόπειρα
div1.sense: a previous trial or venture, πρόπειραν ποιεῖσθαι ἔν τινι, Lat. periculum facere in . . , Hdt.; πρ. ποιεῖσθαι εἰ . . , Thuc.

div1.head: πρόπεμπτος
div1.sense: only in neut. pl. πρόπεμπτα as adv. five days before, on the fifth day, Lex ap. Dem.

div1.head: προπέμπω
div1.sense: to send before, send on or forward, Hom., Hdt., Attic; πρ. ἄχη to cause them, Soph.
of things, to send forth, Aesch.; ἰοὺς πρ. to shoot forth arrows, Soph.

to conduct, attend, escort, Hdt., Attic: — to follow a corpse to the grave, Aesch.; τιμὰς θεοῖς πρ. to carry offerings in procession, Aesch.; jocosely, τὸν ἕνα ψωμὸν ἐνὶ ὄψῳ πρ. to let one piece of bread be attended by one condiment, Xen.
to pursue, Xen.

div1.head: προπέρυσι
div1.sense: two years ago, Plat., Dem., etc.

div1.head: προπετάννυμι
div1.sense: to spread out before, Xen.

div1.head: προπέτεια
div1.sense: reckless haste, vehemence, rashness, indiscretion, Dem., etc.

div1.head: προπετής
div1.sense: falling forwards, inclined forward, Lat. proclivis, Xen.
thrown away, κεῖται προπετές τὸ κάταγμα Soph.
drooping, at the point of death, Soph.; cf. προνωπής.
metaph.,
being upon the point of, πρ. ἐπὶ πολιὰς χαίτας Eur.; τύμβου πρ. παρθένος Eur.
ready for, prone to a thing, ἐπί or εἴς τι Xen.; πρός τι Plat.
headlong, precipitate, rash, reckless, violent, Aeschin., ; ἡ πρ. ἀκρασία Arist.; of a lot, drawn at random, Pind.:—of persons, οἱ θρασεῖς προπετεῖς Arist.
adv. -τῶς, forwards, Xen.
headlong hastily, Xen., etc.; πρ. ἔχειν to be rash, Xen.

div1.head: προπηδάω
div1.sense: to spring before, τῶν ἄλλων Luc.
to spring forward from, c. gen., Babr.

div1.head: προπηλακίζω
div1.sense: to bespatter with mud or to trample in the mire: metaph. to treat with contumely, to abuse foully, τινά Soph., Thuc., etc.:—Pass., ἰδὼν προπεπηλακισμένην τὴν φιλοσοφίαν Plat.
c. acc. rei, to throw in oneʼs teeth, Dem.

div1.head: προπηλάκισις
div1.sense: contumelious treatment, Hdt., Plat. Dem.

div1.head: προπηλακιστικῶς
div1.sense: contumeliously, Dem.

div1.head: προπίνω
div1.sense: to drink before another, c. gen., Luc.

to drink to another, drink to his health, pledge him, Lat. propinare, because the custom was to drink first oneself and then pass the cup to the person pledged, προπίνω σοι Xen.; also, πρ. φιλοτησίας τινί (v. φιλοτήσιος II), Dem.

on festal occasions it was a custom to make a present of the cup to the person pledged, τὰ ἐκπώματα ἐμπιμπλάς προὔπινε καὶ ἐδωρεῖτο Xen.: hence, simply, to give freely, make a present of, πρ. τὴν ἐλευθερίαν Φιλίππῳ to make liberty a drinking-present to Philip, give it carelessly to him, Dem.; Pass., c. gen. pretii, προπέποται τῆς αὐτίκα χάριτος τὰ τῆς πόλεως πράγματα the interests of the state have been sacrificed for mere present pleasure, Dem.

div1.head: προπίπτω
div1.sense: to fall or throw oneself forward, as in rowing, προπεσόντες ἔρεσσον, like Lat. incumbere remis, Od.:—of suppliants, to fall prostrate, Eur.
to rush forward, rush headlong, Soph., Theocr.
to move forwards, advance before the rest, Polyb.: to project, Polyb.
προπίτνω poet. for προπίπτω
to fall prostate, ἐς γᾶν Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: προπιστεύω
div1.sense: to trust or believe beforehand, Xen., Dem.

div1.head: προπλέω
div1.sense: to sail before, Thuc.

div1.head: πρόπλοος
div1.sense: sailing before or in advance, αἱ πρόπλοι νῆες the leading ships, Thuc.

div1.head: προποδίζω
div1.sense: to advance the foot, Il.

div1.head: προποδών
div1.sense: better written divisim πρὸ ποδῶν.

div1.head: προποιέω
div1.sense: to do before or beforehand, Hdt.; absol., προποιῆσαι to make the first move, Thuc.
to prepare beforehand, plup. pass. προεπεποίητο Hdt.

div1.head: προπολεμέω
div1.sense: to make war for or in defence of another, τινός Isocr., etc.; ὑπέρ τινος Plat.: absol., οἱ προπολεμοῦντες the guards or defenders of a country, Plat.; τὸ προπολεμῆσον the body intended to act as guards, Arist.

div1.head: προπόλευμα
div1.sense: service done, πρ. δάφνης its service or use, = πρόπολος δάφνη, Eur.

div1.head: πρόπολος
div1.sense: employing oneself before:
a servant that goes before one, an attendant, minister, Aesch., Eur., etc.: a rower, Pind.
one who serves a god, a minister, Hhymn., Ar.:—generally, a temple-servant, bedel, like νεωκόρος, Hdt., Ar., etc.
as adj. ministering to a thing, devoted to it, Pind.

div1.head: προπομπεύω
div1.sense: to go before in a procession, τινός before him or it, Luc.

div1.head: προπομπή
div1.sense: an attending, escorting, Xen.:— a processional escort, Plut.

div1.head: προπομπός
div1.sense: escorting, esp. in a procession, Xen.: c. acc., πρ. χοάς carrying drink-offerings in procession, Aesch.
as Subst. a conductor, escort, attendant, Aesch., Xen.

div1.head: προπονέω
div1.sense: to work or labour beforehand, Xen.
to work for or instead of another τινός Xen.
c. gen. rei, to work for, work so as to obtain, τῶν εὐφροσυνῶν Xen.
c. acc. rei, to obtain by previous labour, Luc.:—Pass., τὰ προπεπονημένα the things so obtained, Xen.
Mid. to sink under affliction, Soph.

div1.head: Προποντίς
div1.sense: the fore-sea, i. e. the Sea of Marmora, that leads into the Pontus, Hdt., Aesch.

div1.head: προπορεύομαι
div1.sense: Pass., with aor1 mid., to go before or forward, Xen.
to come forward, Polyb.
to be promoted, advance, Polyb.

div1.head: προπορίζομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be provided beforehand, Luc.

div1.head: πρόποσις
div1.sense: a drinking to one, Polyb.

div1.head: προπότης
div1.sense: one who drinks healths, προπόται θίασοι bands of revellers, Eur.

div1.head: πρόπους
div1.sense: the projecting foot of a mountain, its lowest part, Polyb., etc.

div1.head: προπράσσω
div1.sense: to do before, Arist., Luc.
to exact, Aesch.

div1.head: προπρεών
div1.sense: metaph. friendly, kindly, Pind.

div1.head: προπρηνής
div1.sense: with the face downwards, Lat. pronus, Il.; φασγάνῳ προπρηνέϊ with the edge of the sword, Od.:—neut. προπρηνές as adv., forward, Il.

div1.head: προπροκυλίνδομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to keep rolling before another, roll at his feet, c. gen., προπροκυλινδόμενος πατρὸς Διός Il.; absol. roaming on for ever, Od.

div1.head: πρόπρυμνα
div1.sense: away from the stern, πρ. ἐκβολὰν φέρει, of throwing over the freight to save the vessel, metaph. in Aesch.

div1.head: προπύλαιος
div1.sense: before the gate, of the statues of gods, Ar.
προπύλαια, ων, τά, the gateway of temples, Hdt., Ar., etc.:—in sg., Anth.

div1.head: πρόπυλον
div1.sense: in pl., like προπύλαια, Hdt., Soph., etc.; in sg., Anth.

div1.head: προπυνθάνομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:— to learn by inquiring before, hear beforehand, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: πρόπυργος
div1.sense: offered for the towers, i. e. for the city, θυσίαι Aesch.

div1.head: προρέω
div1.sense: to flow forward, flow amain, of rivers, Hom.

div1.head: πρόρρησις
div1.sense: a foretelling, prediction, a previous instruction or warning, Thuc.
public notice, a proclamation, πολεμεῖν ἐκ προρρήσεως Dem.

div1.head: πρόρρητος
div1.sense: proclaimed, commanded, Soph.

div1.head: πρόρριζος
div1.sense: by the roots, root and branch, utterly, Lat. radicitus, Il.; πρόρριζόν τινα ἀνατρέπειν Hdt.; ἐκτρίβειν Eur.; πρόρριζος ἔφθαρται Soph.

div1.head: προσάββατον
div1.sense: the fore-sabbath, eve of the sabbath, NTest.

div1.head: προσαγγέλλω
div1.sense: to announce, τινά τινι Luc.
to denounce, τῇ βουλῇ τινά Plut.

div1.head: προσαγορευτέος
div1.sense: to be called or named, Plat.
προσαγορευτέον, one must call, τινά τι Arist.

div1.head: προσαγορεύω
div1.sense: to address, greet, accost, Lat. salutare, Hdt.: Pass., δυστυχοῦντες οὐ προσαγορευόμεθα in misfortune we are not spoken to, Thuc.
c. dupl. acc. to address or greet as so and so, Δίκαν δέ νιν προσαγορεύομεν Aesch.; τὸν αὐτὸν πατέρα πρ. Xen.: —c. inf., πρ. τινὰ χαίρειν to bid one hail or farewell, Ar.
to call by name, call so and so, τὸν Ἀγαμέμνονα πρ. ποιμένα λαῶν Xen.; τί τὴν πόλιν προσαγορεύεις; Plat.

div1.head: προσάγω
div1.etym: fut. mid. προσάξομαι in pass. sense
div1.sense: to bring to or upon, τίς δαίμων τόδε πῆμα προσήγαγε; Od.; θυσίας πρ. τινί Hdt.; πρ. πάντα to furnish, supply, Xen.
to put to, add, ἅμα ἠγόρευε καὶ ἔργον προσῆγε Hdt.
to put to, bring to, move towards, apply, like Lat. applicare, τὴν ἄνω γνάθον πρ. τῇ κάτω Hdt.; ὀφθαλμὸν πρ. κεγχρώμασι to apply the eye closely to the eyelet-holes, Eur.
of meats, to set before, βρώματά τινι Xen.
metaph., πρ. ὅρκον τινί to put an oath to him, make him take it, Hdt.
in military sense, to bring up for the attack, move on towards, τῇ Ποτιδαίᾳ τὸν στρατόν Thuc.; στρατιὰν πρ. πρὸς πολεμίους, πρ. μηχανὰς πόλει Thuc.
metaph., τὰς ἀνάγκας Thuc.; πρ. τόλμαν to apply or put forth daring, Eur.
πρ. φόρον to bring in tribute, Thuc.
to bring to or before, τῷ Κύρῳ τοὺς αἰχμαλώτους Xen.: to introduce, τινὰ πρὸς τὸν δῆμον, πρὸς τὴν βουλήν Thuc.; πρ. τοὺς πρέσβεις Dem.
Pass. to attach oneself to, τινι Thuc.
seemingly intr. (sub. ἑαυτόν, στρατόν, etc.), to draw near, approach, esp. in a hostile sense, Xen.
(sub. ναῦν) to bring to, come to land, Polyb.
Mid. to bring or draw to oneself, attach to oneself, bring over to oneʼs side, Lat. sibi conciliare, Hdt., Thuc., etc.; πάντων πρ. ὄμματα to draw all eyes upon oneself, Xen.
absol. to draw to oneself, embrace, Eur., Ar.
c. inf. to induce one to do a thing, ἡ Σφὶγξ σκοπεῖν ἡμᾶς προσήγετο Soph.; προσάξομαι δάμαρτʼ ἐᾶν σε will induce her to suffer thee, Eur.
to take to oneself, to take up, ὀστᾶ Eur.; τὰ ναυάγια Thuc.:— to procure, import, Xen.; τὰ προσαχθέντα imports, Xen.

div1.head: προσαγωγεύς
div1.sense: one who brings to: πρ. λημμάτων one who hunts for anotherʼs profit, a jackal, Dem.

div1.head: προσαγωγή
div1.sense: a bringing to or up to, a bringing up, Polyb.
a bringing to, acquisition, ξυμμάχων Thuc.
(intr.) a solemn approach, as at festivals or in supplication, Hdt.
approach, access to a person, esp. to a kingʼs presence, Xen., NTest.

div1.head: προσαγωγός
div1.sense: attractive, persuasive, Thuc., Luc.

div1.head: προσᾴδω
div1.sense: to sing to, Theocr.
πρ. τραγῳδίαν to sing the songs in a Tragedy to music, Ar.
to harmonise, chime in, τινί with one, Soph.; absol., Plat.

div1.head: προσαιθρίζω
div1.sense: to raise high in air, Aesch.

div1.head: προσαιρέομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to choose for oneself, ἑαυτῷ πρ. τινα to take for oneʼs companion or ally, Lat. cooptare, Hdt.
generally, to choose in addition to, τινά τινι Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: προσαΐσσω
div1.sense: to rush to, Od.; ὀμίχλη πρ. ὄσσοις a cloud comes over my eyes, Aesch.

div1.head: προσαιτέω
div1.sense: to ask besides, αἷμα πρ. to demand more blood, Aesch.; πρ. μισθόν to demand higher pay, Xen.
c. acc. pers. to importune, ask an alms of, Hdt.: c. acc. rei, to beg for a thing, Eur.: c. dupl. acc. to beg somewhat of one, Eur., Xen.:—absol. to beg hard, to be importunate, Eur., Ar.

div1.head: προσαίτης
div1.sense: a beggar, Luc.

div1.head: προσαιτιάομαι
div1.sense: to accuse besides, τινα Plut.

div1.head: προσακοντίζω
div1.sense: to shoot like a javelin, Luc.

div1.head: προσακούω
div1.sense: to hear besides, Xen.

div1.head: προσακροβολίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to skirmish with besides, Polyb.

div1.head: προσακτέος
div1.sense: one must bring to or near, Plat.
one must introduce, Arist.

div1.head: προσαλείφω
div1.sense: to rub or smear upon, τί τινι Od.

div1.head: προσάλλομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to jump up at one, like a dog, Xen.

div1.head: προσάλπειος
div1.sense: near the Alps, Strab.

div1.head: προσαμείβομαι
div1.sense: Mid., to answer, τινα Theocr.

div1.head: προσαμέλγομαι
div1.sense: Pass, with fut. mid. to yield milk besides, Theocr.

div1.head: προσαμύνω
div1.sense: to come to aid, τινί Il.

div1.head: προσαμφιέννυμι
div1.sense: to put on over, τί τινα Ar.

div1.head: προσαναβαίνω
div1.sense: to go up or mount besides, Xen.:— to rise higher, as a swollen river, Polyb.: metaph., πρ. τῷ Ῥωμύλῳ to go back to Romulus, Plut.

div1.head: προσανάβασις
div1.sense: a going up, ascent, κλίμακος προσαμβάσεις ascent by means of ladders, i. e. scaling ladders, Aesch., Eur.; πρ. Eur.; τειχέων πρ. a place where they may be approached, Eur.; δωμάτων πρ. i. e. the steps leading to the house, Eur.

div1.head: προσαναγιγνώσκω
div1.sense: to read besides, Aeschin.

div1.head: προσαναγκάζω
div1.sense: to force or constrain besides, Thuc.
to bring under command or discipline, Thuc.
c. acc. et inf. to force one to do, Hhymn.; πρ. τινὰ παρεῖναι, ὁμολογεῖν Xen.; but inf. omitted, τοὺς μὴ δεχομένους τὰς σπονδὰς πρ. (sc. δέχεσθαι) Thuc.

div1.head: προσαναγορεύω
div1.sense: to announce besides, Plat.

div1.head: προσαναγράφω
div1.sense: to record besides, Luc.

div1.head: προσανάγω
div1.sense: seemingly intr. πρ. τῇ γῇ to put back to land, Plut.

div1.head: προσαναιρέω
div1.sense: to lift up besides: Mid. to take upon oneself besides, πόλεμον Thuc.
to destroy besides, τἀληθές Arist.
of an oracle, to give an answer besides, Plat.; πρ. τινὶ ποιεῖν τι Dem.

div1.head: προσαναισιμόομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be spent besides, Hdt.

div1.head: προσανακαλύπτω
div1.sense: to disclose besides, Strab.

div1.head: προσανάκλιμα
div1.sense: that on which one leans, Anth.

div1.head: προσαναλαμβάνω
div1.sense: to take in besides, Dem.:—Pass., πλειόνων προσαναλαμβανομένων εἰς τὴν σύγκλητον, of a batch of new senators, Plut.
to recal to strength: intr. to recover, Polyb.

div1.head: προσαναλίσκω
div1.sense: to lavish or consume besides, Plat., Dem.

div1.head: προσαναπαύω
div1.sense: Mid. or Pass. to sleep beside, τινι Plut.

div1.head: προσαναπληρόω
div1.sense: to fill up or replenish besides, Arist., NTest.:—Mid. to add so as to fill up, Plat.

div1.head: προσαναρρήγνυμι
div1.sense: to break off besides, Plut.

div1.head: προσανασείω
div1.sense: to shake up or about besides:— Pass. to be roused still further, Polyb.; δίκαι αὐτῷ προσανεσείοντο were being promoted against him, Plut.

div1.head: προσαναστέλλω
div1.sense: to hold back besides, τὸν ἵππον Plut.

div1.head: προσανατέλλω
div1.sense: to rise up towards, Eur.

div1.head: προσανατίθημι
div1.sense: Mid. to take an additional burden on oneself, Xen.; but, πρ. τί τινι to contribute of oneself to another, NTest.
προσανατίθεσθαί τινι to take counsel with one, NTest.

div1.head: προσανατρέχω
div1.sense: to run back, retrace past events, Polyb.

div1.head: προσανατρίβω
div1.sense: Mid. to rub oneself upon or against a thing, to frequent the gymnasium, Theophr.

div1.head: προσανεῖπον
div1.sense: to declare, publish, order besides, Xen.

div1.head: προσανέρπω
div1.sense: to creep up to, Plut.

div1.head: προσανερωτάω
div1.sense: to ask or inquire further, Plat.

div1.head: προσανευρίσκω
div1.sense: to find out besides, Strab.

div1.head: προσανέχω
div1.sense: to wait patiently for a thing, c. dat., Polyb.:—also c. acc., Polyb.

div1.head: προσάντης
div1.sense: rising up against, uphill, steep, Lat. adversus, Pind., Thuc.
metaph. arduous, irksome, adverse, Hdt., Eur., etc.
of persons, adverse, hostile, τινί to one, Eur.; πρ. πρός τι setting oneself against it, Xen.

div1.head: προσαντιλαμβάνομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to take hold of one another, τῶν χειρῶν by the hands, Strab.

div1.head: προσαξιόω
div1.sense: to demand besides, Polyb.

div1.head: προσαπαγγέλλω
div1.sense: to announce besides, Xen.

div1.head: προσαπαιτέω
div1.sense: to require from as a duty besides, Luc.

div1.head: προσαπατάω
div1.sense: to deceive besides, Strab.

div1.head: προσαπειλέω
div1.sense: to threaten besides, ap. Dem.

div1.head: προσαπερείδομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to rely mainly upon, Polyb.

div1.head: προσαποβάλλω
div1.sense: to throw away besides, Ar.

div1.head: προσαποδείκνυμι
div1.sense: to demonstrate besides, Plat.
to declare besides, Strab.

div1.head: προσαποδίδωμι
div1.sense: to pay as a debt besides, Dem.
to add by way of completing, Strab.

div1.head: προσαποκρίνομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to answer with some addition, Plat.

div1.head: προσαποκτείνω
div1.sense: to kill besides, Xen.

div1.head: προσαπόλλυμι
div1.sense: to destroy besides or also, Hdt., Eur.:—Mid. aor2 -ωλόμην: perf. -όλωλα:— to perish besides or with others, Hdt., Dem.
to lose besides, τὴν ἀρχήν Hdt., Plat.

div1.head: προσαποπέμπω
div1.sense: to send away or off besides, Ar.

div1.head: προσαπορέω
div1.sense: to propose a further difficulty, Arist.

div1.head: προσαποστέλλω
div1.sense: to despatch besides, Thuc.

div1.head: προσαποστερέω
div1.sense: to defraud of besides, τῆς νίκης Dem.

div1.head: προσαποτιμάω
div1.sense: to estimate besides, Dem.

div1.head: προσαποτίνω
div1.sense: to pay besides, Plat.

div1.head: προσαποφέρω
div1.sense: to carry off besides:—Pass. to be returned besides as liable to taxation, Dem.

div1.head: προσαπτέος
div1.sense: one must apply, τινί τι Plat.

div1.head: προσάπτω
div1.sense: to fasten or attach to, attribute, τί τινι Il., Soph., etc.:—in bad sense, to fix upon, μή τι χρέος ἐμᾷ πόλει προσάψῃς Soph.
c. acc. only, to apply, Eur.
to deliver or confide to, ναυτικόν τινι Xen.
intr. to be added, εἰ κακοῖς κακὰ προσάψει Soph.
Mid. to fasten oneself upon, to lay hold of, reach, touch, Xen.
to meddle with, c. gen., Aeschin.

div1.head: προσαραρίσκω
div1.sense: to fit to:—intr., to be fitted to, ἐπίσσωτρα προσαρηρότα tires firmly fitted, Il.: an Ionic perf. pass. προσαρήρεται Hes.

div1.head: προσαράσσω
div1.sense: to dash against, πρ. ναῦς σκοπέλοις Plut.

div1.head: προσαρκέω
div1.sense: to yield needful aid, succour, assist, τινί Soph.; absol., Soph., Eur.

div1.head: προσάρκτιος
div1.sense: towards the north, Strab.

div1.head: προσαρμόζω
div1.sense: to fit to, attach closely to, τί τινι Eur.; εἴς τι Plat.
metaph. to adapt, Plat.
c. acc. only, πρ. τὴν χεῖρα to fit it on to the stump, Xen.; πρ. δῶρα to add fitting gifts, Soph.
intr. to attach oneself: to suit or agree with a thing, τινί Plat.; πρός τι Xen.

div1.head: προσαρτάω
div1.sense: to fasten or attach to, τί τινι Babr.:—Pass. to be fastened or attached to, προσηρτημένον τῷ καλῷ τὸ ἀγαθόν Xen.: to accrue to one, λῆμμα προσήρτηται Dem.

div1.head: προσατιμόομαι
div1.sense: to be deprived of civil rights besides, Dem.: Pass., perf. part. προσητιμωμένος Dem.

div1.head: προσαυαίνομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to wither away upon, πέτραις Aesch.

div1.head: προσαυδάω
div1.sense: to speak to, address, accost, τινά Il., Trag.
c. acc. to address words to one, Il.
to speak of, τύχαν σέθεν Eur.:—Pass., ἀδελφὴ προσηυδώμην was addressed as sister, Soph.

div1.head: προσαύλειος
div1.sense: near a farm-yard, rustic, Eur.

div1.head: προσαύω
div1.sense: to burn against, πρὶν πυρὶ θερμῷ πόδα τις προσαύσῃ Soph.

div1.head: προσαφαιρέω
div1.sense: to take away besides, Dem.

div1.head: προσαφικνέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to arrive at a place or to arrive and join a force, Thuc.
to approach, τινα Anth.

div1.head: προσαφίστημι
div1.sense: to cause to revolt besides, Thuc.

div1.head: προσβαίνω
div1.sense: to step upon, Hom., Il.; πρὸς τὸ κάτω τοῦ τόξου τῷ ἀριστερῷ ποδὶ πρ., so as to get a purchase in drawing it, Xen.
to go to or towards, approach, c. acc. loci, Hom., etc.; —c. dat., Plat.
to mount, ascend, Hdt., Soph.
absol. to step on, advance, Soph.
metaph. to come upon, τίς σε προσέβα μανία; Soph.; ἄλλοις ἄλλα πρ. ὀδύνα Eur.

div1.head: προσβάλλω
div1.sense: to strike or dash against, τί τινι Il.; ἀψῖδα πέτρῳ πρ. letting it dash against, Eur.; τὸν πρὶν ὄλβον ἕρματι πρ. to wreck his happiness on a rock, Aesch.; πρ. θηρία τινί to set them on him, Dem.; πρ. δόρυ τινί Eur.:—without any notion of violence, to put to, apply, μαλακὰν χέρα πρ. ἕλκει of a surgeon, Pind.; πρ. παρειὰν παρηίδι Eur.; ὄμματα τέκνοις Eur.

to assign to, procure for, κέρδος τινί Hdt.; πρ. Λακεδαιμονίοις Ὀλυμπιάδα to give them the honour of an Olympic victory, Hdt.; πρ. κακὸν τῇ πόλει Aesch.; εὔκλειαν σαυτῇ Soph.; πρ. δεῖμά τινι, Lat. incutere timorem alicui, Eur.
with acc. of the object struck, ἀρούρας προσβάλλειν, of the Sun, to strike the earth with his rays, Hom.; of smells, βροτοῦ ὀσμὴ με προσέβαλε Ar.
metaph. to attend to a thing or to add, Soph.
μή μʼ ἀνάγκῃ προσβάλῃς τάδʼ εἰκαθεῖν do not drive me by force to give way, Soph.
intr. to strike against, to make an attack or assault upon, τινί Aesch., etc.; πρὸς τὸ τεῖχος Hdt.:—absol. to attack, charge, Hdt.; προσβαλὼν αἱρεῖ τὴν πόλιν by assault, Xen.
to put in with a ship, ἐς τὸν λιμένα Thuc.; πρὸς Τάραντα Thuc.; c. dat., Σικελίᾳ Thuc.
Mid. to throw oneself upon, attack, τινα Il.

div1.head: πρόσβασις
div1.sense: a means of approach, access, Hdt., Thuc.; προσβάσεις πύργων means of approaching the towers, Eur.

div1.head: προσβατός
div1.sense: accessible, τινι Xen.; χωρίον ἔνθα οὐ προσβατὸν θανάτῳ where was no point accessible by death, Xen.

div1.head: προσβιάζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to compel, constrain, τινα Ar.
aor1 προσβιασθῆναι, in pass. sense, to be forced or hard pressed, Thuc.

div1.head: προσβιβάζω
div1.sense: to make to approach, bring nearer, τινά Plat.
metaph. to bring over, persuade, εὖ προσβιβάζεις με Ar., Xen.: of things, πρ. τι κατὰ τὸ εἰκός to bring it into accordance with probability, Plat.

div1.head: προσβιόω
div1.sense: to live longer, Plut.

div1.head: προσβλέπω
div1.sense: to look at or upon, τινά Trag.:—rarely c. dat., Xen., Plut.
of things, to regard, Soph., Dem.

div1.head: προσβοάω
div1.sense: Mid. to call to oneself, call in, Hdt.

div1.head: προσβοηθέω
div1.sense: to come to aid, come up with succour, προσβωθῆσαι ἐς τὴν Βοιωτίην Hdt.: absol., Thuc.

div1.head: προσβολή
div1.sense: a putting to, application, e. g. of the touchstone (v. βάσανος), Aesch.; of the cupping-glass, Arist.; φίλιαι πρ. προσώπων, of kisses, Eur.; absol. a kiss or embrace, Eur.
(from intr. sense) a falling upon, an attack, assault, Hdt., etc.; πρ. Ἀχαιΐς an assault of the Achaeans, Aesch.
generally, attacks, assaults, visitations, προσβολαὶ Ἐρινύων Aesch.; μιασμάτοιν Aesch.

without any hostile sense, an approach, a means of approach, προσβολὴν ἔχειν τῆς Σικελίας to afford a means of entering Sicily, Thuc.:—of ships, a landing-place, place to touch at, Thuc.; ἐν προσβολῇ εἶναι to be a place for ships to touch at, Thuc.

div1.head: πρόσβορρος
div1.sense: exposed to the north, Eur.

div1.head: προσβραχής
div1.sense: somewhat shallow, Strab.

div1.head: πρόσγειος
div1.sense: near the earth, near the ground, Luc.

div1.head: προσγελάω
div1.sense: to look laughing at one, τινά Hdt., Eur., etc.; c. acc. cogn., προσγελᾶτε τὸν πανύστατον γέλων smile your last smile upon me, Eur.
metaph., like Lat. arrideo, to delight, ὀσμὴ βροτείων αἱμάτων με προσγελᾷ Aesch.

div1.head: προσγίγνομαι
div1.sense: Dep.
to come or go to, to attach oneself to another, τινι Hdt., etc.; τοῖς προσγιγνομένοις by the reinforcements, Thuc.
generally, to be added, accrue, Lat. accedere, Hdt., Eur., etc.
to come to, happen to, τινι Soph.

div1.head: προσγράφω
div1.sense: to write besides, add in writing, Dem.:—Pass., τὰ προσγεγραμμένα conditions added to a treaty, Xen.:—Mid. to cause to be registered besides, Dem.

div1.head: προσγυμνάζω
div1.sense: to exercise at or in a thing, Plat.:—Pass., προσγεγυμνασμένος πολέμῳ Plut.

div1.head: προσδανείζω
div1.sense: to lend besides: Mid. to have lent one, i. e. to borrow, besides, Xen.

div1.head: προσδαπανάω
div1.sense: to spend besides, Luc.

div1.head: πρόσδεγμα
div1.sense: a reception, Soph.

div1.head: προσδεής
div1.sense: needing besides, yet lacking, τινος Plat.

div1.head: προσδέρκομαι
div1.sense: Dep.
to look at, behold, Od., Aesch., etc.
to look closely, Soph.

div1.head: πρόσδετος
div1.sense: tied to a thing, τινι Eur.

div1.head: προσδέχομαι
div1.sense: Dep.
to receive favourably, accept, Hdt.: to receive hospitably, Soph., etc.: to admit into a place, Thuc.: to admit to citizenship, Plat.
to admit an argument, Thuc.

Epic part. ποτιδέγμενος, waiting for or expecting, Hom.; so, προσδεκομένους τοιοῦτο οὐδέν Hdt.; τῷ Νικίᾳ προσδεχομένῳ ἦν was according to his expectation, Thuc.: —c. acc. et inf. fut. to expect that . . , Hdt., etc.
absol. to wait patiently, Hom.

div1.head: προσδέω
div1.sense: to bind on or to attach, Hdt.

div1.head: προσδέω
div1.sense: act.
to need besides, c. gen., Eur.
impers. προσδεῖ there is still need of, c. gen. rei, Thuc., Xen., etc.; c. inf., ἔτι προσδεῖ ἐρέσθαι Plat.
dep. προσ-δέομαι.
to be in want of, stand in need of, require besides, τινος Thuc., etc.; ἢν τι προσδέωμαι if I be at all in want, Xen.: c. inf. to desire also to do a thing, Xen.
rarely impers. = προσδεῖ, Xen.
to beg or ask of another, τί τινος Hdt.: —c. acc. pers. et inf. to intreat one to do, Hdt.; c. gen. pers. et inf. to beg of one to do, Hdt.

div1.head: προσδηλέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to ruin or destroy besides, Hdt.

div1.head: προσδιαβάλλω
div1.sense: to insinuate besides, Plut.
to slander besides, Plut.

div1.head: προσδιαιρέω
div1.sense: Mid. to distinguish further, Arist.

div1.head: προσδιαλέγομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to answer in conversation or disputation, Hdt.

div1.head: προσδιαμαρτυρέω
div1.sense: to testify in addition, Aeschin.

div1.head: προσδιανέμω
div1.sense: to distribute besides, Plut.: —Mid., in pl., to divide among themselves besides, Dem.

div1.head: προσδιαπράσσω
div1.sense: to accomplish besides, Xen.

div1.head: προσδιασαφέω
div1.sense: to add by way of explanation, Polyb.

div1.head: προσδιαφθείρω
div1.sense: to destroy besides, Soph.: —Pass. to perish besides, Isocr.

div1.head: προσδιδάσκω
div1.sense: to teach besides, Plat.

div1.head: προσδίδωμι
div1.sense: to give besides, Soph., Eur., etc.

div1.head: προσδιηγέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to narrate besides, Theophr.

div1.head: προσδικάζω
div1.sense: Mid. make a further claim in a lawsuit, Dem.

div1.head: προσδιορθόω
div1.sense: Mid. to correct besides, Aeschin.

div1.head: προσδιορίζω
div1.sense: to define or specify besides, Dem.:—so in Mid., Arist.

div1.head: προσδοκάω
div1.sense: to expect:

c. inf. fut. to expect that one will do or that a thing will be, Hdt., etc.; so, c. inf. aor. and ἄν, that one would do or that a thing would be, Ar., etc.; without ἄν, Μενελέων προσδόκα μολεῖν expect his arrival, Aesch.
c. inf. praes. to think, suppose that one is doing or that a thing is, Eur.
c. acc. rei, to expect, look for a thing, Aesch., etc.; πρ. τινά to expect, wait for a person, Eur., etc.
Pass., τὸ προσδοκώμενον, opp. to τὸ ἄελπτον, Plat., etc.

div1.head: προσδοκέω
div1.sense: to be thought besides, c. inf., ἀπειρόκαλος προσέδοξεν εἶναι Dem.

div1.head: προσδοκητός
div1.sense: expected, Aesch.

div1.head: προσδοκία
div1.sense: a looking for, expectation, μέλλοντος κακοῦ, θανάτου Plat.:—absol. Dem.:—foll. by a relat. word, προσδοκία ἦν μὴ . . or μὴ οὐ . . , Thuc.; προσδοκίαν παρέχειν ὡς . . , Thuc.
with Preps., πρὸς προσδοκίαν according to expectation, Thuc.

div1.head: προσδόκιμος
div1.sense: expected, looked for, or to be expected, Hdt.
often of persons, προσδόκιμος ἐς τὴν Κύπρον, ἐπὶ τὴν Μίλητον πρ. expected to come to Cyprus, against Miletus, Hdt.; τοῦ βαρβάρου προσδοκίμου ὄντος Thuc.

div1.head: προσεάω
div1.sense: to suffer to go further, τινά NTest.

div1.head: προσεγγίζω
div1.sense: to approach, τινί Anth.

div1.head: προσεγγράφω
div1.sense: to inscribe besides upon a pillar, Hdt.: to add a limiting clause, Aeschin.

div1.head: προσεγγυάομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to become surety besides, πρ. τινα ὀφλήματος to become his surety also for the sum owed, Dem.

div1.head: προσεγκελεύομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to exhort besides, Plut.

div1.head: προσεγχρίω
div1.sense: to besmear besides or once more, Anth.

div1.head: προσεδαφίζω
div1.sense: to fasten to the ground: Pass., perf., κύτος προσηδάφισται the shield is made solid, Aesch.

div1.head: προσεδρεία
div1.sense: a sitting by:
a besieging, blockade, Lat. obsessio, Thuc.
a sitting by a sick-bed, Eur.

div1.head: προσεδρεύω
div1.sense: to sit near, be always at his side, c. dat., Eur., Dem.; πρ. τῷ διδασκαλείῳ to be in regular attendance at the school, Dem.
metaph. to sit by and watch, τοῖς πράγμασι Dem.

div1.head: πρόσεδρος
div1.sense: sitting near, πρ. λιγνύς smoke hanging about, Soph.

div1.head: προσεθίζω
div1.sense: to accustom or inure one to a thing, τινά τι Xen.; c. acc. et inf., Xen.:—Pass. to accustom oneself to a thing, τινι Xen.

div1.head: προσεῖδον
div1.etym: aor2 without any pres. in use, προσοράω being used instead.
div1.sense: to look at or upon, Hdt., Aesch., etc.:—also in Mid. προσιδέσθαι, Pind., Aesch.
Pass. προσείδομαι, to be like, Aesch.

div1.head: προσεικάζω
div1.sense: to make like, assimilate, τί τινι Xen.:—Pass. to be like, resemble, τινι Aeschin.
metaph. to compare, τί τινι Aesch., Eur.; κακῷ δέ τῳ προσεικάζω τόδε I think this looks like mischief, Aesch.: to guess by comparison, conjecture, Aesch.

div1.head: προσείκελος
div1.sense: somewhat like, c. dat., Hdt.

div1.head: προσειλέω
div1.sense: to press or force towards, Il.; μὴ προσείλει χεῖρα press not your hand against me, Eur.

div1.head: πρόσειλος
div1.sense: towards the sun, sunny, Aesch.

div1.head: πρόσειμι
div1.sense: to be added to, be attached to, belong to, τινι Hdt., Soph., etc.

absol. to be there, be at hand, be present, Aesch., etc.; οὐδὲν ἄλλο προσῆν there was nothing else in the world, Dem.; τὰ προσόνθʼ ἑαυτῷ oneʼs own properties, Dem.; ταῦτα πρόσεσται this too will be ours, Xen.; τὸ προσόν the surplus, Dem.

div1.head: πρόσειμι
div1.etym: πρόσειμι used in Attic as fut. of προσέρχομαι
προσῄειν used in Attic as imperf. of προσέρχομαι
div1.sense: to go to or towards, approach, absol., Hom., Attic:—c. dat. pers. to go to, approach one, Hdt., etc.; πρ. Σωκράτει to visit him as teacher, Xen.:—c. acc. loci, δῶμα, δόμους Aesch., Eur.; πρ. εἰς . . , πρὸς . . , Soph., etc.
in hostile sense, to go or come against, attack, τῇ πόλει Xen.; πρός τινα Hdt.; ἐπί τινα Xen.
to come over to the side of, in war, Thuc.
to come forward to speak, πρ. τῷ δήμῳ Xen.; τῇ βουλῇ Dem.; πρὸς τὰς ἀρχάς Thuc.
of things, to be added, ἐλπὶς προσῄει hope alone was left, Aesch.
of Time, to come on, be at hand, ἐπεὰν προσίῃ ἡ ὥρη Hdt.; ἑσπέρα προσῄει Xen.
to come in, of revenue, Hdt., Thuc.; τὰ προσιόντα the revenue, Ar.

div1.head: προσεῖπον
div1.sense: to speak to one, to address, accost, Hom., etc.; πρ. ὀνόματί τινα Dem.:—c. dupl. acc., τί προσείπω σʼ ἔπος; Ar.
to address as so and so, πρ. τινὰ ὡς ἀλλότριον Plat.; πρ. τινὰ χαίρειν to bid him greeting, Eur.
to call so and so, to name, τί νιν προσείπω; Aesch.; τοῦτο γάρ σʼ ἔχω μόνον προσειπεῖν Soph.; ὅν μοι προσεῖπας πόσιν whom thou didst name my husband, Eur.

div1.head: προσεισπράσσω
div1.sense: to exact besides, Plut.

div1.head: προσείω
div1.sense: to hold out and shake, πρ. χεῖρα to shake it threateningly, Eur.; προσείειν ἀνασείειν τε τὸν πλόκαμον to wave it up and down, Eur.: metaph., πρ. φόβον to hold a thing out as a bugbear, Thuc.

div1.head: προσεκβάλλω
div1.sense: to cast out besides, Dem.
to draw out further, prolong, Strab.

div1.head: προσεκπέμπω
div1.sense: to send away besides, Xen.

div1.head: προσεκπυρόω
div1.sense: to set on fire besides, Luc.

div1.head: προσεκτέος
div1.sense: one must apply, Plat.: absol. one must attend, τινί to a thing, Aeschin.

div1.head: προσεκτικός
div1.sense: attentive, Xen.

div1.head: προσεκτίλλω
div1.sense: to pluck out besides, τὰ πτερά Ar.

div1.head: προσεκτίνω
div1.sense: to pay in addition, Plut.

div1.head: προσεκχλευάζω
div1.sense: to ridicule besides, τινά Dem.

div1.head: προσελαύνω
div1.sense: to drive or chase to a place, Thuc.:—Pass. to be driven or fixed to, πρός τι Plut.
seemingly intr.,
(sub. ἵππον) , to ride towards, ride up, Hdt., Xen.; οἱ προσελαύνοντες the cavalry, Xen.
(sub. στρατόν) , to march up, arrive, Xen.

div1.head: προσέλκω
div1.sense: to draw towards, draw on, τινά:—Mid. to draw towards oneself, attract, Theogn.; aor1 προσειλκυσάμην Eur.

div1.head: προσελλείπω
div1.sense: to be still wanting, Anth.

div1.head: προσεμβαίνω
div1.sense: to step upon, trample on, τινί Soph.

div1.head: προσεμβάλλω
div1.sense: to throw or put into besides, Plut.

div1.head: προσεμβλέπω
div1.sense: to look into besides, Xen.

div1.head: προσεμπικραίνομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be yet more angry with, τινί Hdt.

div1.head: προσεμφερής
div1.sense: resembling, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: προσενεχυράζω
div1.sense: to seize as an additional pledge for payment, Dem.

div1.head: προσεννέπω
div1.sense: to address, accost, Pind., Trag.; τάδε σʼ ἐγὼ πρ. I address these words to thee, Aesch.
c. inf. to intreat or command, τινὰ ποιεῖν τι Pind.
πρ. τινά τι to call by a name, Aesch.

div1.head: προσεννοέω
div1.sense: to think on, observe besides, Xen.

div1.head: προσεντείνω
div1.sense: to strain still more, πρ. πληγάς τινι to lay more blows on one, Dem.

div1.head: προσεντέλλομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to enjoin besides, Xen.

div1.head: προσεξαιρέω
div1.sense: Mid. to choose besides, Hdt.

div1.head: προσεξαμαρτάνω
div1.sense: to err besides or still more, Dem.

div1.head: προσεξανδραποδίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to enslave besides, Dem.

div1.head: προσεξανίσταμαι
div1.sense: to rise up to, πρός τι Plut.

div1.head: προσεξαπατάω
div1.sense: to deceive besides, Arist.

div1.head: προσεξελίσσω
div1.sense: to unrol besides: of soldiers, to wheel them half-round, Polyb.

div1.head: προσεξεργάζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to accomplish besides, Dem.; perf. -εξείργασμαι in pass. sense, Dem.

div1.head: προσεξερείδομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to support oneself by, ταῖς χερσί Polyb.

div1.head: προσεξετάζω
div1.sense: to search into besides, Dem.

div1.head: προσεξευρίσκω
div1.sense: to find out or devise besides, Ar.

div1.head: προσεξηπειρόω
div1.sense: to turn still more into dry land, Strab.

div1.head: πρόσεξις
div1.sense: attention, Plat.

div1.head: προσέοικα
div1.etym: no pres. προσείκω is in use
div1.sense: in Eur.:— to be like, resemble, c. dat., Eur., etc.
to seem fit, τὰ μὴ προσεικότα things not fit and seemly, Soph.; so, οὐκ ἐμοὶ προσεικότα Soph.
to seem to do, c. inf., Dem.

div1.head: προσεπαινέω
div1.sense: to praise besides, Aeschin.

div1.head: προσεπαιτιάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to accuse besides, Plut.

div1.head: προσεπεῖπον
div1.sense: to say besides, Plut.

div1.head: προσεπεξευρίσκω
div1.sense: to invent for any purpose besides, Thuc.

div1.head: προσεπιβάλλω
div1.sense: to add over and above, Isocr.

div1.head: προσεπιγράφω
div1.sense: to write on besides, Theophr.

div1.head: προσεπίκειμαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be urgent besides, Dem.

div1.head: προσεπικοσμέω
div1.sense: to embellish besides, Polyb.

div1.head: προσεπικτάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to acquire besides, Arist.; πρ. Λυδοῖσί τινας to add them to the Lydian realm, Hdt.

div1.head: προσεπιλαμβάνω
div1.sense: Mid. to take part with another in a thing, to help one in a thing besides, προσεπιλαβέσθαι τινὶ τοῦ πολέμου Hdt.

div1.head: προσεπιπλήσσω
div1.sense: to rebuke besides, τινί Arist.

div1.head: προσεπιπνέω
div1.sense: to blow favourably besides, Plut.

div1.head: προσεπιπονέω
div1.sense: to work still more, προσεπιπονεῖν ἀκούοντας to take the additional trouble of listening, Aeschin.

div1.head: προσεπιρρίπτω
div1.sense: to throw to besides, Aesop.

div1.head: προσεπισιτίζομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to provide oneself with further supplies of corn, Polyb.

div1.head: προσεπισκώπτω
div1.sense: to joke besides, Plut.

div1.head: προσεπίσταμαι
div1.sense: Dep. to know besides, Plat.

div1.head: προσεπιστέλλω
div1.sense: to notify, enjoin, command besides, esp. by letter (v. ἐπιστολή, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: προσεπισφραγίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to set oneʼs seal to a thing besides, to testify besides, πρ. τι εἶναι Dem.

div1.head: προσεπιτάσσω
div1.sense: Mid. to take oneʼs post, Polyb.

div1.head: προσεπιτείνω
div1.sense: to stretch still further, to lay more stress upon, τι Polyb.
to torture or punish yet more, τινά Polyb.

div1.head: προσεπιτέρπομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to enjoy oneself still more, Ar.

div1.head: προσεπιτίθημι
div1.sense: to add further, Arist.

div1.head: προσεπιτροπεύομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be under guardianship, Dem.

div1.head: προσεπιφέρω
div1.sense: to bear or produce besides, Xen.

div1.head: προσεπιφωνέω
div1.sense: to say besides, add, Plut.

div1.head: προσεπιχαρίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to gratify besides, τινι Xen.

div1.head: προσεργάζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to work in addition to, τί τινι Eur., Plut.; ἀγαθὰ πρ. τινι to do good service to one besides, Hdt.
to make or earn in addition, Xen.

div1.head: πρόσεργον
div1.sense: earnings, the interest of money, Dem.

div1.head: προσερείδω
div1.sense: to thrust against, Polyb., Plut.
intr. to press against, Polyb.

div1.head: προσερέσθαι
div1.sense: Mid. to ask besides, Plat.

div1.head: προσερεύγομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to belch at or against: metaph., of waves, to break foaming against, Hom.

div1.head: προσερέω
div1.etym: as fut. of προσ-αγορεύω, προσεῖπον being aor2
div1.sense: to speak to, address, accost, τινά Eur., etc.
c. dupl. acc. to call or name, πολίτας πρ. ἀλλήλους Plat.

div1.head: προσερίζω
div1.sense: to strive with or against, Theocr.

div1.head: προσέρπω
div1.sense: to creep to:

absol. to creep or steal on, Soph., Ar.:—metaph., ὁ πρ. χρόνος, i. e. the time thatʼs coming, Pind.; πᾶν τὸ πρ. everything that approaches, Aesch.; τὸ πρ. what is coming, the coming event, Soph.; αἱ προσέρπουσαι τύχαι Aesch.
to come to or upon, c. acc. pers., Pind.; c. dat. pers., σοὶ πρόσερπον τοῦτʼ ἐγὼ τὸ φάρμακον ὅρω, of punishment, Soph.

div1.head: προσέρχομαι
div1.etym: the Attic imperf. and fut. are προσῄειν, πρόσειμι
div1.sense: Dep.:

to come or go to, c. dat., Aesch., etc.; πρ. Σωκράτει to visit him as teacher, Xen.:—c. dat. loci, Aesch., Eur.; also c. acc. loci, Eur.; often also with Preps., ἐπί, εἰς, πρός· and with Advs., δεῦρο, πέλας:—absol. to approach, draw nigh, be nigh at hand, Hdt., Soph.
in hostile sense, πρ. πρός τινα Xen.
to come in, surrender, capitulate, Thuc.
to come forward to speak, πρ. τῷ δήμῳ Dem.; πρὸς τὸν δῆμον Aeschin.
to associate with one, πρός τινα Dem.
to come in, of revenue, Lat. redire, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: προσερωτάω
div1.sense: to question besides, τινά Plat.; Pass., Xen.
c. acc. rei, to ask besides, Arist.

div1.head: προσεσπέριος
div1.sense: towards the west, western, Polyb.

div1.head: προσέσπερος
div1.sense: = προσ-εσπέριος: τὰ ποθέσπερα, as adv. towards evening, Theocr.

div1.head: προσεταιρίζομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to take to oneself as a friend, associate with oneself, τινα Hdt.

div1.head: προσεταιριστός
div1.sense: joined with as a companion, attached to the same ἑταιρεία or club, Thuc.

div1.head: προσέτι
div1.sense: over and above, besides, Hdt., Ar., etc.

div1.head: προσευθύνω
div1.sense: to bring to an account besides, Arist.

div1.head: προσευπορέω
div1.sense: to provide besides, Dem.

div1.head: προσευρίσκω
div1.sense: to find besides or also, Soph.

div1.head: προσευχή
div1.sense: prayer, οἶκος προσευχῆς, of the Temple, NTest.
a place of prayer, an oratory or chapel, NTest., Juven.

div1.head: προσεύχομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:
to offer prayers or vows, Aesch., Eur., etc.
c. acc., πρ. τὸν θεόν to address him in prayer, Ar.
absol. to offer prayers, to worship, Hdt., Aesch., etc.
πρ. τι to pray for a thing, Xen.

div1.head: προσεφέλκομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to draw after one besides: metaph. to invite persons (to be citizens), Arist.

div1.head: προσεχής
div1.sense: of Place, next to, πρ. ἑστάναι τινί in battle, Hdt.:—in geogr. sense, bordering upon, marching with, adjoining, c. dat., Hdt.; οἱ προσεχέες their next neighbours, Hdt.
exposed to the wind, Strab.

div1.head: προσέχω
div1.sense: to hold to, offer, Aesch.: to bring to, τὴν ἀσπίδα προσίσχειν πρὸς τὸ δάπεδον Hdt.

πρ. ναῦν to bring a ship near a place, bring it to port, Hdt.; Μαλέᾳ προσίσχων πρῷραν Eur.; τίς σε προσέσχε χρεία; what need brought thee to land here? Soph.; alone, to put in, touch at a place, προσσχεῖν ἐς τὴν Σάμον, πρὸς τὰς νήσους Hdt.;—also c. dat. loci, πρ. τῇ νήσῳ, etc., Hdt.; also c. acc. loci, προσέσχες τήνδε γῆν Soph.:— absol. to land, Hdt., etc.

to turn to or towards a thing, πρ. ὄμμα Eur.; πρ. τὸν νοῦν to turn oneʼs mind to a thing, be intent on it, Lat. animadvertere, τινί or πρός τινι Ar., etc.; πρ. τὸν νοῦν πρός τινι Ar.:—absol., πρόσεχε τὸν νοῦν take heed, Ar.; so, πρ. τὴν γνώμην Thuc.
without τὸν νοῦν, πρ. ἑαυτῷ to give heed to oneself, Ar., Xen.; πρ. ἑαυτοῖς ἀπό τινος to be on oneʼs guard against, NTest.:—absol., προσέχων ἀκουσάτω attentively, Dem.
to devote oneself to a thing, Lat. totus esse in illo, c. dat., Hdt., Thuc., etc.
c. inf. to expect to do, Hdt.
Mid. to attach oneself to a thing, cleave to it, c. dat., Hdt., Ar.
Pass. to be held fast by a thing, ὑπό τινος Eur.:—metaph. to be implicated in a thing, c. dat., Thuc.
to have besides or in addition, Plat., Dem.

div1.head: προσεῷος
div1.sense: towards the east, Strab.

div1.head: προσζεύγνυμι
div1.sense: Pass. to be attached to, τινι Luc.

div1.head: προσζημιόω
div1.sense: to punish besides, Plat.

div1.head: πρόσηβος
div1.sense: near manhood, Xen.

div1.head: προσηγορέω
div1.sense: to address, Soph.: to console, Eur.

div1.head: προσηγόρημα
div1.sense: the object of oneʼs address, Eur.

div1.head: προσηγορία
div1.sense: an appellation, name, Isocr., Dem.

div1.head: προσηγορικός
div1.sense: of or for addressing, πρ. ὄνομα the Roman praenomen or cognomen, Plut.

div1.head: προσήγορος
div1.sense: addressing, accosting, αἱ πρ. δρύες the speaking oaks, Aesch.; τί ἐμοὶ προσήγορον; what word addressing me, i. e. addressed to me? Soph.; c. dupl. gen., Παλλάδος εὐγμάτων προσήγορος addressing prayers to her, Soph.
generally, conversable, mutually agreeable, Plat.
of things, agreeing, Plat.
pass. τῷ προσήγορος; by whom accosted? Soph.

div1.head: προσηκόντως
div1.sense: suitably, fitly, duly, πρ. τῇ πόλει as beseems the dignity of the state, Thuc.

div1.head: προσήκω
div1.sense: to have arrived at a place, to have come, be near at hand, be present, Trag.; πρ. ἐπὶ τὸν ποταμόν to reach to the river, Xen.

metaph. to belong to, εἰ τῷ ξένῳ προσήκει Λαΐῳ τι συγγενές if to the stranger there belongs any kin with Laius, Soph.; τῷ γὰρ προσήκει τόδε; whom does this concern? Soph.; so οὐδὲν πρὸς τὸ Πέρσας πρ. τὸ πάθος Hdt.:—of persons, to belong to, be related to, τινί Eur.; πρ. γένει Ar.:—c. inf., οὐ προσήκομεν κολάζειν τοῖσδε we do not belong to them to punish, i. e. it is not for them to punish us, Eur.
impers. it belongs to, concerns, τί οὖν προσήκει ἐμοὶ Κορινθίων; what have I to do with the Corinthians? Ar., etc.
c. dat. pers. et inf. it belongs to, beseems, οἷς προσῆκε πενθῆσαι Aesch.; οὔ σοι προσήκει προσφωνεῖν Soph.: —also c. acc. pers., οὔ σε προσήκει λέγειν ʼtis not meet that thou shouldʼst speak, Aesch.

in Partic. belonging to one, αἰτία οὐδέν μοι προσήκουσα Dem.; τὸ προσῆκον ἑκάστῳ ἀποδιδόναι, suum cuique reddere, Plat.:—absol., τὴν προσήκουσαν σωτηρίαν oneʼs own safety, Thuc.; τὰ μὴ προσήκοντα, ἀλλότρια, Thuc.
befitting, beseeming, proper, meet, Thuc.:— τὰ προσήκοντα what is fit, seemly, oneʼs duties, Xen.:— τὸ προσῆκον fitness, propriety, ἐκτὸς τοῦ προσήκοντος Eur.; μᾶλλον τοῦ πρ., παρὰ τὸ πρ. Plat.

of persons, related, akin, τοῖσι Κυψελίδαισι οὐδὲν ἦν προσήκων Hdt.; προσήκων βασιλεῖ Xen.;—and as Subst., οἱ πρ. τινος oneʼs relations, Thuc.; or οἱ πρ. alone, Hdt.: —hence, αἱ προσήκουσαι ἀρεταί hereditary fair fame, Thuc.
οὐδὲν προσήκων one who has nothing to do with the matter, Plat.; c. inf., οὐδὲν προσήκων ἐν γόοις παραστατεῖν having no concern with assisting one in sorrows, Aesch.
absol. in neut., οὐ προσῆκον though or since it is not fitting, Thuc., Plat.

div1.head: προσήλιος
div1.sense: towards the sun, exposed to the sun, sunny, Xen.

div1.head: προσηλόω
div1.sense: to nail, pin, or fix to, τί τινι, τι πρός τι Plat.
to nail up, τὰ παρασκήνια Dem.:—Pass. to be nailed to a plank, Dem.

div1.head: προσήλυτος
div1.sense: one that has arrived at a place, a sojourner, Lat. advena: one who has come over to Judaism, a convert, proselyte, NTest.

div1.head: πρόσημαι
div1.sense: to be seated upon or close to, c. dat., Aesch., Soph.; rarely c. acc., καρδίαν προσήμενος Aesch.:—generally, to be or lie near, νᾶσοι τᾷδε γᾷ προσήμεναι Aesch.
to besiege, Lat. obsidere, Eur.

div1.head: προσημαίνω
div1.sense: to presignify, foretell, announce, of the gods, Hdt., Eur., etc.
to declare beforehand, proclaim, τί τινι Eur.; πρ. τινι ποιεῖν τι to give them public notice to do . . , Hdt.

div1.head: προσημασία
div1.sense: a foretoken, prognostic, Strab.

div1.head: προσήνεμος
div1.sense: towards the wind, to windward, opp. to ὑπήνεμος, Xen.

div1.head: προσηνής
div1.note: προσ-ηνής, Doric προσ-ᾱνής, and ποτ-ᾱνής, ές
div1.sense: soft, gentle, kindly, Pind.; προσηνές τι λέγειν Thuc.
c. dat., λύχνῳ προσηνές, i. e. suitable for burning, Hdt. (For deriv., v. ἀπηνής
adv. -νῶς, Theophr.

div1.head: προσηχέω
div1.sense: to resound or re-echo, Plut.

div1.head: προσηῷος
div1.sense: towards the East, Theocr., Plut.

div1.head: προσθακέω
div1.sense: to sit beside or upon, ἕδραν Soph.

div1.head: πρόσθεν
div1.sense: prep. with gen.:

of Place, before, πρόσθʼ ἵππων Il., etc.; πρ. ποδῶν Od.; πρ. πυλάων, πρ. πόλιος before, i. e. outside, Il.;—in Attic with Art., ἐν τῷ πρ. τοῦ στρατεύματος in front of . . , Xen.; εἰς τὸ πρ. τῶν ὅπλων καθέζεσθαι Xen.
with collat. notion of defence, στὰς πρόσθε νεκύων Il.; πρόσθε φίλων τοκέων Il.
with Verbs of motion, πρ. ἔθεν φεύγοντα Il., etc.
metaph. before, in preference to, πρ. τιθέναι τί τινος Eur.
of Time, before, πρόσθʼ ἄλλων Il.; τοῦ χρόνου πρ. θανοῦμαι Soph.
as adv.:
of Place, before, in front, πρόσθε λέων ὄπιθεν δὲ δράκων Il.:— οἱ πρ. the frontrank men, opp. to οἱ ὄπισθεν, Il.:—Attic, ὁ πρ. Xen.; τὰ πρ. Xen.
with Verbs of motion, on, forward, πρ. ἡγεμονεύειν Od.; πάριτε ἐς τὸ πρ. Ar.

of Time, before, formerly, erst, Hom., etc.; οἱ πρόσθεν ἄνδρες the men of old, Il.; so, τοῦ πρ. Κάδμου Soph.; ἡ πρ. the elder, Eur.; so, οἱ πρ. πόνοι the former, earlier labours, Aesch.; ἡ πρ. ἡμέρα Xen.:—also, τὸ πρ., as adv., formerly, Hom.; τὰ πρ., Aesch.
foll. by a Relat., πρόσθεν, πρὶν . . , Lat. priusquam, mostly with a negat., Od., Xen.:—also, πρόσθεν ἢ . . Soph.; πρόσθεν πρὶν ἤ Xen.
like Lat. potius, πρ. ἀποθανεῖν ἢ . . to die sooner than . . , Xen.

div1.head: πρόσθεσις
div1.sense: a putting to, application of ladders to a wall, Thuc.; of the cupping-glass, Arist.
an adding, addition, Plat.

div1.head: προσθετέος
div1.sense: one must attribute, τινί τι Xen.

div1.head: πρόσθετος
div1.sense: added, put on, of false hair, Xen.
Lat. addictus, given up to the creditor, Plut.

div1.head: προσθέω
div1.sense: to run towards or to one, c. dat., τινί Thuc., Xen.; absol., Xen.

div1.head: προσθήκη
div1.sense: an addition, appendage, appendix, Hdt., Aesch.; ἐν προσθήκης μέρει by way of appendage, Dem.
something added, an accident, Dem.
assistance, προσθήκῃ θεοῦ Soph.

div1.head: προσθιγγάνω
div1.sense: to touch, τινός Soph., Eur.; absol., προσθιγών by his touch, Aesch.

div1.head: πρόσθιος
div1.sense: the foremost, opp. to ὀπίσθιος, οἱ πρ. πόδες the fore-feet, Hdt., etc.;— οἱ πρ. ὀδόντες, Arist.; χοροὶ οἱ πρ. the front rows of teeth, Ar.

div1.head: προσθόδομος
div1.sense: the former lord of a house, Aesch.

div1.head: προσθροέω
div1.sense: to address, call by a name, τινα Aesch.

div1.head: προσθύμιος
div1.sense: according to oneʼs mind, welcome, τινι Anth.

div1.head: προσιζάνω
div1.sense: to sit by or near, c. acc., πρὸς ἄλλοτʼ ἄλλον πημονὴ πρ. Aesch.:—metaph., c. dat., to cleave to, cling to, ἀρά μοι πρ. Aesch.

div1.head: προσίζω
div1.sense: to sit by, c. acc., Eur.

div1.head: προσίημι
div1.sense: to send to or towards, let come to, τινὰ πρὸς τὸ πῦρ Xen.: to apply, τί τινι Xen.
Mid. προσίεμαι, to let come to or near one, admit, πρ. τινὰ εἰς τὴν ὁμιλίαν Plat.; πρ. τοὺς βαρβάρους to let them approach, Xen.
to admit, allow, believe, τοῦτο μὲν οὐ προσίεμαι Hdt.; προσηκάμην τὸ ῥηθέν Eur.
to admit, accept, submit to, ξεινικὰ νόμαια Hdt.; πρ. τὰ προκεκηρυγμένα to accept the proposals, Thuc.; πρ. φάρμακον to take it, Xen.
to allow, approve, τὴν προδοσίην Hdt.; οὐδαμῆ πρ. οἱ θεοὶ τὸν πόλεμον Xen.
c. inf. to undertake or venture to do, Xen.:—also, to allow that, Xen.
c. acc. pers. to attach to oneself, attract, win, please, οὐδὲν προσίετό μιν nothing moved or pleased him, Hdt.; ἓν δʼ οὐ προσίεταί με one thing pleases me not, Ar.; τοῦτʼ οὐ δύναταί με προσέσθαι Ar.

div1.head: προσικνέομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:
to come to, reach, c. gen. to reach so far as, come at, Aesch., Ar.; also, πρ. ἐφʼ ἧπαρ Aesch.
to approach as a suppliant, c. acc. loci, Aesch.

div1.head: προσίκτωρ
div1.sense: one that comes to a god, a suppliant, Aesch.
pass. he to whom one comes as a suppliant, a protector, of a god, Aesch.

div1.head: προσιππεύω
div1.sense: to ride up to, charge, Thuc., Plut.

div1.head: προσίστημι
div1.sense: to place near, bring near, πρῷραν πρὸς κῦμα Eur.

Pass. προσίσταμαι, with aor2 and perf. act., to stand near to or by, c. dat., Hdt., Attic:—c. acc. with a notion of approaching, βωμὸν προσέστην Aesch.:—with a prep., πρ. πρὸς τῷ δικαστηρίῳ Aeschin.:—c. gen., καρδίας προσίσταται is in the region of the heart, Aesch.:—absol., Xen., etc.
metaph., προσίσταταί μοι it comes into my head, occurs to me, ὅ σοι προσέστη Plat.; also c. acc., ὡς ἄρα μιν προσέστη τοῦτο Hdt.
to set oneself against, to give offence to, τοῖς ἀκούουσιν Dem.

div1.head: προσιστορέω
div1.sense: to narrate besides, c. acc. et inf., Plut.

div1.head: προσιτέος
div1.sense: one must go to or approach, Xen.

div1.head: προσκαθέζομαι
div1.sense: to sit down before a town, besiege it, Lat. obsidere, πόλιν Thuc.; absol., Thuc.
to sit by, watch, τοῖς πράγμασιν Dem.

div1.head: προσκαθέλκω
div1.sense: to haul down besides, πλοῖα Plut.

div1.head: προσκάθημαι
div1.sense: to be seated by or near, live with, τινι Hdt., Theophr.
to sit down against a town, besiege it, Lat. obsidere, Hdt., Thuc., etc.

div1.head: προσκαθίζω
div1.sense: to sit down by or near, c. acc., θᾶκον οὐκ εὐδαίμονα Eur.; absol., Plat.:—Mid. to sit idle, Aeschin.
to sit down before a town, Polyb.

div1.head: προσκαθίστημι
div1.sense: to appoint besides, Plut.

div1.head: πρόσκαιρος
div1.sense: for a season, temporary, NTest., Luc.

div1.head: προσκαίω
div1.sense: to set on fire or burn besides:—Pass., σκεύη προσκεκαυμένα pots burnt at the fire, Ar.: metaph., προσκαίεσθαί τινι to be in love with . . , Xen.

div1.head: προσκαλέω
div1.sense: to call to, call on, summon, Thuc., etc.
to call on, invoke, Soph.
Mid., with perf. pass., to call to oneself, call to one, call to oneʼs aid, Hdt., Attic:—c. dupl. acc., ὃ προσκέκλημαι αὐτούς to which I have called them, NTest.

in Attic, of an accuser, to cite or summon into court, Ar., etc.; ὕβρεως for an assault, Ar.:—Pass. to be summoned, φόνου on a charge of murder, Dem., etc.; προσκληθεὶς δίκην εἰς Ἄρειον πάγον to have oneʼs cause called before the Areopagus, Arist.; ὁ προσκληθείς the party summoned, Dem.; so, ὁ προσκεκλημένος Ar.
to cite as witness, Dem.

div1.head: προσκάρδιος
div1.sense: at the heart, Bion.

div1.head: προσκαρτερέω
div1.sense: to persist obstinately in, Xen., etc.
to adhere firmly to a man, be faithful to him, τινί Dem.

div1.head: προσκαρτέρησις
div1.sense: perseverance, NTest.

div1.head: προσκαταβαίνω
div1.sense: to descend besides, Anth.

div1.head: προσκατάβλημα
div1.sense: that which is paid besides: in pl. sums paid to make up a deficiency in the revenue, Dem.

div1.head: προσκαταγιγνώσκω
div1.sense: to condemn besides, Antipho.
to award to, τί τινι Dem.

div1.head: προσκαταισχύνω
div1.sense: to disgrace still further, Plut.

div1.head: προσκατακλείω
div1.sense: to shut up besides: aor1 pass. -κατεκλείσθην Aesop.

div1.head: προσκαταλέγω
div1.sense: to enrol besides or in addition to, τινάς τισι Plut.:—Pass., Plut.
to reckon as belonging to, Strab.

div1.head: προσκαταλείπω
div1.sense: to leave besides as a legacy, ἀρχήν τινι Thuc.
to lose besides, τὰ αὑτῶν Thuc.

div1.head: προσκαταλλάττομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to become reconciled besides, Arist.

div1.head: προσκατανέμω
div1.sense: to assign besides, Plut.

div1.head: προσκαταριθμέω
div1.sense: to count besides, Plut.

div1.head: προσκατασκευάζω
div1.sense: to furnish besides, Dem.

div1.head: προσκατασύρω
div1.sense: to pull down besides, Anth.

div1.head: προσκατατάσσω
div1.sense: to append, subjoin, Polyb.

div1.head: προσκατατίθημι
div1.sense: to pay down besides or as a further deposit, Ar.

div1.head: προσκατηγορέω
div1.sense: to accuse besides, ἐπίδειξιν πρ. to accuse one also of making a display, Thuc.; πρ. τινὸς ὅτι . . Xen.

div1.head: πρόσκειμαι
div1.etym: on the Ionic forms v. κεῖμαι
div1.sense: to be placed or laid by or upon, to lie by or upon, οὔατα προσέκειτο handles were upon it, Il.; τῇ θύρᾳ προσκεῖσθαι to keep close to the door, Ar.; δοκοὶ τῷ τείχει προσκείμεναι lying near the wall, Thuc.:— ὁ προσκείμενος ἵππος the inside horse (turning a corner), Soph.
to lie beside, cling to, Soph.: of a woman, to be given to wife, τινί Hdt.
generally, to be involved in or bound up with good or evil, c. dat., Soph.
to be attached or devoted to, τινί Hdt., Thuc., etc.; πρ. τῷ λεγομένῳ to put faith in a story, Hdt.; πρ. οἴνῳ to be addicted to wine, Hdt.; ἄγραις hunting, Soph., etc.
to press upon, be urgent with a person, c. dat., Hdt., Xen.; προσκείμενος with zeal, Thuc.
in military sense, to press close or hard, pursue closely, τινί Thuc.; absol. to follow close, Ar.; τὸ προσκείμενον the enemy, Hdt.
with a thing for the subject, to fall to, belong to, τοῖσι θεῶν τιμὴ αὕτη προσκέαται Hdt.; πρ. τινι δοῦλος Eur.:— to be laid upon as a charge, to do something, c. inf., Hdt., Eur.
to be added or attached to, Soph., Eur.:—absol., ἡ χάρις προσκείσεται Soph.

div1.head: προσκερδαίνω
div1.sense: to gain besides, Dem.

div1.head: προσκεφάλαιον
div1.sense: a cushion for the head, pillow, Ar., etc.:—then, generally, any cushion, Theophr.

div1.head: προσκηδής
div1.sense: bringing into alliance or kindred, or, as others, kind, affectionate, Od.
akin to, τινί Hdt.; προσκηδέες kinsfolk, Anth.

div1.head: προσκηρυκεύομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to send a herald to one, Thuc.

div1.head: προσκηρύσσω
div1.sense: to summon also, Luc.

div1.head: προσκιγκλίζομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to wag oneʼs tail, εὖ ποτεκιγκλίσδευ (Doric for -ίζου) how nimbly didst thou twist about! Theocr.

div1.head: προσκλάομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be shivered against, Xen.

div1.head: προσκληρόω
div1.sense: Pass to be attached to, keep company with, NTest.

div1.head: πρόσκλησις
div1.sense: a judicial summons or citation, Ar., Dem.

div1.head: προσκλίνω
div1.sense: to make to lean against, put against, Od.:—Pass., θρόνος ποτικέκλιται (Doric perf. pass.) αὐτῇ κίονι leans or stands against the pillar, Od.; νῶτον ποτικεκλιμένον his back thereon reclined, Pind.
Pass. to incline towards, to be attached to one, NTest.

div1.head: πρόσκλισις
div1.sense: inclination, proclivity, Polyb.; κατὰ πρόσκλισιν with partiality, NTest.

div1.head: προσκλύζω
div1.sense: to wash with waves, Xen.: c. dat. to dash against, Orac. ap. Aeschin.

div1.head: προσκνάομαι
div1.sense: Pass. or Mid. to rub oneself against, τινι Xen.

div1.head: προσκοιμίζομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to lie down and sleep beside, ταῖς κώπαις Xen.

div1.head: προσκοινωνέω
div1.sense: to give one a share of a thing, τινὶ ἀπό τινος Dem.

div1.head: προσκολλάω
div1.sense: to glue on or to:—Pass. to stick or cleave to, Plat., NTest.; πρός τινα NTest.

div1.head: προσκομίζω
div1.sense: to carry or convey to aplace, πρὸς τόπον Thuc., Xen.; πρ. τὴν μηχανήν to bring up the engine to assault the wall, Thuc.:—Mid. to bring with one, bring home, Thuc.: to import, Xen.:— Pass., of ships, to be brought to a place, Thuc.

div1.head: πρόσκομμα
div1.sense: a stumble, stumbling, NTest.: an occasion of stumbling, NTest.: an offence, obstacle, NTest.

div1.head: προσκοπέω
div1.sense: to see or consider beforehand, weigh well, look to, provide for, προσκεψάμενος ἐπὶ σεωυτοῦ Hdt.; πάντα προσκοπεῖν Soph.; μὴ παθεῖν προεσκόπουν were making provision against suffering, Thuc.:—so in Mid., τὸ σὸν προσκοπούμενος Eur.
to watch (like a πρόσκοπος or spy), τινά Ar.:—so in Mid., προσκοπουμένη πόσιν Eur.
to prefer before, τί τινος Eur.
perf. and plup. in pass. sense, to be considered beforehand, Thuc., Plat.

div1.head: προσκοπή
div1.sense: an offence, Polyb.

div1.head: προσκοπή
div1.sense: a looking out for, Thuc.

div1.head: πρόσκοπος
div1.sense: seeing beforehand: as Subst. an outpost, vidette, Xen.; in pl. a reconnoitring party, Xen.

div1.head: προσκόπτω
div1.sense: to strike one thing against another, τι πρός τι NTest.; so, πρ. τὸν δακτυλ όν που Arist.
intr. to stumble or strike against, τινί Xen.:—metaph. to take offence at, τινί Polyb.

div1.head: προσκορής
div1.sense: satiating, palling, Luc.

div1.head: προσκοτέω
div1.sense: to darken or cloud over beforehand, Polyb.

div1.head: πρόσκρουσις
div1.sense: a dashing against a thing: an offence, Plut.

div1.head: πρόσκρουσμα
div1.sense: that against which one strikes, a stumbling-block, offence, Dem.

div1.head: προσκρούω
div1.sense: to strike against, τινί Plat.:absol. to stumble, fail, Plut.
to have a collision with another, give offence, Dem.; πρ. τινί Plut.
to take offence at, be angry with, τινί Dem., etc.: —absol. to take offence, Plat.

div1.head: προσκτάομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:

to gain, get or win besides, γῆν ἄλλην πρ. τῇ ἑωυτῶν Hdt.; χώραν πρ. Thuc.; πρ. πρὸς τὴν ἑωυτοῦ μοῖραν to gain and add to his own portion, Hdt.; βραχύ τι πρ. αὐτῇ τῇ ἀρχῇ to make a small addition to it, Thuc.; perf. part. in pass. sense, τὰ προσκεκτημένα Thuc.
of persons, to gain or win over, πρ. τινα φίλον Hdt.; πρ. τὸν Καλλίμαχον to win over Callimachus to his side, Hdt.

div1.head: προσκτίζω
div1.sense: to build or found besides, πόλιν Strab.

div1.head: προσκυλίω
div1.sense: to roll to, roll up, Ar.: προσκυλίσας λίθον NTest.

div1.head: προσκυνέω
div1.sense: Plut.:— to make obeisance to the gods, fall down and worship, to worship, adore, c. acc., Hdt., Aesch., etc.:—proverb., οἱ προσκυνοῦντες τὴν Ἀδράστειαν σοφοί, of deprecating the wrath of Nemesis, Aesch.; so, τὸν φθόνον δὲ πρόσκυσον Soph.:—also of sacred places, to do reverence to, ἕδη θεῶν Soph.; τὴν γῆν Ar.

of the Oriental fashion of making the salam or prostrating oneself before kings and superiors, absol., Hdt.; c. acc., πρ. τὸν Δαρεῖον ὡς βασιλέα to make obeisance to him as king, Hdt.; πάντες σε προσκυνοῦμεν Soph., etc.:—later, c. dat., NTest.

div1.head: προσκύνησις
div1.sense: adoration, obeisance, a salam, Arist., Plut.

div1.head: προσκυνητής
div1.sense: a worshipper, NTest.

div1.head: προσκύπτω
div1.sense: to stoop to or over one, Ar.; πρ. τινὶ τὸ οὖς to lean towards one and whisper in his ear, Plat.

div1.head: προσκυρέω
div1.sense: to reach, touch, arrive at, c. dat., Hes.
to meet with, fall upon, τινί Theogn.; also c. acc. rei, ὅσʼ ἐγὼ προσέκυρσʼ Soph.:—reversely, δόμοισι πῆμα προσκυρεῖ woe betides the house, Aesch.

div1.head: πρόσκωπος
div1.sense: at the oar, a rower, Thuc.

div1.head: προσλαγχάνω
div1.sense: to obtain by lot besides, δίκην πρ. to obtain leave to bring an action also, Dem.

div1.head: προσλάζυμαι
div1.sense: Dep. to take hold of besides, τινος Eur.

div1.head: προσλαλέω
div1.sense: to talk to or with, τινί Theophr.

div1.head: προσλαμβάνω
div1.sense: to take or receive besides, get over and above, πρὸς τοῖς παροῦσιν ἄλλα κακὰ πρ. Aesch.; πρ. αἰσχύνην Thuc., etc.:—so in Mid., Eur., etc.
c. acc. pers. to take to oneself, take as oneʼs helper or partner, Trag., Xen., etc.:—acc., πρ. τινὰ σύμμαχον Xen.:—also in Mid., Polyb., etc.
like συλλαμβάνω, to take hold of, τινά Soph.:—Mid. to take hold of, τινος Ar.
in Mid., πρ. τινος to take part in a work, be accessory to it, Xen.; προσελάβετο τοῦ πάθεος he was partly the author of the calamity, Hdt.; πρ. τινι to help, assist, Ar.

div1.head: προσλάμπω
div1.sense: to shine with or upon, Plat.

div1.head: προσλέγω
div1.sense: For προσέλεκτο (3rd sg. aor2 syncop.) she lay beside or by me, Od. see προσλέχομαι.
Mid. προσλέγομαι to speak to, address, accost, τινά Theocr.: metaph., κακὰ προσελέξατο θυμῷ he took evil counsel with himself, meditated evil, Hes.

div1.head: προσλείπω
div1.sense: to be lacking, Arist.

div1.head: προσλεύσσω
div1.sense: to look on or at, c. acc., Soph.; absol., Soph.

div1.head: προσληπτέος
div1.sense: one must add, Strab.

div1.head: προσλιπαρέω
div1.sense: to persevere or persist in, τοῖς χρήμασι in money-making, Plut.:— to importune, τινί Luc.: absol. to be importunate, Plut.

div1.head: προσλιπάρησις
div1.sense: importunity, Luc.

div1.head: προσλογίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:
to reckon or count in addition to, τί τινι Hdt.
to impute, τί τινι Plut.

div1.head: προσμαθητέος
div1.sense: one must learn besides, Xen.

div1.head: προσμανθάνω
div1.sense: to learn besides, Aesch., Ar.

div1.head: προσμαρτυρέω
div1.sense: to confirm by evidence, Dem.
intr., πρ. τινί to bear additional witness to a thing, Polyb.

div1.head: προσμάσσω
div1.sense: to knead one thing to or with another; to attach closely to, πρ. τὸν Πειραιᾶ τῇ πόλει Ar.:—in Pass., πλευραῖσι προσμαχθέν sticking close to his sides, of the poisoned robe, Soph.: aor1 mid. part., τηλέφιλον ποτιμαξάμενον the leaf having attached itself closely to [the hand], sticking close, Theocr.

div1.head: προσμάχομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to fight against, τινι Plat.: to assault a town, Xen.

div1.head: προσμειδιάω
div1.sense: to smile upon, with a sense of approving, Lat. arrideo, Luc.

div1.head: προσμένω
div1.sense: to bide or wait still longer, Hdt., Soph., etc.
c. dat. to remain attached to, to cleave to, τινί Aesch.; πρ. ταῖς δεήσεσιν to continue in supplications, NTest.
trans. to wait for, await, c. acc., Theogn., Soph., etc.:— to wait for one in battle, i. e. to stand oneʼs ground against, Pind.: —also c. acc. et inf. fut., Ὀρέστην προσμενοῦσʼ ἀεὶ ἐφήξειν Soph.

div1.head: προσμεταπέμπομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to send for or send to fetch besides, Thuc., Aeschin.

div1.head: προσμηχανάομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be cunningly fastened to or upon, Aesch.
Mid. to contrive or procure for oneself, αὐτοῖς ἀσφάλειαν Plat.

div1.head: προσμείγνυμι
div1.sense: to mingle or join to, τί τινι Plut.:—metaph., πρ. δεσπόταν κράτει to lead him to sure victory, Pind.; and reversely, πρ. κίνδυνόν τινι Aeschin.
intr. to hold intercourse with, approach, τινί Soph.:—of things, προσέμιξεν τοὔπος ἡμῖν came suddenly upon us, Soph.
in hostile sense, to go against, meet in battle, engage with, τινί Hdt.; πρός τινα Thuc.:—absol. to engage, Xen.; ἄποροι προσμίσγειν difficult to come to close quarters with, Hdt.

to come or go close up to, προσέμιξαν τῷ τείχει Thuc.; πρὸς τὰς ἐπάλξεις Thuc.; but, πρὸς τὰς ἐντὸς νέας προσμῖξαι to form a junction with them, Thuc.; προσέμιξεν ἐγγὺς τοῦ στρατεύματος came near the army, Thuc.:—poet. c. acc., μέλαθρα πρ. Eur.
προσέμιξαν τῇ Νάξῳ, τῇ Πελοποννήσῳ put to shore at, landed in, Hdt.; τῷ Τάραντι προσμίσγει Thuc.

div1.head: πρόσμειξις
div1.sense: a coming near to, and (in hostile sense) an attack, assault, Thuc.

div1.head: προσμισθόω
div1.sense: to let out for hire besides, πρ. ἀφορμήν to put capital out at interest, Dem.:—Mid. to take into oneʼs pay, to hire, Thuc., Xen., etc.

div1.head: προσμολεῖν
div1.etym: inf. aor. of pres. προσβλώσκω which does not occur.
div1.sense: to come or to go, reach, arrive at, c. acc., Soph.; absol. to approach, Soph.

div1.head: πρόσμορος
div1.sense: doomed to woe, Aesch.

div1.head: προσμυθέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to address, accost, Od.: Epic and Doric aor1 inf. προτιμυθήσασθαι; c. dat., Theocr.

div1.head: προσμυθεύω
div1.sense: to add further fictions, Strab.

div1.head: προσμυθολογέω
div1.sense: to talk or prattle with one, τινί Luc.

div1.head: προσμυθοποιέω
div1.sense: to invent mythically besides, Strab.

div1.head: προσμύρομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to flow to or with, Anth.

div1.head: προσναυπηγέω
div1.sense: to build in addition: Pass., ἑτέρας νέας ἔδει ναυπηγέεσθαι, Hdt.

div1.head: προσνέμω
div1.sense: to assign, attach or dedicate to, ἑαυτόν τινι Dem.:— to add, Dem.:—Pass. to be assigned, attributed, Dem.:—Mid. to grant on oneʼs own part, πρόσνειμαι χάριν grant a further favour, Soph.; προσνείμασθαί τινα θεῷ to devote him to the god, Ar.
πρ. ποίμνας to drive his flocks to pasture, Eur.

div1.head: πρόσνευσις
div1.sense: a nodding to, decision, Cic.

div1.head: προσνεύω
div1.sense: to nod to, assent, Plut.

div1.head: προσνέω
div1.sense: to swim to or towards, Thuc.

div1.head: προσνήχομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:
to swim towards, τινι Plut.
intr. in Act. to dash upon, προσένᾱχε θάλασσα Theocr.

div1.head: προσνίσομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:
to come or go to, Il., Pind.; θεοὺς θοίναις ποτιν. to approach them with sacrifices, Aesch.
to come against, Soph.

div1.head: προσνοέω
div1.sense: to perceive besides, Xen.

div1.head: προσνωμάω
div1.sense: to put to oneʼs lips, ὕδωρ (to be supplied), Soph.

div1.head: προσοδεύω
div1.sense: to accrue; mid. to receive income or revenue, Strab.

div1.head: προσοδικός
div1.sense: productive, Strab.

div1.head: προσόδιος
div1.sense: belonging to or used in processions, processional, Plut.:— a processional hymn, a thanksgiving, Lat. supplicatio, Ar.

div1.head: πρόσοδος
div1.sense: a going or coming to, an approach, ἡ πρ. μάλιστα ταύτῃ ἐγένετο the approach was most feasible on this part, Hdt.; ἀπείπατο τὴν πρ. rejected his advances, Hdt.; πρ. μελάθρων approach to the halls, Eur.
an onset, πρόσοδοι τῆς μάχης onsets or attacks, Eur.
like πομπή II, a solemn procession to a temple with singing and music, Ar., Xen.
the coming forward of a speaker in a public assembly, γράφεσθαι πρόσοδον to petition for a hearing, Dem.; πρ. ποιεῖσθαι πρὸς τὸν δῆμον Aeschin.
income, rent, as opp. to principal, Dem.; often in pl., Oratt.
of the public revenue, φόρων πρόσοδος Hdt.; χρημάτων πρ. Thuc.; mostly in pl. the returns, revenue, Lat. reditus, Hdt., Thuc., etc.

div1.head: προσόζω
div1.sense: intr. to smell of, be redolent of, c. gen., Theocr.

div1.head: πρόσοιδα
div1.etym: perf. without any pres. in use
div1.sense: to know besides; προσειδέναι χάριν to owe thanks besides, Ar., Plat.

div1.head: προσοικειόω
div1.sense: to assign to one as his own, τί τινι Strab.:— προσῳκείου ἑαυτὸν Ἀντώνιος Ἡρακλεῖ associated himself with Hercules, Plut.

div1.head: προσοικέω
div1.sense: to dwell by or near, τινί Xen.: absol., οἱ προσοικοῦντες neighbouring tribes, Isocr.
c. acc. to dwell in or near, Ἐπίδαμνον Thuc.

div1.head: προσοικοδομέω
div1.sense: to build besides, πρ. τεῖχος to build another wall, Thuc.; τῷ μὲν ἐν τῇ ἀγορᾷ βωμῷ προσοικοδομήσας μεῖζον μῆκος having built an additional length to the altar in the agora, i. e. having added to its length, Thuc.

div1.head: πρόσοικος
div1.sense: dwelling near to, bordering on, neighbouring, Hdt., Thuc.; οἱ πρόσοικοι neighbours, Thuc.

div1.head: προσοιστέος
div1.sense: to be added to, τινί Eur.
προσοιστέον one must add, Plat., etc.
one must apply, use, γυμνάσια Arist.

div1.head: προσοίχομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to have gone to a place, Pind.

div1.head: προσοκέλλω
div1.sense: to run a ship on shore, Luc.
absol. of the ship, to run ashore, Luc.

div1.head: προσολοφύρομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to wail to, vent oneʼs griefs to another, τινί Thuc.; πρ. ἀλλήλοις to wail to one another, Plut.

div1.head: προσομαρτέω
div1.sense: to go along with, τινί Theogn., etc.

div1.head: προσομιλέω
div1.sense: to hold intercourse with, live or associate with, converse with, τινί Theogn., Eur., etc.; πρός τινα Xen.; τὰ ἴδια προσομιλοῦντες conducting our private intercourse, Thuc.
to be attached, ποτὶ πέτρῃ Theogn.
to be conversant with, πείρᾳ Soph.; τῷ πολέμῳ Thuc.

div1.head: προσόμνυμι
div1.sense: to swear besides, Xen.

div1.head: προσόμοιος
div1.sense: much like, τινι Eur., Ar.

div1.head: προσομοιόω
div1.sense: to be like, resemble, τὴν σύνεσιν ἀνθρώπῳ, τὴν ἀλκὴν δὲ δράκοντι Dem.

div1.head: προσομολογέω
div1.sense: to concede or grant besides, τί τινι Plat.: to acknowledge a further debt, Dem.: — c. acc. et inf. to grant also that . . , Plat.:—Pass., παλαιὰ καὶ λίαν προσωμολογημένα Aeschin.
to promise further, c. inf. fut., Dem.
to come to terms, surrender, Xen.

div1.head: προσομολογία
div1.sense: a further admission, Dem.

div1.head: προσομόργνυμαι
div1.sense: to wipe upon another, impart; so in Mid., Plut.

div1.head: προσόμουρος
div1.etym: Ionic for προσόμορος (which does not occur)
div1.sense: adjoining, adjacent, τινί Hdt.

div1.head: προσονομάζω
div1.sense: to call by a name, πρ. θεούς to give them the name θεοί, Hdt.

div1.head: προσοράω
div1.sense: to look at, behold, Mimnerm., Soph., etc.; cf. aor2 προσεῖδον:—so in Mid., προσορωμένα Soph.

div1.head: προσορέγομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to stretch oneself towards, to be urgent with, τινί Hdt.

div1.head: πρόσορθρος
div1.sense: towards morning: Doric τὸ πότορθρον, as adv., Theocr.

div1.head: προσορίζω
div1.sense: to include within the boundaries, add to a dominion, Strab.
to determine or fix besides, Plut.
in Mid. as Attic law-term, προσωρίσατο τὴν οἰκίαν δισχιλίων he had the house marked with other stones (v. ὅρος II) to the amount of 2000 drachmae, i. e. mortgaged it anew to that amount, Dem.

div1.head: προσορμάω
div1.sense: intr. to rush on, Xen.

div1.head: προσορμίζομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to come to anchor near a place, Hdt., Dem.; so in aor1 pass. προσωρμίσθην, NTest.

div1.head: προσόρμισις
div1.sense: a coming to anchor or to land, Thuc.

div1.head: πρόσορμος
div1.sense: a landing-place, Strab.

div1.head: προσορχέομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to dance to or with, Luc.

div1.head: προσουδίζω
div1.sense: to dash to earth, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: προσουρέω
div1.sense: to make water upon, τινί Dem.; metaph., πρ. τῇ τραγῳδίᾳ, i. e. to trifle with it, Ar.

div1.head: πρόσουρος
div1.sense: adjoining, bordering on, τῇ Ἀραβίῃ Hdt.: absol., τὰ πρόσορα the neighbouring parts, Xen.:—in Soph., ἵνʼ αὐτὸς ἦν πρόσουρος where he had no neighbour but himself, i. e. lived in solitude, Soph.

div1.head: προσοφείλω
div1.sense: to owe besides or still, Thuc., Xen.: absol., προσοφείλοντας ἡμᾶς ἐνέγραψεν Dem.:—Pass. to be still owing, be still due, Thuc.; so, ἡ ἔχθρη ἡ προσοφειλομένη ἐς Ἀθηναίους ἐκ τῶν Αἰγινητέων the hatred which was still due from the Aeginetans to the Athenians, i. e. their ancient feud, Hdt.

div1.head: προσοφλισκάνω
div1.sense: to owe besides, Dem.: absol. to incur a debt, Arist.
as law-term, to lose oneʼs suit and incur a penalty besides, Aeschin.
generally, to incur or deserve besides, αἰσχύνην Dem.

div1.head: προσοχή
div1.sense: attention, Luc.

div1.head: προσόψιος
div1.sense: like ἐπ-όψιος, full in view, Soph.

div1.head: πρόσοψις
div1.sense: appearance, aspect, mien, Pind.; periphr., σὴ πρ. thy presence, i. e. thyself, Soph.
a seeing, beholding, sight, view, Eur., Thuc.

div1.head: προσπαίζω
div1.sense: to play or sport with, τινί Xen., Plat.
absol. to sport, jest, Plat.
c. acc., πρ. θεούς to sing to the gods, ὕμνον πρ. τὸν Ἔρωτα sang a hymn in praise of Eros, Plat.
to banter, Plat.

div1.head: πρόσπαιος
div1.sense: striking upon: hence, sudden, Aesch.:— ἐκ προσπαίου suddenly, Arist.

div1.head: προσπαλαίω
div1.sense: to wrestle or struggle with, τινί Pind., Plat.

div1.head: Προσπαλτόθεν
div1.sense: from Prospalta, Dem.

div1.head: προσπαραγράφω
div1.sense: to write besides, add yet besides, Plat., Dem.

div1.head: προσπαρακαλέω
div1.sense: to call in besides, invite, Thuc.
to exhort besides, τινὰ εἶναι ἑτοῖμον Polyb.

div1.head: προσπαραμένω
div1.sense: to remain by besides, Aesop.

div1.head: προσπαρασκευάζω
div1.sense: to prepare besides, ἑτέραν δύναμιν Dem.:—Mid. to prepare for oneself besides, Dem.

div1.head: προσπαρατίθημι
div1.sense: to put before one besides, Polyb.

div1.head: προσπαρέχω
div1.sense: to furnish or supply besides, τί τινι Thuc.; so in Mid., Plat.

div1.head: προσπαροξύνω
div1.sense: to provoke besides, Strab.

div1.head: προσπαρτός
div1.sense: fixed to (the rock), Aesch.

div1.head: προσπασσαλεύω
div1.sense: to nail fast to a place, τινά τινι Aesch.; πρός τι Ar.:—reversely, σανίδα προσπασσαλεύσαντες (sc. αὐτῷ) Hdt.
to nail up or hang upon a peg, τὸν τρίποδα Hdt.

div1.head: προσπάσχω
div1.sense: to have an additional or special feeling, Plat.; τινί for a thing, Luc., etc.
to feel passionate love, Isocr.

div1.head: πρός
div1.sense: prep. with gen., implying motion from a place; with dat., abiding at a place; with acc., motion to a place
WITH GEN.,
of Place, from, from forth, Hom., Soph.

on the side or quarter of, νήσοισι πρὸς Ἤλιδος islands looking (as it were) from Elis, i. e. towards Elis, Od.; πρὸς τοῦ Ἑλλησπόντου ἵδρυται μᾶλλον ἢ τοῦ Στρύμονος lies more towards (i. e. nearer) the Hellespont than the Strymon, Hdt.; ἐστρατοπεδεύοντο πρὸς Ὀλύνθου Thuc., etc.:—often with words denoting the points of the compass, δύω θύραι εἰσίν, αἱ μὲν πρὸς βορέαο, αἱ δʼ αὖ πρὸς νότου one looking north wards, the other south wards, Od.; so, οἰκέουσι πρὸς νότου ἀνέμου Hdt., etc.
before, in presence of, in the eyes of, πρός τε θεῶν μακάρων πρός τε θνητῶν ἀνθρώπων Il.: ἄδικον οὔτε πρὸς θεῶν οὔτε πρὸς ἀνθρώπων Thuc.

in supplication, adjuration, protestation, oaths, before, by, Lat. per, γουνάζομαί σε πρός τʼ ἀλόχου καὶ πατρός Od.; ἐπιορκεῖν πρὸς δαίμονος to forswear oneself by the god, Il.; πρὸς θεῶν Attic:—the Trag. sometimes insert the pron. σε between the prep. and its case, as in Lat. per te omnes deos oro, πρός νύν σε πατρὸς πρός τε μητρὸς ἱκνοῦμαι Soph.; μὴ πρός σε γούνων Eur.
of origin or descent, from, on the side of τὰ πρὸς πατρός by the fatherʼs side, Hdt.; Ἀθηναῖον καὶ τὰ πρὸς πατρὸς καὶ τὰ πρὸς μητρός Dem.; πρὸς αἵματος blood-relations, Soph.

proceeding from some cause, from, at the hand of, τιμὴν πρὸς Ζηνὸς ἔχοντες Od.; τυγχάνειν τινὸς πρὸς θεῶν Aesch.:—so with all Passive Verbs, προτὶ Ἀχιλλῆος δεδιδάχθαι to be taught by Achilles, Il.; τὸ ποιεύμενον πρὸς Λακεδαιμονίων Hdt., etc.:— by means or agency of, πρὸς ἀλλήλοιν θανεῖν Eur.:—also of things, πρὸς τίνος ποτʼ αἰτίας τέθνηκεν; from or by what cause? Soph.
of dependence or close connexion; and so,
dependent on one, under oneʼs protection, πρὸς Διός εἰσι ξεῖνοι Od.; πρὸς ἄλλης ἱστὸν ὑφαίνειν to weave a web at the beck of another woman, Il.
on oneʼs side, in oneʼs favour, πρὸς σοῦ Soph.; πρὸς τῶν ἐχόντων τὸν νόμον τίθης Eur.
with, by, μνήμην πρός τινος λείπεσθαι Hdt.

fitting, suitable, οὐ πρὸς τοῦ ἅπαντος ἀνδρός, not befitting every man, Hdt.; ἦ κάρτα πρὸς γυναικός ἐστιν ʼtis very like a woman, Aesch.; οὐ πρὸς ἰατροῦ σοφοῦ θρηνεῖν Soph.:—also of qualities, πρὸς δίκης agreeable to justice, Soph.; οὐ πρὸς τῆς ὑμετέρας δόξης Thuc.

WITH DAT., hard by, near, at, on, in, ποτὶ γαίῃ Od.; ποτὶ δρυσίν among the oaks, Il.; ἄγκυραν ποτὶ ναῒ κρημνάντων Il.; πρὸς μέσῃ ἀγορᾷ Soph.; πρὸς τῇ γῇ ναυμαχεῖν Thuc.; αἱ πρὸς θαλάττῃ πόλεις Xen.; τὰ πρὸς ποσί that which is close to the feet, before one, Soph.
before, in the presence of, πρὸς τοῖς θεσμοθέταις λέγειν Dem.
with Verbs denoting motion, followed by rest in or by a place, upon, against, ποτὶ δὲ σκῆπτρον βάλε γαίῃ Hom.; βάλλειν τινὰ πρὸς πέτρῃ Od.

with a notion of clinging closely, πρὸς ἀλλήλῃσιν ἔχεσθαι Od.; προσπεπλασμένας πρὸς οὔρεσι Hdt.; so, to express close employment, in, upon, πρὸς αὐτῷ γʼ εἰμὶ τῷ δεινῷ λέγειν Soph.; εἶναι or γίγνεσθαι πρός τινι to be employed in or on a thing, Plat.; ὅλον εἶναι πρός τινι Dem.

in addition to, besides, πρὸς τοῖς παροῦσιν ἄλλα Aesch.; δέκα μῆνας πρὸς ἄλλοις πέντε Soph.; πρὸς τῇ σκυτοτομίᾳ in addition to his trade of leather-cutter, Plat.; πρὸς τούτοις besides this, Lat. praeterea, Hdt., etc.; πρὸς τοῖς ἄλλοις besides all the rest, Thuc.
WITH ACCUS.,
of Place, towards, to, Lat. versus, ἰέναι πρὸς Ὄλυμπον Il.; πρὸς ἠῶτʼ ἠέλιόν τε, ποτὶ ζόφον Il.
with Verbs implying previous motion, upon, against, ἑστάναι πρὸς κίονα Od.; ποτὶ τοῖχον ἀρηρότες, ποτὶ βωμὸν ἵζεσθαι Od.; ἑστάναι πρὸς σφαγάς to stand ready for slaughter, Aesch.

with Verbs of seeing, etc., towards, ἰδεῖν πρός τινα Od.; so, στῆναι ποτὶ πνοιήν to stand so as to face it, Il.; κλαίειν πρὸς οὐρανόν to cry to heaven, Il.:—of points of the compass, πρὸς ζόφον κεῖσθαι to lie towards the West, Od.; ναίειν πρὸς Ἠῶ τʼ Ἠέλιόν τε Od.; πρὸς ἑσπέραν, ἄρκτον towards the West, etc.

in hostile sense, against, πρὸς Τρῶας μάχεσθαι Il.; πρὸς θεὸν ἐρίζειν Pind.; χωρεῖν πρός τινα Soph.;—in speeches, πρός τινα in reply to, Lat. adversus, less strong than κατά τινος against, Lat. in, Dem.

without any hostile sense, ἀγορεύειν, εἰπεῖν πρός τινα to address oneself to him, Il.; ἀμείβεσθαι πρός τινα Hdt.; also of communing with oneself, εἶπε πρὸς ὃν μεγαλήτορα θυμόν, προτὶ ὃν μυθήσατο θυμόν Il.:—of all sorts of intercourse, ὀμόσαι πρός τινα to take an oath to him, Od.; σπονδάς, συνθήκας ποιεῖσθαι πρός τινα Thuc.; ἡ πρός τινα ξυμμαχία Thuc.; ἡ πρός τινα φιλία, πίστις Xen., etc.; but also, πρός τινα ἔχθρα, ἀπιστία, μῖσος, πόλεμος Aesch., Xen., etc.
of transactions, πρὸς Τυδείδην τεύχεʼ ἄμειβεν changed arms with Tydeides, Il.: of matters brought before a magistrate, λαγχάνειν πρὸς τὸν ἄρχοντα, γράφεσθαι πρὸς τοὺς θεσμοθέτας ap. Dem.
εἶναι πρός τι to be engaged in . . , Plut.
of Time, towards or near, at or about, ποτὶ ἕσπερα at even, Od.; ἐπεὶ πρὸς ἑσπέραν ἦν Xen.; πρὸς ἠῶ Theocr.; πρὸς γῆρας for or in old age, Eur.
of Relation between two objects,

in reference to, in respect of, touching, τὰ πρὸς τὸν πόλεμον, i. e. military matters, Thuc.; τὰ πρὸς τὸν βασιλέα our relations to the King, Dem.; τὰ πρὸς τοὺς θεούς our duties to the gods, Soph.; ὁ λόγος οὐδὲν πρὸς ἐμέ is nothing to me, concerns me not, Dem.; οὐδὲν αὐτῷ πρὸς τὴν πόλιν ἐστίν he has nothing to do with it, Dem.:—often with Advs., ἀσφαλῶς ἔχειν πρός τι Xen.

in reference to, in consequence of, πρὸς τοῦτο τὸ κήρυγμα Hdt.; ἀθύμως ἔχειν πρός τι Xen.:—often with neut. Pron., πρὸς τί; wherefore? to what end? Soph.; πρὸς οὐδέν for nothing, in vain, Soph.; πρὸς ταῦτα therefore, this being so, Hdt., Attic
for a purpose, ὡς πρός τι χρείας; Soph.; ἕτοιμος πρός τι Xen.

in proportion or relation to, in comparison of, κοῖός τις ἀνὴρ δοκέοι εἶναι πρὸς τὸν πατέρα Hdt.; implying Superiority, πρὸς πάντας τοὺς ἄλλους, Lat. prae aliis omnibus, Hdt.; πρὸς τὰς μεγίστας καὶ ἐλαχίστας ναῦς τὸ μέσον σκοπεῖν the mean between the largest and smallest ships, Thuc.
in reference to, according to, πρὸς τὸ παρεὸν βουλεύεσθαι Hdt.; πρὸς τὴν δύναμιν according to oneʼs power, Dem.; πρὸς τὰς τύχας agreeably to oneʼs fortunes, Eur.
in accompaniment to musical instruments, πρὸς κάλαμον Pind.; πρὸς αὐλόν or τὸν αὐλόν Eur.
