often merely periphr. for adv., as πρὸς βίαν βιαίως, by force, forcibly, Aesch.; πρὸς τὸ καρτερόν Aesch.; πρὸς ἰσχύος κράτος Soph.:— πρὸς ἡδονὴν λέγειν, δημηγορεῖν so as to please, Thuc.; πρὸς τὸ τερπνόν calculated to delight, Thuc.; πρὸς χάριν so as to gratify, Dem.;—and c. gen. rei, πρὸς χάριν τινός, like χάριν alone, Lat. gratia, for the sake of, πρὸς χ. βορᾶς Soph.; πρὸς ἰσχύος χ. by means of, Eur.; also, πρὸς ὀργήν with anger, angrily, Soph., etc.; πρὸς τὸ λιπαρές importunately, Soph.; πρὸς καιρόν seasonably, Soph.
ABSOL. AS ADV., = πρός B. II, besides, over and above, πρὸς δέ or ποτὶ δέ Il., Hdt., etc.; πρὸς δὲ καί, πρὸς δὲ ἔτι, καὶ πρός Hdt., etc.; καὶ πρός γε Eur.; καὶ δὴ πρός Hdt.
IN COMPOS., it expresses
motion towards, προσάγω, προσέρχομαι.
addition, besides, προσκτάομαι, προστίθημι.
connexion and engagement with anything, as πρόσειμι, προσγίγνομαι.

div1.head: πρόσπεινος
div1.sense: hungry, a-hungered, NTest.

div1.head: προσπελάζω
div1.sense: to make to approach, bring near to, νέα ἄκρῃ προσπελάσας having driven the ship against the headland, Od.:—Pass. to approach, c. gen., Πανὸς προσπελασθεῖσα having had intercourse with Pan. Soph.
intr. to draw nigh to, approach, τινί Plat.

div1.head: προσπέμπω
div1.sense: to send to, esp. of messengers or ambassadors, Ar., Thuc.; πρ. τινά τινι to send or conduct one person to another, Soph., Thuc.; simply, πρ. τινί to send to one (sc. ἄγγελον) , Thuc., etc.; also, πρ. λόγους ἔς τινας Thuc.; absol., Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: προσπεριβάλλω
div1.sense: to put round besides, περιτείχισμα τῇ πόλει Thuc.:—Mid. to throw or draw round oneself, τείχη Isocr.:—Pass. to be drawn round, στρατοπέδῳ ἐρύματος προσπεριβαλλομένου Thuc.
Mid. to surround, τὸν πεζὸν στρατὸν ταῖς ναυσὶ πρ. Plut.
Mid., also, to grasp at, Dem.

div1.head: προσπεριγίγνομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to remain over and above as surplus or net profit, Dem., Plut.

div1.head: προσπεριλαμβάνω
div1.sense: to embrace besides, Dem.

div1.head: προσπεριοδεύω
div1.sense: to describe besides, Strab.

div1.head: προσπεριποιέω
div1.sense: to lay by or save besides, Dem.

div1.head: προσπερονάω
div1.sense: to fasten by means of a pin (περόνη) , and, generally, to fasten on, τι πρός τι Plat.; πρός τινι Xen.

div1.head: προσπέτομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:— to fly to or towards, Ar., Xen.
generally, to come upon one suddenly, come over one, ὀδμὰ προσέπτα με Aesch.; μέλος προσέπτα μοι or με music stole over my sense, Aesch.; τίς ἀρχὴ τοῦ κακοῦ προσέπτατο; Soph.

div1.head: προσπήγνυμι
div1.sense: to fix to or on, τί τινι Eur.:—absol. to affix to the cross, crucify, NTest.

div1.head: προσπίλναμαι
div1.sense: Pass. to approach quickly, νήσῳ Od.

div1.head: προσπίπτω
div1.etym: see also the poetic form προσπίτνω.
div1.sense: to fall upon, strike against, ἔς τι Soph.; τινί Xen.:— to fall against, as a mound against a wall, Thuc.
to fall upon, attack, assault, τινί Thuc., Xen., etc.; absol., Thuc., Xen.
simply to run to, Hdt., Xen.
to fall upon, embrace, τινί Eur.; hence, πρ. τινί to join the party of another, Xen.
to fall in with, light upon, meet with, encounter, μὴ λάθῃ με προσπεσών Soph.; c. dat. rei, to fall in with, Eur., Xen.;—c. acc., μείζω βροτείας πρ. ὁμιλίας Eur.
of things,
of accidents, to come suddenly upon, befal one, τινί Hdt., Eur., etc.:— absol. to occur, Hdt., Thuc.; πρὸς τὰ προσπίπτοντα according to circumstances, Arist.
of expenses, to fall upon, Thuc.
to come to oneʼs ears, be told as news, Aeschin.
to fall down at anotherʼs feet, prostrate oneself, Hdt., Soph.: c. dat., πρ. βωμοῖσι Soph.; γόνασί τινος Eur.; θεῶν πρὸς βρέτας Ar.
c. acc. to fall down to, supplicate, Eur.

div1.head: προσπίτνω
div1.sense: to fall upon a personʼs neck, τινί Eur.; ἀμφὶ σὰν γενειάδα Eur.
to come in, come upon the scene, Eur.
of things, to fall upon, of arrows, Aesch.; of anger, Eur.

to fall down to or before, supplicate, Soph.; c. dat., προσπίτνομέν σοι Soph.; but more commonly c. acc., Aesch., etc.; προσπίτνω σε γόνασι Soph.:—c. inf., πρ. σε μὴ θανεῖν I beseech thee that I may not die, Soph.

div1.head: προσπλάζω
div1.sense: intr. to come near, approach, Il.; c. dat., Od.

div1.head: προσπλάσσω
div1.sense: to form or mould upon: Pass., perf. part., νεοσσιαὶ προσπεπλασμέναι ἐκ πηλοῦ πρὸς ἀποκρήμνοισι οὔρεσι nests formed of clay and attached to precipitous mountains, Hdt.

div1.head: πρόσπλατος
div1.sense: approachable, Aesch.

div1.head: προσπλέκω
div1.sense: to connect with:—Pass. to cling to, be implicated with, τινι Strab.

div1.head: προσπλέω
div1.sense: to sail towards or against, Hdt., Thuc., etc.; τινί against one, Thuc.; of ships, Xen.

div1.head: προσπληρόω
div1.sense: to fill up or complete a number, ἱππέας πρ. εἰς δισχιλίους Xen.
to equip ships besides, man still more ships, Thuc.; so in Mid., Xen.

div1.head: προσπλωτός
div1.sense: accessible from the sea, i. e. navigable, Hdt.

div1.head: προσπνέω
div1.sense: to breathe upon, inspire, Theocr.
impers., c. gen., προσπνεῖ μοι κρεῶν a smell of meat comes to me, Ar.

div1.head: προσποιέω
div1.sense: to make over to, Lat. tradere alicui in manus, πρ. τινὶ τὴν Κέρκυραν Thuc.; πρ. Λέσβον τῇ πόλει Xen.

Mid., with aor. mid. and pass., to attach to oneself, win, or gain over, τινά Hdt., Thuc., etc.; τὸν δῆμον Ar.; with a second acc. added, φίλους πρ. τοὺς Λακεδαιμονίους as friends, Hdt.; ὑπηκόους πρ. τὰς πόλεις Thuc.
to take what does not belong to one, pretend to, lay claim to, τὴν τῶν γεφυρῶν διάλυσιν Thuc.
to pretend, feign, affect, simulate, ὀργήν Hdt.; πρ. ἔχθραν to use it as a pretence, allege, Thuc.
c. inf. to pretend to do or to be, Hdt., etc.; πρ. μὲν εἰδέναι, εἰδότες δὲ οὐδέν Plat.:—c. inf. fut. to make as if one would, Xen.
with a negat., Lat. dissimulare, δεῖ δέ, εἰ καὶ ἠδίκησαν, μὴ προσποιεῖσθαι one must make as if it were not so, Thuc.

div1.head: προσποίημα
div1.sense: a pretence, assumption, Arist.

div1.head: προσποίησις
div1.sense: a taking something to oneself, acquisition, Thuc.
a pretension or claim to a thing, c. gen., Thuc.
absol. pretension, Arist.

div1.head: προσποιητικός
div1.sense: making pretence to, τινός Arist.

div1.head: προσποιητός
div1.sense: taken to oneself, assumed, affected, pretended, Dem.:—adv. -τῶς or -τως, opp. to τῷ ὄντι, Plat.; also προσποιητά as adv., Babr.

div1.head: προσπολεμέω
div1.sense: to carry on war against, be at war with another, Thuc., Xen.

div1.head: προσπολεμόομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to make oneʼs enemy or go to war with besides, τινά Thuc.

div1.head: προσπολέω
div1.sense: to attend, serve, τινί Eur.
Pass. to be escorted by a train of attendants, Soph.

div1.head: πρόσπολος
div1.sense: a servant, Soph., Eur.; a ministering priest, Trag.; πρ. φόνου minister of death, Aesch.
fem. a handmaid, Soph.

div1.head: προσπορίζω
div1.sense: to procure or supply besides, Xen., Dem.

div1.head: προσπορπατός
div1.sense: fastened on with a πόρπη, pinned down, Aesch.

div1.head: πρόσπταισμα
div1.sense: a stumble against something, a stumble, Arist.

div1.head: προσπταίω
div1.sense: to strike against a thing, to sprain, τὸ γόνυ Hdt.; πρ. τὸν πόδα to stumble along, halt, limp, Plut.:—absol. to stumble, limp, Ar., Xen.:—c. dat. to stumble upon, strike against, τινί Dem.:—of ships, to be wrecked, Hdt.
metaph. to fail, esp. in war, to suffer a defeat, Hdt.
πρ. τινί to offend, clash with, Plut.

div1.head: προσπτήσσω
div1.sense: to crouch or cower towards, ἀκταὶ λιμένος ποτιπεπτυῖαι (Epic perf. part. for προσπεπτηκυῖαι) headlands, verging towards the harbour, i. e. shutting it in, Od.

div1.head: πρόσπτυγμα
div1.sense: the object of embraces, Eur.

div1.head: προσπτύσσω
div1.sense: to embrace, Eur.
mostly as Dep.:—of a garment, to fold itself close to, προσπτύσσετο πλευραῖσιν χιτών Soph.
of persons,
to fold to oneʼs bosom, clasp, embrace, Od., Eur., etc.; στόμα γε σὸν προσπτύξομαι will press it to my lips, Eur.:—Pass., c. dat. to cling to, Soph.

metaph. to embrace, greet warmly, welcome, Od.; c. dupl. acc., πρ. τινά τι to address a friendly greeting to one, Od.; προσπτύσσεσθαι μύθῳ to entreat warmly, importune, Od.; θεῶν δαῖτας προσπτύσσεσθαι to welcome the feasts of the gods, Pind.

div1.head: προσπτύω
div1.sense: to spit upon, τινί Theophr., Luc.
metaph., πρ. τῷ καλῷ: absol., προσπτύσας Plut.

div1.head: προσραίνω
div1.sense: to sprinkle on one, τινί τι Strab.

div1.head: προσραπτέος
div1.sense: one must sew on, ap. Plut.

div1.head: προσράπτω
div1.sense: to stitch on: Pass., perf. part. τρίβωνες προσερραμμένοι patched coats, Plut.

div1.head: προσρέω
div1.sense: to flow towards a point, to stream in, assemble, Hdt.
to rush up to, τινί Plut.

div1.head: προσρήγνυμι
div1.sense: to dash or beat against (intr.), προσέρρηξεν ὁ ποταμὸς τῇ οἰκίᾳ NTest.

div1.head: πρόσρημα
div1.sense: an address, salutation, Plat.
that by which one is addressed, a name, designation, Plat., Dem.

div1.head: πρόσρησις
div1.sense: an addressing, accosting, πρόσρησιν διδόναι τινί to accost him, Eur.; ἕνεκʼ ἐμῆς προσρήσεως to enable me to address thee, Eur.

div1.head: προσρητέος
div1.sense: to be addressed, called, Plat.
προσρητέον, one must call, Plat.

div1.head: προσρίπτω
div1.sense: to throw to, τί or τινά τινι Plut.

div1.head: προσσαίνω
div1.sense: to fawn upon, properly of dogs; metaph., φῶτα προσσαίνειν κακόν Aesch.
of things, to please, like Lat. arridere, τινά Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: προσσέβω
div1.sense: to worship or honour besides, Aesch.

div1.head: προσσημαίνω
div1.sense: to connote, Arist.

div1.head: προσστάζω
div1.sense: to drop on, shed over, Pind.; πραῢν ποτιστάζων ὄαρον letting fall mild words, Pind.

div1.head: προσσταυρόω
div1.sense: to draw a stockade along or before a place, c. acc., Thuc.

div1.head: προσστείχω
div1.sense: to go or come towards, Od.; δεῦρο πρ. Soph.

div1.head: προσστέλλω
div1.sense: to lay upon: Mid. to keep close to, τοῖς ὀρεινοῖς, of a general, Plut.
in perf. pass. to be tight-drawn, close tucked in, ἰσχία προσεσταλμένα loins tucked up, of dogs, Xen.

div1.head: προσστρατοπεδεύω
div1.sense: to encamp near, τόπῳ Polyb.

div1.head: προσσυκοφαντέω
div1.sense: to slander besides, Dem.

div1.head: προσσυμβάλλομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to contribute to besides or at the same time, προσσυνεβάλετο τῆς ὁρμῆς contributed to their eagerness, Thuc.

div1.head: προσσυνοικέω
div1.sense: to settle with others in a place, join with others in a settlement, c. dat. pers., Thuc.

div1.head: προσσφάζω
div1.sense: to slay at a place, c. dat., Plut.

div1.head: προσσωρεύω
div1.sense: to store up besides, Luc.

div1.head: πρόσταγμα
div1.sense: an ordinance, command, Plat., etc.; ἐκ προστάγματος Dem.

div1.head: προστακτέος
div1.sense: one must order, Plat.

div1.head: προστακτικός
div1.sense: of or for commanding, imperative, Plut.

div1.head: προστακτός
div1.sense: ordained, ordinary, Decr. ap. Dem.

div1.head: προσταλαιπωρέω
div1.sense: to persist or persevere still further in a thing, c. dat., Thuc.

div1.head: πρόσταξις
div1.sense: an ordaining, an ordinance, command, Plat.
an assessment, Thuc.

div1.head: προστασία
div1.sense: a standing before, leadership, τοῦ δήμου, τοῦ πλήθους Thuc.:—absol. chieftainship, presidency, Thuc.
a standing up for, patronage; and in bad sense, partisanship, Dem.
= Roman patronatus, Plut.
a place before a building, a court or area, Aeschin.

div1.head: πρόστασις
div1.sense: outward dignity, pompous appearance, pomp, Plat.

div1.head: προστάσσω
div1.sense: c. acc. pers.,
to place or post at a place, χωρεῖτε οἷ προστάσσομεν (sc. ὑμᾶς) Eur.:—Pass., προσταχθείς πύλαις Aesch., etc.
to attach to, assign to, Hdt.; πρ. τινάς τινι to assign them to his command, Thuc.:—Pass., Ἰνδοὶ προσετετάχατο Φαρναζάθρῃ Hdt.
reversely, πρ. ἄρχοντα to appoint as commander over others, Hdt.

c. acc. rei, to give as a command, prescribe, enjoin, ἔργον, πόνον πρ. τινί Hdt., etc.:—Pass., τοῖσι δὲ ἵππος προσετέτακτο to others orders had been given to supply cavalry, Hdt.; τὰ προσταχθέντα orders given, Hdt.; τὸ προστεταγμένον Hdt.; τὰ προσταχθησόμενα orders that will be given, Xen.:—absol., προσταχθέν μοι the order having been given me, Dem.
c. dat. pers. et inf. to command, order one to do, Hdt., etc.:—Pass., impers., προσετέτακτό τινι πρήσσειν Hdt.
c. acc. et inf., Eur.:—Pass. to be ordered to do, Hdt.: absol. to receive orders, Thuc.

div1.head: προστατεύω
div1.sense: to be leader or ruler of, c. gen., Xen.; absol. to exercise authority, Xen.
πρ. ὅπως . . , to provide or take care that . . , Xen.

div1.head: προστατέω
div1.sense: to stand before, be ruler over, domineer over, χθονός, δωμάτων Eur.; πρ. τοῦ ἀγῶνος to be steward of the games, Xen.; absol., ὁ προστατῶν he that acts as chief, Xen.
to stand before as a defender, to be guardian or protector of, πυλῶν Aesch.; Ἀργείων Eur.
ὁ προστατῶν χρόνος the time thatʼs close at hand, Soph.

div1.head: προστατήριος
div1.sense: standing before, δεῖμα πρ. καρδίας fear hovering before, or domineering over, my heart, Aesch.
standing before, protecting, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: προστάτης
div1.sense: one who stands before, a front-rank-man, Xen.
a chief, leader of a party, Hdt.; ὁ πρ. τοῦ δήμου Thuc.
generally, a president, ruler, Aesch., Eur., etc.; προστάται τῆς εἰρήνης its chief authors, Xen.
one who stands before, a protector, guard, champion, πυλωμάτων Aesch., Soph., etc.

at Athens, of a citizen who took care of the μέτοικοι, as the Rom. patronus took care of his clientes; προστάτην γράφεσθαί τινα to choose as oneʼs patron, Ar.; but, γράφεσθαι προστάτου to enter oneself by oneʼs patronʼs name, attach oneself to a patron, Soph.
προστάτης θεοῦ one who stands before a god to entreat him, a suppliant, Soph.

div1.head: προστατικός
div1.sense: of or for a προστάτης (signf. II) Plat.
of or for rank or honour, Polyb.

div1.head: προσταυρόω
div1.sense: to draw a stockade in front of or along, τὴν θάλασσαν Thuc.

div1.head: προστειχίζω
div1.sense: to add to a fortification, include in the city-wall, Thuc.

div1.head: προστεκταίνομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to add of oneself, Plut.

div1.head: προστελέω
div1.sense: to pay or spend besides, Xen.

div1.head: προστέλλω
div1.sense: to guard or cover in front, Thuc.:—Mid., προστέλλεσθαί τινα to send armed into the field, Aesch.:—Pass., προὐστάλης ὁδόν wast equipt for, didst undertake, a journey, Soph.

div1.head: προστένω
div1.sense: to sigh or grieve beforehand, Aesch.

div1.head: προστερνίδιον
div1.sense: a covering for the breast, of horses, Xen.

div1.head: πρόστερνος
div1.sense: before or on the breast, Aesch.

div1.head: προστέρπω
div1.sense: to delight or please besides, Il.

div1.head: προστεχνάομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to devise besides, Plut.

div1.head: προστήκομαι
div1.sense: to stick fast to, cling to, προστακέντος ἰοῦ, of the poisoned robe clinging to Hercules, Soph.; and he is said to be ὕδρας προστετᾱκὼς φάσματι, Soph.

div1.head: προστίθημι
div1.sense: to put to, Lat. apponere, Od.; πρ. τὰς θύρας to put to the door, Hdt.; πρ. κλίμακας τοῖς πύργοις Thuc.
to hand over or deliver to, θεῶν γέρα ἐφημέροισι προστίθει Aesch.; γυναῖκα πρ. τινί to give her to him as wife, Hdt., etc.
simply, to give, bestow, φερνάς Eur.; χρήματα Dem.
πρ. πρῆγμά τινι to impose further business on a man, Hdt.; also c. inf., πρ. τινὶ πρήσσειν τι Hdt.:—then, πρ. τινὶ ἀτιμίην to impose disgrace upon him, Hdt.; λύπην, πόνους Eur.; ζημίας τινί Thuc.
to attribute or impute to, αἰτίαν τινί Eur.; θράσος τινί Eur.
to add, πρ. τι τῷ νόμῳ Hdt.; ὅρκῳ πρ. (sc. τὸν λόγον) , i. e. to make oath and then add the statement, Soph.:—absol. to make additions, to augment, Thuc.
esp. of adding articles to documents, πρ. τι περὶ τῆς ξυμμαχίας Thuc.; πρ. τῷ δικαίῳ to add to the definition of right, Plat.
c. acc. pers., πρ. ἑαυτόν τινι to join his party, Thuc.

Mid., προστίθεσθαι τὴν γνώμην τινί to associate oneʼs opinion to another, i. e. agree with him, Dem.: absol. to associate oneself to, οἷς ἂν σὺ προσθῇ Soph.; πρ. τῷ ἀστῷ to be well-inclined to him, Hdt.:—absol. to come in, submit, ap. Dem.
to give oneʼs assent, agree to a thing, c. dat., Hdt., Thuc., etc.
ψῆφον δʼ Ὀρέστῃ τήνδʼ ἐγὼ προσθήσομαι, literally, will deposit this vote in favour of Orestes, Aesch.; so, μὴ μιᾷ ψήφῳ προστίθεσθαι (sc. τὴν γνώμην) , ἀλλὰ δυοῖν Thuc.
c. acc. pers. to associate with oneself, i. e. take to one as a friend or ally, win over, Hdt., Thuc.; φίλον πρ. τινά Hdt.; ταύτην προσθοῦ δάμαρτα take her to wife, Soph.
c. acc. rei, to add to oneself, gain, πρ. πλέον to be profited, Soph.; πρ. χάριν ἐπιχαρίζεσθαι, Soph.; of evils, to bring upon oneself, Trag., etc.
to bring upon others, προσεθήκαντο πόλεμον made war, Hdt.; μῆνιν προσθέσθαι τινί to vent wrath upon him, Hdt.

div1.head: προστιλάω
div1.sense: to befoul with dung, Ar.

div1.head: προστιμάω
div1.sense: to award further penalty besides the regular one, Plat., Dem.; πρ. τῷ δημοσίῳ to adjudge to the treasury as a debt, Dem.:—the Act. was used of the Court, the Mid. of the individual who proposed the penalty, Lex ap. Dem.

div1.head: προστίμημα
div1.sense: that which is awarded over and above the regular penalty, a fine, Dem.

div1.head: προστραγῳδέω
div1.sense: to exaggerate in tragic style, Strab.

div1.head: προστρέπω
div1.sense: to turn towards a god, to approach with prayer, supplicate, Soph.; c. acc. pers. et inf. to entreat one to do, Soph.; c. acc. rei et inf. to pray that, Eur.:—so in Mid., Aesch.
to approach (as an enemy), Pind.

div1.head: προστρέφω
div1.sense: to bring up in: Pass., aor1 προσεθρέφθην, Aesch.

div1.head: προστρέχω
div1.sense: to run to or towards, come to one, πρός τινα Plat.; τινί Ar.: absol. to run up, Xen., etc.
in hostile sense, to run at, make a sally, πρός τινα Xen.

div1.head: προστρίβω
div1.sense: to rub against:—Pass., προστετριμμένος τισί worn down by intercourse with others, Aesch.: Mid., mostly in bad sense, to inflict or cause to be inflicted, πληγάς τινι Ar.: Pass. to be inflicted upon, τινί Aesch.
in good sense, πλούτου δόξαν προστρίβεσθαί τινι to attach to one the reputation of wealth, Dem.

div1.head: πρόστριμμα
div1.sense: that which is rubbed on: metaph. an affliction, Aesch.

div1.head: προστρόπαιος
div1.sense: turning oneself towards, hence
one who (having incurred pollution by sin or crime) turns to a god for purification, a suppliant, Soph., etc.; as adj. suppliant, πρ. λιταί Soph.
of one who has not yet been purified, a polluted person, Lat. homo piacularis, Aesch., Eur.
of the pollution incurred, πρ. αἷμα blood- guiltiness, Eur.
a suppliant for vengeance, Aesch.
pass. to whom the murdered person turns for vengeance, i. e. an avenger, Aeschin., etc.

div1.head: προστροπή
div1.sense: a turning oneself towards a god for purification, the supplication of a polluted person, Aesch.:— any address to a god, prayers, Aesch., Eur.; προστροπὴν θεᾶς the duty of praying to the goddess, the priestly office, Eur.; πόλεως προστροπήν a petition to the city, Soph.
πρ. γυναικῶν a suppliant band of women, Aesch.

div1.head: πρόστροπος
div1.sense: like προστρόπαιος, a suppliant, τινος Soph.; absol., Soph.

div1.head: προστυγχάνω
div1.sense: to obtain oneʼs share of a thing, c. gen., Soph.: c. dat. to meet with, hit upon, light upon, Plat.:— ὁ προστυγχάνων, ὁ προστυχών the first person one meets, the first that offers, any body, Plat.; τὰ προστυχόντα ξένια the guestsʼ fare set before him, Eur.

div1.head: προστῷον
div1.sense: a portico, Plat.

div1.head: προσυβρίζω
div1.sense: to maltreat besides, Dem.

div1.head: προσυγγίγνομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to speak with one before, τινι Thuc.

div1.head: προσυμμίσγω
div1.sense: to intermix first, τὸ ὕδωρ ἐς τὠυτό Hdt.

div1.head: προσυνοικέω
div1.sense: to cohabit with before, τινί Hdt.

div1.head: προσυπάρχω
div1.sense: to exist besides, οὐδὲ ταφῆναι προσυπῆρχεν ἐμοί and besides I could not have been buried, Dem.

div1.head: προσυπέχω
div1.sense: (sc. λόγον) , to be answerable also for, τῆς τύχης Dem.

div1.head: προσφάγιον
div1.sense: anything eaten with other food: generally, something to eat, NTest.

div1.head: πρόσφαγμα
div1.sense: a victim sacrificed for others, Eur.; of the victimʼs blood, Eur.
sacrifice, slaughter, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: προσφάζω
div1.sense: to sacrifice beforehand, τινί Eur.

div1.head: προσφαίνομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to appear besides, Xen.

div1.head: πρόσφατος
div1.sense: lately slain, fresh-slain, Il., Hdt.
generally, fresh, recent, Aesch., Dem.
πρόσφατον as adv. of Time, recently, lately, Pind.

div1.head: προσφερής
div1.sense: brought near, approaching: metaph. resembling, similar, τινι Hdt., Aesch., etc.; τὸ σῶμα προσφερὴς τῇ ψυχῇ Plat.:—rarely c. gen., πατρὸς προσφερεῖς ὀμμάτων Eur.; cf. ἐμφερής.
= πρόσφορος, serviceable, τινι Hdt.

div1.head: προσφέρω
div1.sense: to bring to or upon, apply to, Lat. applicare, Hdt., Eur., etc.; but, πρ. χεῖρά τινι to lay hands upon one, Pind.; also to offer oneʼs hand, as a friend, Xen.:—without dat. to apply, exhibit, employ, use, βίην Hdt.; πρ. τόλμαν to bring it to bear, Pind.: also, πρ. πόλεμον Hdt.
to add, τί τινι Soph., Eur.; τι πρός τι Hdt.
to present, offer, give, λουτρὰ πατρί Soph.; δῶρα Thuc.; θυσίας NTest.
esp. of meat and drink, to offer, to set before one, Xen.; πρ. τινὶ ἐμπιεῖν καὶ φαγεῖν Xen.
to bring forward, quote, cite, Pind.
to bring forward proposals, make an offer, πρ. λόγον or λόγους τινι Hdt., Thuc.: absol., πρ. περὶ ὁμολογίας Hdt., Thuc.
to contribute, bring in, yield, ἑκατὸν τάλαντα Hdt., etc.
to bring one thing near another, make it like, πρ. νόον ἀθανάτοις Pind.
Pass., with fut. mid. προσοίσομαι, to be borne towards, of ships, to put in, Xen.
to go against, attack, assault, τινι or πρός τινα Hdt., etc.; absol. to rush on, make an onset, Hdt.; προσφέρεσθαι ἄποροι difficult to engage, Hdt.
simply, to go to or towards, ἐκ τοῦ Ἰκαρίου πελάγεος προσφερόμενοι sailing, Hdt.
to deal with, behave oneself in a certain way towards one, Hdt., Thuc.;— προσφέρεσθαι πρὸς λόγον to answer it, Xen.
προσφέρεσθαί τινι to come near one, be like him, Hdt.
προσφέρεσθαί τινι to be put or imposed upon one, τὰ προσφερόμενα πρήγματα Hdt.
Mid., προσφέρεσθαί τι to take to oneself as meat or drink, Xen.:—Pass., τὰ προσφερόμενα meat or drink, food, Xen.
to exhibit, φιλοτιμίαν ὑμῖν NTest.
to apply or cause to be applied, Polyb.

div1.head: προσφεύγω
div1.sense: to flee for refuge to, τινί Plut.

div1.head: προσφευκτέος
div1.sense: one must be liable to a prosecution besides, Dem.

div1.head: πρόσφημι
div1.etym: mostly used in 3rd sg. aor2 προσέφη
div1.sense: to speak to, address, τινά Hom., Hes.; absol., Hom.;— also inf. mid. προσφάσθαι, Od.

div1.head: προσφθέγγομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:
to call to, address, accost, salute, τινα Eur.
to call by a name, call so and so, Pind.

div1.head: προσφθεγκτός
div1.sense: addressed, saluted, σοῦ φωνῆς by thy voice, Soph.
act. saluting, Anth.

div1.head: πρόσφθεγμα
div1.sense: an address, salutation, Trag.

div1.head: πρόσφθογγος
div1.sense: addressing, saluting, μῦθοι πρ. words of salutation, Aesch.

div1.head: προσφθονέω
div1.sense: to oppose through envy, Plut.

div1.head: προσφίλεια
div1.sense: kindness, good-will, Aesch.

div1.head: προσφιλής
div1.sense: dear, beloved, τῶν ἡλίκων προσφιλεστάτῳ Hdt.; προσφιλέες τῷ βασιλέϊ dear or friendly to him, Hdt.;—of things, pleasing, agreeable, grateful, dear, Lat. gratus, Aesch., Soph.
act., of persons, kindly affectioned, grateful, well-disposed, Soph., Thuc.:—adv. -λῶς, kindly, Soph.; πρ. ἔχειν τινί to be kindly affectioned to one, Xen.

div1.head: προσφιλοκαλέω
div1.sense: to add from a love of splendour, Strab.

div1.head: προσφιλονεικέω
div1.sense: to vie with another in anything, τινι πρός τι Polyb.

div1.head: προσφιλοσοφέω
div1.sense: to speculate further upon, τινί Luc.
to philosophise with another, c. dat. pers., Luc.

div1.head: προσφοιτάω
div1.sense: to go or come to frequently, to resort to a place, Dem., etc.; πρ. τινί to visit constantly, Strab.

div1.head: προσφορά
div1.sense: a bringing to, applying, application, Plat.
(from Pass.) that which is brought to a person or thing, an addition, Soph.
advantage, profit, Soph.:— a bounty, gift, Theophr.: an offering, NTest.

div1.head: προσφορέω
div1.sense: to bring to, bring in, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: προσφόρημα
div1.sense: that which is set before one, victuals, Eur.

div1.head: πρόσφορος
div1.sense: serviceable, useful, profitable, Hdt., Soph.; absol., ἔχοντας τὰ πρ. Hdt., Thuc.
suitable, fitting, worthy, Pind.; c. dat., Pind., Eur., etc.:—c. inf., οὐ πρόσφορον μολεῖν ʼtis not fit or meet to go, Aesch.
πρόσφορον, ου, what is fitting or suitable, Arist.:— πρόσφορα, ων, τά, fitting service, Aesch.; τὰ πρόσφορα all things meet or due, Eur.; τὰ πρ. as adv., fitly, Eur.

div1.head: προσφυής
div1.sense: growing upon or from, attached to, ἔκ τινος Od.
πρ. τινι attached or devoted to, Plat.:—adv. -ῶς, Ionic -έως, προσφυέως λέγειν to speak suitably, Hdt.

div1.head: προσφύω
div1.sense: to make to grow to: metaph. to make sure, confirm, Aesch., Ar.
Pass. or Mid., to grow to or upon, c. dat., Eur.:—metaph. to cling to, τῷ προσφὺς ἐχόμην Od.; and absol., προσφῦσα Il.; of a fish, τὠγκίστρῳ ποτεφύετο Theocr.

div1.head: προσφωνέω
div1.sense: to call or speak to, address, accost, τινά Hom., etc.; absol., Od.; τοῖσιν προσεφώνεε addressed [them] in these words, Od.; (but c. dat. pers., NTest.):—c. dupl. acc. to address words to a person, Il., Eur.
to call by name, Eur.
c. acc. rei, to pronounce, utter, Soph.

div1.head: προσφωνήεις
div1.sense: addressing, capable of addressing, Od.

div1.head: προσφώνημα
div1.sense: that which is addressed to another, an address, Soph., Eur.

div1.head: προσφώνησις
div1.sense: an address: a dedication, Plut.

div1.head: προσχαίρω
div1.sense: to rejoice at, τινί Plut.

div1.head: προσχαρίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep. to gratify or satisfy besides, τινί Xen.; τινί τι to give freely besides, Strab.

div1.head: προσχάσκω
div1.sense: to gape or stare open-mouthed at one, μὴ χαμαιπετὲς βόαμα προσχάνῃς ἐμοί fall not prostrate before me with loud cries, Aesch.

div1.head: προσχεθεῖν
div1.sense: to hold before:—Mid. to ward off from oneself, Theocr.

div1.head: προσχέω
div1.sense: to pour to or on, Luc.

div1.head: πρόσχημα
div1.sense: that which is held before: hence,

a screen, cloak, Thuc.: a plea, pretence, pretext, ostensible cause, Soph.; so, πρ. τοῦ λόγου Hdt.; πρ. ποιεῖσθαι ὡς ἐπʼ Ἀθήνας ἐλαύνει to make a pretence or show of marching against Athens, Hdt.; c. inf., πρ. ποιούμενοι μὴ προδώσειν to pretend that they will not betray, Thuc.; also, πρ. ποιεῖσθαί τι to put forward as a screen or disguise, Plat.:— πρόσχημα, acc. absol., by way of pretext, Hdt.

outward show, ornament, as Miletus is called πρ. τῆς Ἰωνίης, Ioniaʼs chief ornament, Hdt.; and the Pythian games τὸ κλεινὸν Ἑλλάδος πρ. ἀγῶνος, Soph.; πρ. τῆς τραγῳδίας the outward show of tragedy, Ar.

div1.head: πρόσχισμα
div1.sense: the forepart of the shoe, from its being slit, Arist.

div1.head: προσχρῄζω
div1.sense: to require or desire besides, c. gen., Hdt., Soph.: c. gen. pers. et inf., προσχρηίζω ὑμέων πείθεσθαι I request you to obey, Hdt.; c. inf. only, τί προσχρῄζων μαθεῖν; Soph.; πᾶν ὅπερ προσχρῄζετε (sc. πυθέσθαι) Aesch.

div1.head: προσχρίμπτω
div1.sense: to come near, Aesch.

div1.head: πρόσχυσις
div1.sense: a sprinkling, NTest.

div1.head: πρόσχωμα
div1.sense: a deposit made by water, πρ. Νείλου, of the Delta of the Nile, Aesch.

div1.head: προσχώννυμι
div1.sense: to heap up besides:
πρ. ταῦτα τὰ χωρία to form these new lands by deposition, of rivers, Hdt.
to choke up with mud, silt up, τὸν ἀγκῶνα τοῦ Νείλου Hdt.: absol., ὁ ποταμὸς προσχοῖ ἀεί continually forms fresh deposits, Thuc.
to throw earth against: Pass., ᾗ προσεχοῦτο τὸ τεῖχος where [the wall] had earth thrown against it, Thuc.

div1.head: προσχωρέω
div1.sense: to go to, approach, c. dat., Hdt., Thuc.; absol., Xen.
to come or go over to, come in, join, τινί or πρός τινα Hdt., Attic; absol., Thuc.; also, πρ. ἐς ὁμολογίαν or ὁμολογίᾳ Hdt., Thuc.
to accede to an opinion, Hdt.; πρ. λόγοις τινός Soph.: to make concessions, Eur.
to approach, i. e. to agree with, be like, τινί or πρός τινα Hdt.
to put faith in, believe, τινί Hdt.

div1.head: προσχώρησις
div1.sense: a going towards, approach, Xen.

div1.head: πρόσχωρος
div1.sense: lying near, neighbouring, Aesch., Soph.
as Subst., a neighbour, Hdt.

div1.head: πρόσχωσις
div1.sense: = πρόσχωμα, Thuc.
a bank or mound raised against a place, Thuc.

div1.head: προσψαύω
div1.sense: to touch upon, touch, τινί Pind.; absol., Soph.

div1.head: προσψηφίζομαι
div1.sense: Mid. to vote besides, grant by a majority of votes, Plut.

div1.head: προσψύχω
div1.sense: to devote oneself heart and soul, Anth.

div1.head: προσῳδία
div1.sense: the tone or accent of a syllable, Plat.

div1.head: προσῳδός
div1.sense: in accord, in tune, harmonious, Eur.; c. dat., προσῳδὸς ἡ τύχη τὠμῷ πάθει Eur.

div1.head: πρόσωθεν
div1.sense: from afar, Il., Trag., etc.

div1.head: προσωνυμία
div1.sense: a surname, Plut.

div1.head: προσωπεῖον
div1.sense: a mask, Luc.

div1.head: προσωποληπτέω
div1.sense: to be a respecter of persons, NTest.

div1.head: προσωπολήπτης
div1.sense: a respecter of persons, NTest.

div1.head: προσωποληψία
div1.sense: respect of persons, NTest.

div1.head: πρόσωπον
div1.sense: the face, visage, countenance, mostly in pl., even of a single person, Hom., Soph., etc.; βλέπειν τινὰ εἰς πρ. Eur.; ἐς πρ. τινὸς ἀφικέσθαι to come before him, Eur.:— κατὰ πρ. in front, facing, Thuc., etc.; ἡ κατὰ πρ. ἔντευξις a tete-a-tete, Plut.; also, πρὸς τὸ πρ. Xen.; λαμβάνειν πρ. τινος, προσωποληπτεῖν τινα, NTest.:—metaph., ἀρχομένου πρ. ἔργου Pind.
oneʼs look, countenance, Lat. vultus Aesch., etc.; οὐ τὸ σὸν δείσας πρ., cf. Hor. vultus instantis tyranni, Soph.
= προσωπεῖον, a mask, Dem., Arist.
outward appearance, beauty, Pind.
a person, NTest., etc.; πρόσωπον in bodily presence, NTest.

div1.head: πρόσω
div1.sense: absol.:
of Place, forwards, onwards, further, Hom., etc.; μὴ πόρσω φωνεῖν to speak no further, Hom.; μηκέτι πάπταινε πόρσιον Pind.:—also with the Art., πορεύεσθαι αἰεὶ τὸ πρόσω Hdt.; ἰέναι τοῦ πρ. Xen.
of Distance, far off, far away, Pind.; ἐγγύς, οὐ πρόσω βεβηκώς Eur.
too far, Plat.
of Time, forward, πρόσσω καὶ ὀπίσσω, v. sub. ὀπίσω:— henceforth, hereafter, Aesch.; ὡς πόρσιστα as late as possible, Pind.; ἤδη πόρρω τῆς ἡμέρας οὔσης far spent, Aeschin.
c. gen.:

of Place, forwards to, further into, πρ. τοῦ ποταμοῦ Xen.:—metaph., πρ. ἀρετῆς ἀνήκειν to have reached a high point of virtue, Hdt.; πόρρω τῆς μοχθηρίας far in wickedness, Xen., etc.:— also with the Art., προβήσομαι ἐς τὸ πρ. τοῦ λόγου Hdt.; ἐς τὸ πρ. μεγάθεος τιμᾶσθαι to be honoured to a high point of greatness, i. e. very greatly, Hdt.
of Distance, far from, οὐ πρ. τοῦ Ἑλλησπόντου Hdt.: metaph., πρ. δικαίων Aesch.; πόρρω εἶναι τοῦ οἴεσθαι Plat.; also foll. by ἀπό, πρ. ἀπὸ τῶν φορτίων Hdt.; ἀπὸ τοῦ τείχους Xen.
of Time, πρόσω τῆς νυκτός far into the night, Hdt., Plat.; μέχρι π. τῆς ἡμέρας Xen.

div1.head: προσωτέρω
div1.sense: further on, further, Hdt.:—c. gen. further than, Hdt.; πορρ. τοῦ καιροῦ Xen.:—also with the Art., τὸ προσωτέρω Hdt.
further from, τῶν πυλῶν Plut.
Sup. προσωτάτω, Attic πορρωτάτω furthest, Xen.; τὰ προσωτάτω the furthest parts, Hdt.; also προσώτατα, Hdt.:— ὡς προσωτάτω as far as possible, Soph.
c. gen. furthest from, Plat.

div1.head: προσωφελέω
div1.sense: to help or assist besides, contribute to assist, τινά Hdt., Eur.; also c. dat., like ἐπωφελέω, Hdt., Eur.

div1.head: προσωφέλημα
div1.sense: help or aid in a thing, c. gen., Eur.

div1.head: προσωφέλησις
div1.sense: help, aid, advantage, Soph.

div1.head: προσωφελητέος
div1.sense: one must assist, Xen.

div1.head: πρόταγμα
div1.sense: the van, Plut.

div1.head: προταινί
div1.sense: in front of, c. gen., Eur.

div1.head: προτακτέος
div1.sense: one must place in front, Xen.
one must prefer, τί τινος Aeschin.

div1.head: πρότακτος
div1.sense: posted in front, οἱ πρ. the van, Plut.

div1.head: προταμιεῖον
div1.sense: a room before a storeroom, Xen.

div1.head: προταμιεύω
div1.sense: to lay in beforehand, Luc.

div1.head: προταρβέω
div1.sense: to fear beforehand, Aesch.; c. inf., Eur.
to be anxious for one, τινος Soph.

div1.head: πρότασις
div1.sense: a proposition, the premiss of a syllogism, Arist.

div1.head: προτάσσω
div1.sense: to place or post in front, πρ. σφῶν αὐτῶν Ἀστύμαχον put him at their head, as speaker, Thuc.:—Mid., προετάξατο τῆς φάλαγγος τοὺς ἱππέας he posted his horse in front of it, Xen.:— Pass. to stand before one, so as to protect, Aesch.; τὸ προταχθέν, οἱ προτεταγμένοι the front ranks, van, Xen.
generally, to appoint or determine beforehand, χρόνον Soph.

div1.head: προτέγιον
div1.sense: the forepart of a roof, Plut.

div1.head: προτείνω
div1.sense: to stretch out before, hold before, Xen.
to expose to danger, Soph.
metaph. to hold out as a pretext or excuse, Hdt., Soph., etc.
to stretch forth the hands, as a suppliant; Hdt., etc.; (so also in Mid., Hdt.); πρ. τινὶ χεῖρα Soph.: —intr. to stretch forward, εἰς τὸ πέλαγος Plat.
πρ. δεξιάν to offer it as a pledge, Soph., etc.; so, πρ. πίστιν Dem.
to hold out, tender, shew at a distance, Lat. ostentare, Hdt., Aesch., etc.:—so in Mid., Hdt., Plat.
to put forward as an objection, Dem.; so in Mid., Plat.
in Mid., μισθὸν προτείνεσθαι to demand as a reward, Hdt.

div1.head: προτέλειος
div1.sense: before consecration:—as Subst., προ-τέλεια (sc. ἱερά), τά, a sacrifice offered before any solemnity, προτέλεια ναῶν as an offering in behalf of the ships, Aesch.; προτέλεια παιδός a sacrifice before her marriage, Eur.
generally, a beginning, ἐν προτελείοις κάμακος in the preliminary conflicts, Aesch.; ἐν βιότου πρ. Aesch.

div1.head: προτελέω
div1.sense: to pay as toll or tribute, andgenerally to pay or expend beforehand, τί τινι Xen.
to initiate or instruct beforehand, Luc.

div1.head: προτελίζω
div1.sense: to present as an offering preliminary to marriage, Eur.

div1.head: προτεμένισμα
div1.sense: the precincts or entrance of a τέμενος, Thuc.

div1.head: προτέμνω
div1.sense: to cut up beforehand, Il.
to cut off in front, cut short, Lat. praecidere, Od.
Mid. to cut forward or in front of one, εἰ ὦλκα διηνεκέα προταμοίμην if in ploughing I cut a long furrow before me, Od.

div1.head: προτενθεύω
div1.sense: to taste and take out the tid-bits; generally, to have the pick of a thing, Ar.

div1.head: προτένθης
div1.sense: one who picks out the tid-bits, a dainty fellow, gourmand, Ar.

div1.head: προτεραῖος
div1.sense: on the day before, τῇ προτεραίᾳ ἡμέρᾳ Plat.; c. gen., τῇ πρ. ἡμέρᾳ τῆς μάχης Thuc.:—more commonly alone, τῇ προτεραίᾳ (sub. ἡμέρᾳ) , Lat. pridie, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: προτερέω
div1.sense: to be before, be in advance, Hdt.; πρ. τῆς ὁδοῦ to be forward on the way, Hdt.
to be beforehand, take the lead, Thuc.
to gain an advantage, Philipp. ap. Dem.

div1.head: προτέρημα
div1.sense: an advantage, victory, Polyb.

div1.head: πρότερος
div1.etym: πρότερος and πρῶτος comp. and Sup. formed from πρό
div1.sense: as Lat. prior, primus, from prae.
comp. πρότερος, η, ον
of Place, before, in front, forward, Il.; πόδες πρ. the fore feet, Od.

of Time, before, former, sooner, Hom., etc.; οἱ πρότεροι men of former times, Il.; πρότερος γενεῇ Il.; but, πρ. παῖδες children by the first or a former marriage, Od.; τῇ προτέρῃ (sc. ἡμέρᾳ) on the day before, Lat. pridie, Od.; ὁ πρότερος Διονύσιος Dionysius the elder, Xen.:—the adj. is often used where we use the adv., ὅ με πρότερος κάκʼ ἔοργεν Il., etc.
as a regular comp., c. gen., Il., Hdt., etc.; also foll. by ἤ, τῷ προτέρῳ ἔτεϊ ἢ κρητῆρα ἐληίσαντο Hdt.
of Rank, Worth, and generally of Precedence, before, above, superior, Dem.; πρ. τινος πρός τι superior to him in a thing, Plat.

after Hom., neut. πρότερον as adv. before, sooner, earlier, Hdt., etc.; ὀλίγον πρ. Plat.:—c. gen., ὀλίγῳ τι πρ. τούτων Hdt., etc.; most commonly foll. by ἤ, Hdt., Attic; also by πρίν, πρὶν ἄν, πρὶν ἤ, Hdt., Attic; also used with the Art., τὸ πρ. τῶν ἀνδρῶν τούτων Hdt.: adv. often between Art. and Subst., e. g. ὁ πρότερον βασιλεύς Hdt.
Sup. πρῶτος, η, ον, contr. from *πρόατος, Doric πρᾶτος,
adj. first, serving as the ordinal to the cardinal εἷς, Hom.
of Place, first, foremost, ἐνὶ πρώτοισι or μετὰ πρώτοισι alone, Il.; ἐν πρώτῳ ῥυμῷ at the front or end of the pole, Il.; πρώτῃσι θύρῃσι at the first or outermost doors, Il.
of Time, πρὸς πρώτην ἕω at first dawn, Soph.

of Order, πρῶτοι πάντων ἀνθρώπων Hdt.; τῇ πρώτῃ τῶν ἡμερῶν Hdt.:— ἐν πρώτοις, among the first, then like Lat. imprimis, above all, especially, greatly, Hdt.; in Attic, ἐν τοῖς πρῶτοι (v. τό A. IV. 7):—in late Greek it is even foll. by a gen., πρῶτός μου NTest.
of Rank, μετὰ πρώτοισιν among the first men of the state, Od., etc.
neut. pl. πρῶτα, ων, τά,
(sc. ἆθλα) , the first prize, Il., Soph.
the first part, beginning, τῆς Ἰλιάδος τὰ πρ. Plat., etc.

the first, highest, in degree, τὰ πρ. τᾶς λιμῶ (Doric) the extremities of famine, Ar.; ἐς τὰ πρῶτα τιμᾶσθαι Thuc.:—of persons, ἐὼν τῶν Ἐρετριέων τὰ πρῶτα Hdt.; τὰ πρῶτα τῆς ἐκεῖ μοχθηρίας the chief of the rascality down there, Ar.
as adv.,
τὴν πρώτην (sc. ὥραν, ὁδόν) first, at present, just now, Hdt., etc.; so, τὴν πρώτην εἶναι, like ἑκὼν εἶναι, at first, Hdt.
with Preps., ἀπὸ πρώτης (sc. ἀρχῆς) , Thuc.
most commonly in neut. sg. and pl., πρῶτον, πρῶτα,
first, in the first place, Lat. primum, Hom., etc.
= πρότερον, before, Xen., Anth.
first, for the first time, Soph., etc.; ἐπεὶ πρῶτον, Lat. quum primum, as soon as, Hom.; so, ὁππότε κε πρῶτον Od.; ὅτε or ὅταν πρ. Dem.; ἐὰν or ἢν πρ. Plat.
adv. πρώτως, Arist., etc.

div1.head: προτέρω
div1.etym: from πρό, as ἀποτέρω from ἀπό
div1.sense: further, forwards, Hom.; καί νύ κε δὴ προτέρω ἔτʼ ἔρις γένετʼ the quarrel would have gone further, Il.

div1.head: προτέρωσε
div1.sense: toward the front, forward, H. Hom.

div1.head: προτεύχω
div1.sense: to do beforehand:—perf. pass. inf. προτετύχθαι, to have happened beforehand, to be past, Il.

div1.head: προτίθημι
div1.etym: the pres. and imperf. pass. are supplied by πρόκειμαι
div1.sense: to place or set before, set out, esp. of meals, τραπέζας πρότιθεν (Epic for προὐτίθεσαν) Od.; δαῖτά τινι προθεῖναι Hdt., etc.:—Mid. to have set before one, δαῖτα Hdt.
like Lat. projicere, πρ. τινὰ κυσίν to throw him to the dogs, Il.; πρ. τινὰ θηρσὶν ἁρπαγήν Eur.
generally to hand over to, give over to, τί τινι Soph.
to expose a child, Hdt., etc.
to set up as a mark or prize, propose, ἀέθλους Hdt.; ἅμιλλαν Eur.:—Pass., προὐτέθην ἆθλον δορός Eur.
to propose as a penalty, θάνατον πρ. ζημίαν Thuc., etc.
to set forth, fix, set, ἐς ἑβδομήκοντα ἔτεα οὖρον τῆς ζόης πρ. Hdt.; so in Mid., οὖρον πρ. ἐνιαυτόν Hdt.
to propose as a task, τί τινι Soph.:—Mid. to propose to oneself as a task or object, Plat.
Mid. also, to put forth on oneʼs own part, display, shew, εὐλάβειαν Soph.
προτίθεσθαί τινα ἐν οἴκτῳ to set before oneself in pity, i. e. compassionate, Aesch.
πρ. νεκρόν to lay out a dead body, let it lie in state, Hdt.; so in Mid., Eur., etc.
to set out wares for show or sale, Luc.

to propose, bring forward a thing to be debated, Lat. in medium afferre, προθεῖναι πρῆγμα, λόγον Hdt.; γνώμας Thuc.: —c. inf., προθεῖναι λέγειν to propose a discussion, Thuc.:—Mid., πένθος προεθήκαντο proposed to themselves, observed mourning, Hdt.:—Pass., ψῆφος περὶ ἡμῶν προτεθεῖσα Dem.
to appoint, hold a meeting, Luc.:—Mid., προὔθετο λέσχην appointed a council, Soph.
Pass., οὐ προὐτέθη σφίσι λόγος speech was not allowed them, Xen.
to put forward, as one foot before the other, Eur.
to hold out as a pretext, Soph.
to put before or first, τι Plat.:—Mid. to put in front, τοὺς γροσφομάχους Polyb.
to put before or over, πέπλον ὀμμάτων Eur.
to prefer one to another, τί τινος Hdt., Eur.; ἡδονὴν ἀντὶ τοῦ καλοῦ Eur.:—Mid., πάρος τοὐμοῦ πόθου προὔθεντο τὴν τυραννίδα Soph.

div1.head: προτιμάω
div1.sense: to honour one before or above another, to prefer one to another, τινά or τί τινος Plat., etc.; τινὰ ἀντί τινος or πρό τινος Plat.
c. acc. only, to prefer in honour or esteem, Aesch., etc.:— Pass. to be so preferred, Thuc., etc.; προτιμᾶσθαι ἀποθανεῖν to be selected as a victim to be put to death, Thuc.
c. gen. only, to care for, take heed of, reck of, Aesch.; οὐδὲν πρ. τινός Eur., etc.

c. inf. foll. by ἤ, to wish rather, prefer, προτιμῶντες καθαροὶ εἶναι ἢ εὐπρεπέστεροι Hdt.: c. inf. only, to wish greatly, wish much to do or be, Soph., Eur.; πρ. πολλοῦ ἐμοὶ ξεῖνος γενέσθαι to value at a great price the privilege of becoming my friend, Hdt.
c. partic., πρ. τυπτόμενος to care greatly about being beaten, Ar.

div1.head: προτίμησις
div1.sense: an honouring before others, preference, Thuc.

div1.head: προτιμωρέω
div1.sense: to help beforehand or first, τινί Thuc.:—Mid. to revenge oneself before, Thuc.

div1.head: προτιόσσομαι
div1.etym: Epic Dep., only in pres. and imperf., never in the common form προσ-όσσομαι
div1.sense: to look at or upon, Od.
of the mind, to look on, look stedfastly on, θάνατον Od.; ἦ σʼ εὖ γιγνώσκων προτιόσσομαι from thorough knowledge of thee I look on my fate, Il.

div1.head: προτίω
div1.sense: to prefer in honour, Aesch., Soph.

div1.head: προτολμάομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be first ventured or risked, Thuc.

div1.head: προτομή
div1.sense: the foremost or upper part of anything: a bust or half-figure, Anth.
the forepart of a ship, Anth.

div1.head: προτονίζω
div1.sense: to haul up with πρότονοι, Anth.

div1.head: πρότονοι
div1.sense: two ropes from the masthead to the forepart of a ship, the forestays, which kept the mast from falling back (opp. to ἐπίτονοι the backstays), Hom.:—in sg., σωτῆρα ναὸς πρότονον Aesch.
in Eur., the πρότονοι are sail-ropes, braces.

div1.head: προτοῦ
div1.sense: for πρὸ τοῦ ere this, aforetime, erst, formerly, Hdt., Attic; ὁ προτοῦ (sc. χρόνος) Thuc.

div1.head: προτρεπτικός
div1.sense: persuasive, ἡ πρ. σοφία skill in oratory, Plat.; κήρυγμα προτρεπτικώτατον πρὸς ἀρετήν Aeschin. adv. -κῶς, persuasively, Luc.

div1.head: προτρέπω
div1.sense: to urge forwards: Mid. to turn in headlong flight (cf. προτροπάδην) , προτρέποντο μελαινάων ἐπὶ νηῶν Il.; of the sun, ὅτʼ ἂν ἂψ ἐπὶ γαῖαν ἀπʼ οὐρανόθεν προτράπηται Od.; metaph., ἄχεϊ προτραπέσθαι to give oneself up to grief, Il.

to urge on, impel, Soph.;—c. acc. pers. et inf. to urge on, impel, persuade one to do a thing, Hdt., Attic; προτρ. τινὰ εἰς or ἐπὶ φιλοσοφίαν Plat.:—so in Mid., c. acc. pers. et inf., Aesch., etc.; τὰ κατὰ τὸν Τέλλον προετρέψατο ὁ Σόλων τὸν Κροῖσον Solon. roused Croesus to enquire about Tellus, Hdt.; προτρέψομαι I will exhort or urge thee, Soph.:—Pass. to be persuaded, Xen.

div1.head: προτρέχω
div1.sense: to run forward, Xen.
to run before, outrun, τινός Xen.

div1.head: πρότριτα
div1.sense: three days before, or for three successive days, Thuc.

div1.head: προτροπάδην
div1.sense: headforemost, with headlong speed, Il., Plat.

div1.head: προτροπή
div1.sense: exhortation, Arist.

div1.head: προτυγχάνω
div1.sense: to come before one, τὸ προτυχόν the first thing that came to hand, Pind.

div1.head: προτυπόω
div1.sense: to mould beforehand: Mid. to figure to oneself, conceive, Luc.

div1.head: προτύπτω
div1.sense: intr. to press forwards, Τρῶες δὲ προὔτυψαν Il.; ἀνὰ ῥῖνας προὔτυψε shot through his nostrils, Od.:—so in Pass., προτυπέν driven on (against Troy), or perh. stricken by an untimely blow, Aesch.

div1.head: προϋπαρχή
div1.sense: a previous service, Arist.

div1.head: προϋπάρχω
div1.sense: to be beforehand in a thing, to make a beginning of, c. gen., ἀδικίας Thuc.: c. dat. to begin with, πρ. τῷ ποιεῖν εὖ Dem.:—Pass., τὰ προϋπηργμένα benefits formerly received, Dem.
intr. to exist or be there before, Thuc., etc.; προϋπάρξαντα what happened before, past events, Dem.

div1.head: προϋπεξορμάω
div1.sense: to go out secretly before, Luc.

div1.head: προϋποβάλλω
div1.sense: to put under as a foundation:—Pass. to be prepared as materials, Luc.

div1.head: προϋπογράφω
div1.sense: to sketch out before: in Mid., Plut.

div1.head: προϋπόκειμαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be mortgaged before, Plut.

div1.head: προϋπολαμβάνω
div1.sense: to assume beforehand, Arist.

div1.head: προὔργου
div1.sense: serving for or towards a work, serviceable, profitable, useful, τι τῶν προὔργου something useful, Ar.; πρ. ἐστὶ εἴς or πρός τι ʼtis a step towards gaining oneʼs end, Plat.; οὐδὲν πρ. ἐστί, c. inf., Plat.:—also as adv. conveniently, opportunity, προὔργου πεσεῖν Eur.
comp. προὐργιαίτερος, α, ον, more serviceable, πρ. ποιεῖσθαί τι to deem of more consequence, Thuc.; πρ. γίγνεται, Plat.

div1.head: προυσελέω
div1.sense: to maltreat, insult, only in two passages, ὁρῶν ἐμαυτὸν ὦδε προυσελούμενον Aesch.; οὓς μὲν ἴσμεν εὐγενεῖς προυσελοῦμεν we insult those whom we know to be noble, Ar.

div1.head: προϋφαιρέω
div1.sense: to filch beforehand, πρ. τὴν ἐκκλησίαν, i. e. get it held (without notice) before the expected time, Aeschin.

div1.head: προφαίνω
div1.sense: to bring forth, bring to light, shew forth, manifest, display, Soph.: metaph., Ἀχιλεὺς Αἰγίναν πρ. brought it into light, made it illustrious, Pind.:—Pass. to be shewn forth, come to light, appear, Hom., Soph.; impers., οὐδὲ προὐφαίνετʼ ἰδέσθαι nor was there light enough for us to see, Od.:—aor2 pass. part. προφανείς, εῖσα, coming forward, appearing, Od.
to indicate or declare before, Soph., Dem.
= προτίθημι I. 5, to propose, ἆθλα Xen.
Pass., metaph. of sound, to be plainly heard, προὐφάνη κτύπος Soph.
to shew beforehand, foreshew, of oracles, Hdt., Soph.; ὅκως στρατίην πέμψεις, οὐ προφαίνεις holdest out no hope that thou wilt send, Hdt.: —Pass. or Mid. to shew itself or appear before, Xen.
seeminly intr. (the cognate acc. φάος or φῶς being understood), to give forth light, shine forth, οὐδὲ σελήνη προὔφαινε Od.; of a torch, Plut.; ὁ προφαίνων a torch-bearer, Plut.

div1.head: προφανής
div1.sense: shewing itself or seen beforehand, Arist.
seen clearly or plainly, conspicuous, Xen.
metaph. quite plain or clear, Plat.; ἀπὸ or ἐκ τοῦ προφανοῦς openly, Thuc.:—adv. -νῶς, Polyb.

div1.head: πρόφαντος
div1.sense: far seen, hence far-famed, Pind.
foreshewn, as by an oracle, Hdt., Soph.; πρόφαντα δέ σφι ἐγίνετο oracles were delivered to them, Hdt.

div1.head: προφασίζομαι
div1.sense: Dep.:

to set up as a pretext or excuse, allege by way of excuse, plead in excuse, c. acc., Theogn., Thuc., etc.; c. inf. to allege as an excuse that . . , Dem.:—absol. to make excuses, Thuc.:—aor1 προφασισθῆναι in pass. sense, to be used as a pretext, Thuc.
to allege (by way of accusation) that, Plat.

div1.head: πρόφασις
div1.sense: that which is alleged as the cause, an allegation, plea, καὶ ἐπὶ μεγάλῃ καὶ ἐπὶ βραχείᾳ ὁμοίως προφάσει to great or small plea alike, Thuc.; πρ. ἀληθεστάτη Thuc.

mostly in bad sense, a mere pretext, a pretence, excuse, Hdt., etc.; opp. to the true cause (αἰτία) , Thuc.: c. gen. the pretext or pretence for a thing, Hdt., etc.:—absol. in acc., πρόφασιν in pretence, Il., Attic; πρόφασιν μέν, opp. to τὸ δʼ ἀληθές, Thuc.; so in dat., προφάσει Thuc.: — ἀπὸ προφάσιος τοιῆσδε from or on some such pretext as this, Hdt., etc.:— προφάσιος εἵνεκεν Hdt.:— ἐπὶ προφάσει by way of excuse, Theogn., Thuc.; so, ἐπὶ προφάσιος Hdt.; κατὰ πρόφασιν Hdt.:—foll. by an inf., αὕτη ἦν σοι πρ. ἐκβαλεῖν ἐμέ for casting me out, Soph.; πρόφασιν ἔχει τοῖς δειλαίοις μὴ ἰέναι gives them an excuse for not going, Plat.

phrases, πρόφασιν διδόναι, ἐνδιδόναι to give occasion, make an excuse, Dem.; πρ. ἐνδοῦναί τινι Thuc.; πρ. προτείνειν, προΐσχεσθαι to put forward an excuse, Hdt.; παρέχειν Ar.; προφάσιας ἕλκειν to keep making pretences, Hdt., etc.; elliptically, μή μοι πρόφασιν (sc. πάρεχε) no excuse, no shuffling, Ar.
Pind. personifies Πρόφασις, as daughter of Epimetheus (Afterthought).
in Soph. it must mean suggestion.

div1.head: προφερής
div1.sense: carried before, placed before, excelling, c. gen., Hes.:—comp., more excellent, superior, surpassing, τῶν ἄλλων προφερέστερος Od.; c. inf., ἡμίονοι βοῶν προφερέστεραί εἰσιν ἑλκέμεναι are better than oxen in drawing, Il.:—Sup. προφερέστατος Il., Hes.:—also comp. and Sup., προφέρτερος, προφέρτατος Soph.
looking older than one is, well-grown, precocious, Plat., Aeschin.

div1.head: προφέρω
div1.sense: to bring before one, bring to, present, offer, Il., Thuc.
of words, πρ. ὀνείδεά τινι to throw reproaches in his teeth, Il.: and so, πρ. τινί to throw in oneʼs teeth, bring forward, allege, Lat. objicere, μή μοι δῶρα πρόφερε Ἀφροδίτης Il.
simply, to utter, αὐδάν, μῦθον Eur.; πρ. Αἴγιναν πάτραν to proclaim it as their country, Pind.
to bring forward, cite, Thuc.; προφέρων Ἄρτεμιν pleading Artemis as authority, Aesch.
of an oracle, to propose as a task, Hdt.:—Pass., προὐνεχθέντος τινί (gen. absol.) if it were commanded one to do so, Aesch.

to bring forward, display, Il.; ἔριδα πρ. to shew, i. e. engage in, rivalry, Od.; πόλεμόν τινι πρ. to declare war against one, Hdt.:—Mid., ξεινοδόκῳ ἔριδα προφέρεσθαι to offer quarrel to oneʼs host, Od.
to bear on or away, to carry off, sweep away, of a storm, Hom.
to move forward, πόδα Eur.:—then, to promote, further, assist, ἠὼς προφέρει ὁδοῦ morning furthers one on the road, Hes.; πρ. εἴς τι to conduce, help towards gaining an object, Thuc.
intr. to surpass, excel another, c. gen., Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: προφεύγω
div1.sense: to flee forwards, flee away, Il.
c. acc. to flee from, shun, avoid, Hom.

div1.head: προφητεία
div1.sense: the gift of interpreting the will of the gods, Orac. ap. Luc.
in NTest., the gift of expounding scripture, of speaking and preaching.

div1.head: προφητεύω
div1.sense: to be an interpreter of the gods, μαντεύεο, Μοῖσα, προφατεύσω δʼ ἐγώ Pind.; τίς προφητεύει θεοῦ who is his interpreter? Eur.; ὅστις σοι προφητεύσει τάδε who will give thee this oracular advice, Eur.
in NTest. to expound scripture, to speak and preach under the influence of the Holy Spirit.

div1.head: προφήτης
div1.sense: one who speaks for a God and interprets his will to man, a prophet; so Teiresias is πρ. Διός, Joveʼs interpreter, Pind.; and of Apollo, Διὸς προφήτης ἐστὶ Λοξίας πατρός Aesch.; while the Pythia, in turn, became the προφῆτις of Apollo, Hdt.; so Poets are called οἱ τῶν Μουσῶν προφῆται interpreters of the Muses, Plat.
generally, an interpreter, declarer, ἐγὼ πρ. σοι λόγων γενήσομαι Eur.; so, the bowl is called κώμου προφάτης, Pind.
in NTest.,
one who possesses the gift of προφητεία, an inspired preacher and teacher.
the revealer of Godʼs counsel for the future, a prophet (in the modern sense of the word), a predicter of future events.

div1.head: προφητικός
div1.sense: oracular, Luc.

div1.head: προφῆτις
div1.sense: of the Pythia, Eur.

div1.head: προφθάνω
div1.sense: to outrun, anticipate, c. acc., Aesch., Plat.
absol. to be beforehand, Eur.

div1.head: προφθίμενος
div1.sense: dead or killed before, Anth.

div1.head: προφοβέομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to fear beforehand, fear at the thought of, Xen.

div1.head: προφοβητικός
div1.sense: apt to fear beforehand, Arist.

div1.head: προφορέομαι
div1.sense: Mid., in weaving, to carry on the web by passing the weft across the warp: metaph., τὴν ὁδὸν προφορεῖσθαι to run to and fro, Ar.

div1.head: προφράζω
div1.sense: to foretell, Hdt.: perf. pass. part. προπεφραδμένα ἆθλα Hes.

div1.head: πρόφρασσα
div1.sense: kindly, gracious, Hom.

div1.head: πρόφρων
div1.sense: with forward mind, hence zealous, willing, ready, glad to do a thing, Hom., etc.
of acts, efforts, earnest, zealous, Hom.
Epic adv. προφρονέως, readily, earnestly, zealously, Il.; later προφρόνως Theogn., Attic

div1.head: προφυλακή
div1.sense: a guard in front; in pl. outposts, videttes, piquets, Xen.; in sg., ἡ πρ. αὐτοῦ his advanced guard, Xen.; διὰ προφυλακῆς with an advanced guard, Thuc.

div1.head: προφυλακίς
div1.sense: προφυλακὶς ναῦς, ἡ, a look-out ship, Thuc.

div1.head: προφύλαξ
div1.sense: an advanced guard: οἱ προφύλακες

div1.head: προφυλάσσω
div1.sense: to keep guard before, to guard a place or house, c. acc., Hhymn. (in the Epic 2nd pl. imperat. προφύλαχθε, for προφυλάσσετε) , Xen.; προφυλάσσειν ἐπί τινι to keep guard over a person or place, Hdt.:—absol. to be on guard, keep watch, ἡ προφυλάσσουσα (sc. ναῦς) = προφυλακίς, Hdt.: —Mid. to guard oneself, to be on oneʼs guard, take precautions, Hdt., Thuc.:—c. acc. to be on oneʼs guard or take precautions against, Lat. cavere, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: προφυράω
div1.sense: to mix up or knead beforehand: metaph. in Pass., προπεφύραται λόγος the speech is all ready concocted or brewed, Ar.

div1.head: προφυτεύω
div1.sense: to plant before: metaph. to engender, Soph.

div1.head: προφωνέω
div1.sense: to utter beforehand, Aesch.; προφωνεῖ τόνδε λόγον gives this order beforehand, Aesch.
to order beforehand or publicly, c. dat. et inf., καί σοι προφωνῶ τόνδε μὴ θάπτειν Soph.; with inf. omitted, ὑμῖν προφωνῶ τάδε Soph.

div1.head: προχαίρω
div1.sense: to rejoice beforehand, Plat.
in 3rd sg. imperat. προχαιρέτω, far be it from me! away with it! Aesch.

div1.head: προχαλκεύω
div1.sense: to forge beforehand, Aesch.

div1.head: πρόχειλος
div1.sense: with prominent lips, Strab.

div1.head: προχειρίζω
div1.sense: to put into the hand, have ready at hand, Polyb.:—Pass., in perf. part., taken in hand, undertaken, Plat., Dem.
as Dep. προχειρίζομαι, fut. Attic -χειριοῦμαι:— to take into oneʼs hand, prepare for oneself, Dem.
to choose, elect, Dem.
c. inf. to determine to do, Polyb.

div1.head: πρόχειρος
div1.sense: at hand, ready, Aesch., Soph.; of a drawn sword or knife, Soph., Eur.; λίθοις καὶ . . ἀκοντίοις, ὡς ἕκαστός τι πρόχειρον εἶχε Thuc.; ὃ προχειρότατον ἔχω εἰπεῖν Dem.
πρόχειρόν ἐστι it is easy, c. inf., Plat., etc.
of persons, ready to do, c. inf., Soph.; c. dat., πρ. τῇ φυγῇ ready for flight, Eur.
adv. -ρως, off-hand, readily, Plat.

div1.head: προχειροτονέω
div1.sense: to choose or elect before, Plat., Aeschin.
to give a previous vote, Dem.

div1.head: προχέω
div1.sense: to pour forth or forward, Il., Pind.; σπονδὰς προχέαι Hdt.:—metaph., ὄπα γλυκεῖαν Pind.:—Pass., metaph. of large bodies of men pouring over a plain, Il.

div1.head: πρόχνυ
div1.sense: with the knees forward, i. e. kneeling, on oneʼs knees, Il.; metaph., ὥς κεν ἀπόλωνται πρόχνυ that they may perish on their knees, i. e. may be brought low and perish, Il.; so, πρόχνυ ὀλέσθαι Od.

div1.head: προχοή
div1.sense: mostly in pl., the outpouring, i. e. the mouth, of a river, Hom., Pind., etc.; sg. in Hes.

div1.head: προχοΐς
div1.sense: a chamberpot, Xen.

div1.head: πρόχοος
div1.sense: a vessel for pouring out, a ewer for pouring water on the hands of guests, Hom., Soph.;— a wine-jug from which the cupbearer pours into the cups, Od.

div1.head: προχορεύω
div1.sense: to dance before in a chorus, πρ. κῶμον to lead a κῶμος or festive band, Eur.

div1.head: προχρίω
div1.sense: to smear before, πρ. τί τινι to smear or rub with a thing, Soph.

div1.head: πρόχρονος
div1.sense: of former time, Luc.

div1.head: πρόχυσις
div1.sense: a pouring out, πρ. τῆς γῆς a deposition of mud by a river, Lat. alluvies, Hdt.: —in οὐλὰς κριθῶν πρόχυσιν ἐποιέετο (cf. προχύται), πρόχυσιν ἐποιέετο must be taken as a simple Verb = προέχεε, Hdt.

div1.head: προχύται
div1.sense: (sc. κριθαί) , αἱ = οὐλοχύται, Eur.

div1.head: προχύτης
div1.sense: an urn for libations, Eur.

div1.head: προχυτός
div1.sense: poured out in front:— Προχύτη νῆσος the island of Procida, formed by eruption from Vesuvius, Strab.

div1.head: πρόχωλος
div1.sense: very lame or halt, Luc.

div1.head: προχωρέω
div1.sense: to go or come forward, advance, πρὸς ἐμὴν χεῖρα as my hand guides thee, Soph.; of troops, Thuc.:—of Time, to go on, Xen.

metaph. of States, wars, enterprises, etc., to proceed, advance, go on, often with some word to denote a good or bad issue, εὖ προχωρῆσαι Eur.; προχωρησάντων ἐπὶ μέγα τῶν πραγμάτων Thuc.; τούτων προκεχωρηκότων ὡς ἐβούλοντο Xen.:—absol. to go on well, prosper, Hdt., etc.

impers., προχωρεῖ μοι it goes on well for me, I have success, ὡς οἱ δόλῳ οὐ προεχώρεε when he could not succeed by craft, Hdt.; c. inf., ἢν μὴ προχωρήσῃ ἀπελθεῖν if it be not possible to depart, Thuc.:—absol. in part., προκεχωρηκότων when things went on well, Xen.
later, of persons, to advance, Luc.

div1.head: προωθέω
div1.sense: to push forward, push or urge on, Plat.; πρ. αὑτόν to rush on, Xen.

div1.head: προώλης
div1.sense: ruined beforehand, Dem.

div1.head: πρόωρος
div1.sense: before the time, untimely, Anth.

div1.head: πρυλέες
div1.sense: men-at-arms, foot-soldiers, opp. to chiefs fighting from chariots, Il.

div1.head: πρυμναῖος
div1.sense: of a ship-stern, Anth.

div1.head: πρύμνα
div1.sense: (sub. ναῦς) the hindmost part of a ship, the stern, poop, Lat. puppis, Hom., etc.; he sometimes has it in full, νηὶ πάρα πρύμνῃ, ἐπὶ πρύμνῃ νηί, νηὶ ἐνὶ πρ., and in pl., νηυσὶν ἔπι πρύμνῃσι; though he also has πρύμνη νηός Od.:— ἐπὶ πρύμνην ἀνακρούεσθαι to back a ship (v. ἀνακρούω II); so, χωρεῖν πρύμναν to retire, draw back, Eur.; ἐπείγει κατὰ πρύμναν, of a fair wind, Soph.; κατὰ πρ. ἵσταται τὸ πνεῦμα Thuc.—Ships were fastened or drawn up on land by the stern, Il.: hence, πρύμνας λῦσαι Eur.; cf. πρυμνήσιος.
metaph. of the vessel of the State, Aesch.
generally the bottom, πρ. Ὄσσας the foot of mount Ossa, Eur.

div1.head: Πρυμνεύς
div1.sense: steersman, name of a Phaeacian, Od.

div1.head: πρύμνηθεν
div1.sense: from the stern, Il., Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: πρυμνήσιος
div1.sense: of or from a shipʼs stern, κάλως Eur.:—neut. pl. πρυμνήσια (sc. δεσμά) stern-cables, Lat. retinacula navis, Hom.

div1.head: πρυμνήτης
div1.sense: the steersman:—metaph., χώρας πρ. ἄναξ the pilot" of the State, Aesch.
as masc. adj. = πρυμνήσιος, πρ. κάλως Eur.

div1.head: πρυμνόθεν
div1.sense: from the bottom, hence like Lat. funditus, utterly, root and branch, Aesch.

div1.head: πρυμνόν
div1.sense: the lower part, end, Il.; πρυμνοῖς ἀγορᾶς ἔπι at the far end of the agora, Pind.

div1.head: πρυμνός
div1.sense: the hindmost, undermost, end-most: in Hom. always of the end of the limb next the body, the root, πρυμνὸς βραχίων, πρυμνὴ γλῶσσα, etc.; so, πρυμνὴν ὕλην ἐκτάμνειν to cut off the wood at the root, Il.; δόρυ πρυμνόν the part of a spear-head where it joins the shaft, Il.; λᾶας πρυμνὸς παχύς a stone broad at base, opp. to ὕπερθεν ὀξύς (which follows), Il.; Sup. πρυμνότατος Od.:—for πρύμνη ναῦς, v. πρύμνα.

div1.head: πρυμνοῦχος
div1.sense: holding the shipʼs stern, Anth.
detaining the ships (because they were anchored by the stern), Αὖλις Eur.

div1.head: πρυμνώρεια
div1.sense: the foot of a mountain, Il.

div1.head: πρυτανεία
div1.sense: the prytany or presidency, at Athens a period of 35 or 36 days, about 1/10 of a year, during which the prytanes of each φυλή in turn presided in the βουλή and ἐκκλησία, Oratt.; ἑνδεκάτῃ τῆς πρυτανείας (sc. τῆς Πανδιονίδος) on the 11th of the presidency of the Tribe Pandionis, Dem.
any public office held by rotation, πρ. τῆς ἡμέρης the chief command for the day, held by each general in turn, Hdt.

div1.head: πρυτανεῖον
div1.sense: the presidentsʼ hall, town-hall, Lat. curia, Hdt., Thuc., etc.; consecrated to Hestia or Vesta, to whom a perpetual fire was kept burning in it, which in Colonies was brought from the Prytaneion of the mother-city: at Athens the Prytanes had their meals there, and there they entertained foreign ambassadors, Ar., Dem.: citizens also of high merit, and the children of those who had fallen in battle, were rewarded by a seat at this public table, ἐν πρυτανείῳ δειπνεῖν, σιτεῖσθαι Ar., Plat.
a law-court at Athens, Dem., Plut.

πρυτανεῖα, τά, a sum of money deposited by each party to a lawsuit before the suit began, Ar., etc.; τιθέναι πρυτανεῖά τινι, i. e. bring an action against, Ar.; ἵνʼ αἱ θέσεις γίγνοιντο τῇ νουμηνίᾳ (sc. τῶν πρυτανείων) Ar.; δέχεσθαι τὰ πρ. to receive this deposit, i. e. to allow the action to be brought, Ar.

div1.head: πρυτανεύω
div1.sense: to be πρύτανις or president, to hold sway, Hhymn.
at Athens, to hold office as Prytanis, properly used of the presiding φυλή (v. πρύτανις II), ἔτυχεν ἡ φυλὴ Ἀκαμαντὶς πρυτανεύουσα Plat., etc.
πρ. περὶ εἰρήνης to put the question on a motion for peace, this being the duty of the Prytanes, Ar., etc.
generally, to manage, regulate, Dem.:—Pass., πρυτανεύεσθαι παρά τινος to suffer oneself to be guided by one, Dem.

div1.head: πρύτανις
div1.sense: a prince, ruler, lord, chief, of Hiero, Pind.; of Zeus, Pind., Aesch.

at Athens, a Prytanis or President: the πρυτάνεις were a committee of 50, chosen by lot from each of the 10 φυλαί, so that each set formed 1/10 part of the βουλή or Council of 500; out of these 50 πρυτάνεις one was chosen by lot as chief-president (ἐπιστάτης) ; he chose 9 πρόεδροι; and the real business was in the hands of this smaller body, with a secretary (γραμματεύς) added.—The φυλή which first entered office every year was determined by lot; and their term of office (πρυτανεία) was about five weeks. During this time all treaties and public acts ran in their name, in this form: Ἀκαμαντὶς φυλὴ ἐπρυτάνευε, Φαίνιππος ἐγραμμάτευε, Νικιάδης ἐπεστάτει the Tribe Acamantis were the Presidency, Phaenippus the Secretary, Niciades the Chief-president, Thuc.

div1.head: πρώην
div1.sense: lately, just now, Lat. nuper, Il., etc.
the day before yesterday, οὐ χθές, ἀλλὰ πρ. Thuc.; πρώην τε καὶ χθές till yesterday or the day before, i. e. till very lately, Hdt.; so, χθές τε καὶ πρώην Ar.; πρώην καὶ χθές Dem.

div1.head: πρωθήβης
div1.sense: in the prime of youth, Hom.; fem. πρωθήβη Od.

div1.head: πρωϊζός
div1.sense: neut. pl. πρωιζά was used as adv., just like πρώην, χθιζά τε καὶ πρωιζά yesterday or the day before, Il.
οὕτω δὴ πρ. κατέδραθες so very early, Theocr.

div1.head: πρώϊμος
div1.sense: early, of fruits, Xen.

div1.head: πρώϊος
div1.sense: early,
early in the day, at early morn, Il.; also, περὶ δείλην πρωίην (cf. δείλη) Hdt.:— πρωία used alone as Subst., ἦν δὲ πρωία, πρωίας γενομένης NTest.
early in the year, πρώιος ὁ στρατὸς συνελέγετο Hdt.; πρῷα τῶν καρπίμων early fruits, Ar.

div1.head: πρωΐ
div1.sense: early in the day, early, at morn, Il.; c. gen., πρωὶ ἔτι τῆς ἡμέρης Hdt.; ἑκάστης ἡμέρας τὸ πρῷ Xen.; πρῷ τῇ ὑστεραίᾳ early next morning, Xen.; ἅμα πρωί, ἀπὸ πρωί NTest.
generally, betimes, early, in good time, Lat. mature, tempestive, Hes., Ar., etc.; c. gen., πρῲ τῆς ὥρας Thuc.

= πρὸ καιροῦ, too soon, too early, πρῷ γε στενάζεις Aesch.; πρῲ ἐσβαλόντες, καὶ τοῦ σίτου ἔτι χλωροῦ ὄντος Thuc. —πρωί takes its degrees of comparison from its deriv. adj. πρώιος, comp. πρωιαίτερον, Sup. πρωιαίτατα, Attic πρῳαίτερον, πρῳαίτατα, Thuc., etc.

div1.head: πρωκτός
div1.sense: the anus, generally, the hinder parts, tail, Ar.

div1.head: πρών
div1.etym: gen. and dat. πρῶνος, πρῶνι, not πρωνός, πρωνί for it is contr. from πρεών
div1.sense: a foreland, headland, Lat. promontorium, Il.; the pl. is πρώονες from the lengthd. form πρώων, Il.:—in Aesch. Pers. 132, ἀμφοτέρας πρῶνα κοινὸν αἴας the foreland common to both continents is perh. the Chersonese; and Aesch. 879, πρὼν ἅλιος the peninsula of Asia Minor.

div1.head: πρώξ
div1.sense: a dewdrop, Theocr.

div1.head: πρῴραθεν
div1.etym: Ionic -ηθεν, in Poets before a consonant
div1.sense: from the shipʼs head, from the front, Pind., Thuc., etc.:—it is an old gen., and is so used ἐκ πρῴραθεν, by Theocr.

div1.head: πρῷρα
div1.etym: not πρώρα, for it is contr. from πρώειρα
div1.sense: the forepart of a ship, a shipʼs head, prow, bow, Lat. prora, Od., etc.; πνεῦμα τοὐκ πρῴρας a contrary wind, opp. to κατὰ πρύμναν, Soph.
metaph., πρῷρα βιότου the prow of lifeʼs vessel, i. e. early youth, Eur.; πάροιθεν πρῴρας καρδίας before my heartʼs prow, in front of my heart, Aesch.

div1.head: πρῳρατεύω
div1.sense: to be a πρῳράτης, Ar.

div1.head: πρῳρεύς
div1.sense: the officer in command at the bow, the look-out man, Xen., etc.

div1.head: πρωτάγγελος
div1.sense: announcing first, c. gen., Anth.

div1.head: πρωτάγριον
div1.sense: the first fruits of the chase: mostly in pl., Anth.

div1.head: πρωταγωνιστέω
div1.sense: to be πρωταγωνιστής, Plut.:— metaph. to play first fiddle, to take the lead, Arist.

div1.head: πρωταγωνιστής
div1.sense: one who plays the first part, the chief actor, Lat. primarum partium actor, Arist.

div1.head: πρώταρχος
div1.sense: first-beginning, primal, πρ. ἄτα Aesch.

div1.head: πρωτεῖον
div1.sense: the chief rank, first place, Dem.:—mostly in pl. the first prize, first part or place, Plat., Dem.

div1.head: Πρωτεσιλάειον
div1.sense: monument of Protesilaus, Strab.

div1.head: Πρωτεσίλαος
div1.sense: Protesilaus, first-of-the-people, name of the hero who first leaped ashore at Troy, Il.

div1.head: πρωτεύω
div1.sense: to be the first, hold the first place, Plat., etc.:— to be first in a thing, καρτερίᾳ Xen.; βδελυρίᾳ Aeschin.; περὶ κακίαν Aeschin.
c. gen. pers. to be first of or among, τῶν ῥητόρων Aeschin.

div1.head: πρωτηρότης
div1.sense: the earliest plougher, Hes.

div1.head: πρώτιστος
div1.sense: the very first, first of the first, Hom.; πολὺ πρώτιστος Hom.: neut. πρώτιστον as adv. first of all, Od., Ar., etc.: —so πρώτιστα, Hom., Attic; —τὸ πρώτιστον Eur.; τὰ πρώτιστα Od.

div1.head: πρωτόβολος
div1.sense: first struck, Eur.

div1.head: πρωτόγονος
div1.sense: first-born, firstling, Il., Hes.; φοῖνιξ πρ. first-created, Eur.
of rank, πρ. οἶκοι high-born houses, Soph.
first-ordained, Luc.

div1.head: πρωτόζυξ
div1.sense: newly wedded, Anth.

div1.head: πρωτοκαθεδρία
div1.sense: the first seat, NTest.

div1.head: πρωτοκλισία
div1.sense: the first seat at table, NTest.

div1.head: πρωτοκτόνος
div1.sense: committing the first murder, the first homicide, of Ixion, Aesch.

div1.head: πρωτοκύων
div1.sense: first dog, i. e. chief of the Cynics, Anth.

div1.head: πρωτόλεια
div1.sense: the first spoils in war, the firstfruits; τῶν σῶν γονάτων πρωτόλεια as the first act of my supplication, Eur.

div1.head: πρωτόμαντις
div1.sense: the first prophet or seer, Aesch.

div1.head: πρωτόμορος
div1.sense: dying or dead first, Aesch.

div1.head: πρωτοπήμων
div1.sense: first cause of ill, Aesch.

div1.head: πρωτόπλοος
div1.sense: going to sea for the first time, Od., Eur.; πρ. πλάτα the firstplied oar (of the ship Argo), Eur.
sailing first or foremost, Xen.

div1.head: πρωτοπορεία
div1.sense: the advanced guard, vanguard, Polyb.

div1.head: πρωτοστάτης
div1.sense: one who stands first, on the right, the right-hand man, Thuc.; but οἱ πρ. the front-rank men, Xen.
metaph. the leader of a party, NTest.

div1.head: πρωτοτόκια
div1.sense: the rights of the first-born, birthright, NTest.

div1.head: πρωτοτόκος
div1.sense: bearing her first-born, Il., Theocr.

div1.head: πρωτότοκος
div1.sense: pass. first-born, Anth., NTest.

div1.head: πρωτότομος
div1.sense: first cut, Anth.

div1.head: πταίρω
div1.etym: the pres. in use was the Dep. πτάρνυμαι
div1.sense: to sneeze, μέγʼ ἔπταρε he sneezed aloud, Od., Ar.; Ζεῦ σῶσον, ἐὰν πτάρῃ, as we say "God bless you, " Anth.:—of a lamp, to sputter, Anth.

div1.head: πταῖσμα
div1.sense: a stumble, trip, false step, Theogn.
a failure, misfortune, defeat, Hdt., Dem., etc.

div1.head: πταίω
div1.sense: trans. to make to stumble or fall, τινὰ πρός τινι Pind.:—Pass., τὰ πταισθέντα failures, Luc.

intr. to stumble, trip, fall, Soph., etc.; πτ. πρός τινι to stumble against, fall over, Aesch., Plat.; πρός τι Xen.; also, μὴ περὶ Μαρδονίωι πταίσηι ἡ Ἑλλάς lest Hellas should get a fall over him, i.e. be defeated by him, Hdt.
metaph. to make a false step, to fail, Thuc., Dem.; so, ἐλάχιστα, τὰ πλείω πτ. Thuc. etc.

div1.head: πταρμός
div1.sense: a sneezing, Ar., Thuc., etc.

div1.head: πτάρνυμαι
div1.sense: to sneeze, (v. *πταίρω), Xen.

div1.head: πτελέα
div1.sense: the elm, Lat. ulmus, Il.

div1.head: πτέρινος
div1.sense: made of feathers, πτ. κύκλος a feather- fan, Eur.; πτ. ῥιπίς Anth.
feathered, winged, Ar.

div1.head: πτέρνα
div1.sense: the heel, Il.: the under part of the heel, Aesch.
a ham, Batr.

div1.head: Πτερνογλύφος
div1.sense: ham-scraper, Batr.

div1.head: Πτερνοτρώκτης
div1.sense: ham-nibbler, Batr.

div1.head: Πτερνοφάγος
div1.sense: ham-eater, Batr.

div1.head: πτεροδόνητος
div1.sense: moved by flapping wings: metaph. high-soaring, Ar.

div1.head: πτερόεις
div1.sense: feathered, winged, ὀϊστοί, ἰοί Il.; πέδιλα Hes., etc.
feather-like, light, λαισήια Il.
metaph., ἔπεα πτερόεντα winged words, Hom., Hes.; so, πτ. ὕμνος Pind.; also, φυγὴ πτερόεσσα Eur.

div1.head: πτερόν
div1.sense: mostly in pl. feathers, Od., Hdt., etc.; in sg. a feather, Ar.

= πτέρυξ, a birdʼs wing, in pl. wings, Hom., Aesch.; Παλλάδος ὑπὸ πτεροῖς ὄντας, metaph. from chickens under the henʼs wings, Aesch.: —τῷ πτερὰ γίγνετο he got as it were wings, i. e. spirit, courage, Il.
the wings of a bat (v. πτίλον II), Hdt.
any winged creature, as the Sphinx, Eur.; a beetle, Ar.
like οἰωνός, Lat. avis, an augury, omen, Pind., Soph.
anything like wings: as
a shipʼs wings, i. e. oars (cf. πτερόω) , ἐρετμά, τά τε πτερὰ νηυσὶ πέλονται Od.; νηὸς πτερά Hes., Eur.:— hence birds are said πτεροῖς ἐρέσσειν, Eur.
ἀέθλων πτερά, i. e. the wings of victory, which lift the Poet to heaven, Pind.
a feathered arrow, Eur.
τοῦ πώγωνος τὰ πτερά the points of the beard, Luc.
in Architecture, of the rows of columns along the sides of Greek temples, v. ἄπτερος.

div1.head: πτεροποίκιλος
div1.sense: motley-feathered, Ar.

div1.head: πτερόπους
div1.sense: wing-footed, of Hermes, Anth.

div1.head: πτερορρυέω
div1.sense: to shed the feathers, moult, Ar.: metaph. to be plucked, fleeced, plundered, Ar.

div1.head: πτεροφόρος
div1.sense: feathered, winged, Aesch., Eur.; πτ. φῦλα the feathered tribes, Ar.:—metaph., πτ. Διὸς βέλος the winged bolt of Zeus, Ar.

div1.head: πτεροφυέω
div1.sense: to grow feathers, Plat.

div1.head: πτεροφύτωρ
div1.sense: feather-producing, Plat.

div1.head: πτερόω
div1.sense: to furnish with feathers or wings, feather, τινά Ar.; πτεροῦν βιβλίον to tie a paper to a feathered arrow, Hdt.:—Pass. to be or become feathered, to be fledged, Ar., Plat.
to furnish a ship with oars: metaph. in Pass., σκάφος τάρσῳ ἐπτερωμένον winged with oars, Eur.
metaph. to set on the wing, excite (cf. ἀναπτερόω), Ar.:—Pass. to be excited, Luc.

div1.head: πτερυγίζω
div1.sense: to flutter with the wings, like young birds trying to fly, Ar.: to flap the wings like a cock crowing, Ar.:—in Ar. Eq. the word alludes to a play by Magnes called Ὄρνιθες.

div1.head: πτερύγιον
div1.sense: the wing of a building, a turret or pinnacle, NTest.

div1.head: πτερυγωτός
div1.sense: having wings, winged, Ar.

div1.head: πτέρυξ
div1.sense: the wing of a bird, Il.; in pl. wings, Hom., etc.
a winged creature, a bird, Anth.
anything like a wing, the flap or skirt of a coat of armour, Xen.; also of the Doric χιτών, Ar.
the broad edge of a knife or spear, Plut.
anything that covers or protects like wings, πτ. πέπλων Eur.; Εὐβοίης πτέρυξ, i. e. Aulis, Eur.
metaph., πτέρυγες γόων the wings, i. e. the flight or flow, of grief, Soph.; πτ. Πιερίδων Pind.

div1.head: πτερύσσομαι
div1.sense: Attic -ττομαι, fut. ξομαι, Dep. to clap the wings like a cock crowing, Babr., Luc.

div1.head: πτέρωμα
div1.sense: that which is feathered, e. g. a feathered arrow, Aesch.
plumage, Plat.

div1.head: πτέρωσις
div1.sense: plumage, Ar.

div1.head: πτερωτός
div1.sense: feathered, Hdt., Eur., etc.
winged, Hdt., Trag.; so, πτ. φθόγγος, a sound as of wings, Ar.
πτερωτοί (sc. ὄρνιθες) feathered fowl, birds, Eur.

div1.head: πτηνολέτις
div1.sense: bird-killing, Anth.

div1.head: πτηνός
div1.sense: feathered, winged, Trag., etc.; Διὸς πτ. κύνες, i. e. eagles, Aesch.
τὰ πτηνά winged creatures, fowls, birds, Aesch., Trag.; πτηνὸν ὀρνίθων γένος Ar.; πταναὶ θῆραι chase of winged game, Soph.
metaph., πτηνοὶ μῦθοι, like Homerʼs ἔπεα πτερόεντα, Eur.; πτ. ὄνειροι fleeting dreams, Eur.

div1.head: πτῆσις
div1.sense: a flying, flight, Aesch.

div1.head: πτήσσω
div1.sense: to frighten, scare, alarm, Lat. terrere, Il., Theogn.
intr. to crouch or cower down for fear (cf. πτώσσω), properly of animals, Soph.; of men, Pind., Attic; πτ. βωμὸν ὕπο Eur.; also c. acc. loci, πτ. βωμόν to flee cowering to the altar, Eur.
to crouch like a wild beast ready to spring, Eur.;—so of men in ambush, ὑπὸ τεύχεσι πεπτηῶτες Od.
c. acc. rei, to crouch for fear of, ἀπειλάς Aesch.

div1.head: πτίλον
div1.sense: used properly of the soft feathers or down under the true feathers, a piece of down, a plumelet, Ar.; cf. πτιλωτός.
a wing-like membrane in a kind of serpent, Hdt.

div1.head: πτιλόνωτος
div1.sense: with feathered back, Anth.

div1.head: πτιλωτός
div1.sense: with membranous wings, opp. to πτερωτός, Arist.

div1.head: πτισάνη
div1.sense: peeled barley: a drink made thereof, barley-water, a ptisan, Ar.

div1.head: πτίσσω
div1.sense: to winnow: to peel or to bray in a mortar, Hdt.

div1.head: πτιστής
div1.sense: one who shells or pounds, Anth.

div1.head: πτόα
div1.sense: abject fear, terror, Polyb.

div1.head: πτοέω
div1.sense: to terrify, scare, Anth.:—Pass. to be scared, dismayed, φρένες ἐπτοίηθεν Od.; ἐπτοημένος Aesch., Eur.

metaph. to flutter, excite by any passion, τό μοι καρδίαν ἐπτόασεν Sapph.:—Pass. to be in a flutter, be passionately excited, Theogn.; ἐπτοημένοι φρένας Aesch.; ὡς ἐπτόηται Eur.:—generally, μέθʼ ὁμήλικας ἐπτοίηται he gapes like one distraught after his fellows, Hes.; τὸ πτοηθέν distraction, Eur.

div1.head: πτόησις
div1.sense: passionate excitement, Plat.

div1.head: Πτολεμαϊκός
div1.sense: of or from Ptolemy, Strab.

div1.head: Πτολεμαΐς
div1.sense: name of several cities, esp. of one in Phoenicia, now Acre, Strab.

div1.head: πτολίπορθος
div1.sense: sacking or wasting cities, Il., Pind.

div1.head: πτόλις
div1.etym: Epic for πόλις, Hom., Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: πτόρθος
div1.sense: a young branch, shoot, sucker, sapling, Od., Eur., etc.;— πτ. μέγας, of Herculesʼ club, Anth.
a sprouting, budding, Hes.

div1.head: πτύγμα
div1.sense: anything folded, πέπλοιο πτύγμα a folded mantle, Il.

div1.head: πτυκτός
div1.sense: folded, πτ. πίναξ folding tablets, Il.

div1.head: πτύξ
div1.etym: not in nom., πτυχή being used instead
div1.sense: a fold, leaf, plate, mostly in pl., πτύχες σάκεος plates of metal or leather used to form a shield, Il.: the folds of a garment, Hhymn., Eur.; of the entrails, Eur.:—of writing tablets (cf. πτυκτός) , Trag.

in pl. of the sides of a hill (which viewed from a distance appears to be in folds), a cleft, glen, corrie, combe, Hom., etc.; also in sg., Il., Soph.:—so also of the sky with its cloud-clefts, Eur.:—metaph., ὕμνων πτυχαί varied turns of poesy, Pind.

div1.head: πτύον
div1.sense: a winnowing-shovel or fan, Lat. vannus, with which corn after threshing was thrown up against the wind to clear it of the chaff, Il. (in poet. gen. πτυόφιν) , Theocr.

div1.head: πτύρομαι
div1.sense: Pass.:— to be scared or frightened, properly of horses, Plut.

div1.head: πτυρτικός
div1.sense: timorous, Strab.

div1.head: πτύσσω
div1.sense: to fold, χιτῶνα, εἵματα πτύξαι to fold up garments, and put them by, Od.; χεῖρας πτύξαι ἐπί τινι to fold oneʼs arms over or round another, Soph.; βιβλίον πτ. to fold up or close a book, NTest.:—Pass. to be folded, doubled up, Il.; Mid. to fold round oneself, wrap round one, Ar.

div1.head: πτύω
div1.sense: to spit out or up, Il.: absol. to spit, Hdt., Xen.
of the sea, to disgorge, Anth.:—absol., ἐπʼ ἀϊόνι πτύοντα, of waves, Theocr.; πτύσας with a splash, Anth.
metaph., πτύσας in token of abhorrence or loathing, Soph.; πτύσας προσώπωι with loathing in his face, Soph.
εἰς κόλπον πτύειν, Lat. in sinum spuere, done three times to avert a bad omen, Theocr.

div1.head: πτωκάς
div1.sense: cowering, timorous, Epic Hom.: πτωκάδες in Soph. seem to be timorous creatures, birds.

div1.head: πτῶμα
div1.sense: a fall, πεσεῖν πτώματʼ οὐκ ἀνασχετά Aesch.; πίπτουσι πτώματʼ αἰσχρά Soph.
metaph. a fall, calamity, Lat. casus, Eur.
of persons, a fallen body, corpse, carcase, πτῶμα Ἑλένης, Ἐτεοκλέους Eur.; also πτώματα alone, Aesch.

div1.head: πτώξ
div1.sense: the cowering animal, i. e. the hare, Il., Theocr.; also, πτῶκα λαγῷον (the two Substs. being joined, as in ἴρηξ κίρκος, σῦς κάπρος) , Il.

div1.head: πτώσιμος
div1.sense: having fallen, Aesch.

div1.head: πτῶσις
div1.sense: a falling, fall, Plat.
Lat. casus, the case of a noun, Arist.

div1.head: πτώσσω
div1.sense: to crouch or cower from fear, properly of animals (cf. πτάξ, πτώξ, πτωκάς) , Od.; πτώσσουσι καθʼ ὕδωρ flee cowering into the water, Od.; of men, Od.; πτ. ὑφʼ Ἕκτορι fly cowering before Hector, Od.; so, εἰς ἐρημίαν πτ. Eur.
to go cowering or cringing about, like a beggar, Od., Hes.
c. acc. pers., οὐδʼ ἔτι ἀλλήλους πτώσσοιμεν let us no longer flee from one another, Il.; ποῖ καί με φυγᾷ πτώσσουσι; whither have they fled for fear of me? Eur.

div1.head: πτωχεία
div1.sense: beggary, mendicity, Hdt., Ar.

div1.head: πτωχεύω
div1.sense: to be a beggar, go begging, beg, Od., Ar., etc.
trans. to get by begging, δαῖτα Od.
c. acc. pers. to beg or ask an alms of, Theogn.

div1.head: πτωχικός
div1.sense: of or fit for a beggar, beggarly, Eur., Plat., etc.

div1.head: πτωχόμουσος
div1.sense: a beggar-poet, Gorg. ap. Arist.

div1.head: πτωχοποιός
div1.sense: drawing beggarly characters, of a poet, Ar.
making poor, Plut.

div1.head: πτωχός
div1.sense: one who crouches or cringes, a beggar (v. πτώσσω 1. 2), Od., Hes., etc.; πτωχὸς ἀνήρ a beggar-man, Od., etc.; πτωχή a beggar-woman, Soph., NTest.
as adj. beggarly, like πτωχικός, Soph., NTest.: c. gen., poor in a thing, Anth.
comp. πτωχότερος, irreg. πτωχίστερος, Ar.: Sup. πτωχότατος, Anth.
adv. -χῶς, poorly, scantily, Babr.

div1.head: Πυανόψια
div1.sense: (sc. ἱερά) , the Pyanοpsia, an Athenian festival in the month Πυανοψιών, in honour of Apollo; said to be so called from the custom of cooking beans at the feast (πύανον ἕψειν) , Plut. Also written Πυανέψια

div1.head: Πυανοψιών
div1.sense: the fourth month of the Attic year,so named from the festival Πυανόψια, latter part of October and former of November, Theophr.Also written Πυανεψιών.

div1.head: πύανος
div1.sense: a kind of bean.

div1.head: πυγαῖος
div1.sense: of or on the rump: τὸ πυγαῖον ἡ πυγή, the rump, Hdt.

div1.head: πύγαργος
div1.sense: white-rump, the name of a kind of antelope, Hdt.
the white-tailed eagle, the erne, Soph., etc.

div1.head: πυγή
div1.sense: the rump, buttocks, Ar., etc.

div1.head: πυγίδιον
div1.sense: a thin rump, Ar.

div1.head: πυγμαῖος
div1.sense: a πυγμή long or tall: of men, dwarfish, Hdt.:— Πυγμαῖοι, οἱ, the Pygmies, a race of dwarfs on the upper Nile, said to have been warred on and destroyed by cranes, Il.

div1.head: πυγμαχέω
div1.sense: to practise boxing, be a boxer, Inscr. in Hdt., Anth.

div1.head: πυγμαχία
div1.sense: boxing, Lat. pugilatus, Il., Pind.

div1.head: πυγμάχος
div1.sense: one who fights with the fist, a boxer, Lat. pugil, Od., Pind., etc.

div1.head: πυγμή
div1.sense: a fist, Lat. pugnus, πυγμῇ νικήσαντα having conquered with the fist, in boxing, Il.; later, πυγμὴν νικᾶν Eur.; πυγμᾶς ἄεθλα Pind.
πυγμῇ νίψασθαι in NTest., is interpr. = πύκα, diligently; or = πυκνά, often, with; cf. πυκνός B. II. and III.
a measure of length, the distance from the elbow to the knuckles, = 18 δάκτυλοι, about 13 1/2 inches.

div1.head: πυγοστόλος
div1.sense: with sweeping train, Hes.

div1.head: πυγούσιος
div1.sense: of the length of a πυγών, Od.

div1.head: πυγών
div1.sense: the distance from the elbows to the first joint of the fingers, = 20 δάκτυλοι or 5 παλαισταί, rather more than 15 inches, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: πύελος
div1.sense: an oblong trough, for feeding animals, Od.: a bathing-tub, Ar.:— a vat, kitchen-boiler, Ar.

div1.head: Πυθαγόρας
div1.sense: the philosopher Pythagoras, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: Πυθαγόρειος
div1.sense: of Pythagoras, Arist.

div1.head: Πυθαγορίζω
div1.sense: to be a disciple of Pythagoras, Arist., etc.

div1.head: Πυθαεύς
div1.sense: a name of Apollo at Delphi

div1.head: Πυθαϊστής
div1.sense: one who consults Apolloʼs oracle, Strab.

div1.head: Πύθια
div1.sense: (sc. ἱερά) , the Pythian games, celebrated every four years (prob. in the 3rd Olympian year) at Pytho or Delphi in honour of Pythian Apollo, Pind., etc.

div1.head: Πυθία
div1.sense: (sc. ἱέρεια) , the Pythia, priestess of Pythian Apollo at Delphi, Hdt., etc.

div1.head: Πυθιάς
div1.sense: (sub. ἱέρεια) , = ἡ Πυθία, the Pythian priestess, Aesch.
