(sub. ἑορτή) , the celebration of the Pythian games, Pind.
(sub. πομπή) , a sacred mission from Athens to Pytho or Delphi, Strab.

div1.head: Πυθικός
div1.sense: of or for Pytho, Pythian, Trag., etc.

div1.head: Πυθιονίκης
div1.sense: a conqueror in the Pythian games, Pind.

div1.head: Πυθιόνικος
div1.sense: of or a belonging to a Pythian victory, Pind.

div1.head: Πύθιον
div1.sense: the temple of Pythian Apollo, Thuc.

div1.head: Πύθιος
div1.sense: Pythian, i. e. Delphian, of Apollo, Hhymn., Pind., Attic; Π. alone, Eur.; ἐν Πυθίου in his temple, Thuc.
= Πυθικός, Pind., Soph., etc.
οἱ Πύθιοι, Lacon. Ποίθιοι, at Sparta, four persons whose office it was to consult the Delphic oracle on affairs of state, Hdt., Xen.

div1.head: πυθμήν
div1.sense: the hollow bottom or stand of a cup, Lat. fundus, Il., Hes., etc.
of the sea, the bottom, depth, Hes., Solon., etc.
the bottom or foundation of a thing, in pl., χθόνα ἐκ πυθμένων κραδαίνειν Aesch.; ἐκ π. ἔκλινε κλῇθρα Soph.; δίκας π. the anvil-stand on which is forged the sword of retribution, Soph.
the bottom, stock, root of a tree, Od., Solon.:—metaph. the stem or stock of a family, Aesch.; σμικροῦ γένοιτʼ ἂν σπέρματος π. μέγας, i. e. great things might come from small, Aesch.

div1.head: Πυθοῖ
div1.sense: at Pytho or Delphi, Pind., Xen., etc.
to Pytho or Delphi, Plut.

div1.head: Πυθόκραντος
div1.sense: confirmed by the Pythian god: τὰ Πυθόκραντα the Pythian oracles, Aesch.

div1.head: Πυθόμαντις
div1.sense: the Pythian prophet, Aesch., —Π. ἑστία the prophetic seat at Pytho, Soph.

div1.head: Πυθοχρήστης
div1.sense: sent by the Pythian oracle, Aesch.

div1.head: Πυθόχρηστος
div1.sense: delivered by the Pythian god, Aesch., Xen.
= Πυθοχρήστης, Eur.

div1.head: Πυθώδε
div1.sense: to Pytho, Od., Soph., Ar., etc.

div1.head: Πυθῶθεν
div1.sense: from Pytho, Pind.

div1.head: Πύθων
div1.sense: the serpent Python, slain by Apollo.
πνεῦμα Πύθωνος a spirit of divination, NTest.: ventriloquists (ἐγγαστρίμυθοι) were called Πύθωνες, Plut.

div1.head: Πυθώ
div1.sense: Pytho, older name of that part of Phocis at the foot of Parnassus, in which lay the city of Delphi, Hom., etc.

div1.head: πύθω
div1.sense: to make rot, to rot, Il., Hes.:—Pass. to become rotten, to decay, Hom.

div1.head: πυκάεις
div1.sense: vehement, Aesch. See πευκήεις.

div1.head: πυκάζω
div1.sense: to make close, cover or wrap up, enwrap, Il.; π. νῆα λίθοισι to surround a ship with stones, so as to protect it when laid up, Hes.:— to cover thickly, of a youthʼs chin, Od.; πυκ. στεφάνοις to cover thick with crowns, Eur., Theocr.; so in Mid., στεφάνοις κεφαλὰς πυκασώμεθα Anth.; also without στεφάνοις, to crown, deck with garlands, Eur.:—Pass., στέμμασι πυκασθείς Hdt.; δάφνῃ πυκασθείς Eur.; perf. part. πεπυκασμένος, thickly covered, ὄρος πεπυκασμένον a hill well-clothed with wood, Hes.:—Mid., πυκάζου cover thyself, Eur.
metaph., Ἕκτορα ἄχος πύκασε φρένας threw a shadow over his heart, Il.:—Pass., νόον πεπυκασμένος, close, cautious of mind, Hes.
to close, shut, shut up, ἐντὸς πυκάζειν σφέας αὐτούς to shut themselves close up within, Od.; πύκαζε (sc. τὸ δῶμα) shut it close, Soph.

div1.head: πύκα
div1.sense: poet. adv., v. πυκνός B. III.

div1.head: πυκιμηδής
div1.sense: of close or cautious mind, shrewd, Hom.

div1.head: πυκνίτης
div1.sense: assembled in the Pnyx, Ar.; cf. πνύξ.

div1.head: πυκνόπτερος
div1.sense: thick-feathered, π. ἀηδόνες, where it seems to be a poet. periphr. for πυκναί, multitudinous, Soph.

div1.head: πυκνορράξ
div1.sense: thick with berries, Anth.

div1.head: πυκνός
div1.sense: close, compact: and so,
of consistency, close, firm, solid, opp. to what is loose and porous (μανός, ἀραιός) , Hom.; πυκινὸν λέχος a well-stuffed bed, Hom.
close-packed, crowded, thick, close, dense, Hom.; of the plumage of a sea-bird, Hom.; of foliage, Hom.; of a shower of darts or stones, Hom., Hdt.; of hair, Aesch., etc.
frequent, many, Lat. creber, Aesch., Eur., etc.
well put together, compact, fast, strong, Il.
close, concealed, δόλος Il.
generally, strong of its kind, great, sore, excessive, ἄτη Il.
metaph. of the mind, sagacious, shrewd, wise, Hom.; πυκινοί the wise, Soph.; of a fox, Ar.
adv. πυκινῶς, and after Hom. πυκνῶς, θύραι or σανίδες πυκινῶς ἀραρυῖαι close or fast shut, Hom.
very much, constantly, sorely, greatly, Hom.
sagaciously, shrewdly, craftily, Hom.
Hom. also uses neuters πυκνόν and πυκνά, πυκινόν and πυκινά as adv., much, often; so also in Attic; comp. πυκνότερον, πυκνότερα; Sup. πυκνότατα.
poet. adv. πύκα (q. v.), as if from πύκος, strongly, Hom.
πύκα βάλλετο with thick-falling darts, Il.
carefully, diligently, Il.

div1.head: πυκνόστικτος
div1.sense: thick-spotted, dappled, ἔλαφοι Soph.

div1.head: πυκνότης
div1.sense: closeness, thickness, denseness, Ar., Thuc., etc.
frequency, Isocr., etc.
metaph. sagacity, shrewdness, craft, Ar.

div1.head: πυκνόω
div1.sense: to make close or solid, to pack close, π. ἑαυτούς to close their ranks, Hdt.; σαυτὸν στρόβει πυκνώσας spin yourself round and concentrate your thoughts, Ar.:—Pass. to be compressed, πυκνουμένῳ πνεύματι, i. e. without taking breath, Plut.
Pass. to be thickly covered, Xen.

div1.head: πύκνωμα
div1.sense: close order or array, Plut.
in pl. combined notes, or recurrent notes, in music, Plat.

div1.head: πυκτεύω
div1.sense: to practise boxing, box, spar, Xen., etc.; εἰς κρᾶτα π. to strike with the fist on the head, Eur.

div1.head: πύκτης
div1.sense: a boxer, pugilist, Pind., Soph.

div1.head: πυκτικός
div1.sense: skilled in boxing, Plat.: —ἡ -κή (sc. τέχνη) the art of boxing, Plat.
of or for boxers, Plat.

div1.head: πυκτίς
div1.sense: a writing tablet, Anth.

div1.head: πυκτίς2
div1.sense: prob. an unknown animal, perh. the beaver, Ar.

div1.head: Πυλαγορέω
div1.sense: to be or act as a Πυλαγόρας, Dem.

div1.head: Πυλαγόρης
div1.sense: one sent as a deputy to Pylae, where the Amphictyonic Council was held, the deputy of a Greek State to that Council, Dem., Aeschin.

div1.head: Πυλαία
div1.sense: (sc. σύνοδος) , the autumn-meeting of the Amphictyons at Pylae, Hdt.; then, generally, the Amphictyonic Council, Hdt.
the right of sending deputies to this Council, Dem.
a promiscuous crowd, such as was found at these meetings, Plut.: then, idle jesting, trifling, Plut.

div1.head: πυλαϊκός
div1.sense: jesting, silly, Plut.

div1.head: πυλαιμάχος
div1.sense: fighting at the gates, or at Pylos, Ar.

div1.head: πυλαῖος
div1.sense: at Pylae, Anth.

div1.head: πυλάρτης
div1.sense: gate-fastener, he that keeps the gates of hell, Hom.

div1.head: πυλᾶτις
div1.sense: at the gates, Soph.

div1.head: πυλαωρός
div1.sense: keeping the gate, a gate-keeper, Il. (Altered, to suit the Epic metre, from πυλαορός, cf. τιμάορος, τιμωρός, and v. οὖρος custos.)

div1.head: πυληδόκος
div1.sense: watching at the door, of Hermes, Hhymn.

div1.head: πύλη
div1.sense: one wing of a pair of double gates, Hdt.: mostly in pl. the gates of a town, opp. to θύρα (a house-door), Il., Attic
in Trag., sometimes, of the house-door.
Ἀΐδαο πύλαι, periphr. for the nether world, hell, Hom., Aesch., etc.
generally, an entrance, of the liver, π. καὶ δοχαὶ χολῆς the orifice and receptacle of gall, Eur.

an entrance into a country through mountains, a mountain-pass, Hdt.: esp. Πύλαι, ῶν, αἱ, the common name for Θερμοπύλαι, the pass round the mountains from Thessaly to Locris, considered the gates of Greece, Hdt.; so, of the pass from Syria into Cilicia, Xen., etc.
also of narrow straits, by which one enters a broad sea, ἐπʼ αὐταῖς λίμνης π., of the Thracian Bosporus, Aesch.; ἐν πύλαις, of the Euripus, Eur.

div1.head: πυλίς
div1.sense: a postern, Hdt., Thuc.

div1.head: Πυλόθεν
div1.sense: from Pylos, Od.

div1.head: Πυλοιγενής
div1.sense: sprung from Pylos, Il.

div1.head: Πυλόνδε
div1.sense: to or towards Pylos, Hom.

div1.head: Πύλος
div1.sense: Pylos, a town and district of Triphylia in Peloponnesus, where Nestor ruled, Hom. Two towns of the same name, in Elis and Messenia, are often confounded with Triphylian Pylos.

div1.head: πυλόω
div1.sense: to furnish with gates, Xen.:— Pass. to be so furnished, Ar.

div1.head: πύλωμα
div1.sense: a gate, gateway, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: πυλών
div1.sense: a gateway, gate-house, Polyb., etc.

div1.head: πυλωρέω
div1.sense: to be a πυλωρός, keep the gate, Luc., etc.

div1.head: πυλωρός
div1.sense: a gate-keeper, warder, porter (v. πυλαωρός), Aesch., Eur.; also as fem., ἡ π. δωμάτων γυνή Eur.:—metaph., τοῖον πυλωρὸν φύλακα τροφῆς such a watchful guardian of thy life, Soph.

div1.head: πυματηγόρος
div1.sense: last-speaking, ἠχώ Anth.

div1.head: πύματος
div1.sense: hindmost, last, Il.:— also outermost, Il.:— nethermost, φάρος Plat.; π. Ταρτάρου βάθη Luc.
of Time, last, Hom.:—neut. πύματον and πύματα as adv., at the last, for the last time, Hom.
of Degree, ὅ τι πύματον whatever is the last, worst fate, Soph.

div1.head: πύνδαξ
div1.sense: the bottom of a vessel, Theophr.

div1.head: πυνθάνομαι
div1.sense: to learn by hearsay or by inquiry, Hdt.:
πυνθ. τί τινος to learn something from a person, Hom., etc.; τι ἀπό τινος Aesch.; ἔκ τινος Soph.; παρά τινος Hdt.
c. acc. rei only, to hear or learn a thing, Od., Attic
c. gen. to hear of, hear tell of, hear news of, Od., etc.
π. τινά τινος to inquire about one person of or from another, Ar.; so, π. περί τινος Hdt., Attic

c. part., πυθόμην ὁρμαίνοντα ὁδόν I heard that he was starting, Od.; π. τὸ Πλημμύριον ἑαλωκός to hear that Plemmyrium had been taken, Thuc.:—so, οὔπω πυθέσθην Πατρόκλοιο θανόντος they had not yet heard of his being dead, Il.
c. inf. to hear or learn that, Soph., etc.

div1.head: πύξινος
div1.sense: made of box-wood, Il., Theocr.

div1.head: πυξίον
div1.sense: a tablet of box-wood, Luc.

div1.head: πυξίς
div1.sense: a box of box-wood, Luc.

div1.head: πύξος
div1.sense: the box-tree or box-wood, Lat. buxus.

div1.head: πύξ
div1.sense: with clenched fist, πὺξ ἀγαθὸς Πολυδεύκης good at the fist, i. e. at boxing, Hom., etc.; πὺξ μάχεσθαι with the fists, Il.; πὺξ πατάσσειν, παίειν Ar.

div1.head: πυός
div1.sense: the first milk after the birth, beestings, Lat. colostrum, Ar.

div1.head: πύππαξ
div1.sense: an exclamation of surprise, bravo! Plat.

div1.head: πυράγρα
div1.sense: a pair of fire-tongs, Hom.

div1.head: πυραγρέτης
div1.sense: serving for tongues, Anth.

div1.head: πυρακτέω
div1.sense: to turn in the fire, to harden in the fire, char, Od.

div1.head: πυραμίς
div1.sense: a pyramid, Hdt.

div1.head: πυραμοῦς
div1.sense: a cake of wheat and honey, given as a prize, Ar.

div1.head: πυρά
div1.sense: watch-fires, mostly in acc., καίωμεν πυρὰ πολλά Il.; πυρὰ ἐκκαίειν Hdt.:— beacon-fires, Thuc.: — ἄτιμος ἐν πυροῖσι, of sacrificial fires, Aesch.
div1.etym: The accent, as well as the dat. πυροῖς, shews that it does not belong to πῦρ.

div1.head: πυραυγής
div1.sense: fiery bright, Hhymn., Anth.

div1.head: πυργηδόν
div1.sense: like a tower:—of soldiers, in columns, in close array, Il.: v. πύργος II.

div1.head: πυργηρέομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to be shut up as in a tower, to be beleaguered, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: πυργήρης
div1.sense: of a place, fortified, ap. Paus.

div1.head: πύργινος
div1.sense: tower-like, Aesch.

div1.head: πυργοδάϊκτος
div1.sense: destroying towers, Aesch.

div1.head: πυργομαχέω
div1.sense: to assault a tower, Xen.

div1.head: πύργος
div1.sense: a tower, Il., Hdt., etc.:—in pl. the city walls with towers, Il.; so, collectively, in sg., Od., Eur.
a movable tower for storming towns, Xen.
metaph. a tower of defence, as Ajax is called πύργος Ἀχαιοῖς, Od.; παῖς ἄρσην πατέρʼ ἔχει πύργον μέγαν Eur.; θανάτων π. a tower of defence from deaths, Soph.
the highest part of any building, where the women lived, Il.
troops drawn up in close order, a column, Il.; cf. πυργηδόν.

div1.head: πυργοφορέω
div1.sense: to bear a tower or towers, Luc.

div1.head: πυργοφόρος
div1.sense: bearing a tower, of Cybele, Anth.

div1.head: πυργοφύλαξ
div1.sense: a tower-guard, warder, Aesch.

div1.head: πυργόω
div1.sense: to gird or fence with towers, Od., Eur.:—Mid. to build towers, Xen.:—Pass., πυργωθείς furnished with a tower, of an elephant, Anth.

metaph. to raise up to a towering height, πυργῶσαι ῥήματα σεμνά "to build the lofty rhyme," Ar.; so, ἀοιδὰς ἐπύργωσε Eur.:—hence, to exalt, lift up, Ar.; so, π. χάριν to exalt, exaggerate it, Ar.:—Pass. to exalt oneself, Aesch.; πεπύργωσαι θράσει, λόγοις Eur.

div1.head: πυργώδης
div1.sense: like a tower, Soph.

div1.head: πύργωμα
div1.sense: that which is furnished with towers, a fenced city, Orac. ap. Hdt., Eur.:—in pl. fenced walls, Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: πυργῶτις
div1.sense: fem. adj. towering, Aesch.

div1.head: πυρδαής
div1.sense: burning with fire, incendiary, Aesch.

div1.head: πυρεῖον
div1.sense: mostly in pl. pieces of wood, rubbed one against another to produce fire, Hhymn., Soph., etc.

div1.head: πυρέσσω
div1.sense: to be ill of a fever, Eur., Ar.

div1.head: πυρετός
div1.sense: burning heat, fiery heat, Il.
feverish heat, a fever, Ar., etc.

div1.head: πυρεύς
div1.sense: a fire-proof vessel, Anth.

div1.head: πυρήνεμος
div1.sense: fanning fire, Anth.

div1.head: πυρήν
div1.sense: the stone of stone-fruit, as of the olive, Hdt.

div1.head: πυρή
div1.note: πῠρή, ῆς, Ionic πῠρή, ῆς, ἡ,
div1.sense: any place where fire is kindled,
a funeral-pyre, Lat. bustum, Il., Hdt., etc.
a mound raised on the place of the pyre, Soph., Eur.
an altar for burnt sacrifice, Hdt., Eur.:—also the fire burning thereon, Hdt.

div1.head: πυρητόκος
div1.sense: producing fire, Anth.

div1.head: πυρήφατος
div1.etym: πυρός, πέφαται 3rd sg. perf. pass. of *φένω
div1.sense: π. λάτρις Δήμητρος the wheat-slaying servant of Demeter, i. e. a millstone, Anth.

div1.head: πυρηφόρος
div1.sense: wheat-bearing, Od.

div1.head: πυριάτη
div1.sense: beestings-pudding, Ar.

div1.head: πυρία
div1.sense: a vapour-bath, made by throwing scented substances on hot embers confined under a cloth, Hdt.

div1.head: πυριατήριον
div1.sense: a vapour-bath, heated by a furnace underneath, Plut.

div1.head: πυριγενέτης
div1.sense: fire-wrought, Aesch.

div1.head: πυριγενής
div1.sense: born in fire: of instruments, wrought by fire, Eur.

div1.head: πυριγόνος
div1.sense: producing fire, Plut.

div1.head: πυρίδαπτος
div1.sense: devoured by fire, Aesch.

div1.head: πυριηκής
div1.sense: with fiery point, Od.

div1.head: πυριθαλπής
div1.sense: heated in the fire, Anth.

div1.head: πυρίκαυστος
div1.sense: or -καυτος, burnt in fire, Il.

div1.head: πυρικοίτης
div1.sense: wherein fire lies asleep, νάρθηξ π., of the cane of Prometheus, Anth.

div1.head: πυριλαμπής
div1.sense: bright with fire, Plut.

div1.head: πυρίληπτος
div1.sense: seized by fire, volcanic, Strab.

div1.head: πυριμανέω
div1.sense: to break out into a furious blaze, Plut.

div1.head: πύρινος
div1.sense: of wheat, wheaten, Xen., etc.

div1.head: πύρινος
div1.sense: of fire, fiery, hot, Anth.

div1.head: πυριπνέων
div1.etym: πυρι-πνέων, ουσα, ον, part. with no Verb in use
div1.sense: firebreathing, Eur.

div1.head: πυρίπνοος
div1.sense: fire-breathing, fiery, Anth.

div1.head: πυρισμάραγος
div1.sense: roaring with fire, Theocr.

div1.head: πυρίσπαρτος
div1.sense: sowing fire, inflaming, Anth.

div1.head: πυρίστακτος
div1.sense: fire-streaming, Eur.

div1.head: πυρίτης
div1.sense: of or in fire, Luc.

div1.head: πυριτρόφος
div1.sense: cherishing fire, of billows.

div1.head: πυριφλεγέθων
div1.sense: fire-blazing: as Subst., Pyriphlegethon, one of the rivers of hell, Od.

div1.head: πυριφλεγής
div1.sense: flaming with fire, blazing, Eur., Xen.

div1.head: πυρίφλεκτος
div1.sense: blazing with fire, Eur.

div1.head: πυρίχρως
div1.sense: fire-coloured, Alcidam. ap. Arist.

div1.head: πυρκαιά
div1.note: πυρ-καϊά, Epic and Ionic ιή, ἡ,
div1.sense: any place where fire is kindled, a funeral pyre, Il.
a fire, conflagration, Hdt.: arson, Lex ap. Dem.
metaph. the flame of love, Anth.

div1.head: πυρναῖος
div1.sense: fit for eating, Theocr.

div1.head: πύρνον
div1.sense: wheaten bread, Od.

div1.head: πυροβόλος
div1.sense: giving forth fire:— τὰ πυροβόλα bolts or arrows tipped with fire, Plut.

div1.head: πυρογενής
div1.sense: made from wheat, Anth.

div1.head: πυρόεις
div1.sense: fiery, Anth.
ὁ Πυρόεις the planet Mars, from his fiery colour, Arist.

div1.head: πυροκλοπία
div1.sense: a theft of fire, Anth.

div1.head: πυρολόγος
div1.sense: reaping wheat, Anth.

div1.head: πυροπωλέω
div1.sense: to deal in wheat, Dem.

div1.head: πυρορραγής
div1.sense: bursting in the fire, fire-flawed, cracked, Ar.

div1.head: πυρός
div1.sense: wheat, Hom.; also in pl., Od., etc.

div1.head: πυροφόρος
div1.sense: wheat-bearing, Il., Eur.

div1.head: πυρόω
div1.sense: to burn with fire, burn up, Hdt., Soph.: to burn as a burnt sacrifice, Aesch., Eur.; π. Κύκλωπος ὄψιν to burn out his eye, Eur.:—Mid., παῖδα πυρωσαμένη having placed oneʼs son on the pyre, Anth.:—Pass. to set on fire, to be burnt, Pind., Eur.
metaph. in Pass. to be inflamed or excited, Aesch.
Pass. also, of gold, to be proved or tested by fire, NTest.
to fumigate, Theocr.

div1.head: πυρπαλαμάομαι
div1.sense: to play tricks with fire, play mischievous tricks, Hhom.

div1.head: πυρπάλαμος
div1.sense: wrought from fire, of a thunderbolt, Pind.

div1.head: πύρπνοος
div1.sense: firebreathing, Τυφών Aesch., Eur.

div1.head: πῦρ
div1.sense: fire, Hom., etc.; πῦρ καίειν or δαίειν to kindle fire, Hom.; πῦρ ἀνακαίειν, ἅπτειν, ἐξάπτειν, αἴθειν, ἐναύειν, v. sub vocc.; πῦρ ἐμβάλλειν νηυσί Il.
the funeral-fire (cf. πυρά) , Il.
the fire of the hearth, πυρὶ δέχεσθαί τινα Eur.; π. ἄσβεστον or ἀθάνατον the fire of Vesta in the Prytaneion, Plut.

as a symbol of things irresistible or terrible, μάρναντο δέμας πυρὸς αἰθομένοιο they were fighting like burning fire, Il.; κρεῖσσον ἀμαιμακέτου πυρός Soph.; διὰ πυρὸς ἰέναι (as we say) to go through fire and water, Xen.; but, διὰ πυρὸς ἦλθε ἑτέρῳ λέκτρῳ she raged furiously against the other partner of the bed, Eur.:—of persons, ὦ πῦρ σύ Soph.:—rarely as an image of warmth and comfort, Aesch.

div1.head: πυρπολέω
div1.sense: to light and keep up a fire, watch a fire, Od., Xen.; π. τοὺς ἄνθρακας to stir up the fire, Ar.
to waste with fire, burn and destroy, Ar.;—Mid., πυρπολέεσθαι πᾶσαν τὴν Ἀττικήν to cause it to be burnt with fire, Hdt.

div1.head: πυρπόλημα
div1.sense: a watchfire, beacon, Eur.

div1.head: πυρπόλος
div1.sense: wasting with fire, burning, κεραυνός Eur.

div1.head: πυρράζω
div1.sense: to be fiery red, of the sky, NTest.

div1.head: Πυρρικός
div1.sense: named after Pyrrhus, Theocr.

div1.head: πυρρίχη
div1.sense: (sc. ὄρχησις) , the pyrrhic dance, a kind of war-dance, Ar., Xen.;—attributed to one Πύρριχος the inventor.
generally, δειναὶ π. strange contortions, Eur.:—proverb., πυρρίχην βλέπειν "to look daggers, " Ar.

div1.head: πυρριχίζω
div1.sense: to dance the pyrrhic dance, Luc.

div1.head: πυρρίχιος
div1.sense: of or belonging to the pyrrhic dance, Luc.
ποὺς π. a pyrrhic, i. e. a foot consisting of two short syllables, used in the πυρρίχη or war-song.

div1.head: πυρριχιστής
div1.sense: a dancer of the πυρρίχη: οἱ π. the chorus of Pyrrhic dancers, Lys., Isae.

div1.head: πύρριχος
div1.sense: red, Theocr.

div1.head: πυρρογένειος
div1.sense: red-bearded, Anth.

div1.head: πυρρόθριξ
div1.sense: red-haired, Solon.

div1.head: πυρροκόραξ
div1.sense: a crow with a red beak, Plin.

div1.head: πυρρόομαι
div1.sense: Pass. to become red, Arist.

div1.head: πυρροπίπης
div1.sense: one that ogles young boys with a play upon πῡρο-πίπης, ogling wheat (i. e. dinner in the Prytaneium), Ar.

div1.head: πυρρός
div1.sense: flame-coloured, yellowish-red: of persons with red hair, like the Scythians, Lat. rufus, Hdt.; of the colour of the first beard, Aesch., Eur.
generally, red, tawny, Lat. fulvus, λέων Eur., Xen.
of persons also, red with blushes, Ar.; but, κύων πυρσʼ ἔχουσα δέργματα glaring with red eyes, Eur.

div1.head: πυρσαίνω
div1.sense: to make red, tinge with red, Eur.

div1.head: πυρσεύω
div1.sense: to light up, kindle, πυρσεύσας σέλας Εὐβοίαν having lit up Euboea with beacon-fires (σέλας combining with the notion of the Verb), Eur.

to make signals by torches or beacon-fires, Xen.: metaph., πυρσεύετε κραυγὴν ἀγῶνος give a shout in signal of battle, Eur.:—Pass., δόξα ὥσπερ ἀπὸ σκοπῆς πυρσεύεται Plut.: impers., πυρσεύεται fire-signals are made, Luc.

div1.head: πυρσοβόλος
div1.sense: shooting forth fire, Anth.

div1.head: πυρσόνωτος
div1.sense: red-backed, Eur.

div1.head: πυρσός
div1.sense: a firebrand, torch, Il., Eur.:—in pl. fires, Anth.:—metaph., πυρσὸς ὕμνων Pind.; pl. the fires of love, Theocr.
a beacon or signal-fire, bale-fire, Hdt.
pl. πύρσα, watch-fires, Eur.

div1.head: πυρσοτόκος
div1.sense: fire-producing, π. λίθος a flint, Anth.

div1.head: πυρσώδης
div1.sense: like a firebrand, Eur.

div1.head: πυρφορέω
div1.sense: to be a πυρφόρος, to carry a torch, Eur.
to set on fire, Aesch.

div1.head: πυρφόρος
div1.sense: fire-bearing, Aesch.; of lightning, Pind., Aesch.:— πυρφόροι ὀϊστοί arrows with combustibles tied to them, Thuc.
in special senses,

epith. of Zeus in reference to his lightnings, Soph.; of Demeter, in reference to the torches used by her worshippers, Eur.; of Artemis, Soph.; —but θεὸς πυρφόρος the fire-bearing god, the god who produces plague or fever, Soph.
ὁ πυρφόρος, in the Lacedaemonian army, was the priest who kept the sacrificial fire, which was never allowed to go out, Xen.; hence proverb. of a total defeat, ἔδεε δὲ μηδὲ πυρφόρον περιγενέσθαι Hdt.

div1.head: πυρώδης
div1.sense: like fire, fiery, Ar., etc.

div1.head: πυρωπός
div1.sense: fiery-eyed, fiery, Aesch.

div1.head: πύστις
div1.sense: enquiry, τὰς πύστεις ἐρωτῶντες, εἰ . . introducing the questions whether . . , Thuc.
that which is learnt by asking, tidings, Aesch., Eur.; κατὰ πύστιν ᾗ χωροίη according as they learnt which way he was gone, Thuc.; πύστει τῶν προγενομένων by hearing of what was done before, Thuc.

div1.head: πυτιναῖος
div1.sense: plaited with osier, πτερὰ πυτιναῖα are given to Diitrephes, because he had grown rich by his trade of a basket-maker, Ar.

trans.i: a flask covered with plaited osier.

div1.head: πωγωνοφόρος
div1.sense: wearing a beard, Anth.

div1.head: πώγων
div1.sense: the beard, Hdt., Ar., etc.:—metaph., πώγων πυρός a beard or tail of fire, Aesch.

div1.head: πωλεία
div1.sense: a breeding of foals, stud, breed, Xen.

div1.head: πώλειος
div1.sense: of a foal, χαίτη Suid.

div1.head: πωλέομαι
div1.sense: to go up and down, go to and fro, Lat. versari in loco: hence, to go or come frequently, εἰς ἀγορὴν πωλέσκετο Il.; εἰς ἡμέτερον δῶμα πωλεύμενοι Od.

div1.head: πώλευσις
div1.sense: horsebreaking, Xen.

div1.head: πωλεύω
div1.sense: to break in a young horse, Xen.

div1.head: πωλέω
div1.sense: to exchange or barter goods, to sell or offer for sale, Hdt., Attic; c. gen. pretii, ἐς Σάρδις χρημάτων μεγάλων π. to sell at a high price for exportation to Sardis, Hdt.; ἐπώλεε οὐδενὸς χρήματος refused to sell it at any price, Hdt.; ἐρέσθαι ὁπόσου πωλεῖ to ask what he wants for it, Xen.; absol., π. πρός τινα to deal with one, Ar.
π. τέλη to let out the taxes, Lat. locare, Aeschin.
to sell, i. e. give up, betray, Dem.:—of persons, to be bought and sold, Ar.

div1.head: πώλησις
div1.sense: a selling, sale, Xen.

div1.head: πώλης
div1.sense: a seller, dealer, Ar.

div1.head: πωλητήριον
div1.sense: a place where wares are sold, an auction-room, shop, Xen.
the office of the πωληταί, Dem.

div1.head: πωλητής
div1.sense: one who sells; at Athens, the πωληταί were ten officers, who let out (locabant) the taxes and revenues to the highest bidders, Dem.

div1.head: πωλικός
div1.sense: of foals, fillies, or young horses, ἀπήνη π. a chariot drawn by horses, Soph., Eur.; π. διώγματα pursuit in chariot drawn by horses, Eur.
of any young animal, π. ἑδώλια the girlsʼ apartments, Aesch.

div1.head: πωλίον
div1.sense: a pony, Ar.

div1.head: πωλοδαμνέω
div1.sense: to break young horses, Eur., Xen.
metaph. to train up, Soph.

div1.head: πωλοδάμνης
div1.sense: a horsebreaker, Xen.

div1.head: πωλομάχος
div1.sense: fighting on horseback or in a chariot, Anth.

div1.head: πῶλος
div1.sense: a foal, young horse, whether colt or filly, Hom.: in Poets generally for ἵππος, Soph., etc.
a young animal, a puppy, Anth.
in Poets, in fem., a young girl, maiden, like δάμαλις, μόσχος, πόρτις, Lat. juvenca, Eur.:—more rarely masc., a young man, Aesch.

div1.head: πωλοτρόφος
div1.sense: rearing young horses, Anth.

div1.head: πῶμα
div1.sense: a lid, cover, Hom.

div1.head: πῶμα
div1.etym: ΠΟ, Root of some tenses of πίνω
div1.sense: a drink, a draught, Trag., Plat., etc.

div1.head: πωμάζω
div1.sense: to furnish with a lid, cover up, Babr.

div1.head: πω
div1.sense: up to this time, yet, almost always with a negat. (like Lat. -dum in nondum), with which it forms one word, οὔπω, μήπω.
after Hom., with questions which imply a negative, Soph., Thuc.

div1.head: πώποτε
div1.sense: ever yet, mostly with negat., οὐ πώποτε, μὴ πώποτε, Hom., etc.

div1.head: πῶ
div1.sense: πῶ μάλα; or πώμαλα; where in the world? how in the name of fortune? i. e. not a whit, Ar., Dem.

div1.head: πῶρος
div1.sense: Lat. tophus, Ital. tufa, a porous stone; the πώρινος λίθος of Hdt.

div1.head: πωρόω
div1.sense: to petrify, turn into stone: metaph. in Pass. to become hardened, of the heart, NTest.

div1.head: πώρωσις
div1.sense: petrifaction: metaph. hardness, NTest.

div0.div1:
πως in any way, at all, by any means, Hom.; ὧδέ πως somehow so, Xen.; ἄλλως πως in some other way, Xen.:—after hypothet. Particles, εἴπως, ἐάν or ἤν πως, Lat. si qua, si forte, Od., etc.
πῶς, πώς not enclitic in a certain way, opp. to ἁπλῶς, Arist.

div1.head: πῶς
div1.sense: interrog. adv. of manner, how? in what way or manner? Lat. qui? quomodo? used in direct questions, as ὅπως in indirect, Hom., etc.:—with a second interrog. in the same clause, πῶς ἐκ τίνος νεὼς . . ἥκετε; how and by what ship came ye? Eur.:—c. gen., πῶς ἀγῶνος ἥκομεν; how are we come off in it? Eur.
with Verbs of selling, how? at what price? πῶς ὁ σῖτος ὤνιος; Ar.
πῶς δοκεῖς; v. δοκέω 1. 2.

with other Particles, πῶς ἂν. . ; Epic πῶς κε or κεν . . ; how possibly . . ? Hom., Eur.: —in Trag., πῶς ἄν with opt. expresses a wish, O how might it be? i. e. would that it were . . ! Lat. O si . . ! O utinam . . ! πῶς ἂν θάνοιμι; πῶς ἂν ὀλοίμην, etc.
πῶς ἄρα . . ; in reply, how then . . ? Hom.
πῶς γὰρ . . ; also in reply, as if something had gone before, [that cannot be], for how can . . ? Hom., Soph.
πῶς δή; how in the world? Il., etc.:—also, πῶς γὰρ δή; Od.; πῶς δῆτα . . ; Aesch., etc.
καὶ πῶς . . ; to introduce an objection, yet how can it be? Attic
πῶς οὐ . . ; how not so . . ; ? i. e. surely it is so . . , Thuc., etc.
πῶς οὖν. . ; like πῶς ἄρα . . ; Aesch., etc.

div1.head: πωτάομαι
div1.sense: to fly about, Il., Hapoll.

div1.head: πῶυ
div1.note: .πῶυ, ος, εος, πλ. πώεα, ων, τά,
div1.sense: a flock, of sheep, opp. to ἀγέλη (a herd of oxen), Hom., Hes.
